data.v: पराशरात्मजो विद्वान्ब्रह्मर्षिः संशितव्रतः । मातुर्नियोगाद्धर्मात्मा गाङ्गेयस्य च धीमतः ॥
क्षेत्रे विचित्रवीर्यस्य कृष्णद्वैपायनः पुरा । त्रीनग्नीनिव कौरव्याञ्जनयामास वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Requested by his own mother and the son of Ganga, Bhishma, the mighty and holy Krishna Dvaipayana became the father of three sons, who were like three fires, by the two wives of Vichitravirya. Having thus begotten Dhritarashtra, Pandu and Vidura, he returned to his hermitage to prosecute this religious studies.

data.v: उत्पाद्य धृतराष्ट्रं च पाण्डुं विदुरमेव च । जगाम तपसे धीमान्पुनरेवाश्रमं प्रति ॥
data.md: Requested by his own mother and the son of Ganga, Bhishma, the mighty and holy Krishna Dvaipayana became the father of three sons, who were like three fires, by the two wives of Vichitravirya. Having thus begotten Dhritarashtra, Pandu and Vidura, he returned to his hermitage to prosecute this religious studies.

data.v: तेषु जातेषु वृद्धेषु गतेषु परमां गतिम् । अब्रवीद्भारतं लोके मानुषेऽस्मिन्महानृषिः ॥
data.md: The great Rishi Vyasa did not publish this Bharata to the world of mankind until these his sons were born, grown up and (died) (went on the supreme journey).

data.v: जनमेजयेन पृष्टः सन्ब्राह्मणैश्च सहस्रशः । शशास शिष्यमासीनं वैशंपायनमन्तिके ॥
data.md: When he was earnestly solicited by Janamejaya and thousands of Brahmanas, he taught it to his disciple Vaishampayana.

data.v: स सदस्यैः सहासीनः श्रावयामास भारतम् । कर्मान्तरेषु यज्ञस्य चोद्यमानः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana, sitting together with his comrades, recited the Bharata at the intervals of the sacrifice and he was repeatedly asked to proceed when he stopped.

data.v: विस्तरं कुरुवंशस्य गान्धार्या धर्मशीलताम् । क्षत्तुः प्रज्ञां धृतिं कुन्त्याः सम्यग्द्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vyasa has fully described the greatness of the Kuru race, virtues of Gandhari, the wisdom of Vidura and constancy of Kunti.

data.v: वासुदेवस्य माहात्म्यं पाण्डवानां च सत्यताम् । दुर्वृत्तं धार्तराष्ट्राणामुक्तवान्भगवानृषिः ॥
data.md: He has also described the divinity of Vasudeva (Krishna), the goodness of the sons of Pandu and the evil conduct of the sons of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: चतुर्विंशतिसाहस्रीं चक्रे भारतसंहिताम् । उपाख्यानैर्विना तावद्भारतं प्रोच्यते बुधैः ॥
data.md: Vyasa originally compiled the Bharata, exclusive of episodes, in twenty-four thousand verses and this much only is called by the learned as the real Bharata,

data.v: ततोऽध्यर्धशतं भूयः संक्षेपं कृतवानृषिः । अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं वृत्तान्तानां सपर्वणाम् ॥
data.md: He subsequently composed an epitome in one hundred and fifty verses, an index of the chapters of contents.

data.v: इदं द्वैपायनः पूर्वं पुत्रमध्यापयच्छुकम् । ततोऽन्येभ्योऽनुरूपेभ्यः शिष्येभ्यः प्रददौ प्रभुः ॥
data.md: He first taught this epitome to his son Shuka and then to others of his disciples who had the same qualifications.

data.v: नारदोऽश्रावयद्देवानसितो देवलः पितॄन् । गन्धर्वयक्षरक्षांसि श्रावयामास वै शुकः ॥
data.md: Narada recited them to the Devas Devala to Pitris and Shuka to the Gandharvas, Yakshas and Rakshasas.

data.v: दुर्योधनो मन्युमयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धः कर्णः शकुनिस्तस्य शाखाः । दुःशासनः पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं राजा धृतराष्ट्रोऽमनीषी ॥
data.md: Duryodhana is like a great tree created out of anger, Karna is its trunk; Shakuni is its branches; Dushasana its fruit and flowers and weak Dhritarashtra is its root.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरो धर्ममयो महाद्रुमः; स्कन्धोऽर्जुनो भीमसेनोऽस्य शाखाः । माद्रीसुतौ पुष्पफले समृद्धे; मूलं कृष्णो ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणाश्च ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira is a great tree, created out of virtue and religion; Arjuna is its trunk; Bhima is its branches; two sons of Madri are its flowers and fruits; and Krishna, Brahma and Brahmanas are its roots.

data.v: पाण्डुर्जित्वा बहून्देशान्युधा विक्रमणेन च । अरण्ये मृगयाशीलो न्यवसत्सजनस्तदा ॥
data.md: Pandu, after conquering many countries by his valour and wisdom, retired into a forest and took up his abode with the Rishis.

data.v: मृगव्यवायनिधने कृच्छ्रां प्राप स आपदम् । जन्मप्रभृति पार्थानां तत्राचारविधिक्रमः ॥
data.md: As a sportsman he brought upon himself a very great misfortune by killing a stag when it was with its mate. Pandu's misfortune served as a warning for the conduct of all the princes of his house as long as they lived.

data.v: मात्रोरभ्युपपत्तिश्च धर्मोपनिषदं प्रति । धर्मस्य वायोः शक्रस्य देवयोश्च तथाश्विनोः ॥
data.md: His two wives, (Kunti and Madri), according to the ordinance of the Shastras, admitted to their embraces the celestials, Dharma, Vayu, Shakra and two Ashvinis, so that the race of Pandu might not be extinct.

data.v: तापसैः सह संवृद्धा मातृभ्यां परिरक्षिताः । मेध्यारण्येषु पुण्येषु महतामाश्रमेषु च ॥
data.md: When these offsprings of the celestials were grown up under the care of their two mothers and in the society of holy Rishis, in the midst of sacred groves and in the holy hermitage, they were taken by the Rishis into the presence of Dhritarashtra and his sons. They followed them in the garb of Brahmacharis and as students; their hairs were tied in knots on their heads.

data.v: ऋषिभिश्च तदानीता धार्तराष्ट्रान्प्रति स्वयम् । शिशवश्चाभिरूपाश्च जटिला ब्रह्मचारिणः ॥
data.md: When these offsprings of the celestials were grown up under the care of their two mothers and in the society of holy Rishis, in the midst of sacred groves and in the holy hermitage, they were taken by the Rishis into the presence of Dhritarashtra and his sons. They followed them in the garb of Brahmacharis and as students; their hairs were tied in knots on their heads.

data.v: पुत्राश्च भ्रातरश्चेमे शिष्याश्च सुहृदश्च वः । पाण्डवा एत इत्युक्त्वा मुनयोऽन्तर्हितास्ततः ॥
data.md: "Our these pupils," said they, “Are your sons, your brothers and your friends. They are the Pandavas.” So saying they went away.

data.v: तांस्तैर्निवेदितान्दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवान्कौरवास्तदा । शिष्टाश्च वर्णाः पौरा ये ते हर्षाच्चुक्रुशुर्भृशम् ॥
data.md: When the Kuru people saw that they were introduced by Rishis as the sons of Pandu, the higher class amongst them loudly shouted with joy.

data.v: आहुः केचिन्न तस्यैते तस्यैत इति चापरे । यदा चिरमृतः पाण्डुः कथं तस्येति चापरे ॥
data.md: Some, however, said they were not the sons of Pandu; others said they were. Some said how they could be the sons of Pandu who was dead long ago.

data.v: स्वागतं सर्वथा दिष्ट्या पाण्डोः पश्याम संततिम् । उच्यतां स्वागतमिति वाचोऽश्रूयन्त सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Voices, however, were heard from all sides, crying, “They are welcome. Through divine providence, we see before us the sons of Pandu. Let their welcome be proclaimed."

data.v: तस्मिन्नुपरते शब्दे दिशः सर्वा विनादयन् । अन्तर्हितानां भूतानां निस्वनस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: When the acclamations of the people ceased, tremendous plaudits of invisible spirits were heard, echoing every point of the heavens. Showers of fragrant flowers fell and conches and kettle-drums were sounded. Such wonders happened when the princes arrived.

data.v: पुष्पवृष्टिः शुभा गन्धाः शङ्खदुन्दुभिनिस्वनाः । आसन्प्रवेशे पार्थानां तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् ॥
data.md: When the acclamations of the people ceased, tremendous plaudits of invisible spirits were heard, echoing every point of the heavens. Showers of fragrant flowers fell and conches and kettle-drums were sounded. Such wonders happened when the princes arrived.

data.v: तत्प्रीत्या चैव सर्वेषां पौराणां हर्षसंभवः । शब्द आसीन्महांस्तत्र दिवस्पृक्कीर्तिवर्धनः ॥
data.md: The joyous cry, of the citizens in expression of their pleasure for the happy event, was so great that it reached the very heavens.

data.v: तेऽप्यधीत्याखिलान्वेदाञ्शास्त्राणि विविधानि च । न्यवसन्पाण्डवास्तत्र पूजिता अकुतोभयाः ॥
data.md: Without any apprehension from any one and much respected by all the people the Pandavas lived there, having studied the whole of the Vedas and various other Shastras.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य शौचेन प्रीताः प्रकृतयोऽभवन् । धृत्या च भीमसेनस्य विक्रमेणार्जुनस्य च ॥
data.md: The chief men of the city were highly pleased with the purity of Yudhishthira, the strength of Bhima, the gallantry of Arjuna.

data.v: गुरुशुश्रूषया कुन्त्या यमयोर्विनयेन च । तुतोष लोकः सकलस्तेषां शौर्यगुणेन च ॥
data.md: The obedience to all their superiors, patience and the humility of Nakula and Sahadeva. All people were rejoiced to see their heroism.

data.v: समवाये ततो राज्ञां कन्यां भर्तृस्वयंवराम् । प्राप्तवानर्जुनः कृष्णां कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् ॥
data.md: A few years after, Arjuna, after performing a difficult feat of archery, obtained the hands of Draupadi at the Svayamvara in the midst of a great assemblage of kings and princes.

data.v: ततः प्रभृति लोकेऽस्मिन्पूज्यः सर्वधनुष्मताम् । आदित्य इव दुष्प्रेक्ष्यः समरेष्वपि चाभवत् ॥
data.md: From that day he was very much respected by all men as a great bowman. Like the sun he appeared in the field of battle and was difficult to be beheld by enemies.

data.v: स सर्वान्पार्थिवाञ्जित्वा सर्वांश्च महतो गणान् । आजहारार्जुनो राज्ञे राजसूयं महाक्रतुम् ॥
data.md: He defeated all the neighbouring potentates and chief tribes and thus accomplished all that was necessary for the king (Yudhishthira) to perform the great Rajasuya sacrifice.

data.v: अन्नवान्दक्षिणावांश्च सर्वैः समुदितो गुणैः । युधिष्ठिरेण संप्राप्तो राजसूयो महाक्रतुः ॥
data.md: After killing Jarasandha, proud of his prowess through the wise counsel of Krishna and by the prowess of Bhima and Arjuna, Yudhishthira acquired the right to perform the Rajasuya which abounded in provisions and offerings and was full of transcendent merits.

data.v: सुनयाद्वासुदेवस्य भीमार्जुनबलेन च । घातयित्वा जरासंधं चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम् ॥
data.md: After killing Jarasandha, proud of his prowess through the wise counsel of Krishna and by the prowess of Bhima and Arjuna, Yudhishthira acquired the right to perform the Rajasuya which abounded in provisions and offerings and was full of transcendent merits.

data.v: दुर्योधनमुपागच्छन्नर्हणानि ततस्ततः । मणिकाञ्चनरत्नानि गोहस्त्यश्वधनानि च ॥
समृद्धां तां तथा दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवानां तदा श्रियम् । ईर्ष्यासमुत्थः सुमहांस्तस्य मन्युरजायत ॥
data.md: Duryodhana came to this sacrifice. When he saw on all sides the great wealth of the Pandavas, the offerings, the precious stones, gold and jewels, elephants and horses; valuable textures, garments and mantles; shawls and furs, carpets made of the skin of the Ranku, he was filled with envy and became very angry.

data.v: विमानप्रतिमां चापि मयेन सुकृतां सभाम् । पाण्डवानामुपहृतां स दृष्ट्वा पर्यतप्यत ॥
data.md: When he saw the hall of assembly, beautifully constructed by Maya after the celestial Court, he became exceedingly sorry.

data.v: यत्रावहसितश्चासीत्प्रस्कन्दन्निव संभ्रमात् । प्रत्यक्षं वासुदेवस्य भीमेनानभिजातवत् ॥
data.md: (To charging him more) when he was confused at certain architectural deceptions, Bhima sneered at him, before Vasudeva, saying he was of low birth.

data.v: स भोगान्विविधान्भुञ्जन्रत्नानि विविधानि च । कथितो धृतराष्ट्रस्य विवर्णो हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: It was represented to Dhritarashtra that his son notwithstanding he was partaking various objects of enjoyments and valuable things, was becoming pale, lean and meagre.

data.v: अन्वजानात्ततो द्यूतं धृतराष्ट्रः सुतप्रियः । तच्छ्रुत्वा वासुदेवस्य कोपः समभवन्महान् ॥
data.md: Out of affection for him the blind king gave his son permission to play at dice (with the Pandavas). When Krishna came to know this, he became very angry.

data.v: नातिप्रीतमनाश्चासीद्विवादांश्चान्वमोदत । द्यूतादीननयान्घोरान्प्रवृद्धांश्चाप्युपैक्षत ॥
data.md: And being displeased, he did nothing to stop the dispute, but overlooked the fatal game and other horrible unjust deeds that were the result of it.

data.v: निरस्य विदुरं द्रोणं भीष्मं शारद्वतं कृपम् । विग्रहे तुमुले तस्मिन्नहन्क्षत्रं परस्परम् ॥
data.md: In spite of Bhishma, Drona, Vidura and the son of Shardvata, Kripa, he made the Kshatriyas kill one another in the great battle that followed.

data.v: जयत्सु पाण्डुपुत्रेषु श्रुत्वा सुमहदप्रियम् । दुर्योधनमतं ज्ञात्वा कर्णस्य शकुनेस्तथा । धृतराष्ट्रश्चिरं ध्यात्वा संजयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: (At the end of the battle) Dhritarashtra, hearing the news of the Pandavas' success and recollecting the vows that Duryodhana, Karna and Shakuni had taken.

data.v: शृणु संजय मे सर्वं न मेऽसूयितुमर्हसि । श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः ॥
data.md: You are learned in the Shastras, you are intelligent and you are possessed of wisdom. (Hear), my inclinations were never for war, nor did I feel pleasure in the destruction of my race.

data.v: न विग्रहे मम मतिर्न च प्रीये कुरुक्षये । न मे विशेषः पुत्रेषु स्वेषु पाण्डुसुतेषु च ॥
वृद्धं मामभ्यसूयन्ति पुत्रा मन्युपरायणाः । अहं त्वचक्षुः कार्पण्यात्पुत्रप्रीत्या सहामि तत् । मुह्यन्तं चानुमुह्यामि दुर्योधनमचेतनम् ॥
data.md: I felt no difference between my sons and the sons of Pandu. My own sons were wayward and they hated me, because I was old and blind. I bore all on account of my miserable state of being blind and for paternal affection. I was foolish and thoughtless and Duryodhana grew in folly.

data.v: राजसूये श्रियं दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवस्य महौजसः । तच्चावहसनं प्राप्य सभारोहणदर्शने ॥
data.md: My own son was a spectator of the great wealth of the powerful sons of Pandu and was sneered at for his awkwardness in entering into the hall.

data.v: अमर्षितः स्वयं जेतुमशक्तः पाण्डवान्रणे । निरुत्साहश्च संप्राप्तुं श्रियमक्षत्रियो यथा । गान्धारराजसहितश्छद्मद्यूतममन्त्रयत् ॥
data.md: Being unwilling to bear all this at the same time being incapable of vanquishing the Pandavas in the field of bettle, he planned a most unjust game at dice, instead of being willing to obtain fortune by his own exertion and with the help of the king of Gandhara.

data.v: तत्र यद्यद्यथा ज्ञातं मया संजय तच्छृणु । श्रुत्वा हि मम वाक्यानि बुद्ध्या युक्तानि तत्त्वतः । ततो ज्ञास्यसि मां सौते प्रज्ञाचक्षुषमित्युत ॥
data.md: Hear, O Sanjaya all that happened afterwards and all that came to my knowledge. When you hear all that I say, recollecting everything you will then know me to be a man having prophetic eyes.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं धनुरायम्य चित्रं; विद्धं लक्ष्यं पातितं वै पृथिव्याम् । कृष्णां हृतां पश्यतां सर्वराज्ञां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Arjuna, having bent the bow, had pierced the mark and brought it to the ground and had carried away the princes Krishnaa (Draupadi) in the presence of the assembled chiefs and potentates.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्वारकायां सुभद्रां; प्रसह्योढां माधवीमर्जुनेन । इन्द्रप्रस्थं वृष्णिवीरौ च यातौ; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Subhadra of the Madhu race had been forcibly carried away by Arjuna and had been subsequently married by him in the city of Dwarka and the two heroes of the Vrishni race, instead of being angry, had come to Indraprastha as friends.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं देवराजं प्रवृष्टं; शरैर्दिव्यैर्वारितं चार्जुनेन । अग्निं तथा तर्पितं खाण्डवे च; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Arjuna had satisfied Agni by giving him the forest of Khandava preventing at the same time by his celestial arrows the downpour made by Indra, the king of the celestials.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं हृतराज्यं युधिष्ठिरं; पराजितं सौबलेनाक्षवत्याम् । अन्वागतं भ्रातृभिरप्रमेयै;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira had been defeated by Saubala at dice and had been deprived of his kingdom as its result but still he was attended by his powerful brothers.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रौपदीमश्रुकण्ठीं; सभां नीतां दुःखितामेकवस्त्राम् । रजस्वलां नाथवतीमनाथव;त्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that weeping and sorrowing, Draupadi in the season of her impurity, had been dragged into court with but one cloth on and treated as if she had none in this, though she had her protectors.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं विविधास्तात चेष्टा; धर्मात्मनां प्रस्थितानां वनाय । ज्येष्ठप्रीत्या क्लिश्यतां पाण्डवानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the four Pandava brothers, weeping in sorrow, had followed their eldest brother and had tried every means to mitigate his discomfort.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं स्नातकानां सहस्रै;रन्वागतं धर्मराजं वनस्थम् । भिक्षाभुजां ब्राह्मणानां महात्मनां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira had been followed into wilderness by Snatakas and by holy Brahmanas.

data.v: यदाश्रौषमर्जुनो देवदेवं; किरातरूपं त्र्यम्बकं तोष्य युद्धे । अवाप तत्पाशुपतं महास्त्रं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that, Arjuna, after pleasing in combat the god of gods, the three-eyed Shiva who appeared before him in the guise of a hunter, had obtained the great weapon Pashupata.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं त्रिदिवस्थं धनंजयं; शक्रात्साक्षाद्दिव्यमस्त्रं यथावत् । अधीयानं शंसितं सत्यसंधं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the just and famous Arjuna had gone to the land of the celestials and had there obtained celestial weapons from Indra, the king of the gods.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं वैश्रवणेन सार्धं; समागतं भीममन्यांश्च पार्थान् । तस्मिन्देशे मानुषाणामगम्ये; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Bhima and other sons of Kunti, had gone to that country which was inaccessible to men and met Vaishravana.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं घोषयात्रागतानां; बन्धं गन्धर्वैर्मोक्षणं चार्जुनेन । स्वेषां सुतानां कर्णबुद्धौ रतानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that my sons were taken prisoners by the Gandharvas their journey to Ghoshayatra, but were rescued by Arjuna.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं यक्षरूपेण धर्मं; समागतं धर्मराजेन सूत । प्रश्नानुक्तान्विब्रुवन्तं च सम्य;क्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: on I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Dharma had come in the guise of a Yaksha and asked some questions of Yudhishthira, who answered them well.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं मामकानां वरिष्ठा;न्धनंजयेनैकरथेन भग्नान् । विराटराष्ट्रे वसता महात्मना; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that all the chief warriors of my side had been defeated by Arjuna on a single chariot while he was in the kingdom of Virata.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं सत्कृतां मत्स्यराज्ञा; सुतां दत्तामुत्तरामर्जुनाय । तां चार्जुनः प्रत्यगृह्णात्सुतार्थे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that king of Matsya (Virata) had offered his virtuous daughter Uttara to Arjuna and Arjuna had accepted her for his son Abhimanyu.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं निर्जितस्याधनस्य; प्रव्राजितस्य स्वजनात्प्रच्युतस्य । अक्षौहिणीः सप्त युधिष्ठिरस्य; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira, who was defeated at dice and deprived of his wealth, who was exiled and separated from his relatives and friends, had collected an army of seven Akshauhinis.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं नरनारायणौ तौ; कृष्णार्जुनौ वदतो नारदस्य । अहं द्रष्टा ब्रह्मलोके सदेति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Narada declared that Krishna and Arjuna are Nara and Narayana and they had been seen together in the region of Brahma.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं माधवं वासुदेवं; सर्वात्मना पाण्डवार्थे निविष्टम् । यस्येमां गां विक्रममेकमाहु;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Vasudeva of the Madhu race, who covered the whole universe with his but one foot, had been heartily engaged to do good to the Pandavas.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कर्णदुर्योधनाभ्यां; बुद्धिं कृतां निग्रहे केशवस्य । तं चात्मानं बहुधा दर्शयानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Karna and Duryodhana had determined to make Krishna a prisoner, but he had shown the whole universe in himself.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवे प्रयाते; रथस्यैकामग्रतस्तिष्ठमानाम् । आर्तां पृथां सान्त्वितां केशवेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Kunti had received consolation from him when she stood near his car, weeping in sorrow.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं मन्त्रिणं वासुदेवं; तथा भीष्मं शांतनवं च तेषाम् । भारद्वाजं चाशिषोऽनुब्रुवाणं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Vasudeva was their adviser and Shantanu's son Bhishma and Bharadvaja's son Drona had pronounced blessings on them.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कर्ण उवाच भीष्मं; नाहं योत्स्ये युध्यमाने त्वयीति । हित्वा सेनामपचक्राम चैव; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Karna had said to Bhishma,"I will not fight when you fight,” and so saying had gone away.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं वासुदेवार्जुनौ तौ; तथा धनुर्गाण्डिवमप्रमेयम् । त्रीण्युग्रवीर्याणि समागतानि; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Vasudeva, Arjuna and powerful Gandiva, these three of fearful energy, had come together.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कश्मलेनाभिपन्ने; रथोपस्थे सीदमानेऽर्जुने वै । कृष्णं लोकान्दर्शयानं शरीरे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Krishna had shown Arjuna all the worlds within himself when he full of pity sank down upon his chariot.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं भीष्मममित्रकर्शनं; निघ्नन्तमाजावयुतं रथानाम् । नैषां कश्चिद्वध्यते दृश्यरूप;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the great destroyer of foes, Bhishma killing ten thousand car-warriors every day, had not killed any Pandava hero of note.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं भीष्ममत्यन्तशूरं; हतं पार्थेनाहवेष्वप्रधृष्यम् । शिखण्डिनं पुरतः स्थापयित्वा; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Arjuna, having placed Shikhandin before him on his chariot, had wounded the infinitely courageous and the unconquerable Bhishma.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं शरतल्पे शयानं; वृद्धं वीरं सादितं चित्रपुङ्खैः । भीष्मं कृत्वा सोमकानल्पशेषां;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that, after reducing the Somakas to a few, the old hero Bhishma had been overcome with innumerable wounds and was lying on the bed of arrows.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं शांतनवे शयाने; पानीयार्थे चोदितेनार्जुनेन । भूमिं भित्त्वा तर्पितं तत्र भीष्मं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that having been requested, Arjuna, piercing the ground, had allayed the thirst of Bhishma when he very much longed for water.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं शुक्रसूर्यौ च युक्तौ; कौन्तेयानामनुलोमौ जयाय । नित्यं चास्माञ्श्वापदा व्याभषन्त;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Vayu, with Indra and Surya had united in alliance for the success of the Pandavas and even the bcasts of prey were putting us to fear.

data.v: यदा द्रोणो विविधानस्त्रमार्गा;न्विदर्शयन्समरे चित्रयोधी । न पाण्डवाञ्श्रेष्ठतमान्निहन्ति; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Drona though he displayed many modes of fight, had not killed any of the chief Pandavas.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं चास्मदीयान्महारथा;न्व्यवस्थितानर्जुनस्यान्तकाय । संशप्तकान्निहतानर्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the mighty car-warriors Sansaptakas, appointed to defeat Arjuna, had been all killed by him.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं व्यूहमभेद्यमन्यै;र्भारद्वाजेनात्तशस्त्रेण गुप्तम् । भित्त्वा सौभद्रं वीरमेकं प्रविष्टं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Subhadra's brave son had singly penetrated into our Vyuha, which impenetrable by others and defended by wellarmed Drona himself.

data.v: यदाभिमन्युं परिवार्य बालं; सर्वे हत्वा हृष्टरूपा बभूवुः । महारथाः पार्थमशक्नुवन्त;स्तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that our great car-warriors, being unable to defeat Arjuna, had enjoyed joy after jointly surrounded and slain the boy Abhimanyu.

data.v: यदाश्रौषमभिमन्युं निहत्य; हर्षान्मूढान्क्रोशतो धार्तराष्ट्रान् । क्रोधं मुक्तं सैन्धवे चार्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the blind Kauravas were shouting was with joy for killing Abhimanyu and that Arjuna had taken his celebrated vow about Saindhava.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं सैन्धवार्थे प्रतिज्ञां; प्रतिज्ञातां तद्वधायार्जुनेन । सत्यां निस्तीर्णां शत्रुमध्ये च तेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Arjuna had taken the vow of killing Saindhava and he had fulfilled his vow in the presence of his enemies.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तहये धनंजये; मुक्त्वा हयान्पाययित्वोपवृत्तान् । पुनर्युक्त्वा वासुदेवं प्रयातं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Vasudeva, finding the horses of Arjuna fatigued, unyoked them in the field of battle, gave them water to drink and re-yoking them, drove the chariot as before.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं वाहनेष्वाश्वसत्सु; रथोपस्थे तिष्ठता गाण्डिवेन । सर्वान्योधान्वारितानर्जुनेन; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Arjuna had kept back all is assailants when his horses were taken away for drink.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं नागबलैर्दुरुत्सहं; द्रोणानीकं युयुधानं प्रमथ्य । यातं वार्ष्णेयं यत्र तौ कृष्णपार्थौ; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yuyudhana of the Vrishni race went back to the place where Krishna and Arjuna were, after having thrown the army of Drona into disorder, having none to withstand the attack on account of powerful elephant.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमासाद्य मुक्तं; वधाद्भीमं कुत्सयित्वा वचोभिः । धनुष्कोट्या तुद्य कर्णेन वीरं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Karna, having got Bhima in his power, had allowed him to escape only with some contemptuous terms and having dragged him with the end of his bow.

data.v: यदा द्रोणः कृतवर्मा कृपश्च; कर्णो द्रौणिर्मद्रराजश्च शूरः । अमर्षयन्सैन्धवं वध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I hear that Drona, Kritavarma, Kripa, Karna, Ashvathama and Shalya had allowed Saindhava to be killed before their presence.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं देवराजेन दत्तां; दिव्यां शक्तिं व्यंसितां माधवेन । घटोत्कचे राक्षसे घोररूपे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that through the machinations of Krishna, the celestial weapon Shakti, given to Karna by Indra, had been hurdled against Ghatotkacha of a dreadful form.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कर्णघटोत्कचाभ्यां; युद्धे मुक्तां सूतपुत्रेण शक्तिम् । यया वध्यः समरे सव्यसाची; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that in the fight between Karna and Ghatotkacha, the Shakti, had been hurled against Ghatotkacha by Karna, the weapon which should have certainly killed Arjuna.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणमाचार्यमेकं; धृष्टद्युम्नेनाभ्यतिक्रम्य धर्मम् । रथोपस्थे प्रायगतं विशस्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Dhrishtadyumna, violating all the rules of war, had killed Drona while insensible on his chariot and bent on death.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रौणिना द्वैरथस्थं; माद्रीपुत्रं नकुलं लोकमध्ये । समं युद्धे पाण्डवं युध्यमानं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Nakula, the son of Madri, had driven the chariot of the son of Drona all around the place, having engaged with him in single combat before the whole army and proving himself fully equal to him.

data.v: यदा द्रोणे निहते द्रोणपुत्रो; नारायणं दिव्यमस्त्रं विकुर्वन् । नैषामन्तं गतवान्पाण्डवानां; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Drona's son had misused the weapon named Narayana and had failed to kill the Pandavas.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कर्णमत्यन्तशूरं; हतं पार्थेनाहवेष्वप्रधृष्यम् । तस्मिन्भ्रातॄणां विग्रहे देवगुह्ये; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the exceedingly brave and unconquerable in war, Karna had been killed by Arjuna in the war of brothers, which was mysterious even to celestial.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रं कृपं च; दुःशासनं कृतवर्माणमुग्रम् । युधिष्ठिरं शून्यमधर्षयन्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira had defeated the son of Drona, Dushasana and fearful Kritavarma.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं निहतं मद्रराजं; रणे शूरं धर्मराजेन सूत । सदा संग्रामे स्पर्धते यः स कृष्णं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Yudhishthira had killed the King of Madra, who always challenged Krishna.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं कलहद्यूतमूलं; मायाबलं सौबलं पाण्डवेन । हतं संग्रामे सहदेवेन पापं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Saubala, the man of magic power and the root of the gaming and the feud, had been killed by Sahadeva.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं श्रान्तमेकं शयानं; ह्रदं गत्वा स्तम्भयित्वा तदम्भः । दुर्योधनं विरथं भग्नदर्पं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Duryodhana, having been spent with fatigue, his strength being gone out and without even a chariot, had gone to a lake and had taken refuge in its waters.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं पाण्डवांस्तिष्ठमाना;न्गङ्गाह्रदे वासुदेवेन सार्धम् । अमर्षणं धर्षयतः सुतं मे; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the Pandavas accompanied by Krishna had gone to the lake and had begun to address my son contemptuously, who was never able to put up with any affront.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं विविधांस्तात मार्गा;न्गदायुद्धे मण्डलं संचरन्तम् । मिथ्या हतं वासुदेवस्य बुद्ध्या; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that while displaying various modes of atiаck and defence in a club-fight, he had been unjustly slain through the counsels of Krishna.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रादिभिस्तै;र्हतान्पाञ्चालान्द्रौपदेयांश्च सुप्तान् । कृतं बीभत्समयशस्यं च कर्म; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that the sons of Drona and others had committed a horrible and infamous deed by killing the Panchalas and the sons of Draupadi in their sleep.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं भीमसेनानुयातेन; अश्वत्थाम्ना परमास्त्रं प्रयुक्तम् । क्रुद्धेनैषीकमवधीद्येन गर्भं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that Ashvathama, having been pursued by Bhima, had discharged the greatest of weapons, named Aishika, by which the son in the womb of Uttara was destroyed.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं ब्रह्मशिरोऽर्जुनेन; मुक्तं स्वस्तीत्यस्त्रमस्त्रेण शान्तम् । अश्वत्थाम्ना मणिरत्नं च दत्तं; तदा नाशंसे विजयाय संजय ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when heard that the weapon the weapon Brahmashira, discharged by Ashvathama, had been repelled by Arjuna with another weapon, on which he had uttered the word Svasti and Ashvathaina bad to surrender the Jewel that was on his hcad.

data.v: यदाश्रौषं द्रोणपुत्रेण गर्भे; वैराट्या वै पात्यमाने महास्त्रे । द्वैपायनः केशवो द्रोणपुत्रं; परस्परेणाभिशापैः शशाप ॥
data.md: I had no hope of success, O Sanjaya, when I heard that for wounding the son in the womb of Uttara both Krishna and Dvaipayana had cursed him.

data.v: शोच्या गान्धारी पुत्रपौत्रैर्विहीना; तथा वध्वः पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिश्च । कृतं कार्यं दुष्करं पाण्डवेयैः; प्राप्तं राज्यमसपत्नं पुनस्तैः ॥
data.md: Alas! Gandhari is to be pitied! She has lost all her children, grand children, parents, brothers and kindred. A most difficult work has been performed by the Pandavas. A kingdom has been gained by them without a rival.

data.v: कष्टं युद्धे दश शेषाः श्रुता मे; त्रयोऽस्माकं पाण्डवानां च सप्त । द्व्यूना विंशतिराहताक्षौहिणीनां; तस्मिन्संग्रामे विग्रहे क्षत्रियाणाम् ॥
data.md: Alas! I have heard that only ten persons are alive in this war three on our side and seven the side of the Pandavas. Eighteen Akshauhinis of Kshatriyas have been slain in this fearful battle.

data.v: तमसा त्वभ्यवस्तीर्णो मोह आविशतीव माम् । संज्ञां नोपलभे सूत मनो विह्वलतीव मे ॥
data.md: Utter darkness is all around me, a faintness comes over me. O Suta, consciousness is leaving me, my mind is distracted.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा धृतराष्ट्रोऽथ विलप्य बहुदुःखितः । मूर्च्छितः पुनराश्वस्तः संजयं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said: Bewailing his fate thus, Dhritarashtra was overcome with the greatest sorrow and lost his senses for a time. But being revived, he addressed Sanjaya in these words.

data.v: संजयैवंगते प्राणांस्त्यक्तुमिच्छामि माचिरम् । स्तोकं ह्यपि न पश्यामि फलं जीवितधारणे ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said: After what has happened, O Sanjaya, I desire to abandon this life without any further delay. I do not see any good by keeping it alive any longer.

data.v: तं तथावादिनं दीनं विलपन्तं महीपतिम् । गावल्गणिरिदं धीमान्महार्थं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said: While thus talking and bewailing sighing like a serpent and fainting every moment, the wise son of Gavalgana (Sanjaya) addressed the pitiable king of the earth in words instilled with deep meaning.

data.v: श्रुतवानसि वै राज्ञो महोत्साहान्महाबलान् । द्वैपायनस्य वदतो नारदस्य च धीमतः ॥
महत्सु राजवंशेषु गुणैः समुदितेषु च । जातान्दिव्यास्त्रविदुषः शक्रप्रतिमतेजसः ॥
धर्मेण पृथिवीं जित्वा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वाप्तदक्षिणैः । अस्मिँल्लोके यशः प्राप्य ततः कालवशं गताः ॥
data.md: Sanjaya said : From wise Narada and Vyasa you have heard, O king, of immensely powerful men, men of great exertions, men born of great royal dynasties, men full of great qualities, men wellversed in the art of using celestial weapons, men who, having conquered the world by righteous war and perforining sacrifices with proper offerings, obtained fame in this world and finally succumbed to death.

data.v: वैन्यं महारथं वीरं सृञ्जयं जयतां वरम् । सुहोत्रं रन्तिदेवं च कक्षीवन्तं तथौशिजम् ॥
बाह्लीकं दमनं शैब्यं शर्यातिमजितं जितम् । विश्वामित्रममित्रघ्नमम्बरीषं महाबलम् ॥
मरुत्तं मनुमिक्ष्वाकुं गयं भरतमेव च । रामं दाशरथिं चैव शशबिन्दुं भगीरथम् ॥
ययातिं शुभकर्माणं देवैर्यो याजितः स्वयम् । चैत्ययूपाङ्किता भूमिर्यस्येयं सवनाकरा ॥
इति राज्ञां चतुर्विंशन्नारदेन सुरर्षिणा । पुत्रशोकाभितप्ताय पुरा शैब्याय कीर्तिताः ॥
तेभ्यश्चान्ये गताः पूर्वं राजानो बलवत्तराः । महारथा महात्मानः सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः ॥
data.md: But besides these, other kings, who were great car-warriors, who were more powerful than the above, who were noble in mind and full of every good quality, had also fallen into the grasp of Death.

data.v: पूरुः कुरुर्यदुः शूरो विष्वगश्वो महाधृतिः । अनेना युवनाश्वश्च ककुत्स्थो विक्रमी रघुः ॥
विजिती वीतिहोत्रश्च भवः श्वेतो बृहद्गुरुः । उशीनरः शतरथः कङ्को दुलिदुहो द्रुमः ॥
दम्भोद्भवः परो वेनः सगरः संकृतिर्निमिः । अजेयः परशुः पुण्ड्रः शंभुर्देवावृधोऽनघः ॥
देवाह्वयः सुप्रतिमः सुप्रतीको बृहद्रथः । महोत्साहो विनीतात्मा सुक्रतुर्नैषधो नलः ॥
सत्यव्रतः शान्तभयः सुमित्रः सुबलः प्रभुः । जानुजङ्घोऽनरण्योऽर्कः प्रियभृत्यः शुभव्रतः ॥
बलबन्धुर्निरामर्दः केतुशृङ्गो बृहद्बलः । धृष्टकेतुर्बृहत्केतुर्दीप्तकेतुर्निरामयः ॥
अविक्षित्प्रबलो धूर्तः कृतबन्धुर्दृढेषुधिः । महापुराणः संभाव्यः प्रत्यङ्गः परहा श्रुतिः ॥
एते चान्ये च बहवः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । श्रूयन्तेऽयुतशश्चान्ये संख्याताश्चापि पद्मशः ॥
हित्वा सुविपुलान्भोगान्बुद्धिमन्तो महाबलाः । राजानो निधनं प्राप्तास्तव पुत्रैर्महत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Who were greatly powerful and wise, met death like your sons, quitting immense wealth and pleasure.

data.v: येषां दिव्यानि कर्माणि विक्रमस्त्याग एव च । माहात्म्यमपि चास्तिक्यं सत्यता शौचमार्जवम् ॥
data.md: Even those men, who possessed all the noble virtues and whose heavenly valour, generosity, magnanimity, faith, truth, purity, simplicity and mercy, are published in the Puranas by the sacred bards of great learning, gave up their lives.

data.v: विद्वद्भिः कथ्यते लोके पुराणैः कविसत्तमैः । सर्वर्द्धिगुणसंपन्नास्ते चापि निधनं गताः ॥
data.md: Even those men, who possessed all the noble virtues and whose heavenly valour, generosity, magnanimity, faith, truth, purity, simplicity and mercy, are published in the Puranas by the sacred bards of great learning, gave up their lives.

data.v: तव पुत्रा दुरात्मानः प्रतप्ताश्चैव मन्युना । लुब्धा दुर्वृत्तभूयिष्ठा न ताञ्शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Your wicked, envious, avaricious, of passionate temperament and vicious disposition; you are well-versed in the Shastras, you are intelligent and wise; those men whose understanding follows the dictates of the Shastras, never succumb to grief or misfortune.

data.v: श्रुतवानसि मेधावी बुद्धिमान्प्राज्ञसंमतः । येषां शास्त्रानुगा बुद्धिर्न ते मुह्यन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: You are learned in the Shastras, you are intelligent and you are possessed of wisdom. (Hear), my inclinations were never for war, nor did I feel pleasure in the destruction of my race.

data.v: निग्रहानुग्रहौ चापि विदितौ ते नराधिप । नात्यन्तमेवानुवृत्तिः श्रूयते पुत्ररक्षणे ॥
data.md: You know, O king, the severity and levity of fate. You know what anxiety you showed sons were for the safety of your sons. Therefore, this grief is unbecoming of you. It is not fit for you to grieve for that which must happen.

data.v: भवितव्यं तथा तच्च नातः शोचितुमर्हसि । दैवं प्रज्ञाविशेषेण को निवर्तितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: You know, O king, the severity and levity of fate. You know what anxiety you showed sons were for the safety of your sons. Therefore, this grief is unbecoming of you. It is not fit for you to grieve for that which must happen.

data.v: विधातृविहितं मार्गं न कश्चिदतिवर्तते । कालमूलमिदं सर्वं भावाभावौ सुखासुखे ॥
data.md: Who can avert by his cleverness the decrees of fate? None can go beyond the path marked for him by Providence. Existence and non-existence, pleasure and pain, come by Time.

data.v: कालः पचति भूतानि कालः संहरति प्रजाः । निर्दहन्तं प्रजाः कालं कालः शमयते पुनः ॥
data.md: Time creates all things and Time destroys them all. Time burns all creatures and Time again extinguishes that fire.

data.v: कालो विकुरुते भावान्सर्वाँल्लोके शुभाशुभान् । कालः संक्षिपते सर्वाः प्रजा विसृजते पुनः । कालः सर्वेषु भूतेषु चरत्यविधृतः समः ॥
data.md: All things, good and bad, in the three worlds, are created by Time. Time destroys them and Time creates them again.

data.v: अतीतानागता भावा ये च वर्तन्ति सांप्रतम् । तान्कालनिर्मितान्बुद्ध्वा न संज्ञां हातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Knowing that all things, past, present and future, are the outcome of Time it is not fit for you to be overcome with grief.

data.v: अत्रोपनिषदं पुण्यां कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् । भारताध्ययनात्पुण्यादपि पादमधीयतः । श्रद्दधानस्य पूयन्ते सर्वपापान्यशेषतः ॥
data.md: The study of Bharata is such an act of piety that even he who reads only one line of a verse with reverence has his sins all destroyed.

data.v: देवर्षयो ह्यत्र पुण्या ब्रह्मराजर्षयस्तथा । कीर्त्यन्ते शुभकर्माणस्तथा यक्षमहोरगाः ॥
data.md: In this Bharata, sinless and immaculate Devas, Devarshis and Brahmanas have been described as well as Yakshas and great Nagas.

data.v: भगवान्वासुदेवश्च कीर्त्यतेऽत्र सनातनः । स हि सत्यमृतं चैव पवित्रं पुण्यमेव च ॥
data.md: In it has also the possessor of six attributes, the eternal Vasudeva, been described. He is true and just, pure and holy.

data.v: शाश्वतं ब्रह्म परमं ध्रुवं ज्योतिः सनातनम् । यस्य दिव्यानि कर्माणि कथयन्ति मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: In it is described the eternal Brahma, the great true light, whose great and divine deeds the wise and learned men declare.

data.v: असत्सत्सदसच्चैव यस्माद्देवात्प्रवर्तते । संततिश्च प्रवृत्तिश्च जन्म मृत्युः पुनर्भवः ॥
data.md: From whom has been produced the nonexistent and existent-non-existent universe with the principle of reproduction and progression, birth, death and rebirth.

data.v: अध्यात्मं श्रूयते यच्च पञ्चभूतगुणात्मकम् । अव्यक्तादि परं यच्च स एव परिगीयते ॥
data.md: In it has also been described He who is Adhyatma and who partakes the attributes of the five elements and He to whom unmanifested and other such words cannot be applied.

data.v: यत्तद्यतिवरा युक्ता ध्यानयोगबलान्विताः । प्रतिबिम्बमिवादर्शे पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम् ॥
data.md: And also He whom the Yogis, possessed of meditation and Tapa, behold in their hearts as the reflection of an image in a mirror.

data.v: श्रद्दधानः सदोद्युक्तः सत्यधर्मपरायणः । आसेवन्निममध्यायं नरः पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The man of faith, ever devoted, ever employed in the exercise of virtue, is freed from sin on reading this chapter, of the Bharata.

data.v: अनुक्रमणिमध्यायं भारतस्येममादितः । आस्तिकः सततं शृण्वन्न कृच्छ्रेष्ववसीदति ॥
data.md: The believer who always hears this introductory chapter, of the Bharata from the beginning, never meets with any difficulties (in this world).

data.v: उभे संध्ये जपन्किंचित्सद्यो मुच्येत किल्बिषात् । अनुक्रमण्या यावत्स्यादह्ना रात्र्या च संचितम् ॥
data.md: The man, who repeats any part of its introduction at the inorning and evening twilights, at the time of repeating, is freed from sins collected during the day and night.

data.v: भारतस्य वपुर्ह्येतत्सत्यं चामृतमेव च । नवनीतं यथा दध्नो द्विपदां ब्राह्मणो यथा ॥
data.md: In the body of Bharata this chapter, is truth and ambrosia; as butter is among curds and a Brahmana among bipeds.

data.v: ह्रदानामुदधिः श्रेष्ठो गौर्वरिष्ठा चतुष्पदाम् । यथैतानि वरिष्ठानि तथा भारतमुच्यते ॥
data.md: As Aranyaka among the Vedas, as ambrosia among medicines, as the ocean is great among all lakes, as cow among all quadrupeds.

data.v: यश्चैनं श्रावयेच्छ्राद्धे ब्राह्मणान्पादमन्ततः । अक्षय्यमन्नपानं तत्पितॄंस्तस्योपतिष्ठति ॥
data.md: So is Bharata, among all histories. He, who causes to be recited by a Brahmana even one line of it during a Shraddha, gives to the dead ancestors his offerings of food and drink which become inexhaustible. The Vedas expounded by the aid of history and Purana.

data.v: इतिहासपुराणाभ्यां वेदं समुपबृंहयेत् । बिभेत्यल्पश्रुताद्वेदो मामयं प्रतरिष्यति ॥
कार्ष्णं वेदमिमं विद्वाञ्श्रावयित्वार्थमश्नुते । भ्रूणहत्याकृतं चापि पापं जह्यान्न संशयः ॥
य इमं शुचिरध्यायं पठेत्पर्वणि पर्वणि । अधीतं भारतं तेन कृत्स्नं स्यादिति मे मतिः ॥
यश्चेमं शृणुयान्नित्यमार्षं श्रद्धासमन्वितः । स दीर्घमायुः कीर्तिं च स्वर्गतिं चाप्नुयान्नरः ॥
data.md: I tell you, the whole Bharata has been read by the man who reads this chapter,. The man who with reverence hears every day these sacred words, gains long life and goes to heaven. In time gone by, the celestials met together and placed the four Vedas on one side and this Bharata on the other side of a scale and the Bharata weighed heavier.

data.v: चत्वार एकतो वेदा भारतं चैकमेकतः । समागतैः सुरर्षिभिस्तुलामारोपितं पुरा । महत्त्वे च गुरुत्वे च ध्रियमाणं ततोऽधिकम् ॥
data.md: From that time, it is called Mahabharata. It is considered superior to the Vedas, both in substance and gravity of import.

data.v: महत्त्वाद्भारवत्त्वाच्च महाभारतमुच्यते । निरुक्तमस्य यो वेद सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: It is called Mahabharata from this superiority in substance and gravity of import. He who understands its real meaning, is freed from all sins.

data.v: तपो न कल्कोऽध्ययनं न कल्कः; स्वाभाविको वेदविधिर्न कल्कः । प्रसह्य वित्ताहरणं न कल्क;स्तान्येव भावोपहतानि कल्कः ॥
data.md: Tapa is not a sin, study is not a sin, the ordinances of the Vedas are not sins, the acquisition of wealth by exertion is not a sin: when they are abused, then do they become the sources of evil.

data.v: समन्तपञ्चकमिति यदुक्तं सूतनन्दन । एतत्सर्वं यथान्यायं श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said: we wish to hear, O son of Suta, all about the place you called Samantapanchaka.

data.v: शुश्रूषा यदि वो विप्रा ब्रुवतश्च कथाः शुभाः । समन्तपञ्चकाख्यं च श्रोतुमर्हथ सत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Hear, O Brahmanas, the sacred words I say, You are fit, O best of men, to hear them.

data.v: त्रेताद्वापरयोः संधौ रामः शस्त्रभृतां वरः । असकृत्पार्थिवं क्षत्रं जघानामर्षचोदितः ॥
data.md: At the end of Treta and in the beginning of Dwapara Yuga, the greatest of all that ever wielded arms, Parashurama, being impatient of wrongs, repeatedly destroyed all the Kshatriya races of the world.

data.v: स सर्वं क्षत्रमुत्साद्य स्ववीर्येणानलद्युतिः । समन्तपञ्चके पञ्च चकार रुधिरह्रदान् ॥
data.md: That fiery Rama, after destroying the Kshatriyas by his own prowess, made five lakes of blood at Samantapanchaka.

data.v: स तेषु रुधिराम्भस्सु ह्रदेषु क्रोधमूर्च्छितः । पितॄन्संतर्पयामास रुधिरेणेति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard, that being senseless with anger, he offered oblations to the manes of his ancestors, standing in the bloody water of these lakes.

data.v: अथर्चीकादयोऽभ्येत्य पितरो ब्राह्मणर्षभम् । तं क्षमस्वेति सिषिधुस्ततः स विरराम ह ॥
data.md: The ancestors then said, "It would be as you have wished. But be pacified.

data.v: तेषां समीपे यो देशो ह्रदानां रुधिराम्भसाम् । समन्तपञ्चकमिति पुण्यं तत्परिकीर्तितम् ॥
data.md: The region, that lies near those five bloody lakes, has become famous from that day by the name of holy Samantapanchaka.

data.v: येन लिङ्गेन यो देशो युक्तः समुपलक्ष्यते । तेनैव नाम्ना तं देशं वाच्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: The wise men have said that every place should be known by a name significant of something which may have made it famous.

data.v: अन्तरे चैव संप्राप्ते कलिद्वापरयोरभूत् । समन्तपञ्चके युद्धं कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः ॥
data.md: At the end of Dwapara and in the beginning of Kali, a great battle was fought between the Kurus and the Pandavas, here at this holy Samantapanchaka.

data.v: तस्मिन्परमधर्मिष्ठे देशे भूदोषवर्जिते । अष्टादश समाजग्मुरक्षौहिण्यो युयुत्सया ॥
data.md: In that holy place, where there was not the least raggedness, were assembled eighteen Akshauhinis of soldiers, all eager for battle.

data.v: एवं नामाभिनिर्वृत्तं तस्य देशस्य वै द्विजाः । पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च स देशो वः प्रकीर्तितः ॥
तदेतत्कथितं सर्वं मया वो मुनिसत्तमाः । यथा देशः स विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः ॥
data.md: I have described to you that beautiful and holy place. I have told you, O best of Brahmanas, all about this place, a place famous in the three worlds.

data.v: अक्षौहिण्य इति प्रोक्तं यत्त्वया सूतनन्दन । एतदिच्छामहे श्रोतुं सर्वमेव यथातथम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said : We wish to know, O Son of Suta, all about Akshauhini which you have mentioned to us.

data.v: अक्षौहिण्याः परीमाणं रथाश्वनरदन्तिनाम् । यथावच्चैव नो ब्रूहि सर्वं हि विदितं तव ॥
data.md: Tell us the numbers of foot-soldiers, horses chariots and elephants, which make Akshauhini, for you know every thing.

data.v: एको रथो गजश्चैको नराः पञ्च पदातयः । त्रयश्च तुरगास्तज्ज्ञैः पत्तिरित्यभिधीयते ॥
data.md: Sauti said: One chariot and one elephant, five foot soldiers and three horse-men, form a Patti.

data.v: पत्तिं तु त्रिगुणामेतामाहुः सेनामुखं बुधाः । त्रीणि सेनामुखान्येको गुल्म इत्यभिधीयते ॥
data.md: Three Pattis make a Senamukha, three Senamukhas make a Gulma.

data.v: त्रयो गुल्मा गणो नाम वाहिनी तु गणास्त्रयः । स्मृतास्तिस्रस्तु वाहिन्यः पृतनेति विचक्षणैः ॥
data.md: Three Gulmas make a Gana, three Ganas a Vahini, three Vahinis taking together, form a Pritana.

data.v: चमूस्तु पृतनास्तिस्रस्तिस्रश्चम्वस्त्वनीकिनी । अनीकिनीं दशगुणां प्राहुरक्षौहिणीं बुधाः ॥
data.md: Three Pritanas make a Chamu, three Chamus an Anikini and ten times one Anikini is called by the learned as one Akshauhini.

data.v: अक्षौहिण्याः प्रसंख्यानं रथानां द्विजसत्तमाः । संख्यागणिततत्त्वज्ञैः सहस्राण्येकविंशतिः ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, mathematicians have calculated that there are twenty one thousand eight hundred and seventy chariots in an Akshauhini. The number of elephants is also the same.

data.v: शतान्युपरि चैवाष्टौ तथा भूयश्च सप्ततिः । गजानां तु परीमाणमेतदेवात्र निर्दिशेत् ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, mathematicians have calculated that there are twenty one thousand eight hundred and seventy chariots in an Akshauhini. The number of elephants is also the same.

data.v: ज्ञेयं शतसहस्रं तु सहस्राणि तथा नव । नराणामपि पञ्चाशच्छतानि त्रीणि चानघाः ॥
data.md: Know, the number of foot soldiers is one hundred nine-thousand three hundred and fifty; the number of horses is sixty-five thousand six-hundred and ten.

data.v: पञ्चषष्टिसहस्राणि तथाश्वानां शतानि च । दशोत्तराणि षट्प्राहुर्यथावदिह संख्यया ॥
data.md: Know, the number of foot soldiers is one hundred nine-thousand three hundred and fifty; the number of horses is sixty-five thousand six-hundred and ten.

data.v: एतामक्षौहिणीं प्राहुः संख्यातत्त्वविदो जनाः । यां वः कथितवानस्मि विस्तरेण द्विजोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Those who are acquainted with the Principle of number call the above, explained fully by me, the numbers of an Akshauhini.

data.v: एतया संख्यया ह्यासन्कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः । अक्षौहिण्यो द्विजश्रेष्ठाः पिण्डेनाष्टादशैव ताः ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, the eighteen Akshauhinis of the Kurus and the Pandava soldiers were composed according to this count.

data.v: समेतास्तत्र वै देशे तत्रैव निधनं गताः । कौरवान्कारणं कृत्वा कालेनाद्भुतकर्मणा ॥
data.md: Time brought them all together in this place and making the Kauravas the cause, destroyed thein all.

data.v: अहानि युयुधे भीष्मो दशैव परमास्त्रवित् । अहानि पञ्च द्रोणस्तु ररक्ष कुरुवाहिनीम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma, skillfull in arms, fought for ten days. Drona defended the Kuru army for five days.

data.v: अहनी युयुधे द्वे तु कर्णः परबलार्दनः । शल्योऽर्धदिवसं त्वासीद्गदायुद्धमतः परम् ॥
data.md: The destroyer of enemy's soldiers, Karna, fought for two days; Shalya for half a day and for a half a day then lasted the club-fight of Duryodhana and Bhima. At the close of that day, Ashvathama, Kritavarma and Kripa.

data.v: तस्यैव तु दिनस्यान्ते हार्दिक्यद्रौणिगौतमाः । प्रसुप्तं निशि विश्वस्तं जघ्नुर्यौधिष्ठिरं बलम् ॥
data.md: Destroyed the army of Yudhishthira when his soldiers were unsuspectingly sleeping. O Shaunaka, the best of narrations, the Bharata, which is narrated here at your sacrifice,

data.v: यत्तु शौनकसत्रे ते भारताख्यानविस्तरम् । आख्यास्ये तत्र पौलोममाख्यानं चादितः परम् ॥
विचित्रार्थपदाख्यानमनेकसमयान्वितम् । अभिपन्नं नरैः प्राज्ञैर्वैराग्यमिव मोक्षिभिः ॥
data.md: As men desirous of final release, accept Vairagya, so it is accepted by the wise. As Self is among things to be known, as life among things that are dear.

data.v: आत्मेव वेदितव्येषु प्रियेष्विव च जीवितम् । इतिहासः प्रधानार्थः श्रेष्ठः सर्वागमेष्वयम् ॥
data.md: So is it the best among all histories and also among all Shastras. There is not a story current in the world which does not depend on it.

data.v: इतिहासोत्तमे ह्यस्मिन्नर्पिता बुद्धिरुत्तमा । स्वरव्यञ्जनयोः कृत्स्ना लोकवेदाश्रयेव वाक् ॥
data.md: As the servant who wishes for promotion serves his master and as the words, constituting the various branches of knowledge and the Vedas, display vowels and consonants only, so this excellent history displays the highest knowledge.

data.v: अस्य प्रज्ञाभिपन्नस्य विचित्रपदपर्वणः । भारतस्येतिहासस्य श्रूयतां पर्वसंग्रहः ॥
data.md: Hear the outline of the Parvas (chapters) of this Bharata history which is full of subtle meaning and logical connection and which is rich with the meanings of the Vedas.

data.v: पर्वानुक्रमणी पूर्वं द्वितीयं पर्वसंग्रहः । पौष्यं पौलोममास्तीकमादिवंशावतारणम् ॥
data.md: The first is called Anukramanika, the second Parva Sangraha; then come Pauloma, Paushya, Astika, Adianshavatarana,

data.v: ततः संभवपर्वोक्तमद्भुतं देवनिर्मितम् । दाहो जतुगृहस्यात्र हैडिम्बं पर्व चोच्यते ॥
data.md: After this the wonderful and thoughtful Sambhava, then Jatugrihadaha, then Hidimba,

data.v: ततो बकवधः पर्व पर्व चैत्ररथं ततः । ततः स्वयंवरं देव्याः पाञ्चाल्याः पर्व चोच्यते ॥
data.md: Then Baka-vadha and then Chaitraratha, then Panchali-svayamvara Parva,

data.v: क्षत्रधर्मेण निर्जित्य ततो वैवाहिकं स्मृतम् । विदुरागमनं पर्व राज्यलम्भस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: Then after defeating the rivals in rightful battle Vaivahika Parva, then Viduragamana and Rajya-lambha.

data.v: अर्जुनस्य वने वासः सुभद्राहरणं ततः । सुभद्राहरणादूर्ध्वं ज्ञेयं हरणहारिकम् ॥
data.md: Then Arjuna-vanavasa, Subhadraharana, Harana-harika,

data.v: ततः खाण्डवदाहाख्यं तत्रैव मयदर्शनम् । सभापर्व ततः प्रोक्तं मन्त्रपर्व ततः परम् ॥
data.md: Then Khandava-daha and Mayadarshana, then come Sabha Parva and Mantra Parva,

data.v: जरासंधवधः पर्व पर्व दिग्विजयस्तथा । पर्व दिग्विजयादूर्ध्वं राजसूयिकमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Then Jarasandha-vadha and Digvijaya; after Digvijaya comes the Parva called Rajasuyika.

data.v: ततश्चार्घाभिहरणं शिशुपालवधस्ततः । द्यूतपर्व ततः प्रोक्तमनुद्यूतमतः परम् ॥
data.md: Then Arghabhiharana, Shishupalavadha, Dyuta, Anudyuta Parva; Then comes Aranyaka, Kirmira-vadha, Arjunabhigamana;

data.v: तत आरण्यकं पर्व किर्मीरवध एव च । ईश्वरार्जुनयोर्युद्धं पर्व कैरातसंज्ञितम् ॥
data.md: And then Kairata, in which the battle between Arjuna and Shiva is described; Then Indralokabhigamana.

data.v: इन्द्रलोकाभिगमनं पर्व ज्ञेयमतः परम् । तीर्थयात्रा ततः पर्व कुरुराजस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: Then the pathetic, pious and religious story of Nala-upakhyana; Then Tirtha-yatra of the wise king of the Kurus.

data.v: जटासुरवधः पर्व यक्षयुद्धमतः परम् । तथैवाजगरं पर्व विज्ञेयं तदनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: Then Jatasura-vadha, then Yakshayuddha, then Nivatakavacha-yuddha and Ajagara;

data.v: मार्कण्डेयसमस्या च पर्वोक्तं तदनन्तरम् । संवादश्च ततः पर्व द्रौपदीसत्यभामयोः ॥
data.md: Then Markandeya-samasya, then the Parva of the meeting of Draupadi and Satyabhama;

data.v: घोषयात्रा ततः पर्व मृगस्वप्नभयं ततः । व्रीहिद्रौणिकमाख्यानं ततोऽनन्तरमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Then Ghoshayatra, Mriga-svapna, then Brihidraunikamakhyana and Aindradyumna;

data.v: द्रौपदीहरणं पर्व सैन्धवेन वनात्ततः । कुण्डलाहरणं पर्व ततः परमिहोच्यते ॥
data.md: After this the story of Rama, then Kundala-Harana Parva:

data.v: आरणेयं ततः पर्व वैराटं तदनन्तरम् । कीचकानां वधः पर्व पर्व गोग्रहणं ततः ॥
data.md: That which comes next is Aranya and then Virata, where the Pandavas went (in disguise) and fulfilled their promise.

data.v: अभिमन्युना च वैराट्याः पर्व वैवाहिकं स्मृतम् । उद्योगपर्व विज्ञेयमत ऊर्ध्वं महाद्भुतम् ॥
ततः संजययानाख्यं पर्व ज्ञेयमतः परम् । प्रजागरं ततः पर्व धृतराष्ट्रस्य चिन्तया ॥
data.md: After this the story of Rama, then Kundala-Harana Parva:

data.v: पर्व सानत्सुजातं च गुह्यमध्यात्मदर्शनम् । यानसंधिस्ततः पर्व भगवद्यानमेव च ॥
data.md: Then comes Prajagara, the anxieties of Dhritarashtra, then Sanatsujata, the mysteries of Philosophy.

data.v: ज्ञेयं विवादपर्वात्र कर्णस्यापि महात्मनः । निर्याणं पर्व च ततः कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः ॥
data.md: Then comes the quarrel of the noble Karna, then the march of the Kuru and Pandava armies to the field of battle.

data.v: रथातिरथसंख्या च पर्वोक्तं तदनन्तरम् । उलूकदूतागमनं पर्वामर्षविवर्धनम् ॥
data.md: Then Rathatiratha-Sankhya Parva, then the arrival of wrath-inspiring messenger Uluka;

data.v: अम्बोपाख्यानमपि च पर्व ज्ञेयमतः परम् । भीष्माभिषेचनं पर्व ज्ञेयमद्भुतकारणम् ॥
data.md: Then the story of Amba, then the wonderful installation of Bhishma;

data.v: जम्बूखण्डविनिर्माणं पर्वोक्तं तदनन्तरम् । भूमिपर्व ततो ज्ञेयं द्वीपविस्तरकीर्तनम् ॥
data.md: Then (the account of) the creation of Jambukhanda and Bhumi, then the account of island.

data.v: पर्वोक्तं भगवद्गीता पर्व भीष्मवधस्ततः । द्रोणाभिषेकः पर्वोक्तं संशप्तकवधस्ततः ॥
data.md: Then Bhagavad-Gita Parva, then Bhishmavadha, then the installation of Drona and then the death of Sanshaptakas;

data.v: अभिमन्युवधः पर्व प्रतिज्ञापर्व चोच्यते । जयद्रथवधः पर्व घटोत्कचवधस्ततः ॥
data.md: Then Abhimanyu-vadha, then Pratijna Parva, then Jayadratha-vadha and Ghatotkacha-vadha;

data.v: ततो द्रोणवधः पर्व विज्ञेयं लोमहर्षणम् । मोक्षो नारायणास्त्रस्य पर्वानन्तरमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Then the hair-stirring Drona-vadha, then the discharge of Narayana weapon;

data.v: कर्णपर्व ततो ज्ञेयं शल्यपर्व ततः परम् । ह्रदप्रवेशनं पर्व गदायुद्धमतः परम् ॥
data.md: Then Karna Parva and then next to it is Shalya Parva. Then Hrida Pravesha Parva, then Gada-Yudha.

data.v: सारस्वतं ततः पर्व तीर्थवंशगुणान्वितम् । अत ऊर्ध्वं तु बीभत्सं पर्व सौप्तिकमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Then Sarasvata and the description of Tirtha and Vansha and then Sauptika, describing the disgraceful conduct of the Kurus.

data.v: ऐषीकं पर्व निर्दिष्टमत ऊर्ध्वं सुदारुणम् । जलप्रदानिकं पर्व स्त्रीपर्व च ततः परम् ॥
data.md: Then dreadful Aishika Parva, then Jalapradana, then Strivilapa;

data.v: श्राद्धपर्व ततो ज्ञेयं कुरूणामौर्ध्वदेहिकम् । आभिषेचनिकं पर्व धर्मराजस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: Then Shraddha Parva, describing the funeral rites for the killed Kurus; then Charvaka-vadha who was a Rakshasa but appeared as a Brahmana.

data.v: चार्वाकनिग्रहः पर्व रक्षसो ब्रह्मरूपिणः । प्रविभागो गृहाणां च पर्वोक्तं तदनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: Then the coronation of wise Yudhishthira, then Griha-pravibhagaparva;

data.v: शान्तिपर्व ततो यत्र राजधर्मानुकीर्तनम् । आपद्धर्मश्च पर्वोक्तं मोक्षधर्मस्ततः परम् ॥
data.md: Then Shanti Parva, then Rajadharmanushasana, then Apaddharma and Mokshadharma;

data.v: ततः पर्व परिज्ञेयमानुशासनिकं परम् । स्वर्गारोहणिकं पर्व ततो भीष्मस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: Next Anushasana, then the ascension of wise Bhishma to heaven.

data.v: ततोऽश्वमेधिकं पर्व सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् । अनुगीता ततः पर्व ज्ञेयमध्यात्मवाचकम् ॥
data.md: The next is all sin-destroying Ashvamedha and then Anu-Gita, containing spiritual philosophy.

data.v: पर्व चाश्रमवासाख्यं पुत्रदर्शनमेव च । नारदागमनं पर्व ततः परमिहोच्यते ॥
data.md: Next Ashramavashika, Putradarshana and the arrival of Narada;

data.v: मौसलं पर्व च ततो घोरं समनुवर्ण्यते । महाप्रस्थानिकं पर्व स्वर्गारोहणिकं ततः ॥
data.md: Then comes Mausala, full of cruel and terrible incidents; then Mahaprasthana; and the ascension to heaven.

data.v: हरिवंशस्ततः पर्व पुराणं खिलसंज्ञितम् । भविष्यत्पर्व चाप्युक्तं खिलेष्वेवाद्भुतं महत् ॥
data.md: Then follows the Purana which is called Khila Harivansha, in it is Vishnu Parva, comes one come describing the early life of Vishnu and the destruction of Kansa.

data.v: एतत्पर्वशतं पूर्णं व्यासेनोक्तं महात्मना । यथावत्सूतपुत्रेण लोमहर्षणिना पुनः ॥
कथितं नैमिषारण्ये पर्वाण्यष्टादशैव तु । समासो भारतस्यायं तत्रोक्तः पर्वसंग्रहः ॥
पौष्ये पर्वणि माहात्म्यमुत्तङ्कस्योपवर्णितम् । पौलोमे भृगुवंशस्य विस्तारः परिकीर्तितः ॥
data.md: The meeting with Maya, these are the contents of Adi Parva. The Paushya Parva contains the greatness of Uttanka.

data.v: आस्तीके सर्वनागानां गरुडस्य च संभवः । क्षीरोदमथनं चैव जन्मोच्छैःश्रवसस्तथा ॥
यजतः सर्पसत्रेण राज्ञः पारिक्षितस्य च । कथेयमभिनिर्वृत्ता भारतानां महात्मनाम् ॥
विविधाः संभवा राज्ञामुक्ताः संभवपर्वणि । अन्येषां चैव विप्राणामृषेर्द्वैपायनस्य च ॥
अंशावतरणं चात्र देवानां परिकीर्तितम् । दैत्यानां दानवानां च यक्षाणां च महौजसाम् ॥
data.md: Living in disguise; the destruction of Baka and the astonishment of the people,

data.v: नागानामथ सर्पाणां गन्धर्वाणां पतत्रिणाम् । अन्येषां चैव भूतानां विविधानां समुद्भवः ॥
वसूनां पुनरुत्पत्तिर्भागीरथ्यां महात्मनाम् । शंतनोर्वेश्मनि पुनस्तेषां चारोहणं दिवि ॥
data.md: It describes the births of the graet Vasus in the house of Shantanu in the womb of Bhagirathi and their again going to heaven.

data.v: तेजोंशानां च संघाताद्भीष्मस्याप्यत्र संभवः । राज्यान्निवर्तनं चैव ब्रह्मचर्यव्रते स्थितिः ॥
data.md: And the birth of fiery Bhishma, his renunciation of royalty, his adoption of Brahmacharya,

data.v: प्रतिज्ञापालनं चैव रक्षा चित्राङ्गदस्य च । हते चित्राङ्गदे चैव रक्षा भ्रातुर्यवीयसः ॥
data.md: His adherence to his vow, his protection of Chitrangada, his protection of his younger brother after the death of Chitrangada,

data.v: विचित्रवीर्यस्य तथा राज्ये संप्रतिपादनम् । धर्मस्य नृषु संभूतिरणीमाण्डव्यशापजा ॥
data.md: His placing Vichitravirya on the throne, the birth of Dharma on account of the curse of Animandavya,

data.v: कृष्णद्वैपायनाच्चैव प्रसूतिर्वरदानजा । धृतराष्ट्रस्य पाण्डोश्च पाण्डवानां च संभवः ॥
data.md: The births of Dhritarashtra and Pandu, by the blessing of Krishna Dvaipayana and also the birth of the Pandavas,

data.v: वारणावतयात्रा च मन्त्रो दुर्योधनस्य च । विदुरस्य च वाक्येन सुरुङ्गोपक्रमक्रिया ॥
data.md: The conspiracy of Duryodhana to send the Pandavas to Varanavata and other plotting of the sons of Dhritarashtra against the Pandavas;

data.v: पाण्डवानां वने घोरे हिडिम्बायाश्च दर्शनम् । घटोत्कचस्य चोत्पत्तिरत्रैव परिकीर्तिता ॥
data.md: Then the destruction of Hidimba by powerful Bhima; then the birth of Ghatotkacha,

data.v: अज्ञातचर्या पाण्डूनां वासो ब्राह्मणवेश्मनि । बकस्य निधनं चैव नागराणां च विस्मयः ॥
data.md: Living in disguise; the destruction of Baka and the astonishment of the people,

data.v: अङ्गारपर्णं निर्जित्य गङ्गाकूलेऽर्जुनस्तदा । भ्रातृभिः सहितः सर्वैः पाञ्चालानभितो ययौ ॥
data.md: The accounts of Tapati, Vasishtha and Aurva; then the arrival of the Pandavas with all the brothers at Panchala;

data.v: तापत्यमथ वासिष्ठमौर्वं चाख्यानमुत्तमम् । पञ्चेन्द्राणामुपाख्यानमत्रैवाद्भुतमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The accounts of Tapati, Vasishtha and Aurva; then the arrival of the Pandavas with all the brothers at Panchala;

data.v: पञ्चानामेकपत्नीत्वे विमर्शो द्रुपदस्य च । द्रौपद्या देवविहितो विवाहश्चाप्यमानुषः ॥
data.md: The story of five Indras told in consequence; the wonderful and divinely arranged marriage of Draupadi;

data.v: विदुरस्य च संप्राप्तिर्दर्शनं केशवस्य च । खाण्डवप्रस्थवासश्च तथा राज्यार्धशासनम् ॥
नारदस्याज्ञया चैव द्रौपद्याः समयक्रिया । सुन्दोपसुन्दयोस्तत्र उपाख्यानं प्रकीर्तितम् ॥
पार्थस्य वनवासश्च उलूप्या पथि संगमः । पुण्यतीर्थानुसंयानं बभ्रुवाहनजन्म च ॥
द्वारकायां सुभद्रा च कामयानेन कामिनी । वासुदेवस्यानुमते प्राप्ता चैव किरीटिना ॥
data.md: Arjuna's taking of Subhadra by force with the permission of Krishna on the car which goes every where at the will of the rider;

data.v: हरणं गृह्य संप्राप्ते कृष्णे देवकिनन्दने । संप्राप्तिश्चक्रधनुषोः खाण्डवस्य च दाहनम् ॥
data.md: Taking the dower of Krishna, Arjuna's departure to Indraprastha; the birth of that prodigy of prowess, Abhimanyu, in the womb of Subhadra;

data.v: अभिमन्योः सुभद्रायां जन्म चोत्तमतेजसः । मयस्य मोक्षो ज्वलनाद्भुजंगस्य च मोक्षणम् । महर्षेर्मन्दपालस्य शार्ङ्ग्यं तनयसंभवः ॥
इत्येतदादिपर्वोक्तं प्रथमं बहुविस्तरम् । अध्यायानां शते द्वे तु संख्याते परमर्षिणा । अष्टादशैव चाध्याया व्यासेनोत्तमतेजसा ॥
data.md: Greatly powerful Vyasa has divided this Parva into two hundred and twenty seven chapters.

data.v: सप्त श्लोकसहस्राणि तथा नव शतानि च । श्लोकाश्च चतुराशीतिर्दृष्टो ग्रन्थो महात्मना ॥
data.md: These two hundred and twenty-seven chapters contain eight thousand eight hundred and eighty-four slokas. a

data.v: द्वितीयं तु सभापर्व बहुवृत्तान्तमुच्यते । सभाक्रिया पाण्डवानां किंकराणां च दर्शनम् ॥
data.md: The second is Sabha Parva which is very extensive and full of matter. It describes the building of the assembly-hall by the Pandavas and the review of their servants;

data.v: लोकपालसभाख्यानं नारदाद्देवदर्शनात् । राजसूयस्य चारम्भो जरासंधवधस्तथा ॥
data.md: The description of the courts of Lokapalas by Narada who knows all the celestial regions; the preparations for the Rajasuya Yajna; the destruction of Jarasandha;

data.v: गिरिव्रजे निरुद्धानां राज्ञां कृष्णेन मोक्षणम् । राजसूयेऽर्घसंवादे शिशुपालवधस्तथा ॥
data.md: The arrival of the chiefs and potentates with tribute at the Rajasuya Yajna; the destruction of Shishupala at the sacrifice, in connection with Arghya giving;

data.v: यज्ञे विभूतिं तां दृष्ट्वा दुःखामर्षान्वितस्य च । दुर्योधनस्यावहासो भीमेन च सभातले ॥
data.md: The grief and envy of Duryodhana at the sight of the magnificence of the sacrifice; the joking of Bhima at the expense of Duryodhana in the great assembly.

data.v: यत्रास्य मन्युरुद्भूतो येन द्यूतमकारयत् । यत्र धर्मसुतं द्यूते शकुनिः कितवोऽजयत् ॥
data.md: The preparation for the game of dice; the defeat of Yudhishthira at the play by cunning and crafty Shakuni;

data.v: यत्र द्यूतार्णवे मग्नान्द्रौपदी नौरिवार्णवात् । तारयामास तांस्तीर्णाञ्ज्ञात्वा दुर्योधनो नृपः । पुनरेव ततो द्यूते समाह्वयत पाण्डवान् ॥
data.md: Seeing this, the attempt of Duryodhana to engage Yudhishthira again in

data.v: एतत्सर्वं सभापर्व समाख्यातं महात्मना । अध्यायाः सप्ततिर्ज्ञेयास्तथा द्वौ चात्र संख्यया ॥
श्लोकानां द्वे सहस्रे तु पञ्च श्लोकशतानि च । श्लोकाश्चैकादश ज्ञेयाः पर्वण्यस्मिन्प्रकीर्तिताः ॥
data.md: This Parva is divided into seventy eight chapters and it contains, O best of Brahmanas, two thousand five hundred and eleven slokas. Then comes the third Parva, called Aranya.

data.v: अतः परं तृतीयं तु ज्ञेयमारण्यकं महत् । पौरानुगमनं चैव धर्मपुत्रस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: It describes the departure of the Pandavas to the forest with the citizens following the wise Yudhishthira;

data.v: वृष्णीनामागमो यत्र पाञ्चालानां च सर्वशः । यत्र सौभवधाख्यानं किर्मीरवध एव च । अस्त्रहेतोर्विवासश्च पार्थस्यामिततेजसः ॥
data.md: It then describes the departure of Vyasa, the Pandavas' going to the forest of Kamyaka; the rovings of greatly powerful Arjuna in quest of weapons;

data.v: महादेवेन युद्धं च किरातवपुषा सह । दर्शनं लोकपालानां स्वर्गारोहणमेव च ॥
data.md: His fight with Shiva who was in the disguise of a hunter; his meeting with the Lokapalas and his receipt of weapons from them;

data.v: दर्शनं बृहदश्वस्य महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । युधिष्ठिरस्य चार्तस्य व्यसने परिदेवनम् ॥
data.md: It then relates the lamentations of Yudhishthira in his meeting with the holy sage Brihadashva.

data.v: नलोपाख्यानमत्रैव धर्मिष्ठं करुणोदयम् । दमयन्त्याः स्थितिर्यत्र नलस्य व्यसनागमे ॥
data.md: It then contains the holy and most pathetic story of Nala, illustrating the great patience of Damayanti and the character of Nala.

data.v: वनवासगतानां च पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । स्वर्गे प्रवृत्तिराख्याता लोमशेनार्जुनस्य वै ॥
data.md: The receipt from the Rishi by the highsouled dwellers of forest (the Pandavas) the news of the third brother (Arjuna) who was then staying in the celestial regions;

data.v: तीर्थयात्रा तथैवात्र पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । जटासुरस्य तत्रैव वधः समुपवर्ण्यते ॥
नियुक्तो भीमसेनश्च द्रौपद्या गन्धमादने । यत्र मन्दारपुष्पार्थं नलिनीं तामधर्षयत् ॥
यत्रास्य सुमहद्युद्धमभवत्सह राक्षसैः । यक्षैश्चापि महावीर्यैर्मणिमत्प्रमुखैस्तथा ॥
आगस्त्यमपि चाख्यानं यत्र वातापिभक्षणम् । लोपामुद्राभिगमनमपत्यार्थमृषेरपि ॥
data.md: The story of Agastya which relates how he ate up the Asura, Vatapi; his approaching Lopamudra to have an offspring.

data.v: ततः श्येनकपोतीयमुपाख्यानमनन्तरम् । इन्द्रोऽग्निर्यत्र धर्मश्च अजिज्ञासञ्शिबिं नृपम् ॥
data.md: Then follows the beautiful story of the hawk and the pegion; then the trial of king Shivi by Indra, Agni and Dharma,

data.v: ऋश्यशृङ्गस्य चरितं कौमारब्रह्मचारिणः । जामदग्न्यस्य रामस्य चरितं भूरितेजसः ॥
data.md: It then tells the story of Rishyashringa who adopted the life of an ascetic from his boyhood. Then follows the story of greatly powerful Rama, the son of Jamadagni,

data.v: कार्तवीर्यवधो यत्र हैहयानां च वर्ण्यते । सौकन्यमपि चाख्यानं च्यवनो यत्र भार्गवः ॥
data.md: In which is described the death of Kartavirya and Haihayas, then the meeting of the Pandavas and the Vrishnis at the holy pilgrimage of Prabhasa;

data.v: शर्यातियज्ञे नासत्यौ कृतवान्सोमपीथिनौ । ताभ्यां च यत्र स मुनिर्यौवनं प्रतिपादितः ॥
जन्तूपाख्यानमत्रैव यत्र पुत्रेण सोमकः । पुत्रार्थमयजद्राजा लेभे पुत्रशतं च सः ॥
data.md: Then it tells the story of prince Jantu and how king Somaka, by offering up his only son Jantu in sacrifice, got one hundred others.

data.v: अष्टावक्रीयमत्रैव विवादे यत्र बन्दिनम् । विजित्य सागरं प्राप्तं पितरं लब्धवानृषिः ॥
data.md: The defeat of Bandi and the release of the father of the Rishi (Ashtavakra) from the ocean. Then follows the story of Yavakrita, then that of the great Raibhya,

data.v: अवाप्य दिव्यान्यस्त्राणि गुर्वर्थे सव्यसाचिना । निवातकवचैर्युद्धं हिरण्यपुरवासिभिः ॥
समागमश्च पार्थस्य भ्रातृभिर्गन्धमादने । घोषयात्रा च गन्धर्वैर्यत्र युद्धं किरीटिनः ॥
पुनरागमनं चैव तेषां द्वैतवनं सरः । जयद्रथेनापहारो द्रौपद्याश्चाश्रमान्तरात् ॥
यत्रैनमन्वयाद्भीमो वायुवेगसमो जवे । मार्कण्डेयसमस्यायामुपाख्यानानि भागशः ॥
संदर्शनं च कृष्णस्य संवादश्चैव सत्यया । व्रीहिद्रौणिकमाख्यानमैन्द्रद्युम्नं तथैव च ॥
data.md: Then Ghoshayatra, Mriga-svapna, then Brihidraunikamakhyana and Aindradyumna;

data.v: सावित्र्यौद्दालकीयं च वैन्योपाख्यानमेव च । रामायणमुपाख्यानमत्रैव बहुविस्तरम् ॥
data.md: Then the stories of Savitri, Vamadeva and Vainya; then the stories of Jamadagni and Shodasharajika;

data.v: कर्णस्य परिमोषोऽत्र कुण्डलाभ्यां पुरंदरात् । आरणेयमुपाख्यानं यत्र धर्मोऽन्वशात्सुतम् । जग्मुर्लब्धवरा यत्र पाण्डवाः पश्चिमां दिशम् ॥
data.md: The story of Araneya in which Dharma gave advice to his son and in which is related how the Pandavas received a boon and went to the west.

data.v: एतदारण्यकं पर्व तृतीयं परिकीर्तितम् । अत्राध्यायशते द्वे तु संख्याते परमर्षिणा । एकोनसप्ततिश्चैव तथाध्यायाः प्रकीर्तिताः ॥
data.md: These matters are all described in the third Parva called Aranyaka. It contains two hundred and sixty-nine chapters. Its numbers of slokas is eleven thousand, six hundred and sixty four. Then comes the extensive Virata Parva.

data.v: एकादश सहस्राणि श्लोकानां षट्शतानि च । चतुःषष्टिस्तथा श्लोकाः पर्वैतत्परिकीर्तितम् ॥
data.md: The number of slokas, composed by the greatly wise Rishi, is three thousand three hundred and twenty.

data.v: अतः परं निबोधेदं वैराटं पर्वविस्तरम् । विराटनगरं गत्वा श्मशाने विपुलां शमीम् । दृष्ट्वा संनिदधुस्तत्र पाण्डवा आयुधान्युत ॥
data.md: It described how the Pandavas arrived at the city of Virata and saw a Shami tree in a cremation ground on which they kept hidden their weapons.

data.v: यत्र प्रविश्य नगरं छद्मभिर्न्यवसन्त ते । दुरात्मनो वधो यत्र कीचकस्य वृकोदरात् ॥
data.md: Then have been related their entry into the city and their stay in disguise; then the slaying by Bhima of the wicked Kichaka who lustfully aspired for Draupadi; then the attempt of king Duryodhana to find out the Pandavas;

data.v: गोग्रहे यत्र पार्थेन निर्जिताः कुरवो युधि । गोधनं च विराटस्य मोक्षितं यत्र पाण्डवैः ॥
data.md: The capture of Virata by the enemy and his rescue by Bhima; the release of his kine also by the Pandava (Bhima).

data.v: विराटेनोत्तरा दत्ता स्नुषा यत्र किरीटिनः । अभिमन्युं समुद्दिश्य सौभद्रमरिघातिनम् ॥
data.md: The release of the king's kine by Arjuna's valour; the bestowal by Virata of his daughter to Arjuna for his acceptance of her for his son by Subhadra, Abhimanyu, the destroyer of foes. These are the contents of the extensive fourth Parva Virata.

data.v: चतुर्थमेतद्विपुलं वैराटं पर्व वर्णितम् । अत्रापि परिसंख्यातमध्यायानां महात्मना ॥
data.md: This twelfth Parva, the favourite of the wise, contains three hundred and thirty nine chapters.

data.v: सप्तषष्टिरथो पूर्णा श्लोकाग्रमपि मे शृणु । श्लोकानां द्वे सहस्रे तु श्लोकाः पञ्चाशदेव तु । पर्वण्यस्मिन्समाख्याताः संख्यया परमर्षिणा ॥
data.md: The great Rishi has composed it in sixty seven chapters and it contains two thousand and fifty slokas.

data.v: उद्योगपर्व विज्ञेयं पञ्चमं शृण्वतः परम् । उपप्लव्ये निविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु जिगीषया । दुर्योधनोऽर्जुनश्चैव वासुदेवमुपस्थितौ ॥
data.md: Here now, the contents of the fifth Parva, named Udyoga. When the Pandavas were living at Upaplavya,

data.v: साहाय्यमस्मिन्समरे भवान्नौ कर्तुमर्हति । इत्युक्ते वचने कृष्णो यत्रोवाच महामतिः ॥
अयुध्यमानमात्मानं मन्त्रिणं पुरुषर्षभौ । अक्षौहिणीं वा सैन्यस्य कस्य वा किं ददाम्यहम् ॥
वव्रे दुर्योधनः सैन्यं मन्दात्मा यत्र दुर्मतिः । अयुध्यमानं सचिवं वव्रे कृष्णं धनंजयः ॥
data.md: And one Akshauhini of my soldiers, between these two which shall I give to you?" Blind to his own interest, the foolish' Duryodhana asked for the soldiers.

data.v: संजयं प्रेषयामास शमार्थं पाण्डवान्प्रति । यत्र दूतं महाराजो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् ॥
श्रुत्वा च पाण्डवान्यत्र वासुदेवपुरोगमान् । प्रजागरः संप्रजज्ञे धृतराष्ट्रस्य चिन्तया ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra heard all about the Pandavas, their friends, Krishna and others; and his great anxiety and sleeplessness in consequence. Vidura's sound, wise and various counsels were given to the wise king Dhritarashtra.

data.v: विदुरो यत्र वाक्यानि विचित्राणि हितानि च । श्रावयामास राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra heard all about the Pandavas, their friends, Krishna and others; and his great anxiety and sleeplessness in consequence. Vidura's sound, wise and various counsels were given to the wise king Dhritarashtra.

data.v: तथा सनत्सुजातेन यत्राध्यात्ममनुत्तमम् । मनस्तापान्वितो राजा श्रावितः शोकलालसः ॥
data.md: It then contains the excellent truths of spiritual philosophy that were told by Sanatsujata.

data.v: प्रभाते राजसमितौ संजयो यत्र चाभिभोः । ऐकात्म्यं वासुदेवस्य प्रोक्तवानर्जुनस्य च ॥
data.md: Of the great friendship between Arjuna and Krishna. It was then that great Krishna, moved by pity and being desirous of bringing peace.

data.v: यत्र कृष्णो दयापन्नः संधिमिच्छन्महायशाः । स्वयमागाच्छमं कर्तुं नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
प्रत्याख्यानं च कृष्णस्य राज्ञा दुर्योधनेन वै । शमार्थं याचमानस्य पक्षयोरुभयोर्हितम् ॥
data.md: Went himself to Hastinapur, the capital of the Kurus. (It then relates) the rejection of the peaceful offer of Krishna by the king Duryodhana.

data.v: कर्णदुर्योधनादीनां दुष्टं विज्ञाय मन्त्रितम् । योगेश्वरत्वं कृष्णेन यत्र राजसु दर्शितम् ॥
रथमारोप्य कृष्णेन यत्र कर्णोऽनुमन्त्रितः । उपायपूर्वं शौण्डीर्यात्प्रत्याख्यातश्च तेन सः ॥
data.md: Karna's rejection of Krishna's advice out of pride; then the chastiser of his enemies, Krishna returned to Upaplavya from Hastinapur.

data.v: ततश्चाप्यभिनिर्यात्रा रथाश्वनरदन्तिनाम् । नगराद्धास्तिनपुराद्बलसंख्यानमेव च ॥
यत्र राज्ञा उलूकस्य प्रेषणं पाण्डवान्प्रति । श्वोभाविनि महायुद्धे दूत्येन क्रूरवादिना । रथातिरथसंख्यानमम्बोपाख्यानमेव च ॥
data.md: As an envoy on the day before the great battle; then the number of charioteers of different classes was related. Then is told the story of Amba.

data.v: एतत्सुबहुवृत्तान्तं पञ्चमं पर्व भारते । उद्योगपर्व निर्दिष्टं संधिविग्रहसंश्रितम् ॥
data.md: These are the matters that have been dwelt on, the fifth Parva of the Bharata in full of incidents regarding both peace and war.

data.v: अध्यायाः संख्यया त्वत्र षडशीतिशतं स्मृतम् । श्लोकानां षट्सहस्राणि तावन्त्येव शतानि च ॥
data.md: Great Rishis, the great Vyasa has composed this Parva in one hundred and eighty six chapters. The number of slokas composed in it by the great Rishi is six thousand six hundred and ninety eight.

data.v: श्लोकाश्च नवतिः प्रोक्तास्तथैवाष्टौ महात्मना । व्यासेनोदारमतिना पर्वण्यस्मिंस्तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Great Rishis, the great Vyasa has composed this Parva in one hundred and eighty six chapters. The number of slokas composed in it by the great Rishi is six thousand six hundred and ninety eight.

data.v: अत ऊर्ध्वं विचित्रार्थं भीष्मपर्व प्रचक्षते । जम्बूखण्डविनिर्माणं यत्रोक्तं संजयेन ह ॥
data.md: Then is told the wonderful Bhishma Parva. Sanjaya related in it the creation of Jambu country.

data.v: यत्र युद्धमभूद्घोरं दशाहान्यतिदारुणम् । यत्र यौधिष्ठिरं सैन्यं विषादमगमत्परम् ॥
कश्मलं यत्र पार्थस्य वासुदेवो महामतिः । मोहजं नाशयामास हेतुभिर्मोक्षदर्शनैः ॥
data.md: The high-souled Krishna dispelled in this Parva the great compunction which was felt by Arjuna towards his relatives, by citing reasons based on the philosophy of final emancipation.

data.v: शिखण्डिनं पुरस्कृत्य यत्र पार्थो महाधनुः । विनिघ्नन्निशितैर्बाणै रथाद्भीष्ममपातयत् ॥
षष्ठमेतन्महापर्व भारते परिकीर्तितम् । अध्यायानां शतं प्रोक्तं सप्तदश तथापरे ॥
पञ्च श्लोकसहस्राणि संख्ययाष्टौ शतानि च । श्लोकाश्च चतुराशीतिः पर्वण्यस्मिन्प्रकीर्तिताः । व्यासेन वेदविदुषा संख्याता भीष्मपर्वणि ॥
data.md: This extensive Parva is the sixth in the Bharata. It is composed of one hundred and seventeen chapters. Its number of slokas is five thousand eight hundred and eighty-four as composed by Vyasa, well-learned in the Vedas. Then comes Drona Parva, full of wonderful incidents.

data.v: द्रोणपर्व ततश्चित्रं बहुवृत्तान्तमुच्यते । यत्र संशप्तकाः पार्थमपनिन्यू रणाजिरात् ॥
भगदत्तो महाराजो यत्र शक्रसमो युधि । सुप्रतीकेन नागेन सह शस्तः किरीटिना ॥
data.md: The overthrow by Arjuna of the great king Bhagadatta, as great a warrior as Indra himself, with his elephant Supratika.

data.v: यत्राभिमन्युं बहवो जघ्नुर्लोकमहारथाः । जयद्रथमुखा बालं शूरमप्राप्तयौवनम् ॥
data.md: The death of the boy-hero, Abhimanyu in his teens, alone and unsupported at the hand of many great car-warriors including Jayadratha.

data.v: हतेऽभिमन्यौ क्रुद्धेन यत्र पार्थेन संयुगे । अक्षौहिणीः सप्त हत्वा हतो राजा जयद्रथः । संशप्तकावशेषं च कृतं निःशेषमाहवे ॥
data.md: On the death death of Abhimanyu, the destruction by Arjuna of seven Akshauhinis of soldiers alongwith Jayadratha in a great battle.

data.v: अलम्बुसः श्रुतायुश्च जलसंधश्च वीर्यवान् । सौमदत्तिर्विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः । घटोत्कचादयश्चान्ये निहता द्रोणपर्वणि ॥
data.md: In this Drona Parva is narrated the deaths of Alambusha, Shrutayus, valorous Jalasandha, Somdatti, Virata, great car-warrior Drupada, Ghatotkacha and others. Being exceedingly angry on account of the death of Drona in battle, Ashvathama also.

data.v: अश्वत्थामापि चात्रैव द्रोणे युधि निपातिते । अस्त्रं प्रादुश्चकारोग्रं नारायणममर्षितः ॥
सप्तमं भारते पर्व महदेतदुदाहृतम् । अत्र ते पृथिवीपालाः प्रायशो निधनं गताः । द्रोणपर्वणि ये शूरा निर्दिष्टाः पुरुषर्षभाः ॥
data.md: These are the matters elaborately narrated in the seventh Parva of the Bharata, in which all the chief and potentates mentioned were killed.

data.v: अध्यायानां शतं प्रोक्तमध्यायाः सप्ततिस्तथा । अष्टौ श्लोकसहस्राणि तथा नव शतानि च ॥
श्लोका नव तथैवात्र संख्यातास्तत्त्वदर्शिना । पाराशर्येण मुनिना संचिन्त्य द्रोणपर्वणि ॥
data.md: The number of chapters in this Parva is one hundred and seventy. The number of slokas composed in the Drona Parva by the great Rishi, the son of Parashara and the master of great knowledge, is eight thousand nine hundred and nine.

data.v: अतः परं कर्णपर्व प्रोच्यते परमाद्भुतम् । सारथ्ये विनियोगश्च मद्रराजस्य धीमतः । आख्यातं यत्र पौराणं त्रिपुरस्य निपातनम् ॥
data.md: Then comes the most wonderful Parva named Karna. In it is described the appointment of king of the Madra as the charioteer (of Karna).

data.v: प्रयाणे परुषश्चात्र संवादः कर्णशल्ययोः । हंसकाकीयमाख्यानमत्रैवाक्षेपसंहितम् ॥
अन्योन्यं प्रति च क्रोधो युधिष्ठिरकिरीटिनोः । द्वैरथे यत्र पार्थेन हतः कर्णो महारथः ॥
अष्टमं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतद्भारतचिन्तकैः । एकोनसप्ततिः प्रोक्ता अध्यायाः कर्णपर्वणि । चत्वार्येव सहस्राणि नव श्लोकशतानि च ॥
data.md: The leader of the Bharata calls this Parva the eighth Parva. The number of its chapters is sixty nine and that of the slokas is four thousand nine hundred and sixty four.

data.v: अतः परं विचित्रार्थं शल्यपर्व प्रकीर्तितम् । हतप्रवीरे सैन्ये तु नेता मद्रेश्वरोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Then is told the wonderful, Parva called Shalya. After the death of all great warriors, the king of Madra became the commander.

data.v: वृत्तानि रथयुद्धानि कीर्त्यन्ते यत्र भागशः । विनाशः कुरुमुख्यानां शल्यपर्वणि कीर्त्यते ॥
data.md: Then is described one after the other the encounters of various charioteer; then the deaths of the chief warrior of the Kuru army.

data.v: शल्यस्य निधनं चात्र धर्मराजान्महारथात् । गदायुद्धं तु तुमुलमत्रैव परिकीर्तितम् । सरस्वत्याश्च तीर्थानां पुण्यता परिकीर्तिता ॥
data.md: The arrival of Balarama at the time of the fight is next described. Then is told the sacredness of the Sarasvati.

data.v: नवमं पर्व निर्दिष्टमेतदद्भुतमर्थवत् । एकोनषष्टिरध्यायास्तत्र संख्याविशारदैः ॥
संख्याता बहुवृत्तान्ताः श्लोकाग्रं चात्र शस्यते । त्रीणि श्लोकसहस्राणि द्वे शते विंशतिस्तथा । मुनिना संप्रणीतानि कौरवाणां यशोभृताम् ॥
data.md: The number of chapters in this Parva is fifty-nine and the number of slokas composed by the great Vyasa, the spreader of the fame of the Kuru Dynasty, is three thousand two hundred and twenty.

data.v: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सौप्तिकं पर्व दारुणम् । भग्नोरुं यत्र राजानं दुर्योधनममर्षणम् ॥
data.md: I shall now describe the contents of the terrible tenth Parva, named Sauptika. On the departure of the Pandavas the great car-warrior, Kritavarma. Kripa and the son of Drona (Ashvathama) came in the evening to he place where Duryodhana was lying with the brocken thigh.

data.v: व्यपयातेषु पार्थेषु त्रयस्तेऽभ्याययू रथाः । कृतवर्मा कृपो द्रौणिः सायाह्ने रुधिरोक्षिताः ॥
data.md: I shall now describe the contents of the terrible tenth Parva, named Sauptika. On the departure of the Pandavas the great car-warrior, Kritavarma. Kripa and the son of Drona (Ashvathama) came in the evening to he place where Duryodhana was lying with the brocken thigh.

data.v: प्रतिजज्ञे दृढक्रोधो द्रौणिर्यत्र महारथः । अहत्वा सर्वपाञ्चालान्धृष्टद्युम्नपुरोगमान् । पाण्डवांश्च सहामात्यान्न विमोक्ष्यामि दंशनम् ॥
data.md: "I will not take off my armour without killing all the Panchalas with Dhristadyumna and the Pandavas with their allies."
