data.md: He grew up in the house of the king of the snakes. He studied the Vedas with their Angas from the great Rishi Chyavana, the son of Bhrigu.

data.v: चरितव्रतो बाल एव बुद्धिसत्त्वगुणान्वितः । नाम चास्याभवत्ख्यातं लोकेष्वास्तीक इत्युत ॥
data.md: Though he was a mere boy, his asceticism was great; he was gifted with great intelligence and many virtues. He was known in the world by the name of Astika.

data.v: अस्तीत्युक्त्वा गतो यस्मात्पिता गर्भस्थमेव तम् । वनं तस्मादिदं तस्य नामास्तीकेति विश्रुतम् ॥
data.md: He was known by the name of Astika, because his father had gone away to the forest, saying 'Asti' (one is there), when he was in his mother's womb.

data.v: स बाल एव तत्रस्थश्चरन्नमितबुद्धिमान् । गृहे पन्नगराजस्य प्रयत्नात्पर्यरक्ष्यत ॥
data.md: Though he was only a boy, yet he was grave and intelligent. He was kept with great care in the palace of the snake-king.

data.v: भगवानिव देवेशः शूलपाणिर्हिरण्यदः । विवर्धमानः सर्वांस्तान्पन्नगानभ्यहर्षयत् ॥
data.md: He was like the illustrious lord of the celestials, Shulapani (Shiva). He grew up day by day to the infinite delight of all the snakes.

data.v: यदपृच्छत्तदा राजा मन्त्रिणो जनमेजयः । पितुः स्वर्गगतिं तन्मे विस्तरेण पुनर्वद ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said: Tell me again in detail all that king Janamejaya asked his ministers to say about his father's ascension to heaven.

data.v: शृणु ब्रह्मन्यथा पृष्टा मन्त्रिणो नृपतेस्तदा । आख्यातवन्तस्ते सर्वे निधनं तत्परिक्षितः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : O Brahmana, hear all that the king asked his ministers and all that they said about the death of Parikshit.

data.v: जानन्ति तु भवन्तस्तद्यथावृत्तः पिता मम । आसीद्यथा च निधनं गतः काले महायशाः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : You know all that happened to my father and how my illustrious father met with his death.

data.v: श्रुत्वा भवत्सकाशाद्धि पितुर्वृत्तमशेषतः । कल्याणं प्रतिपत्स्यामि विपरीतं न जातु चित् ॥
data.md: Hearing from you all about my father, I shall do what is proper and good. I shall not do otherwise.

data.v: मन्त्रिणोऽथाब्रुवन्वाक्यं पृष्टास्तेन महात्मना । सर्वधर्मविदः प्राज्ञा राजानं जनमेजयम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Being asked by that high-souled king Janamejaya, the virtuous and wise ministers thus replied.

data.v: धर्मात्मा च महात्मा च प्रजापालः पिता तव । आसीदिह यथावृत्तः स महात्मा शृणुष्व तत् ॥
data.md: Your father was virtuous and noble and a protector of his subjects. Hear, how that highsouled king conducted himself on earth.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यं स्वधर्मस्थं स कृत्वा पर्यरक्षत । धर्मतो धर्मविद्राजा धर्मो विग्रहवानिव ॥
data.md: That virtuous king, virtuously inclined, protected, like Virtue and Justice themselves, the four castes, keeping them in the duties of their respective orders.

data.v: ररक्ष पृथिवीं देवीं श्रीमानतुलविक्रमः । द्वेष्टारस्तस्य नैवासन्स च न द्वेष्टि कंचन । समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु प्रजापतिरिवाभवत् ॥
data.md: Blessed with fortune and with matchless prowess, he protected the goddess earth. He hated none and had none to hate him.

data.v: ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्राश्चैव स्वकर्मसु । स्थिताः सुमनसो राजंस्तेन राज्ञा स्वनुष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: Like Prajapati he looked at all creatures with equal eyes. The Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras,

data.v: विधवानाथकृपणान्विकलांश्च बभार सः । सुदर्शः सर्वभूतानामासीत्सोम इवापरः ॥
तुष्टपुष्टजनः श्रीमान्सत्यवाग्दृढविक्रमः । धनुर्वेदे च शिष्योऽभून्नृपः शारद्वतस्य सः ॥
गोविन्दस्य प्रियश्चासीत्पिता ते जनमेजय । लोकस्य चैव सर्वस्य प्रिय आसीन्महायशाः ॥
परिक्षीणेषु कुरुषु उत्तरायामजायत । परिक्षिदभवत्तेन सौभद्रस्यात्मजो बली ॥
राजधर्मार्थकुशलो युक्तः सर्वगुणैर्नृपः । जितेन्द्रियश्चात्मवांश्च मेधावी वृद्धसेवितः ॥
षड्वर्गविन्महाबुद्धिर्नीतिधर्मविदुत्तमः । प्रजा इमास्तव पिता षष्टिं वर्षाण्यपालयत् । ततो दिष्टान्तमापन्नः सर्पेणानतिवर्तितम् ॥
ततस्त्वं पुरुषश्रेष्ठ धर्मेण प्रतिपेदिवान् । इदं वर्षसहस्राय राज्यं कुरुकुलागतम् । बाल एवाभिजातोऽसि सर्वभूतानुपालकः ॥
data.md: Your father ruled over his subjects for sixty years. When he died, all the people were extremely sorry. After him, O best of men, you have acquired this hereditary kingdom of the Kurus, (who have been ruling over it) for the last thousand years. O protector of every creature, you were installed when you were a child.

data.v: नास्मिन्कुले जातु बभूव राजा; यो न प्रजानां हितकृत्प्रियश्च । विशेषतः प्रेक्ष्य पितामहानां; वृत्तं महद्वृत्तपरायणानाम् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : None was born in our dynasty who did not look after the good of his subjects and who was not beloved by them. See specially the conduct of my grandfathers (five Pandava brothers) who were ever engaged in great deeds.

data.v: कथं निधनमापन्नः पिता मम तथाविधः । आचक्षध्वं यथावन्मे श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: How did my such a noble father meet with his death? Describe it to me. I am desirous of hearing it.

data.v: एवं संचोदिता राज्ञा मन्त्रिणस्ते नराधिपम् । ऊचुः सर्वे यथावृत्तं राज्ञः प्रियहिते रताः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Thus asked by the king, the ministers, the well-wishers of the king, told him everything as it had happened.

data.v: बभूव मृगयाशीलस्तव राजन्पिता सदा । यथा पाण्डुर्महाभागो धनुर्धरवरो युधि । अस्मास्वासज्य सर्वाणि राजकार्याण्यशेषतः ॥
data.md: The Ministers said: O king, that monarch, the lord of the world, greatly obedient to all Shastras like the first of all beings, became addicted to sports like the best of bow-men, the great warrior and exceedingly powerful Pandu. He made over to us all state affairs.

data.v: स कदाचिद्वनचरो मृगं विव्याध पत्रिणा । विद्ध्वा चान्वसरत्तूर्णं तं मृगं गहने वने ॥
data.md: Once on a time he went into the forest and pierced a deer with an arrow. Having thus wounded the deer, he followed it armed with sword and quiver into the dense forest,

data.v: पदातिर्बद्धनिस्त्रिंशस्ततायुधकलापवान् । न चाससाद गहने मृगं नष्टं पिता तव ॥
data.md: Alone on foot. But he could not, however, come upon that lost deer.

data.v: परिश्रान्तो वयःस्थश्च षष्टिवर्षो जरान्वितः । क्षुधितः स महारण्ये ददर्श मुनिमन्तिके ॥
data.md: He, wo was sixty years old and therefore fatigued and hungry, saw a great Rishi in that great forest.

data.v: स तं पप्रच्छ राजेन्द्रो मुनिं मौनव्रतान्वितम् । न च किंचिदुवाचैनं स मुनिः पृच्छतोऽपि सन् ॥
data.md: The king accosted that Rishi, who was then observing the vow of silence, but the Rishi did not make any reply.

data.v: ततो राजा क्षुच्छ्रमार्तस्तं मुनिं स्थाणुवत्स्थितम् । मौनव्रतधरं शान्तं सद्यो मन्युवशं ययौ ॥
data.md: The fatigued and the hungry king grew angry with the Rishi who sat motionless as a piece of wood in observance of his vow of silence.

data.v: न बुबोध हि तं राजा मौनव्रतधरं मुनिम् । स तं मन्युसमाविष्टो धर्षयामास ते पिता ॥
data.md: Knowing not that the Rishi was observing a vow of silence, your father, being angry, insulted him.

data.v: मृतं सर्पं धनुष्कोट्या समुत्क्षिप्य धरातलात् । तस्य शुद्धात्मनः प्रादात्स्कन्धे भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: O excellent one of the Bharata race, he took up from the ground a dead snake with the end of his bow and placed it on the shoulder of that holy Rishi.

data.v: न चोवाच स मेधावी तमथो साध्वसाधु वा । तस्थौ तथैव चाक्रुध्यन्सर्पं स्कन्धेन धारयन् ॥
data.md: But that wise man did not speak a word, good or bad and he did not become angry. He remained as he was, bearing the snake on his shoulder.

data.v: ततः स राजा राजेन्द्र स्कन्धे तस्य भुजंगमम् । मुनेः क्षुत्क्षाम आसज्य स्वपुरं पुनराययौ ॥
data.md: The Ministers said : O king of kings, that tired and hungry monarch, having placed the snake on the shoulder of the Rishi, came back to his own capital.

data.v: ऋषेस्तस्य तु पुत्रोऽभूद्गवि जातो महायशाः । शृङ्गी नाम महातेजास्तिग्मवीर्योऽतिकोपनः ॥
data.md: The Rishi had a son, born of a cow, named Shringi. He was greatly renowned, exceedingly powerful and greatly energetic and very wrathful.

data.v: ब्रह्माणं सोऽभ्युपागम्य मुनिः पूजां चकार ह । अनुज्ञातो गतस्तत्र शृङ्गी शुश्राव तं तदा । सख्युः सकाशात्पितरं पित्रा ते धर्षितं तथा ॥
data.md: He went to Brahma and worshipped him. Commanded by him, Shringi was one day returning home,

data.v: मृतं सर्पं समासक्तं पित्रा ते जनमेजय । वहन्तं कुरुशार्दूल स्कन्धेनानपकारिणम् ॥
तपस्विनमतीवाथ तं मुनिप्रवरं नृप । जितेन्द्रियं विशुद्धं च स्थितं कर्मण्यथाद्भुते ॥
data.md: O king, (he heard that your father had insulted the Rishi) who was a great ascetic, the best of Rishis, a controller of his passions, a pious and holy man, a door of wonderful deeds, his soul enlightened with asceticism and his senses and their functions under his complete control.

data.v: तपसा द्योतितात्मानं स्वेष्वङ्गेषु यतं तथा । शुभाचारं शुभकथं सुस्थिरं तमलोलुपम् ॥
अक्षुद्रमनसूयं च वृद्धं मौनव्रते स्थितम् । शरण्यं सर्वभूतानां पित्रा विप्रकृतं तव ॥
data.md: His practices were pious, his speeches pure. He was contented and had no avarice; he had not the least meanness, nor had he any avarice. He was old and observant of the vow of silence. And he was the refuge of all creatures. Such was the Rishi whom your father insulted. The son of that Rishi, however, cursed your father in anger.

data.v: शशापाथ स तच्छ्रुत्वा पितरं ते रुषान्वितः । ऋषेः पुत्रो महातेजा बालोऽपि स्थविरैर्वरः ॥
स क्षिप्रमुदकं स्पृष्ट्वा रोषादिदमुवाच ह । पितरं तेऽभिसंधाय तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव ॥
अनागसि गुरौ यो मे मृतं सर्पमवासृजत् । तं नागस्तक्षकः क्रुद्धस्तेजसा सादयिष्यति । सप्तरात्रादितः पापं पश्य मे तपसो बलम् ॥
data.md: With reference to your father, burning as if in effulgence, “Behold my ascetic powers. The angry and effulgent snake Takshaka, as spoken by me, will burn with his poison, within seven nights hence, the wretch who has placed a dead snake on the shoulder of my sire.“ Having said this, he went to the place where his father was. Seeing his father, he told him of the curse uttered by him.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा प्रययौ तत्र पिता यत्रास्य सोऽभवत् । दृष्ट्वा च पितरं तस्मै शापं तं प्रत्यवेदयत् ॥
स चापि मुनिशार्दूलः प्रेषयामास ते पितुः । शप्तोऽसि मम पुत्रेण यत्तो भव महीपते । तक्षकस्त्वां महाराज तेजसा सादयिष्यति ॥
data.md: (Saying in the words of his preceptor) “O king, you have been cursed by my son. Takshaka will burn you with his poison. O great king, be careful.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु तद्वचो घोरं पिता ते जनमेजय । यत्तोऽभवत्परित्रस्तस्तक्षकात्पन्नगोत्तमात् ॥
data.md: O Janamejaya, your father, having heard these terrible words, took every precaution against the powerful snake Takshaka.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिंस्तु दिवसे सप्तमे समुपस्थिते । राज्ञः समीपं ब्रह्मर्षिः काश्यपो गन्तुमैच्छत ॥
data.md: When the seventh day arrived, a Brahmana Rishi, named Kashyapa, wished to come to the king.

data.v: तं ददर्शाथ नागेन्द्रः काश्यपं तक्षकस्तदा । तमब्रवीत्पन्नगेन्द्रः काश्यपं त्वरितं व्रजन् । क्व भवांस्त्वरितो याति किं च कार्यं चिकीर्षति ॥
data.md: The king of the snakes, Takshaka, saw Kashyapa and that king of the snakes asked that Brahmana, “Where are you going in a hurry? And what is your business for which you go?"

data.v: यत्र राजा कुरुश्रेष्ठः परिक्षिन्नाम वै द्विज । तक्षकेण भुजंगेन धक्ष्यते किल तत्र वै ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said : O Brahmana, I am going where the best of the Kurus, the king named Parikshit is. He will today be killed by the snake Takshaka.

data.v: गच्छाम्यहं तं त्वरितः सद्यः कर्तुमपज्वरम् । मयाभिपन्नं तं चापि न सर्पो धर्षयिष्यति ॥
data.md: I am going in a hurry to cure him, so that he, being treated by me, may not he killed by the snake.

data.v: किमर्थं तं मया दष्टं संजीवयितुमिच्छसि । ब्रूहि काममहं तेऽद्य दद्मि स्वं वेश्म गम्यताम् ॥
धनलिप्सुरहं तत्र यामीत्युक्तश्च तेन सः । तमुवाच महात्मानं मानयञ्श्लक्ष्णया गिरा ॥
data.md: “I am going there with the desire of (getting) wealth.” The illustrious Takshaka, (thereupon) told him in sweet words,

data.v: यावद्धनं प्रार्थयसे तस्माद्राज्ञस्ततोऽधिकम् । गृहाण मत्त एव त्वं संनिवर्तस्व चानघ ॥
data.md: "O sinless one, take from me more wealth than you expect to get from that king. And then go back."

data.v: स एवमुक्तो नागेन काश्यपो द्विपदां वरः । लब्ध्वा वित्तं निववृते तक्षकाद्यावदीप्सितम् ॥
data.md: The best of men, Kashyapa, being thus addressed by the snake and having received from him as much wealth as he desired to get, went back.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रतिगते विप्रे छद्मनोपेत्य तक्षकः । तं नृपं नृपतिश्रेष्ठ पितरं धार्मिकं तव ॥
data.md: When the Brahman went back, Takshaka went in disguise to that best of kings, your virtuous father, who was then staying with all precautions in his palace; and he burnt him with the fire of his poison. After this (most lamentable event,) you, O best of kings, were installed on the throne.

data.v: प्रासादस्थं यत्तमपि दग्धवान्विषवह्निना । ततस्त्वं पुरुषव्याघ्र विजयायाभिषेचितः ॥
data.md: When the Brahman went back, Takshaka went in disguise to that best of kings, your virtuous father, who was then staying with all precautions in his palace; and he burnt him with the fire of his poison. After this (most lamentable event,) you, O best of kings, were installed on the throne.

data.v: एतद्दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि यथावन्नृपसत्तम । अस्माभिर्निखिलं सर्वं कथितं ते सुदारुणम् ॥
data.md: O best of kings, we have told you all that we saw and heard, though the account is te: ible and cruel.

data.v: श्रुत्वा चैतं नृपश्रेष्ठ पार्थिवस्य पराभवम् । अस्य चर्षेरुत्तङ्कस्य विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: O best of kings, you have now heard how (your father) the great king of the world was killed and how Rishi Uttanka was insulted, do what is proper.

data.v: एतत्तु श्रोतुमिच्छामि अटव्यां निर्जने वने । संवादं पन्नगेन्द्रस्य काश्यपस्य च यत्तदा ॥
केन दृष्टं श्रुतं चापि भवतां श्रोत्रमागतम् । श्रुत्वा चाथ विधास्यामि पन्नगान्तकरीं मतिम् ॥
शृणु राजन्यथास्माकं येनैतत्कथितं पुरा । समागमं द्विजेन्द्रस्य पन्नगेन्द्रस्य चाध्वनि ॥
data.md: The Ministers said : O king, hear from whom we heard the conversation between that king of the Brahmanas and the king of the snakes.

data.v: तस्मिन्वृक्षे नरः कश्चिदिन्धनार्थाय पार्थिव । विचिन्वन्पूर्वमारूढः शुष्कशाखं वनस्पतिम् । अबुध्यमानौ तं तत्र वृक्षस्थं पन्नगद्विजौ ॥
data.md: O king, a certain man had climbed that lord of the forest to collect its dry twigs for sacrificial fuel.

data.v: स तु तेनैव वृक्षेण भस्मीभूतोऽभवत्तदा । द्विजप्रभावाद्राजेन्द्र जीवितः सवनस्पतिः ॥
तेन गत्वा नृपश्रेष्ठ नगरेऽस्मिन्निवेदितम् । यथावृत्तं तु तत्सर्वं तक्षकस्य द्विजस्य च ॥
एतत्ते कथितं राजन्यथावृत्तं यथाश्रुतम् । श्रुत्वा तु नृपशार्दूल प्रकुरुष्व यथेप्सितम् ॥
data.md: And told us in detail what happened between Takshaka and the Brahmana. O king, we are thus able to tell you what we saw or heard. O best of kings, having heard it, do what should be done now.

data.v: मन्त्रिणां तु वचः श्रुत्वा स राजा जनमेजयः । पर्यतप्यत दुःखार्तः प्रत्यपिंषत्करे करम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Having heard the words of the ministers, the king Janamejaya began to weep in grief and squeezed his hands.

data.v: निःश्वासमुष्णमसकृद्दीर्घं राजीवलोचनः । मुमोचाश्रूणि च तदा नेत्राभ्यां प्रततं नृपः । उवाच च महीपालो दुःखशोकसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: The lotus-eyed king breathed long and hot breaths; the king shed tears and wept aloud.

data.v: श्रुत्वैतद्भवतां वाक्यं पितुर्मे स्वर्गतिं प्रति । निश्चितेयं मम मतिर्या वै तां मे निबोधत ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : I have heard your account of my father's ascension to heaven. Know now what is my fixed resolve. No time should be lost to avenge the wretch Takshaka who killed my father. The wretch killed the king, making Shringi a mere pretext.

data.v: अनन्तरमहं मन्ये तक्षकाय दुरात्मने । प्रतिकर्तव्यमित्येव येन मे हिंसितः पिता ॥
ऋषेर्हि शृङ्गेर्वचनं कृत्वा दग्ध्वा च पार्थिवम् । यदि गच्छेदसौ पापो ननु जीवेत्पिता मम ॥
data.md: Out of malignity alone he prevented Kashyapa from coming. If that Brahmana had come, my father would have certainly lived.

data.v: परिहीयेत किं तस्य यदि जीवेत्स पार्थिवः । काश्यपस्य प्रसादेन मन्त्रिणां सुनयेन च ॥
data.md: What harm could have possibly come to him if the king had revived by the grace of Kashyapa and the precautions taken by the ministers?

data.v: स तु वारितवान्मोहात्काश्यपं द्विजसत्तमम् । संजिजीवयिषुं प्राप्तं राजानमपराजितम् ॥
data.md: He, being ignorant of my anger, prevented that best of Brahmana, Kashyapa, from coming to my unconquerable father.

data.v: महानतिक्रमो ह्येष तक्षकस्य दुरात्मनः । द्विजस्य योऽददद्द्रव्यं मा नृपं जीवयेदिति ॥
data.md: The aggression of the wretch Takshaka is great, for he gave wealth to the Brahmana, so that he might not revive the king.

data.v: उत्तङ्कस्य प्रियं कुर्वन्नात्मनश्च महत्प्रियम् । भवतां चैव सर्वेषां यास्याम्यपचितिं पितुः ॥
data.md: I must avenge myself on my father's enemy, to please myself, to please Uttanka and you all.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा ततः श्रीमान्मन्त्रिभिश्चानुमोदितः । आरुरोह प्रतिज्ञां स सर्पसत्राय पार्थिवः । ब्रह्मन्भरतशार्दूलो राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The illustrious king having said so, the ministers expressed their approbation. The king expressed his determination of performing a Snake-sacrifice.

data.v: पुरोहितमथाहूय ऋत्विजं वसुधाधिपः । अब्रवीद्वाक्यसंपन्नः संपदर्थकरं वचः ॥
यो मे हिंसितवांस्तातं तक्षकः स दुरात्मवान् । प्रतिकुर्यां यथा तस्य तद्भवन्तो ब्रुवन्तु मे ॥
अपि तत्कर्म विदितं भवतां येन पन्नगम् । तक्षकं संप्रदीप्तेऽग्नौ प्राप्स्येऽहं सहबान्धवम् ॥
यथा तेन पिता मह्यं पूर्वं दग्धो विषाग्निना । तथाहमपि तं पापं दग्धुमिच्छामि पन्नगम् ॥
data.md: Tell me what I must do. Do you know any act by which I can throw Takshaka with all his friends and relatives in the blazing fire? I want to burn the wretch of a snake as he burnt my father with his poison.

data.v: अस्ति राजन्महत्सत्रं त्वदर्थं देवनिर्मितम् । सर्पसत्रमिति ख्यातं पुराणे कथ्यते नृप ॥
data.md: The Ritwijas said : O king, there is a sacrifice advised by the celestials for you. It is known as the Snakesacrifice and is spoken of in the Puranas.

data.v: आहर्ता तस्य सत्रस्य त्वन्नान्योऽस्ति नराधिप । इति पौराणिकाः प्राहुरस्माकं चास्ति स क्रतुः ॥
data.md: O king, you alone can accomplish it and no one else. The men, learned in the Puranas, have told us that there is such a sacrifice.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स राजर्षिर्मेने सर्पं हि तक्षकम् । हुताशनमुखं दीप्तं प्रविष्टमिति सत्तम ॥
data.md: Sauti said : O excellent one, thus addressed, that royal sage thought Takshaka already thrown into the blazing fire and burnt to ashes.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्मन्त्रविदस्तान्राजा ब्राह्मणांस्तदा । आहरिष्यामि तत्सत्रं संभाराः संभ्रियन्तु मे ॥
data.md: The king then told these Brahmanas, learned in Mantras, “I shall perform that sacrifice. Tell me the things that are necessary.

data.v: ततस्ते ऋत्विजस्तस्य शास्त्रतो द्विजसत्तम । देशं तं मापयामासुर्यज्ञायतनकारणात् । यथावज्ज्ञानविदुषः सर्वे बुद्ध्या परं गताः ॥
data.md: O best of Biahmanas, thereupon his wise Ritwijas, learned in the Shastras, measured, according to the ordinances, a piece of land for the sacrificial platform.

data.v: ऋद्ध्या परमया युक्तमिष्टं द्विजगणायुतम् । प्रभूतधनधान्याढ्यमृत्विग्भिः सुनिवेशितम् ॥
निर्माय चापि विधिवद्यज्ञायतनमीप्सितम् । राजानं दीक्षयामासुः सर्पसत्राप्तये तदा ॥
इदं चासीत्तत्र पूर्वं सर्पसत्रे भविष्यति । निमित्तं महदुत्पन्नं यज्ञविघ्नकरं तदा ॥
यज्ञस्यायतने तस्मिन्क्रियमाणे वचोऽब्रवीत् । स्थपतिर्बुद्धिसंपन्नो वास्तुविद्याविशारदः ॥
data.md: An incident which foreboded a hindrance to it. For when the sacrificial platform was being built, a man, Suta by caste, well acquainted with the Puranas and learned in the art of masonry and of laying foundations, said,

data.v: इत्यब्रवीत्सूत्रधारः सूतः पौराणिकस्तदा । यस्मिन्देशे च काले च मापनेयं प्रवर्तिता । ब्राह्मणं कारणं कृत्वा नायं संस्थास्यते क्रतुः ॥
data.md: “The land in which the platform was made and the time when it was measured indicate that this sacrifice will not be completed. A Brahmana will be its cause."

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु राजा स प्राग्दीक्षाकालमब्रवीत् । क्षत्तारं नेह मे कश्चिदज्ञातः प्रविशेदिति ॥
data.md: Having heard this, the king, before he was installed in the sacrifice, ordered the gate keepers, saying, “None must be allowed to enter here without my permission."

data.v: ततः कर्म प्रववृते सर्पसत्रे विधानतः । पर्यक्रामंश्च विधिवत्स्वे स्वे कर्मणि याजकाः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The Snake-sacrifice then began in due form. The sacrificial priests, expert in their respective duties according to the ordinance, their bodies with black garments and their eyes red from the smoke, poured ghee in the blazing fire, uttering the Mantras.

data.v: परिधाय कृष्णवासांसि धूमसंरक्तलोचनाः । जुहुवुर्मन्त्रवच्चैव समिद्धं जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The Snake-sacrifice then began in due form. The sacrificial priests, expert in their respective duties according to the ordinance, their bodies with black garments and their eyes red from the smoke, poured ghee in the blazing fire, uttering the Mantras.

data.v: कम्पयन्तश्च सर्वेषामुरगाणां मनांसि ते । सर्पानाजुहुवुस्तत्र सर्वानग्निमुखे तदा ॥
data.md: Making the hearts of all the snakes tremble in fear, they began to pour ghee in the mouth of the Agni, uttering the names of the snakes.

data.v: ततः सर्पाः समापेतुः प्रदीप्ते हव्यवाहने । विवेष्टमानाः कृपणा आह्वयन्तः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Thereupon the snakes fell into the blazing fire one after another, each be-numbed and calling piteously to one another.

data.v: विस्फुरन्तः श्वसन्तश्च वेष्टयन्तस्तथा परे । पुच्छैः शिरोभिश्च भृशं चित्रभानुं प्रपेदिरे ॥
data.md: Breathing hard, swelling to enormous sizes, intwining one another with their heads and tails, they came in large numbers and fell into the blazing fire.

data.v: श्वेताः कृष्णाश्च नीलाश्च स्थविराः शिशवस्तथा । रुवन्तो भैरवान्नादान्पेतुर्दीप्ते विभावसौ ॥
data.md: The white, the black, the blue, the old and the young, those measuring a crosa those measuring a Yojana and those measuring a Gokarna, all fell violently into that blazing fire uttering various cries.

data.v: एवं शतसहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च । अवशानि विनष्टानि पन्नगानां द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Hundreds and thousands, tens of thousands and hundreds of thousands came be-numbed and perished on that occasion.

data.v: इन्दुरा इव तत्रान्ये हस्तिहस्ता इवापरे । मत्ता इव च मातङ्गा महाकाया महाबलाः ॥
data.md: Amongst those that perished, there were some that were like the horses, some like the trunks of elephants and others with the huge bodies and strength of mad elephants.

data.v: उच्चावचाश्च बहवो नानावर्णा विषोल्बणाः । घोराश्च परिघप्रख्या दन्दशूका महाबलाः । प्रपेतुरग्नावुरगा मातृवाग्दण्डपीडिताः ॥
data.md: The snakes of various colours and of virulent poison, of terrible look, like maces furnished with iron spikes, of enormous strength and of the greatest biting propensity, fell into the fire as the result of their mother's curse.

data.v: सर्पसत्रे तदा राज्ञः पाण्डवेयस्य धीमतः । जनमेजयस्य के त्वासन्नृत्विजः परमर्षयः ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said: Who were the great Rishis that became the Ritvijas in the Snake-sacrifice of the wise king Janamejaya of the Pandava dynasty?

data.v: के सदस्या बभूवुश्च सर्पसत्रे सुदारुणे । विषादजननेऽत्यर्थं पन्नगानां महाभये ॥
data.md: Who became the Sadasyas in that terrible Snake-sacrifice, so fearful to the snakes and so sorrowful to them?

data.v: सर्वं विस्तरतस्तात भवाञ्शंसितुमर्हति । सर्पसत्रविधानज्ञा विज्ञेयास्ते हि सूतज ॥
data.md: O child, you should describe all this in detail, so that, O Sauti, we may know who were acquainted with the rituals of the Snakesacrifice.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि नामानीह मनीषिणाम् । ये ऋत्विजः सदस्याश्च तस्यासन्नृपतेस्तदा ॥
data.md: Sauti said : I shall tell you the names of those wise men who became the Ritvijas and Sadasyas of the king.

data.v: तत्र होता बभूवाथ ब्राह्मणश्चण्डभार्गवः । च्यवनस्यान्वये जातः ख्यातो वेदविदां वरः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, named Chanda Bhargava, born in the race of Chyavana, greatly illustrious and the foremost man amongst all the learned in the Vedas, became the Hota in that sacrifice.

data.v: उद्गाता ब्राह्मणो वृद्धो विद्वान्कौत्सार्यजैमिनिः । ब्रह्माभवच्छार्ङ्गरवो अध्वर्युर्बोधपिङ्गलः ॥
data.md: This learned old Brahmana, Kautsa became the Udgata, Jaimini became the Brahma, Shranagarava and Pingala became the Adhvaryus.

data.v: सदस्यश्चाभवद्व्यासः पुत्रशिष्यसहायवान् । उद्दालकः शमठकः श्वेतकेतुश्च पञ्चमः ॥
असितो देवलश्चैव नारदः पर्वतस्तथा । आत्रेयः कुण्डजठरो द्विजः कुटिघटस्तथा ॥
वात्स्यः श्रुतश्रवा वृद्धस्तपःस्वाध्यायशीलवान् । कहोडो देवशर्मा च मौद्गल्यः शमसौभरः ॥
एते चान्ये च बहवो ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रताः । सदस्या अभवंस्तत्र सत्रे पारिक्षितस्य ह ॥
data.md: These and many others, who were vastly learned in the Vedas, became the Sadasyas in the sacrifice of the son of Parikshit.

data.v: जुह्वत्स्वृत्विक्ष्वथ तदा सर्पसत्रे महाक्रतौ । अहयः प्रापतंस्तत्र घोराः प्राणिभयावहाः ॥
data.md: When the Ritvijas began to offer ghee in the fire in that Snake-sacrifice, fearful snakes, striking fear into every creature, began to fall into its fire.

data.v: वसामेदोवहाः कुल्या नागानां संप्रवर्तिताः । ववौ गन्धश्च तुमुलो दह्यतामनिशं तदा ॥
data.md: The fat and the marrow of the snakes, thus burnt in the sacrificial fire, flowed like rivers and the whole atmosphere was filled with an insufferable stench, owing to this continual burning of the snakes.

data.v: पततां चैव नागानां धिष्ठितानां तथाम्बरे । अश्रूयतानिशं शब्दः पच्यतां चाग्निना भृशम् ॥
data.md: Incessant were the piteous cries of the snakes that fell into the fire and of those that were in the air about to fall into it.

data.v: तक्षकस्तु स नागेन्द्रः पुरंदरनिवेशनम् । गतः श्रुत्वैव राजानं दीक्षितं जनमेजयम् ॥
data.md: In the meanwhile, as soon as Takshaka heard that Janamejaya had been installed in the sacrifice, he, the king of snakes, went to Indra.

data.v: ततः सर्वं यथावृत्तमाख्याय भुजगोत्तमः । अगच्छच्छरणं भीत आगस्कृत्वा पुरंदरम् ॥
data.md: That best of snakes told every thing to Indra and having acknowledged his fault, asked his protection in fear,

data.v: तमिन्द्रः प्राह सुप्रीतो न तवास्तीह तक्षक । भयं नागेन्द्र तस्माद्वै सर्पसत्रात्कथंचन ॥
data.md: Indra, being much pleased, told him, “0 i Takshaka, o king of the snakes, you have nothing to fear here from the snake-sacrifice.

data.v: प्रसादितो मया पूर्वं तवार्थाय पितामहः । तस्मात्तव भयं नास्ति व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ॥
data.md: The Grandfather was pacified by me for your sake. Therefore, you have no fear. Drive away this fever of fear from your mind.”

data.v: एवमाश्वासितस्तेन ततः स भुजगोत्तमः । उवास भवने तत्र शक्रस्य मुदितः सुखी ॥
data.md: Thus being encouraged by him, the best of snakes, Takshaka, lived in Indra's abode in joy and happiness.

data.v: अजस्रं निपतत्स्वग्नौ नागेषु भृशदुःखितः । अल्पशेषपरीवारो वासुकिः पर्यतप्यत ॥
data.md: Here did Vasuki become exceedingly sorry, seeing that the snakes were continually falling into the fire and that his race had been reduced to only a few. That best of the snakes were confounded with grief and thus spoke to his sister,

data.v: कश्मलं चाविशद्घोरं वासुकिं पन्नगेश्वरम् । स घूर्णमानहृदयो भगिनीमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Here did Vasuki become exceedingly sorry, seeing that the snakes were continually falling into the fire and that his race had been reduced to only a few. That best of the snakes were confounded with grief and thus spoke to his sister,

data.v: दह्यन्तेऽङ्गानि मे भद्रे दिशो न प्रतिभान्ति च । सीदामीव च संमोहाद्घूर्णतीव च मे मनः ॥
data.md: “O amiable sister, my body is burning. I can no longer see the points of the heavens. I am about to fall owing to the loss of consciousness. My mind is whirling.

data.v: दृष्टिर्भ्रमति मेऽतीव हृदयं दीर्यतीव च । पतिष्याम्यवशोऽद्याहं तस्मिन्दीप्ते विभावसौ ॥
data.md: My sight is falling, my heart is trembling. Being be-numbed, I may fall into the blazing fire (of the sacrifice) today.

data.v: पारिक्षितस्य यज्ञोऽसौ वर्ततेऽस्मज्जिघांसया । व्यक्तं मयापि गन्तव्यं पितृराजनिवेशनम् ॥
data.md: This sacrifice of the son of Parikshit is begun for the extermination of our race. It is evident I also shall have (soon) to go to the land of the dead.

data.v: अयं स कालः संप्राप्तो यदर्थमसि मे स्वसः । जरत्कारोः पुरा दत्ता सा त्राह्यस्मान्सबान्धवान् ॥
data.md: That time has come, O sister, for which I bestowed you on the Rishi Jaratkaru; O sister, protect us with all our race.

data.v: आस्तीकः किल यज्ञं तं वर्तन्तं भुजगोत्तमे । प्रतिषेत्स्यति मां पूर्वं स्वयमाह पितामहः ॥
data.md: O best of the women of the snake race,। Astika will put an end to this sacrifice which is being performed. The Grandsire himself told me this in time gone by.

data.v: तद्वत्से ब्रूहि वत्सं स्वं कुमारं वृद्धसंमतम् । ममाद्य त्वं सभृत्यस्य मोक्षार्थं वेदवित्तमम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, O sister, ask your dear son, who is exceedingly learned in the Vedas and respected even by the old, to protect me and those dependent on me.

data.v: तत आहूय पुत्रं स्वं जरत्कारुर्भुजंगमा । वासुकेर्नागराजस्य वचनादिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The snake-lady, Jaratkaru, then calling her son, told him what was spoken to her by Vasuki, the king of the Nagas.

data.v: अहं तव पितुः पुत्र भ्रात्रा दत्ता निमित्ततः । कालः स चायं संप्राप्तस्तत्कुरुष्व यथातथम् ॥
data.md: (She said) "O son, the time has come for the accomplishment of that object for which I was bestowed by my brother on your father. Therefore, do what is needful."

data.v: किंनिमित्तं मम पितुर्दत्ता त्वं मातुलेन मे । तन्ममाचक्ष्व तत्त्वेन श्रुत्वा कर्तास्मि तत्तथा ॥
data.md: Astika said: For what object, O mother, were you bestowed by my uncle on my father? Tell me all, so that I may do what is proper.

data.v: तत आचष्ट सा तस्मै बान्धवानां हितैषिणी । भगिनी नागराजस्य जरत्कारुरविक्लवा ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Jaratkaru, the sister of the snake-king, ever desirous to do good to her race and much moved by the general distress said,

data.v: भुजगानामशेषाणां माता कद्रूरिति श्रुतिः । तया शप्ता रुषितया सुता यस्मान्निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: Jaratkaru said: O son, the mother of all the snakes was Kadru. Hear, why she cursed her sons in anger.

data.v: उच्चैःश्रवाः सोऽश्वराजो यन्मिथ्या न कृतो मम । विनतानिमित्तं पणिते दासभावाय पुत्रकाः ॥
data.md: Addressing her sons she said, “As you have refused to to change the colour of Uchchaishrava, the king of horses, thus making me a slave to Vinata according to the wager, the god of fire will consume you all in the sacrifice of Janamejaya. Thus being killed, you will go to the land of the dead.

data.v: जनमेजयस्य वो यज्ञे धक्ष्यत्यनिलसारथिः । तत्र पञ्चत्वमापन्नाः प्रेतलोकं गमिष्यथ ॥
data.md: Addressing her sons she said, “As you have refused to to change the colour of Uchchaishrava, the king of horses, thus making me a slave to Vinata according to the wager, the god of fire will consume you all in the sacrifice of Janamejaya. Thus being killed, you will go to the land of the dead.

data.v: तां च शप्तवतीमेवं साक्षाल्लोकपितामहः । एवमस्त्विति तद्वाक्यं प्रोवाचानुमुमोद च ॥
data.md: The Grandsire of all creatures approved her curse and when she was uttering it, he said, "Be it so."

data.v: वासुकिश्चापि तच्छ्रुत्वा पितामहवचस्तदा । अमृते मथिते तात देवाञ्शरणमीयिवान् ॥
data.md: O child, Vasuki, having heard this curse and the words of the Grandsire, sought the protection of the celestials after the completion of the churning of the ocean.

data.v: सिद्धार्थाश्च सुराः सर्वे प्राप्यामृतमनुत्तमम् । भ्रातरं मे पुरस्कृत्य प्रजापतिमुपागमन् ॥
data.md: The celestials, having their object gained, for they had obtained the excellent Ambrosia, came to the Grandsire, placing my brother (Vasuki) at the head.

data.v: ते तं प्रसादयामासुर्देवाः सर्वे पितामहम् । राज्ञा वासुकिना सार्धं स शापो न भवेदिति ॥
data.md: All the celestials, with the snake-king Vasuki, tried to induce the great Deity, born of the lotus to grace in a way so that the curse might be made futile.

data.v: वासुकिर्नागराजोऽयं दुःखितो ज्ञातिकारणात् । अभिशापः स मात्रास्य भगवन्न भवेदिति ॥
data.md: The celestials said : O lord, the king of the snakes, Vasuki, is sorry for his relatives. How may his mother's curse be made futile?

data.v: जरत्कारुर्जरत्कारुं यां भार्यां समवाप्स्यति । तत्र जातो द्विजः शापाद्भुजगान्मोक्षयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Brahma said : Jaratkaru will marry wife named Jaratkaru. That Brahmana, who will be born of her, will save the snakes.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचनं वासुकिः पन्नगेश्वरः । प्रादान्माममरप्रख्य तव पित्रे महात्मने । प्रागेवानागते काले तत्र त्वं मय्यजायथाः ॥
data.md: Jaratkaru said : The best of snakes, Vasuki, having heard this, O illustrious son, bestowed me on your noble father, long before the commencement of this sacrifice.

data.v: अयं स कालः संप्राप्तो भयान्नस्त्रातुमर्हसि । भ्रातरं चैव मे तस्मात्त्रातुमर्हसि पावकात् ॥
अमोघं नः कृतं तत्स्याद्यदहं तव धीमते । पित्रे दत्ता विमोक्षार्थं कथं वा पुत्र मन्यसे ॥
data.md: You should protect my brother and myself from the fire, so that the object (our protection) for which I was bestowed on your wise father, may not remain unfulfilled. O my son, what do you think (proper now)?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा सोऽस्तीको मातरं तदा । अब्रवीद्दुःखसंतप्तं वासुकिं जीवयन्निव ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Thus addressed, Astika said to his mother, “Yes, I will (save the snakes).” He then addressed Vasuki, thereby infusing life unto him and said,

data.v: अहं त्वां मोक्षयिष्यामि वासुके पन्नगोत्तम । तस्माच्छापान्महासत्त्व सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: "O Vasuki, the best of snakes, I shall protect you, I tell you truly that I shall relieve you from the curse.

data.v: भव स्वस्थमना नाग न हि ते विद्यते भयम् । प्रयतिष्ये तथा सौम्य यथा श्रेयो भविष्यति । न मे वागनृतं प्राह स्वैरेष्वपि कुतोऽन्यथा ॥
data.md: O snake, be at your ease. There is no longer any fear. I shall try my utmost to do you good.

data.v: तं वै नृपवरं गत्वा दीक्षितं जनमेजयम् । वाग्भिर्मङ्गलयुक्ताभिस्तोषयिष्येऽद्य मातुल । यथा स यज्ञो नृपतेर्निर्वर्तिष्यति सत्तम ॥
data.md: None can say that my words even in jest have ever been false, not to speak of my words on serious occasions. O uncle, going to that best of kings, Janamejaya, now installed in the sacrifice, I shall please him with words mixed with blessings, so that, O excellent one, that king will refrain from the sacrifice.

data.v: स संभावय नागेन्द्र मयि सर्वं महामते । न ते मयि मनो जातु मिथ्या भवितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: O king of the snakes, O high-minded one, believe all I say. Believe me, my resolve can never remain unfulfilled.

data.v: आस्तीक परिघूर्णामि हृदयं मे विदीर्यते । दिशश्च न प्रजानामि ब्रह्मदण्डनिपीडितः ॥
data.md: Vasuki said: O Astika, being afflicted with my mother's curse my head is whirling, my heart is breaking. I cannot see the points of the heavens.

data.v: न संतापस्त्वया कार्यः कथंचित्पन्नगोत्तम । दीप्तादग्नेः समुत्पन्नं नाशयिष्यामि ते भयम् ॥
data.md: Astika said: O best of snakes, you should not grieve any longer. I shall dispel your fear of the blazing fire.

data.v: ब्रह्मदण्डं महाघोरं कालाग्निसमतेजसम् । नाशयिष्यामि मात्र त्वं भयं कार्षीः कथंचन ॥
data.md: I shall extinguish this (fire), this terrible punishment, blazing as the fire of the end of the Yuga. You should not entertain any fear any longer.

data.v: ततः स वासुकेर्घोरमपनीय मनोज्वरम् । आधाय चात्मनोऽङ्गेषु जगाम त्वरितो भृशम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : In order to save the king of the snakes, the best of Brahmanas, Astika dispelling the terrible fever of Vasuki's heart and taking it as it were upon himself, went with speed to the sacrifice of Janamejaya which was adorned with all merits.

data.v: जनमेजयस्य तं यज्ञं सर्वैः समुदितं गुणैः । मोक्षाय भुजगेन्द्राणामास्तीको द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : In order to save the king of the snakes, the best of Brahmanas, Astika dispelling the terrible fever of Vasuki's heart and taking it as it were upon himself, went with speed to the sacrifice of Janamejaya which was adorned with all merits.

data.v: स गत्वापश्यदास्तीको यज्ञायतनमुत्तमम् । वृतं सदस्यैर्बहुभिः सूर्यवह्निसमप्रभैः ॥
data.md: saw Having gone there, Astika the excellent Yajna place, full of numerous Sadasyas, as effulgent as the sun or Agni.

data.v: स तत्र वारितो द्वाःस्थैः प्रविशन्द्विजसत्तमः । अभितुष्टाव तं यज्ञं प्रवेशार्थी द्विजोत्तमः ॥
data.md: But the best of Brahmanas, (Astika) was denied admittance by the door-keepers, and the mighty ascetic, wishing to enter into the (enclosed sacrificial place), pleased them (by praising the sacrifice).

data.v: सोमस्य यज्ञो वरुणस्य यज्ञः; प्रजापतेर्यज्ञ आसीत्प्रयागे । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: Astika said: O son of Parikshit, О best of the Bharata race, Soma, Varuna and Prajapati performed sacrifices at Prayaga in the days of yore, but your sacrifice, is in no way inferior to them. Blessing be upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: शक्रस्य यज्ञः शतसंख्य उक्त;स्तथापरस्तुल्यसंख्यः शतं वै । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, О best of the Bharata race, Indra performed one hundred sacrifices, but your sacrifices, is fully equal to his sacrifice. Blessings be upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: यमस्य यज्ञो हरिमेधसश्च; यथा यज्ञो रन्तिदेवस्य राज्ञः । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, O best of the Bharata race, your this sacrifice is like the sacrifices of Yama, Harimedha and king Rantideva. Blessings be upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: गयस्य यज्ञः शशबिन्दोश्च राज्ञो; यज्ञस्तथा वैश्रवणस्य राज्ञः । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, O best of the Bharata race, your this sacrifice is like the sacrifices of Gaya, king Sashabindu and king Vaishravana. Blessings be upon those who are dear to us

data.v: नृगस्य यज्ञस्त्वजमीढस्य चासी;द्यथा यज्ञो दाशरथेश्च राज्ञः । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, О best of the Bharata race, your this sacrifice is like me sacrifices of Nriga, Ajamidha and (Rama) the son of Dasaratha. Blessings be upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: यज्ञः श्रुतो नो दिवि देवसूनो;र्युधिष्ठिरस्याजमीढस्य राज्ञः । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, O best of the Bharata race, your this sacrifice is like the sacrifice of king Yudhishthira, the son of a deity and a descendant of Ajamidha race, famous even in heavens. Blessings upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: कृष्णस्य यज्ञः सत्यवत्याः सुतस्य; स्वयं च कर्म प्रचकार यत्र । तथा यज्ञोऽयं तव भारताग्र्य; पारिक्षित स्वस्ति नोऽस्तु प्रियेभ्यः ॥
data.md: O son of Parikshit, O best of the Bharata race, your this sacrifice is like the sacrifice of Krishna Dvaipayana, the son of Satyavati, in which he himself acted as the chief priest. Blessings be upon those who are dear to us!

data.v: इमे हि ते सूर्यहुताशवर्चसः; समासते वृत्रहणः क्रतुं यथा । नैषां ज्ञानं विद्यते ज्ञातुमद्य; दत्तं येभ्यो न प्रणश्येत्कथंचित् ॥
data.md: These (learned men), that are sitting here, are as effulgent as the sun and they make your this sacrifice like the sacrifice of the slayer of Vitra (Indra). There is nothing for them to know and gifts made to them become inexhaustible.

data.v: ऋत्विक्समो नास्ति लोकेषु चैव; द्वैपायनेनेति विनिश्चितं मे । एतस्य शिष्या हि क्षितिं चरन्ति; सर्वर्त्विजः कर्मसु स्वेषु दक्षाः ॥
data.md: There is not a Ritvija in all the worlds equal to your Ritvija Dvaipayana. His disciples, becoming Ritvijas, competent in their duties, travel over the earth.

data.v: विभावसुश्चित्रभानुर्महात्मा; हिरण्यरेता विश्वभुक्कृष्णवर्त्मा । प्रदक्षिणावर्तशिखः प्रदीप्तो; हव्यं तवेदं हुतभुग्वष्टि देवः ॥
data.md: The noble bearer of libations, Vibhavasu and Chitrabhanu (Fire), having gold for his vital seed and black smokes on its way, carries these your libations of ghee to the celestial.

data.v: नेह त्वदन्यो विद्यते जीवलोके; समो नृपः पालयिता प्रजानाम् । धृत्या च ते प्रीतमनाः सदाहं; त्वं वा राजा धर्मराजो यमो वा ॥
data.md: There is no other king in this world equal to you in protecting his subjects. I am well pleased with your courage. You are either Varuna, Yama or Dharmaraja.

data.v: शक्रः साक्षाद्वज्रपाणिर्यथेह; त्राता लोकेऽस्मिंस्त्वं तथेह प्रजानाम् । मतस्त्वं नः पुरुषेन्द्रेह लोके; न च त्वदन्यो गृहपतिरस्ति यज्ञे ॥
data.md: You are protector of all creatures in this world, like Indra himself, thunderbolt in hand. There is no man in this world so great as you. There is no king who is your equal in sacrifices.

data.v: खट्वाङ्गनाभागदिलीपकल्पो; ययातिमान्धातृसमप्रभावः । आदित्यतेजःप्रतिमानतेजा; भीष्मो यथा भ्राजसि सुव्रतस्त्वम् ॥
data.md: You are like Khatvanga, Nabhaga and Dilipa. You are like Yayati and Mandhata in prowess. You are equal to the sun in splendour. O royal sage of excellent vows, you are like Bhishma.

data.v: वाल्मीकिवत्ते निभृतं सुधैर्यं; वसिष्ठवत्ते नियतश्च कोपः । प्रभुत्वमिन्द्रेण समं मतं मे; द्युतिश्च नारायणवद्विभाति ॥
data.md: You are like Valmiki of power concealed. Like Vasishtha you have controlled your anger. Your sovereignty is like that of Indra and your splendour is like that of Narayana.

data.v: यमो यथा धर्मविनिश्चयज्ञः; कृष्णो यथा सर्वगुणोपपन्नः । श्रियां निवासोऽसि यथा वसूनां; निधानभूतोऽसि तथा क्रतूनाम् ॥
data.md: You are learned in the administration of justice like Yama and you are adorned with all qualifications like Krishna. You are the home of the wealth that belongs to the Vasus, you are the main-spring of all sacrifices.

data.v: दम्भोद्भवेनासि समो बलेन; रामो यथा शस्त्रविदस्त्रविच्च । और्वत्रिताभ्यामसि तुल्यतेजा; दुष्प्रेक्षणीयोऽसि भगीरथो वा ॥
data.md: You are equal to Dambhodbhava in strength, you are learned both, in Shastras and arms like Parshurama. You are equal to Aurva and Trita in strength. You inspire terror with your looks like Bhagiratha.

data.v: एवं स्तुताः सर्व एव प्रसन्ना; राजा सदस्या ऋत्विजो हव्यवाहः । तेषां दृष्ट्वा भावितानीङ्गितानि; प्रोवाच राजा जनमेजयोऽथ ॥
data.md: Sauti said: Having thus adored them, Astika gratified and pleased them all, the king, the Sadasyas, the Ritvijas and the sacrificial fire. And king Janamejaya, seeing the signs and indications manifested on all sides, addressed them thus.

data.v: बालो वाक्यं स्थविर इव प्रभाषते; नायं बालः स्थविरोऽयं मतो मे । इच्छाम्यहं वरमस्मै प्रदातुं; तन्मे विप्रा वितरध्वं समेताः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : Though this (Rishi) is but a boy, he speaks like a wise old man. He is not a boy; I think he is wise and old. I wish to bestow on him a boon. Therefore, O Brahmanas, give me necessary permission.

data.v: बालोऽपि विप्रो मान्य एवेह राज्ञां; यश्चाविद्वान्यश्च विद्वान्यथावत् । सर्वान्कामांस्त्वत्त एषोऽर्हतेऽद्य; यथा च नस्तक्षक एति शीघ्रम् ॥
data.md: The Sadasyas said : A Brahmana, though he may be a boy, deserves the respect of kings, more so if he is learned. This boy deserves to have his all desires fulfilled, but not before Takshaka is here with all speed.

data.v: व्याहर्तुकामे वरदे नृपे द्विजं; वरं वृणीष्वेति ततोऽभ्युवाच । होता वाक्यं नातिहृष्टान्तरात्मा; कर्मण्यस्मिंस्तक्षको नैति तावत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The king, being willing to grant a boon to the Brahmana boy, said, "Ask from me a boon.” The Hota, being rather displeased at this, said, "Takshaka has not as yet come to this sacrifice.

data.v: यथा चेदं कर्म समाप्यते मे; यथा च नस्तक्षक एति शीघ्रम् । तथा भवन्तः प्रयतन्तु सर्वे; परं शक्त्या स हि मे विद्विषाणः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : Try your best to bring this my sacrifice to a successful completion; exert your might, so that Takshaka may come here without further delay. He is my enemy.

data.v: यथा शास्त्राणि नः प्राहुर्यथा शंसति पावकः । इन्द्रस्य भवने राजंस्तक्षको भयपीडितः ॥
data.md: The Ritvijas said : O king, Takshaka is now living in fear in the abode of Indra. The Shastra declares this to us and the Fire also says it.

data.v: यथा सूतो लोहिताक्षो महात्मा; पौराणिको वेदितवान्पुरस्तात् । स राजानं प्राह पृष्टस्तदानीं; यथाहुर्विप्रास्तद्वदेतन्नृदेव ॥
data.md: Sauti said: The illustrious Suta, Lohitakshya, wellversed in the Puranas, had also said this before. Asked by the king again on this occasion, he told him what he said before.

data.v: पुराणमागम्य ततो ब्रवीम्यहं; दत्तं तस्मै वरमिन्द्रेण राजन् । वसेह त्वं मत्सकाशे सुगुप्तो; न पावकस्त्वां प्रदहिष्यतीति ॥
data.md: (He said), “O king, what the Brahmanas have said is true. Knowing as I do the Puranas, I say, O king, Indra has granted him a boon, saying, 'Live here in concealment and fire will not be able to burn you."

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा दीक्षितस्तप्यमान; आस्ते होतारं चोदयन्कर्मकाले । होता च यत्तः स जुहाव मन्त्रै;रथो इन्द्रः स्वयमेवाजगाम ॥
data.md: Having heard this, the king, installed in the sacrifice, became very sorry and urged the Hota to do his duty. He too, with Mantras, began to pour the ghee into the fire. Thereupon Indra himself came to the place.

data.v: विमानमारुह्य महानुभावः; सर्वैर्देवैः परिसंस्तूयमानः । बलाहकैश्चाप्यनुगम्यमानो; विद्याधरैरप्सरसां गणैश्च ॥
data.md: The illustrious god came on his car, adored and worshipped by all the celestial standing around his chariot and entertained by masses of clouds, celestial singers and various classes of celestial dancing girls.

data.v: तस्योत्तरीये निहितः स नागो; भयोद्विग्नः शर्म नैवाभ्यगच्छत् । ततो राजा मन्त्रविदोऽब्रवीत्पुनः; क्रुद्धो वाक्यं तक्षकस्यान्तमिच्छन् ॥
data.md: The snake (Takshaka), however, kept himself hidden within the garments of Indra. Thereupon the king, being desirous of the destruction of Takshaka, spoke to his Mantraknowing Brahmanas thus,

data.v: इन्द्रस्य भवने विप्रा यदि नागः स तक्षकः । तमिन्द्रेणैव सहितं पातयध्वं विभावसौ ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O Brahmanas, if Takshaka be in the abode of Indra, throw him into the fire with Indra also.

data.v: अयमायाति वै तूर्णं तक्षकस्ते वशं नृप । श्रूयतेऽस्य महान्नादो रुवतो भैरवं भयात् ॥
data.md: The Ritvijas said : O king, behold, Takshaka has come under your control. His terrible cries and loud roars are heard.

data.v: नूनं मुक्तो वज्रभृता स नागो; भ्रष्टश्चाङ्कान्मन्त्रविस्रस्तकायः । घूर्णन्नाकाशे नष्टसंज्ञोऽभ्युपैति; तीव्रान्निःश्वासान्निःश्वसन्पन्नगेन्द्रः ॥
data.md: The snake has been forsaken by the wielder of thunder-bolt (Indra). his body has been disabled by our Mantras. (Behold), he is falling from the heavens, (behold) the king of snakes, deprived of his consciousness, comes rolling in the sky breathing loudly.

data.v: वर्तते तव राजेन्द्र कर्मैतद्विधिवत्प्रभो । अस्मै तु द्विजमुख्याय वरं त्वं दातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: The Ritvijas said : O king of kings, O Lord, your this act (sacrifice) is being properly performed. It is now proper for you to grant a boon to this best of Brahmanas (Astika).

data.v: बालाभिरूपस्य तवाप्रमेय; वरं प्रयच्छामि यथानुरूपम् । वृणीष्व यत्तेऽभिमतं हृदि स्थितं; तत्ते प्रदास्याम्यपि चेददेयम् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O immeasurable one, you are of such child-like and handsome features, that I desire to bestow upon you a worthy boon. Therefore, ask that which you desire in your heart to possess. I promise you, I will grant it if it be even ungrantable.

data.v: पतिष्यमाणे नागेन्द्रे तक्षके जातवेदसि । इदमन्तरमित्येवं तदास्तीकोऽभ्यचोदयत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : When the king of snakes, Takshaka, was at the point of falling into the sacrificial fire, within that very short moment, Astika spoke thus,

data.v: वरं ददासि चेन्मह्यं वृणोमि जनमेजय । सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतन्न पतेयुरिहोरगाः ॥
data.md: Astika said: O Janamejaya, if you will at all to grant me a boon, let your this sacrifice be stopped and let no more snakes fall into the fire.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्ततो राजा ब्रह्मन्पारिक्षितस्तदा । नातिहृष्टमना वाक्यमास्तीकमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : O Brahmana, the son of Parikshit, having been thus addressed, became exceedingly sorry and spoke to Astika thus,

data.v: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च यच्चान्यन्मन्यसे विभो । तत्ते दद्यां वरं विप्र न निवर्तेत्क्रतुर्मम ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O illustrious man, I shall give you gold, silver, kine, or whatever else you desire to possess. But let not my this sacrifice be stopped.

data.v: सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च न त्वां राजन्वृणोम्यहम् । सत्रं ते विरमत्वेतत्स्वस्ति मातृकुलस्य नः ॥
data.md: Astika said: O king, I do not ask from you gold, silver or kine. Let your this sacrifice be stopped, so that my maternal relatives are saved.

data.v: आस्तीकेनैवमुक्तस्तु राजा पारिक्षितस्तदा । पुनः पुनरुवाचेदमास्तीकं वदतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Sautisaid: Thus addressed by Astika, the son of Parikshit (Janamejaya,) again and again said to that best of speakers, Astika,

data.v: अन्यं वरय भद्रं ते वरं द्विजवरोत्तम । अयाचत न चाप्यन्यं वरं स भृगुनन्दन ॥
data.md: "O best of the best Brahmanas, O blessed one, O illustrious man, ask some other boon." But, O descendant of the Bhrigu race, he did not ask any other boon.

data.v: ततो वेदविदस्तत्र सदस्याः सर्व एव तम् । राजानमूचुः सहिता लभतां ब्राह्मणो वरम् ॥
data.md: Thereupon, all the Sadasyas, learned in the Vedas, told the king in one voice, in the Vedas, told the king in one voice, “Let the Brahmana receive the boon (asked by him.")

data.md: Shaunaka said: O son of Suta, I desire to hear the names of those snakes, that fell into the fire of the Snakesacrifice.

data.v: सहस्राणि बहून्यस्मिन्प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च । न शक्यं परिसंख्यातुं बहुत्वाद्वेदवित्तम ॥
data.md: Sauti said: O best of the twice-born, they were many thousands, tens of thousands and millions and billions; so great was their number that I am unable even to count them.

data.v: यथास्मृति तु नामानि पन्नगानां निबोध मे । उच्यमानानि मुख्यानां हुतानां जातवेदसि ॥
data.md: As far as I remember, hear, I shall mention the names of the principal snakes that fell into the fire.

data.v: वासुकेः कुलजांस्तावत्प्राधान्येन निबोध मे । नीलरक्तान्सितान्घोरान्महाकायान्विषोल्बणान् ॥
data.md: Hear first the names of the chief ones of Vasuki's family, they were of colour, blue, red and white; they were of terrible forms, huge bodies and dreadfully poisonous.

data.md: Helpless and miserable, affected with their mother's curse, they all fell into that sacrificial fire as libations of ghee. (They were) Kotisha, Manasa, Purna, Shala, Pala, Halimaka, Pichchhala, Kaunapa, Chakra, Kalavega Prakalana, Hiranyabahu, Sharana Kakshaka and Kaladantaka.

data.md: These snakes, born of Takshaka, fell into the fire. Paravata, Pariyata, Pandara, Harina, Krisha, Vihanga, Sharabha, Meda, Pramoda, Sanhatapan these, born in the family of Airvata, fell into the fire.

data.md: Now hear, O best of Brahmanas, the names of the snakes, born in the family of Kauravya, that I mention. Eraka, Kundala Veni, Veniskandha, Kumaraka, Bahuka, Shringavera, Dhurtaka, Pratara and Ataka, these, born in the Kauravya family, fell into the fire.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रकुले जाताञ्शृणु नागान्यथातथम् । कीर्त्यमानान्मया ब्रह्मन्वातवेगान्विषोल्बणान् ॥
data.md: Now hear, O Brahmana, I mention those born in the family of Dhritarashtra, they were all exceedingly powerful, as swift as the wind and full of virulent poison.

data.md: O Brahmana, thus have I recited the names of the chief snakes, all famous for their great deeds. I have not been able to mention all, their number being countless.

data.v: एतेषां पुत्रपौत्रास्तु प्रसवस्य च संततिः । न शक्याः परिसंख्यातुं ये दीप्तं पावकं गताः ॥
data.md: I am unable to mention the names of the sons of these and again the sons of their sons that fell into the blazing fire. They are countless.

data.v: सप्तशीर्षा द्विशीर्षाश्च पञ्चशीर्षास्तथापरे । कालानलविषा घोरा हुताः शतसहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Some of them had three heads, some seven and some ten. They had poison like the fire at the end of the Yuga and they were all terrible in appearance.

data.md: They had huge bodies and great speed, they were as tall as mountain peaks. Some of them were as long as a Yama, some a Yojana and some two Yojanas.

data.md: They were capable of assuming any form at will and of mustering any strength at will, they had the poison like the blazing fire, (such were the snakes that) that were burnt in the great sacrifice, affected by Brahma's punishment, (their mother's curse.)

data.md: Sauti said : Now hsar, (I shall mention) another wonderful incident in connection with Astika. When the son of Parikshit, the king (Janamejaya) was about to grant the boon (to Astika).

data.md: The snake, (Takshaka) though thrown off form Indra's hands, remained in the air without falling. Thereupon, king Janamejaya became thoughtful,

data.md: Shaunaka said : O Suta, were not the Mantras of those wise Brahmanas propitious? Why did not Takshaka fall into the fire?"

data.v: तमिन्द्रहस्ताद्विस्रस्तं विसंज्ञं पन्नगोत्तमम् । आस्तीकस्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति वाचस्तिस्रोऽभ्युदैरयत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Astika had said thrice, "Stay, stay, stay," to the unconscious Takshaka, the best of snakes, when he was cast off from Indra's hands.

data.v: वितस्थे सोऽन्तरिक्षेऽथ हृदयेन विदूयता । यथा तिष्ठेत वै कश्चिद्गोचक्रस्यान्तरा नरः ॥
data.md: And afflicted with grief he remained in the sky like a person who hang between the heaven and the earth.

data.v: ततो राजाब्रवीद्वाक्यं सदस्यैश्चोदितो भृशम् । काममेतद्भवत्वेवं यथास्तीकस्य भाषितम् ॥
data.md: Being again and again urged by his Sadasyas, the king said, “Let it be done as asked by Astika.

data.v: समाप्यतामिदं कर्म पन्नगाः सन्त्वनामयाः । प्रीयतामयमास्तीकः सत्यं सूतवचोऽस्तु तत् ॥
data.md: Let the sacrifice be stopped, let the snakes be saved, let this Astika be gratified and let the words of the Suta be true."

data.v: ततो हलहलाशब्दः प्रीतिजः समवर्तत । आस्तीकस्य वरे दत्ते तथैवोपरराम च ॥
data.md: When the boon was granted to Astika, loud acclamation of joy rose into the sky and the sacrifice of the son of Parikshit, the king of the Pandavas dynasty, came to an end. And king Janamejaya of the Bharata race was much pleased with himself.

data.v: स यज्ञः पाण्डवेयस्य राज्ञः पारिक्षितस्य ह । प्रीतिमांश्चाभवद्राजा भारतो जनमेजयः ॥
data.md: When the boon was granted to Astika, loud acclamation of joy rose into the sky and the sacrifice of the son of Parikshit, the king of the Pandavas dynasty, came to an end. And king Janamejaya of the Bharata race was much pleased with himself.

data.v: ऋत्विग्भ्यः ससदस्येभ्यो ये तत्रासन्समागताः । तेभ्यश्च प्रददौ वित्तं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: The king bestowed money by hundreds and thousands on the Ritvijas and Sadasyas and on all that were present there (in that great sacrifice).

data.v: लोहिताक्षाय सूताय तथा स्थपतये विभुः । येनोक्तं तत्र सत्राग्रे यज्ञस्य विनिवर्तनम् ॥
data.md: And he bestowed much wealth on Suta Lohitaksha, who was learned in the science of masonry and foundations and who had said at the very commencement of the Snake-sacrifice that a Brahmana would be the cause of its interruption. He gave him wealth and various things, food and wearing apparel.

data.v: निमित्तं ब्राह्मण इति तस्मै वित्तं ददौ बहु । ततश्चकारावभृथं विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: The king of immeasurable kindness was thus much pleased and he concluded the sacrifice according to the rites of the ordinance.

data.v: आस्तीकं प्रेषयामास गृहानेव सुसत्कृतम् । राजा प्रीतमनाः प्रीतं कृतकृत्यं मनीषिणम् ॥
data.md: He sent back home in much joy the wise Astika, whom he treated with every respect. He too was exceedingly pleased, because his object was attained.

data.v: पुनरागमनं कार्यमिति चैनं वचोऽब्रवीत् । भविष्यसि सदस्यो मे वाजिमेधे महाक्रतौ ॥
data.md: The king said to him, “You must come again to become a Sadasya in my great Horsesacrifice.”

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा प्रदुद्राव स चास्तीको मुदा युतः । कृत्वा स्वकार्यमतुलं तोषयित्वा च पार्थिवम् ॥
data.md: And Astika replied, Yes." He then returned home in great joy, having achieved his great object, by pleasing the king.

data.v: स गत्वा परमप्रीतो मातरं मातुलं च तम् । अभिगम्योपसंगृह्य यथावृत्तं न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Having returned in great joy to his uncle and mother, he touched their feet and told them all that had happened.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा प्रीयमाणाः समेता; ये तत्रासन्पन्नगा वीतमोहाः । तेऽऽस्तीके वै प्रीतिमन्तो बभूवु;रूचुश्चैनं वरमिष्टं वृणीष्व ॥
data.md: Having heard all he said, those snakes, that assembled there, were much delighted and their fear was dispelled. They were greatly pleased with Astika and insisted him to ask a boon.

data.v: भूयो भूयः सर्वशस्तेऽब्रुवंस्तं; किं ते प्रियं करवामोऽद्य विद्वन् । प्रीता वयं मोक्षिताश्चैव सर्वे; कामं किं ते करवामोऽद्य वत्स ॥
data.md: They all again and again asked him, "O learned one, what good can we do to you? We are exceedingly pleased with you, for we have been all saved by you. O child, (tell us) what can we do for you?

data.v: सायं प्रातः सुप्रसन्नात्मरूपा; लोके विप्रा मानवाश्चेतरेऽपि । धर्माख्यानं ये वदेयुर्ममेदं; तेषां युष्मद्भ्यो नैव किंचिद्भयं स्यात् ॥
data.md: Astika said : Let those Brahmans and other men, who will cheerfully and with attention read morning and evening this sacred account of my this act have no fear from you.'

data.v: तैश्चाप्युक्तो भागिनेयः प्रसन्नै;रेतत्सत्यं काममेवं चरन्तः । प्रीत्या युक्ता ईप्सितं सर्वशस्ते; कर्तारः स्म प्रवणा भागिनेय ॥
data.md: They said in joy, "O nephew, as regards the boon asked by you, let it be exactly as you say. O nephew, we shall all cheerfully do what you ask us to do.

data.v: जरत्कारोर्जरत्कार्वां समुत्पन्नो महायशाः । आस्तीकः सत्यसंधो मां पन्नगेभ्योऽभिरक्षतु ॥
data.md: He will have no fear from snakes, who will say, Astika, the son of Jaratkaru, born of Jaratkaru, Astika who saved the snakes from the Snakes-sacrifice. I recall him to my mind. Therefore, O illustrious snakes, you should not bite me.

data.v: असितं चार्तिमन्तं च सुनीथं चापि यः स्मरेत् । दिवा वा यदि वा रात्रौ नास्य सर्पभयं भवेत् ॥
data.md: Those that will recall to their minds, Asita, Artiman and Sunitha, in the day or in the night, will have no fear from snakes.

data.v: मोक्षयित्वा स भुजगान्सर्पसत्राद्द्विजोत्तमः । जगाम काले धर्मात्मा दिष्टान्तं पुत्रपौत्रवान् ॥
data.md: That virtuous and the best of the twice born, having thus saved the snakes from the Snake-sacrifice, died at the proper time, leaving sons and grandsons behind him.

data.v: इत्याख्यानं मयास्तीकं यथावत्कीर्तितं तव । यत्कीर्तयित्वा सर्पेभ्यो न भयं विद्यते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: Thus have I narrated to you the history of Astika exactly as it happened, a history, which if narrated, dispels all fear of snakes.

data.v: श्रुत्वा धर्मिष्ठमाख्यानमास्तीकं पुण्यवर्धनम् । आस्तीकस्य कवेर्विप्र श्रीमच्चरितमादितः ॥
data.md: And as I heard it (from my father), I have narrated this blessed history of the learned Astika from the beginning (to the end).

data.v: भृगुवंशात्प्रभृत्येव त्वया मे कथितं महत् । आख्यानमखिलं तात सौते प्रीतोऽस्मि तेन ते ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said: O child, O Sauti, you have narrated to me this great and extensive history of the Bhrigu race from the birth of Bhrigu. I am much pleased with you.

data.v: प्रक्ष्यामि चैव भूयस्त्वां यथावत्सूतनन्दन । यां कथां व्याससंपन्नां तां च भूयः प्रचक्ष्व मे ॥
data.md: O son of Suta, I ask you now to recite to me that wonderful and varied narrations composed by Vyasa, which were recited by the illustrious Sadasyas in the intervals of the longextending ceremony (Snake-sacrifice).

data.v: तस्मिन्परमदुष्प्रापे सर्पसत्रे महात्मनाम् । कर्मान्तरेषु विधिवत्सदस्यानां महाकवे ॥
data.md: O son of Suta, I ask you now to recite to me that wonderful and varied narrations composed by Vyasa, which were recited by the illustrious Sadasyas in the intervals of the longextending ceremony (Snake-sacrifice).

data.v: या बभूवुः कथाश्चित्रा येष्वर्थेषु यथातथम् । त्वत्त इच्छामहे श्रोतुं सौते त्वं वै विचक्षणः ॥
data.md: O son of Suta, I wish to learn from you the object of those narrations. Therefore, recite them to me in full.

data.v: कर्मान्तरेष्वकथयन्द्विजा वेदाश्रयाः कथाः । व्यासस्त्वकथयन्नित्यमाख्यानं भारतं महत् ॥
data.md: Sauti said : The Brahmanas spoke of many things, founded on the Vedas, in the intervals of their duties, but Vyasa recited the wonderful and great history, called the Bharata.

data.v: महाभारतमाख्यानं पाण्डवानां यशस्करम् । जनमेजयेन यत्पृष्टः कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said : I desire to hear that sacred history, called Mahabharata, that spreader of the fame of the Pandavas, which Krishna Dvaipayana, asked by Janamejaya, caused to be duly recited in the intervals of the sacrifice.

data.v: श्रावयामास विधिवत्तदा कर्मान्तरेषु सः । तामहं विधिवत्पुण्यां श्रोतुमिच्छामि वै कथाम् ॥
data.md: Shaunaka said : I desire to hear that sacred history, called Mahabharata, that spreader of the fame of the Pandavas, which Krishna Dvaipayana, asked by Janamejaya, caused to be duly recited in the intervals of the sacrifice.

data.v: मनःसागरसंभूतां महर्षेः पुण्यकर्मणः । कथयस्व सतां श्रेष्ठ न हि तृप्यामि सूतज ॥
data.md: It was born in the ocean-like mind of the great Rishi of purified soul. O best of men, recite it to me, for, O son of Suta, my thirst has not been appeased by all that you have narrated.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि महदाख्यानमुत्तमम् । कृष्णद्वैपायनमतं महाभारतमादितः ॥
data.md: Sauti said : I shall recite from the beginning the great and excellent history, called Mahabharata, composed by Krishna Dvaipayana.

data.v: तज्जुषस्वोत्तममते कथ्यमानं मया द्विज । शंसितुं तन्मनोहर्षो ममापीह प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Listen to it in full, O Brahmana, as I recite it. I myself feel a great pleasure in reciting it.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु सर्पसत्राय दीक्षितं जनमेजयम् । अभ्यागच्छदृषिर्विद्वान्कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Having heard that Janamejaya has been installed in the Snake-sacrifice, the learned Rishi Krishna Dvaipayana went there.

data.v: जनयामास यं काली शक्तेः पुत्रात्पराशरात् । कन्यैव यमुनाद्वीपे पाण्डवानां पितामहम् ॥
data.md: The grandfather of the Pandavas, (Krishna Dvaipayana) was born in an island of the Yamuna, in the womb of the maiden Kali by Shakti's son Parashara.

data.v: जातमात्रश्च यः सद्य इष्ट्या देहमवीवृधत् । वेदांश्चाधिजगे साङ्गान्सेतिहासान्महायशाः ॥
data.md: As soon as born, the illustrious man developed his body by his will alone and mastered the Vedas and the Vedangas and all the histories.

data.v: यं नातितपसा कश्चिन्न वेदाध्ययनेन च । न व्रतैर्नोपवासैश्च न प्रसूत्या न मन्युना ॥
data.md: He achieved that which could not be achieved by asceticism, or by the study of the Vedas, by vows, by fasts, by progeny or by sacrifice.

data.v: विव्यासैकं चतुर्धा यो वेदं वेदविदां वरः । परावरज्ञो ब्रह्मर्षिः कविः सत्यव्रतः शुचिः ॥
data.md: The best of the best Veda-knowing men first divided the Vedas into four parts. He was a great Brahma-knowing Rishi, a great poet, a truthful man, a holy ascetic.

data.v: यः पाण्डुं धृतराष्ट्रं च विदुरं चाप्यजीजनत् । शंतनोः संततिं तन्वन्पुण्यकीर्तिर्महायशाः ॥
data.md: That great Rishi of sacred deeds and great fame, in order to continue the line of Shantanu begot Pandu, Dhritarashtra and Vidura.

data.v: जनमेजयस्य राजर्षेः स तद्यज्ञसदस्तदा । विवेश शिष्यैः सहितो वेदवेदाङ्गपारगैः ॥
data.md: This illustrious man accompanied by his disciples, learned in the Vedas and the Vedangas, entered the sacrificial grounds of the royal sage Janamejaya.

data.v: तत्र राजानमासीनं ददर्श जनमेजयम् । वृतं सदस्यैर्बहुभिर्देवैरिव पुरंदरम् ॥
data.md: He saw there seated king Janamejaya surrounded by his numerous Sadasya like Indra surrounded by the celestials.

data.v: तथा मूर्धावसिक्तैश्च नानाजनपदेश्वरैः । ऋत्विग्भिर्देवकल्पैश्च कुशलैर्यज्ञसंस्तरे ॥
data.md: He was surrounded by kings of various countries who had undergone the sacred baths and by competent Ritvijas who were like Brahma himself all seated comfortably in the sacrificial grounds.

data.v: जनमेजयस्तु राजर्षिर्दृष्ट्वा तमृषिमागतम् । सगणोऽभ्युद्ययौ तूर्णं प्रीत्या भरतसत्तमः ॥
data.md: The best of the Bharata race, the royal sage Janamejaya, seeing the Rishi approaching, advanced quickly in great joy with all his relatives and followers.

data.v: काञ्चनं विष्टरं तस्मै सदस्यानुमते प्रभुः । आसनं कल्पयामास यथा शक्रो बृहस्पतेः ॥
data.md: The king, with the approval of the Sadasyas, offered a golden seat to the Rishi as did Indra to (his preceptor) Brihaspati.

data.v: तत्रोपविष्टं वरदं देवर्षिगणपूजितम् । पूजयामास राजेन्द्रः शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: When the boon-granting and the adored of the celestials, the Rishis (Vyasa) took his seat, the king of kings (Janamejaya) worshipped him according to the ordinances.

data.v: पाद्यमाचमनीयं च अर्घ्यं गां च विधानतः । पितामहाय कृष्णाय तदर्हाय न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: The king then offered to his grandfather Krishna (Dvaipayana) in due form water to wash his feet and mouth, Arghya and kine.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तां पूजां पाण्डवाज्जनमेजयात् । गां चैव समनुज्ञाय व्यासः प्रीतोऽभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Vyasa was much pleased on accepting the offerings from the Pandava Janamejaya and he ordered that the kine should not be slaughtered.

data.v: तथा संपूजयित्वा तं यत्नेन प्रपितामहम् । उपोपविश्य प्रीतात्मा पर्यपृच्छदनामयम् ॥
data.md: Thus having worshipped him the king bowed to his great grandfather. And having seated himself in joy, he asked him about his welfare.

data.v: भगवानपि तं दृष्ट्वा कुशलं प्रतिवेद्य च । सदस्यैः पूजितः सर्वैः सदस्यानभ्यपूजयत् ॥
data.md: The illustrious Rishi, also looked (graciously) at him and asked him about his welfare. He then worshipped the Sadasyas who had already worshipped him.

data.v: ततस्तं सत्कृतं सर्वैः सदस्यैर्जनमेजयः । इदं पश्चाद्द्विजश्रेष्ठं पर्यपृच्छत्कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: Thereupon with joined hands, Janamejaya, with all his Sadasyas, addressed the best of the Brahmanas (Vyasa) thus:

data.v: कुरूणां पाण्डवानां च भवान्प्रत्यक्षदर्शिवान् । तेषां चरितमिच्छामि कथ्यमानं त्वया द्विज ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O Brahmana, you saw with your own eyes the great deeds of the Kurus and the Pandavas. I desire to hear them narrated by you.

data.v: कथं समभवद्भेदस्तेषामक्लिष्टकर्मणाम् । तच्च युद्धं कथं वृत्तं भूतान्तकरणं महत् ॥
data.md: What was the cause of the quarrel between them? They were all of great deeds and virtuous mind. Why did that great battle, which was the cause of the death of countless men, occur among my grandfathers, their sense being (surely) over-clouded by Fate? O best of Brahmanas, tell me all this in full as they happened.

data.v: पितामहानां सर्वेषां दैवेनाविष्टचेतसाम् । कार्त्स्न्येनैतत्समाचक्ष्व भगवन्कुशलो ह्यसि ॥
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा । शशास शिष्यमासीनं वैशंपायनमन्तिके ॥
data.md: Sauti said : Having heard these words of Janamejaya, Krishna Dvaipayana addressed his disciple Vaishampayana, seated by his side saying,

data.v: कुरूणां पाण्डवानां च यथा भेदोऽभवत्पुरा । तदस्मै सर्वमाचक्ष्व यन्मत्तः श्रुतवानसि ॥
data.md: Vyasa said : Repeat, exactly as you heard from me the account of the quarrel between the Kurus and the Pandavas of old.

data.v: गुरोर्वचनमाज्ञाय स तु विप्रर्षभस्तदा । आचचक्षे ततः सर्वमितिहासं पुरातनम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said: That best of Brahmanas, (Vaishampayana), having been thus commanded by his preceptor, recited the whole of that old history,

data.v: तस्मै राज्ञे सदस्येभ्यः क्षत्रियेभ्यश्च सर्वशः । भेदं राज्यविनाशं च कुरुपाण्डवयोस्तदा ॥
data.md: To the king, to the Sadasyas and to all the chiefs and potentates present there. He told them all about the quarrel and the utter extinction of the Kurus and the Pandavas.

data.v: अस्मिन्नर्थश्च धर्मश्च निखिलेनोपदिश्यते । इतिहासे महापुण्ये बुद्धिश्च परिनैष्ठिकी ॥
data.md: It contains many useful instructions on Artha and Kama. This sacred history makes the heart desire to attain salvation.

data.v: अक्षुद्रान्दानशीलांश्च सत्यशीलाननास्तिकान् । कार्ष्णं वेदमिमं विद्वाञ्श्रावयित्वार्थमश्नुते ॥
data.md: The learned men earn much wealth by reciting this Veda composed by Krishna (Dvaipayana) to those who are noble, liberal, truthful and believing.

data.v: भ्रूणहत्याकृतं चापि पापं जह्यादसंशयम् । इतिहासमिमं श्रुत्वा पुरुषोऽपि सुदारुणः ॥
data.md: Sins, even of killing embryo, are destroyed by (reading or hearing) it. Even a greatly sinful man, by hearing this history, escapes from all his sins, like the sun from Rahu. This history is called Jaya (victory); it should be heard by those that desire victory.

data.v: जयो नामेतिहासोऽयं श्रोतव्यो विजिगीषुणा । महीं विजयते सर्वां शत्रूंश्चापि पराजयेत् ॥
इदं पुंसवनं श्रेष्ठमिदं स्वस्त्ययनं महत् । महिषीयुवराजाभ्यां श्रोतव्यं बहुशस्तथा ॥
अर्थशास्त्रमिदं पुण्यं धर्मशास्त्रमिदं परम् । मोक्षशास्त्रमिदं प्रोक्तं व्यासेनामितबुद्धिना ॥
data.md: It is the Dharma Shastra, it is also the sacred Artha Shastra, it is also the great Moksha Shastra, said Vyasa of immeasurable intelligence.

data.v: संप्रत्याचक्षते चैव आख्यास्यन्ति तथापरे । पुत्राः शुश्रूषवः सन्ति प्रेष्याश्च प्रियकारिणः ॥
data.md: It is recited in the present age and will be recited in future ages. He, who hears it, gets sons and survivors, who perform their favourite works.

data.v: शरीरेण कृतं पापं वाचा च मनसैव च । सर्वं तत्त्यजति क्षिप्रमिदं शृण्वन्नरः सदा ॥
data.md: He who hears it escapes immediately from all his sins that are committed by him in body, word or mind.

data.v: भारतानां महज्जन्म शृण्वतामनसूयताम् । नास्ति व्याधिभयं तेषां परलोकभयं कुतः ॥
data.md: He who hears the history of the Bharata race without being fault-finding, can have no fear from diseases, let alone the fear of the other world.

data.v: धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वर्ग्यं पुण्यं तथैव च । कृष्णद्वैपायनेनेदं कृतं पुण्यचिकीर्षुणा ॥
कीर्तिं प्रथयता लोके पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । अन्येषां क्षत्रियाणां च भूरिद्रविणतेजसाम् ॥
यथा समुद्रो भगवान्यथा च हिमवान्गिरिः । ख्यातावुभौ रत्ननिधी तथा भारतमुच्यते ॥
data.md: This Bharata is said to be a mine of gems, as the illustrious ocean or the great mountain Meru.

data.v: य इदं श्रावयेद्विद्वान्ब्राह्मणानिह पर्वसु । धूतपाप्मा जितस्वर्गो ब्रह्मभूयं स गच्छति ॥
data.md: The learned man, who recites it to Brahmanas during the sacred Parvas (lunar changes), is cleansed of all his sins and being victorious over heaven (not caring for it) attains to an union with Brahma.

data.v: यश्चेदं श्रावयेच्छ्राद्धे ब्राह्मणान्पादमन्ततः । अक्षय्यं तस्य तच्छ्राद्धमुपतिष्ठेत्पितॄनपि ॥
data.md: He who causes even a single line of it to be heard by Brahmanas at a Shraddha, that Shraddha becomes inexhaustible and the Pitris (ancestors) become gratified with food presented to them.

data.v: अह्ना यदेनश्चाज्ञानात्प्रकरोति नरश्चरन् । तन्महाभारताख्यानं श्रुत्वैव प्रविलीयते ॥
data.md: Are all destroyed by hearing the Mahabharata, The history of the great births of the Bharata princes is called Mahabharata.

data.v: भारतानां महज्जन्म महाभारतमुच्यते । निरुक्तमस्य यो वेद सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: He who knows the etymology of the name (Bharata is cleansed of all his sins. As this history of the Bharata race is wonderful.

data.v: त्रिभिर्वर्षैः सदोत्थायी कृष्णद्वैपायनो मुनिः । महाभारतमाख्यानं कृतवानिदमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: The Rishi Krishna Dvaipayana, regularly rising (every morning) for three years, composed this wonderful history, called Mahabharata.

data.v: धर्मे चार्थे च कामे च मोक्षे च भरतर्षभ । यदिहास्ति तदन्यत्र यन्नेहास्ति न तत्क्वचित् ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, whatever about Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha, that is contained in this Bharata, may be met with elsewhere; but whatever is not in it, is not to be found anywhere.

data.v: राजोपरिचरो नाम धर्मनित्यो महीपतिः । बभूव मृगयां गन्तुं स कदाचिद्धृतव्रतः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : There was a king, ever devoted to virtue, named Uparichara. He was very much addicted to hunting.

data.v: स चेदिविषयं रम्यं वसुः पौरवनन्दनः । इन्द्रोपदेशाज्जग्राह ग्रहणीयं महीपतिः ॥
data.md: That son of Paurava, (Uparichara) called also Vasu, directed by Indra, conquered the beautiful and excellent kingdom of Chedi.

data.v: तमाश्रमे न्यस्तशस्त्रं निवसन्तं तपोरतिम् । देवः साक्षात्स्वयं वज्री समुपायान्महीपतिम् ॥
data.md: The king, sometime after, giving up the use of arms and dwelling in a secluded retreat, practised severe asceticism. The celestials with Indra at their head one day came to the king.

data.v: इन्द्रत्वमर्हो राजायं तपसेत्यनुचिन्त्य वै । तं सान्त्वेन नृपं साक्षात्तपसः संन्यवर्तयत् ॥
data.md: Believing that he sought to be the king of the celestials by practising severe austerities, the celestials, appearing before him, succeeded with sweet words in winning him from his asceticism.

data.v: न संकीर्येत धर्मोऽयं पृथिव्यां पृथिवीपते । तं पाहि धर्मो हि धृतः कृत्स्नं धारयते जगत् ॥
data.md: The celestials said: O king of the world, you should see that piety may not sustain a diminution in your hands. Protected by you, piety will protect the universe.

data.v: लोक्यं धर्मं पालय त्वं नित्ययुक्तः समाहितः । धर्मयुक्तस्ततो लोकान्पुण्यानाप्स्यसि शाश्वतान् ॥
data.md: Indra said: Protect attentively and rigidly piety on earth. Protecting virtue on earth, you will see many sacred regions (in after-life).

data.v: दिविष्ठस्य भुविष्ठस्त्वं सखा भूत्वा मम प्रियः । ऊधः पृथिव्या यो देशस्तमावस नराधिप ॥
data.md: Though I belong to heaven and you to earth, yet you are my friend and you are dear to me. O king of men, live in that place in earth which is delightful, which is full of animals, wealth and com, which is sacred, which is well-protected like heaven and which is blessed with fertility, which has agreeable climate and every object of enjoyment.

data.v: पशव्यश्चैव पुण्यश्च सुस्थिरो धनधान्यवान् । स्वारक्ष्यश्चैव सौम्यश्च भोग्यैर्भूमिगुणैर्युतः ॥
data.md: Though I belong to heaven and you to earth, yet you are my friend and you are dear to me. O king of men, live in that place in earth which is delightful, which is full of animals, wealth and com, which is sacred, which is well-protected like heaven and which is blessed with fertility, which has agreeable climate and every object of enjoyment.

data.v: अत्यन्यानेष देशो हि धनरत्नादिभिर्युतः । वसुपूर्णा च वसुधा वस चेदिषु चेदिप ॥
data.md: O king of Chedi, this Chedi, your kingdom, is full of riches, gems and precious stones. It contains much mineral wealth. You dwell there.

data.v: धर्मशीला जनपदाः सुसंतोषाश्च साधवः । न च मिथ्याप्रलापोऽत्र स्वैरेष्वपि कुतोऽन्यथा ॥
data.md: The cities in this kingdom are all devoted to virtue. The people are honest and contented. They never speak falsehood even in jest.

data.v: न च पित्रा विभज्यन्ते नरा गुरुहिते रताः । युञ्जते धुरि नो गाश्च कृशाः संधुक्षयन्ति च ॥
data.md: The sons never divide their wealth here with their fathers. They are always mindful of their parent's welfare. Lean kine are never yoked to the plough or to the cart engaged in carrying merchandise.

data.v: सर्वे वर्णाः स्वधर्मस्थाः सदा चेदिषु मानद । न तेऽस्त्यविदितं किंचित्त्रिषु लोकेषु यद्भवेत् ॥
data.md: They are all well-fed and fat. O reverencer of the celestials, the four castes are engaged in doing their respective duties in Chedi. Let nothing in the three worlds remain unknown to you.

data.v: देवोपभोग्यं दिव्यं च आकाशे स्फाटिकं महत् । आकाशगं त्वां मद्दत्तं विमानमुपपत्स्यते ॥
data.md: I shall give you an excellent and great crystal car, which the celestials alone possess and which is capable of carrying you through the sky.

data.v: त्वमेकः सर्वमर्त्येषु विमानवरमास्थितः । चरिष्यस्युपरिस्थो वै देवो विग्रहवानिव ॥
data.md: You only, among all mortals on earth, will ride on that best of cars and go through the sky like a celestial, though possessing a physical body.

data.v: ददामि ते वैजयन्तीं मालामम्लानपङ्कजाम् । धारयिष्यति संग्रामे या त्वां शस्त्रैरविक्षतम् ॥
data.md: I shall also give you a victory producing garland of unfading lotuses, wearing which you shall not be wounded by weapons.

data.v: लक्षणं चैतदेवेह भविता ते नराधिप । इन्द्रमालेति विख्यातं धन्यमप्रतिमं महत् ॥
data.md: O king of men, this excellent, matchless and great garland, widely known as Indra's garland, will be your distinctive badge.

data.v: यष्टिं च वैणवीं तस्मै ददौ वृत्रनिषूदनः । इष्टप्रदानमुद्दिश्य शिष्टानां परिपालिनीम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : The slayer of Vitra (Indra) gave him also a bamboo-stick to protect the honest and the peaceful.

data.v: तस्याः शक्रस्य पूजार्थं भूमौ भूमिपतिस्तदा । प्रवेशं कारयामास गते संवत्सरे तदा ॥
data.md: After the expiration of a year, the king planted it on the ground for the purpose of worshipping the giver, (Indra.)

data.v: ततः प्रभृति चाद्यापि यष्ट्याः क्षितिपसत्तमैः । प्रवेशः क्रियते राजन्यथा तेन प्रवर्तितः ॥
data.md: O king, from that day up to this day, all kings, following the example of Vasu, began to plant a bamboo-stick on the ground to worship Indra.

data.v: अपरेद्युस्तथा चास्याः क्रियते उच्छ्रयो नृपैः । अलंकृतायाः पिटकैर्गन्धैर्माल्यैश्च भूषणैः । माल्यदामपरिक्षिप्ता विधिवत्क्रियतेऽपि च ॥
data.md: After planting the stick, they cover it with golden cloths, perfume it with scents and decorate it with garlands and various ornaments.

data.v: भगवान्पूज्यते चात्र हास्यरूपेण शंकरः । स्वयमेव गृहीतेन वसोः प्रीत्या महात्मनः ॥
एतां पूजां महेन्द्रस्तु दृष्ट्वा देव कृतां शुभाम् । वसुना राजमुख्येन प्रीतिमानब्रवीद्विभुः ॥
ये पूजयिष्यन्ति नरा राजानश्च महं मम । कारयिष्यन्ति च मुदा यथा चेदिपतिर्नृपः ॥
तेषां श्रीर्विजयश्चैव सराष्ट्राणां भविष्यति । तथा स्फीतो जनपदो मुदितश्च भविष्यति ॥
data.md: And will observe this my festival like the king of Chedi, will gain wealth and victory for their countries and kingdoms.

data.v: एवं महात्मना तेन महेन्द्रेण नराधिप । वसुः प्रीत्या मघवता महाराजोऽभिसत्कृतः ॥
data.md: Their cities will also expand and will be ever in joy.” O king, Vasu, the great monarch, was thus blessed by the high-souled chief of the celestials, Maghavat Indra. Those men, who cause this festival of Indra to be observed.

data.v: उत्सवं कारयिष्यन्ति सदा शक्रस्य ये नराः । भूमिदानादिभिर्दानैर्यथा पूता भवन्ति वै । वरदानमहायज्ञैस्तथा शक्रोत्सवेन ते ॥
data.md: With the gifts of lands, gems and precious stones, like king Vasu, become much respected in the worlds.

data.v: संपूजितो मघवता वसुश्चेदिपतिस्तदा । पालयामास धर्मेण चेदिस्थः पृथिवीमिमाम् । इन्द्रप्रीत्या भूमिपतिश्चकारेन्द्रमहं वसुः ॥
data.md: Vasu, the King of Chedi, thus being blessed by Indra and bestowing boons and performing great sacrifices, continued to observe the festival of Indra. He had five greatly powerful and immeasurably effulgent sons.

data.v: पुत्राश्चास्य महावीर्याः पञ्चासन्नमितौजसः । नानाराज्येषु च सुतान्स सम्राडभ्यषेचयत् ॥
महारथो मगधराड्विश्रुतो यो बृहद्रथः । प्रत्यग्रहः कुशाम्बश्च यमाहुर्मणिवाहनम् । मच्छिल्लश्च यदुश्चैव राजन्यश्चापराजितः ॥
data.md: His other sons were Pratyagraha and Kushamba, who was also called Manivahana. Two others were Mavella and Yadu who was greatly powerful and invincible in battle.

data.v: एते तस्य सुता राजन्राजर्षेर्भूरितेजसः । न्यवेशयन्नामभिः स्वैस्ते देशांश्च पुराणि च । वासवाः पञ्च राजानः पृथग्वंशाश्च शाश्वताः ॥
data.md: O king, these were the sons of that greatly effulgent royal sage. The five sons founded kingdoms and cities after their names.

data.v: वसन्तमिन्द्रप्रासादे आकाशे स्फाटिके च तम् । उपतस्थुर्महात्मानं गन्धर्वाप्सरसो नृपम् । राजोपरिचरेत्येवं नाम तस्याथ विश्रुतम् ॥
data.md: The Gandharvas and Apsaras came to adore that illustrious man. And because he moved through the upper regions (in his car), he was called Uparichara.

data.v: पुरोपवाहिनीं तस्य नदीं शुक्तिमतीं गिरिः । अरौत्सीच्चेतनायुक्तः कामात्कोलाहलः किल ॥
data.md: The river by name Shuktimati, which flowed by his capital, was once stopped by a living mountain called Kolahala, who was maddened by lust.

data.v: गिरिं कोलाहलं तं तु पदा वसुरताडयत् । निश्चक्राम नदी तेन प्रहारविवरेण सा ॥
data.md: The mountain Kolahala was kicked by Vasu and the river came out of the embrace of the mountain by the indentation caused by his kick.

data.v: तस्यां नद्यामजनयन्मिथुनं पर्वतः स्वयम् । तस्माद्विमोक्षणात्प्रीता नदी राज्ञे न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: From this embrace of the mountain, the river gave birth to a twin, a son and a daughter and the river, grateful to Vasu, gave them both to him.

data.v: यः पुमानभवत्तत्र तं स राजर्षिसत्तमः । वसुर्वसुप्रदश्चक्रे सेनापतिमरिंदमम् । चकार पत्नीं कन्यां तु दयितां गिरिकां नृपः ॥
data.md: The best of royal sages and the giver of wealth and the punisher of enemies, (Vasu) made the son of the river the generalissimo of his army.

data.v: वसोः पत्नी तु गिरिका कामात्काले न्यवेदयत् । ऋतुकालमनुप्राप्तं स्नाता पुंसवने शुचिः ॥
data.md: The king made the daughter of the river who was called Girika his wife; and Girika, the wife of Vasu, purifying herself by a bath when her season of impurity came, told her state to her husband. But that very day the ancestors of Vasu came to him;

data.v: तदहः पितरश्चैनमूचुर्जहि मृगानिति । तं राजसत्तमं प्रीतास्तदा मतिमतां वरम् ॥
स पितॄणां नियोगं तमव्यतिक्रम्य पार्थिवः । चचार मृगयां कामी गिरिकामेव संस्मरन् । अतीव रूपसंपन्नां साक्षाच्छ्रियमिवापराम् ॥
data.md: Went out to hunt (the deer), thinking of Girika who was exceedingly beautiful and was like Sree herself.

data.v: तस्य रेतः प्रचस्कन्द चरतो रुचिरे वने । स्कन्नमात्रं च तद्रेतो वृक्षपत्रेण भूमिपः ॥
प्रतिजग्राह मिथ्या मे न स्कन्देद्रेत इत्युत । ऋतुश्च तस्याः पत्न्या मे न मोघः स्यादिति प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Having discharged the semen, the king Uparichara collected that semen on the leaf of a tree, to save its utility. The king thought that his semen might not be wasted and also the time of the menses of his wife would not pass uselessly.
