data.md: In the wombs of his two wives. Yudhishthira was the son of the eldest. Yudhishthira was born of Dharma, Vrikodara Bhima was born of Maruta;

data.v: धर्माद्युधिष्ठिरो जज्ञे मारुतात्तु वृकोदरः । इन्द्राद्धनंजयः श्रीमान्सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः ॥
जज्ञाते रूपसंपन्नावश्विभ्यां तु यमावुभौ । नकुलः सहदेवश्च गुरुशुश्रूषणे रतौ ॥
data.md: The first of all, the best wielder of the arms, illustrious Arjuna was born of Indra; and Nakula and Sahadeva of handsome features, ever-engaged in the services of their superiors, were born of the twin Ashvinis. One hundred sons were born to the wise Dhritarashtra,

data.v: तथा पुत्रशतं जज्ञे धृतराष्ट्रस्य धीमतः । दुर्योधनप्रभृतयो युयुत्सुः करणस्तथा ॥
data.md: Namely Duryodhana and others and another son, named Yuyutsu (born of a Vaisya woman).

data.v: अभिमन्युः सुभद्रायामर्जुनादभ्यजायत । स्वस्रीयो वासुदेवस्य पौत्रः पाण्डोर्महात्मनः ॥
पाण्डवेभ्योऽपि पञ्चभ्यः कृष्णायां पञ्च जज्ञिरे । कुमारा रूपसंपन्नाः सर्वशस्त्रविशारदाः ॥
प्रतिविन्ध्यो युधिष्ठिरात्सुतसोमो वृकोदरात् । अर्जुनाच्छ्रुतकीर्तिस्तु शतानीकस्तु नाकुलिः ॥
data.md: From Arjuna was born Shrutakirti, from Nakula was born Shatanika and from Sahadeva was born the greatly powerful Shrutasena.

data.v: तथैव सहदेवाच्च श्रुतसेनः प्रतापवान् । हिडिम्बायां च भीमेन वने जज्ञे घटोत्कचः ॥
शिखण्डी द्रुपदाज्जज्ञे कन्या पुत्रत्वमागता । यां यक्षः पुरुषं चक्रे स्थूणः प्रियचिकीर्षया ॥
कुरूणां विग्रहे तस्मिन्समागच्छन्बहून्यथ । राज्ञां शतसहस्राणि योत्स्यमानानि संयुगे ॥
तेषामपरिमेयानि नामधेयानि सर्वशः । न शक्यं परिसंख्यातुं वर्षाणामयुतैरपि । एते तु कीर्तिता मुख्या यैराख्यानमिदं ततम् ॥
data.md: She was thus transformed into a male child by a Yaksha, named Sthuna, who did it from the desire of doing her good. In that great battle of Kurus assembled many hundred of kings and potentates to fight among one another. I am unable to recount the names of those innumerable hosts. I have named only the principal ones who have been mentioned in this history (Mahabharata).

data.v: य एते कीर्तिता ब्रह्मन्ये चान्ये नानुकीर्तिताः । सम्यक्ताञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि राज्ञश्चान्यान्सुवर्चसः ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O Brahmana, I wish to hear in detail the accounts of those that you have named and of those that you have not named and other kings and potentates by thousands.

data.v: यदर्थमिह संभूता देवकल्पा महारथाः । भुवि तन्मे महाभाग सम्यगाख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O great man, you should tell me in full the object for which these great car-warriors, all equal to the celestials, were born on earth.

data.v: रहस्यं खल्विदं राजन्देवानामिति नः श्रुतम् । तत्तु ते कथयिष्यामि नमस्कृत्वा स्वयंभुवे ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O king, we have heard that what you ask is a mystery even to the celestials. I shall however, speak of it, after bowing my head to the Self-Born (Brahma).

data.v: त्रिःसप्तकृत्वः पृथिवीं कृत्वा निःक्षत्रियां पुरा । जामदग्न्यस्तपस्तेपे महेन्द्रे पर्वतोत्तमे ॥
data.md: The son of Jamadagni, (Parshurama), after making the earth bereft of Kshatriyas for twenty-one times, went to the best of the mountains, named Mahendra and began his penances.

data.v: तदा निःक्षत्रिये लोके भार्गवेण कृते सति । ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रिया राजन्गर्भार्थिन्योऽभिचक्रमुः ॥
data.md: O king, when the earth was thus bereft of Kshatriyas, the Kshatriya women used to come to the Brahmanas for offspring.

data.v: ताभिः सह समापेतुर्ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रताः । ऋतावृतौ नरव्याघ्र न कामान्नानृतौ तथा ॥
data.md: O best of men, the Brahmanas had connections with them only at their seasons and not when they were not in their seasons and they the Brahmans did not do it with lust.

data.v: तेभ्यस्तु लेभिरे गर्भान्क्षत्रियास्ताः सहस्रशः । ततः सुषुविरे राजन्क्षत्रियान्वीर्यसंमतान् । कुमारांश्च कुमारीश्च पुनः क्षत्राभिवृद्धये ॥
data.md: Thus thousands of Kshatriya women conceived through these connections with the Brahmanas and O king, thus were born many Kshatriyas of great prowess,

data.v: एवं तद्ब्राह्मणैः क्षत्रं क्षत्रियासु तपस्विभिः । जातमृध्यत धर्मेण सुदीर्घेणायुषान्वितम् । चत्वारोऽपि तदा वर्णा बभूवुर्ब्राह्मणोत्तराः ॥
data.md: The new generation, blessed with long life, began to thrive in virtue and thus were again established the four castes having Brahmanas at their head.

data.v: अभ्यगच्छन्नृतौ नारीं न कामान्नानृतौ तथा । तथैवान्यानि भूतानि तिर्यग्योनिगतान्यपि । ऋतौ दारांश्च गच्छन्ति तदा स्म भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: At the time (of which I speak), every man went to his wife only at the time of her season and never from lust or when she was not at her season. Other creatures also, even those that were born in the race of birds, followed this example. O best of the Bharata race, thus were born hundreds and thousands of creatures and they all thrived in virtue.

data.v: ततोऽवर्धन्त धर्मेण सहस्रशतजीविनः । ताः प्रजाः पृथिवीपाल धर्मव्रतपरायणाः । आधिभिर्व्याधिभिश्चैव विमुक्ताः सर्वशो नराः ॥
data.md: O lord of the earth, all creatures were virtuous and religious and all men were free from sorrow and disease.

data.v: अथेमां सागरापाङ्गां गां गजेन्द्रगताखिलाम् । अध्यतिष्ठत्पुनः क्षत्रं सशैलवनकाननाम् ॥
data.md: O king having the walk of an elephant, thus once more, the wide earth, with the ocean for her boundaries, with her mountains and woods and towns was governed by the Kshatriyas.

data.v: प्रशासति पुनः क्षत्रे धर्मेणेमां वसुंधराम् । ब्राह्मणाद्यास्तदा वर्णा लेभिरे मुदमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: When thus the earth was again governed virtuously by the Kshatriyas, the other castes, having Brahmanas at their head, were filled with great joy.

data.v: कामक्रोधोद्भवान्दोषान्निरस्य च नराधिपाः । दण्डं दण्ड्येषु धर्मेण प्रणयन्तोऽन्वपालयन् ॥
data.md: All the kings (of the world), becoming free from vices born of lust and anger and punishing those that deserved punishment, protected the earth.

data.v: तथा धर्मपरे क्षत्रे सहस्राक्षः शतक्रतुः । स्वादु देशे च काले च ववर्षाप्याययन्प्रजाः ॥
data.md: And (Indra) the deity that performed one hundred sacrifices and who has one thousand eyes, seeing that all the Kshatriya sovereigns ruled their kingdoms very virtuously, poured down vivifying showers of rains at the proper time and at the proper place and thus protected all creatures.

data.v: न बाल एव म्रियते तदा कश्चिन्नराधिप । न च स्त्रियं प्रजानाति कश्चिदप्राप्तयौवनः ॥
data.md: O king, no one died in early age and none took to wife before attaining to age.

data.v: एवमायुष्मतीभिस्तु प्रजाभिर्भरतर्षभ । इयं सागरपर्यन्ता समापूर्यत मेदिनी ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, thus was filled the earth to the very shores of the sea with long-lived men.

data.v: ईजिरे च महायज्ञैः क्षत्रिया बहुदक्षिणैः । साङ्गोपनिषदान्वेदान्विप्राश्चाधीयते तदा ॥
data.md: The Kshatriyas performed great sacrifices and bestowed much wealth on the Brahmanas and all the Brahmanas also studied the Vedas and the Vedangas and the Upanishads.

data.v: न च विक्रीणते ब्रह्म ब्राह्मणाः स्म तदा नृप । न च शूद्रसमाभ्याशे वेदानुच्चारयन्त्युत ॥
data.md: O king, no Brahmana ever sold the Vedas and none of them ever read them aloud before a Shudra.

data.v: कारयन्तः कृषिं गोभिस्तथा वैश्याः क्षिताविह । न गामयुञ्जन्त धुरि कृशाङ्गाश्चाप्यजीवयन् ॥
data.md: The Vaishyas tilled well the earth with the help of bullocks and they never yoked kine to the plough. They carefully fed the lean ones.

data.v: फेनपांश्च तथा वत्सान्न दुहन्ति स्म मानवाः । न कूटमानैर्वणिजः पण्यं विक्रीणते तदा ॥
data.md: Men never milched the cows as long as the calves could not live on the milk of their mothers. No merchant sold his goods with false scales.

data.v: कर्माणि च नरव्याघ्र धर्मोपेतानि मानवाः । धर्ममेवानुपश्यन्तश्चक्रुर्धर्मपरायणाः ॥
data.md: O best of men, all men, thus virtuously inclined, did every thing with their eyes fixed on virtue.

data.v: स्वकर्मनिरताश्चासन्सर्वे वर्णा नराधिप । एवं तदा नरव्याघ्र धर्मो न ह्रसते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: O king, all men of all castes were mindful of the respective duties of their respective castes. O best of men, their virtue never sustained any diminution.

data.v: काले गावः प्रसूयन्ते नार्यश्च भरतर्षभ । फलन्त्यृतुषु वृक्षाश्च पुष्पाणि च फलानि च ॥
data.md: Both women and kine gave birth to offspring at the proper time and trees bore flowers and fruits at their proper seasons.

data.v: एवं कृतयुगे सम्यग्वर्तमाने तदा नृप । आपूर्यत मही कृत्स्ना प्राणिभिर्बहुभिर्भृशम् ॥
data.md: O king, the Krita (Satya) Yuga having come into the world, the whole earth was filled with numerous beings.

data.v: ततः समुदिते लोके मानुषे भरतर्षभ । असुरा जज्ञिरे क्षेत्रे राज्ञां मनुजपुंगव ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, O lord of men, when such was the happy state of the world, the Asuras began to take birth in royal dynasties.

data.v: आदित्यैर्हि तदा दैत्या बहुशो निर्जिता युधि । ऐश्वर्याद्भ्रंशिताश्चापि संबभूवुः क्षिताविह ॥
data.md: The sons of Diti, (the Asuras), having been continually defeated by the sons of Aditi, (the celestials) and deprived of sovereignty and heaven, began to take birth on earth.

data.v: इह देवत्वमिच्छन्तो मानुषेषु मनस्विनः । जज्ञिरे भुवि भूतेषु तेषु तेष्वसुरा विभो ॥
data.md: O king, wishing to enjoy sovereignty in this earth, the powerful Asuras took birth among humens, cows, horses, mules, camels, buffaloes, elephants, deer; they also took birth as Rakshasas and others.

data.v: गोष्वश्वेषु च राजेन्द्र खरोष्ट्रमहिषेषु च । क्रव्यादेषु च भूतेषु गजेषु च मृगेषु च ॥
data.md: O king, wishing to enjoy sovereignty in this earth, the powerful Asuras took birth among humens, cows, horses, mules, camels, buffaloes, elephants, deer; they also took birth as Rakshasas and others.

data.v: जातैरिह महीपाल जायमानैश्च तैर्मही । न शशाकात्मनात्मानमियं धारयितुं धरा ॥
data.md: O protector of the world, owing to the birth of those (Asuras) that were already born and those that were being born, the Earth became incapable of supporting herself.

data.v: अथ जाता महीपालाः केचिद्बलसमन्विताः । दितेः पुत्रा दनोश्चैव तस्माल्लोकादिह च्युताः ॥
data.md: Amongst the sons of Diti and Danu, some, being thrown off from heaven, took birth as men and became proud and insolent monarchs on earth.

data.v: वीर्यवन्तोऽवलिप्तास्ते नानारूपधरा महीम् । इमां सागरपर्यन्तां परीयुररिमर्दनाः ॥
data.md: Possessed of great prowess, they covered the earth in various shapes. They, becoming great oppressors, filled the earth to the very shores of the sea.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रियान्वैश्याञ्शूद्रांश्चैवाप्यपीडयन् । अन्यानि चैव भूतानि पीडयामासुरोजसा ॥
data.md: They began to oppress the Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras; they began to persecute all other creatures with their strength.

data.v: त्रासयन्तो विनिघ्नन्तस्तांस्तान्भूतगणांश्च ते । विचेरुः सर्वतो राजन्महीं शतसहस्रशः ॥
data.md: O king, frightening and killing all creatures, they roamed over the earth in hundred and thousands.

data.v: आश्रमस्थान्महर्षींश्च धर्षयन्तस्ततस्ततः । अब्रह्मण्या वीर्यमदा मत्ता मदबलेन च ॥
data.md: Bereft of virtue and truth, proud of their strength, intoxicated with their insolence, they even insulted the holy Rishis in their hermitages.

data.v: एवं वीर्यबलोत्सिक्तैर्भूरियं तैर्महासुरैः । पीड्यमाना महीपाल ब्रह्माणमुपचक्रमे ॥
data.md: O king, the earth, thus oppressed by the Asuras of great strength, energy and abundant means, thought of appealing to Brahma.

data.v: न हीमां पवनो राजन्न नागा न नगा महीम् । तदा धारयितुं शेकुराक्रान्तां दानवैर्बलात् ॥
data.md: The united strength of the Naga Shesha and other creatures (such as the tortoise and the elephant), could not support the earth, attacked by the powerful Danavas.

data.v: ततो मही महीपाल भारार्ता भयपीडिता । जगाम शरणं देवं सर्वभूतपितामहम् ॥
data.md: O protector of the world, thereupon the Earth, afflicted with fear and oppressed by the weight (of the Danavas went to the Grandfather of all creatures and asked his protection.

data.v: सा संवृतं महाभागैर्देवद्विजमहर्षिभिः । ददर्श देवं ब्रह्माणं लोककर्तारमव्ययम् ॥
data.md: She saw the divine Brahma, the creator of the worlds, who is undeteriorating, seated (on his seat), surrounded by the celestials and great and illustrious Rishis and adored by the delighted Gandharvas and Apsaras who are always engaged in the services of the celestials.

data.v: गन्धर्वैरप्सरोभिश्च बन्दिकर्मसु निष्ठितैः । वन्द्यमानं मुदोपेतैर्ववन्दे चैनमेत्य सा ॥
data.md: She saw the divine Brahma, the creator of the worlds, who is undeteriorating, seated (on his seat), surrounded by the celestials and great and illustrious Rishis and adored by the delighted Gandharvas and Apsaras who are always engaged in the services of the celestials.

data.v: अथ विज्ञापयामास भूमिस्तं शरणार्थिनी । संनिधौ लोकपालानां सर्वेषामेव भारत ॥
data.md: The Earth adored the Grandsire and O best of the Bharata race, telling him all that had happened, before all the regents of the world she asked his protection.

data.v: तत्प्रधानात्मनस्तस्य भूमेः कृत्यं स्वयंभुवः । पूर्वमेवाभवद्राजन्विदितं परमेष्ठिनः ॥
data.md: O king, the object (for which she came) was already known beforehand to the Omniscient, Self-created and Supreme Lord.

data.v: स्रष्टा हि जगतः कस्मान्न संबुध्येत भारत । सुरासुराणां लोकानामशेषेण मनोगतम् ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race he is the creator of the universe, why should he not know fully what is in the minds of the creatures, including the very Devas and the Danavas?

data.v: तामुवाच महाराज भूमिं भूमिपतिर्विभुः । प्रभवः सर्वभूतानामीशः शंभुः प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: O great king, the Lord of the earth, Prajapati, Isha, Shambhu, then thus spoke to her.

data.v: यदर्थमसि संप्राप्ता मत्सकाशं वसुंधरे । तदर्थं संनियोक्ष्यामि सर्वानेव दिवौकसः ॥
data.md: Brahma said: O Vasundhara (the holder of wealth,) I shall appoint all the dwellers of heaven in the work for which you have come to me.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा स महीं देवो ब्रह्मा राजन्विसृज्य च । आदिदेश तदा सर्वान्विबुधान्भूतकृत्स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O king, having thus addressed the Earth, the divine Brahma, bade her farewell. Then the Creator commanded all the celestials, saying, "All of you go and take your birth on earth to free her from her burden. data.v: आयुष्यश्चैव पुण्यश्च धन्यः श्रुतिसुखावहः । श्रोतव्यश्चैव सततं श्राव्यश्चैवानसूयता ॥
data.md: This history, (if read or heard) extends period of life. It is sacred, it is worthy of all praise, it gives pleasure, if heard. It should be always heard and recited to others in a proper frame of mind.

data.v: इमं तु वंशं नियमेन यः पठे;न्महात्मनां ब्राह्मणदेवसंनिधौ । अपत्यलाभं लभते स पुष्कलं; श्रियं यशः प्रेत्य च शोभनां गतिम् ॥
data.md: He, who properly reads in the presence of the deities and Brahmanas, this account of the births of noble creature, obtains large progeny, good fortune and fame. He attains to the higher worlds hereafter.

data.v: ब्रह्मणो मानसाः पुत्रा विदिताः षण्महर्षयः । एकादश सुताः स्थाणोः ख्याताः परममानसाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : It is known that the mind-born sons of Brahma were six great Rishis. There was another (mind-borm son of Brahma,) named Sthanu. He had eleven sons gifted with great energy,

data.v: मृगव्याधश्च शर्वश्च निरृतिश्च महायशाः । अजैकपादहिर्बुध्न्यः पिनाकी च परंतपः ॥
data.md: Namely, Mrigavyadha, Sarpa, famous Niriti, Ajaikapada, Ahirbudhnya, the chastiser of his foes Pinaki.

data.v: दहनोऽथेश्वरश्चैव कपाली च महाद्युतिः । स्थाणुर्भवश्च भगवान्रुद्रा एकादश स्मृताः ॥
data.md: Dahana, Ishvara and greatly effulgent Kapali, Sthanu and the illustrious Bhaga. These eleven are called eleven Rudras.

data.v: मरीचिरङ्गिरा अत्रिः पुलस्त्यः पुलहः क्रतुः । षडेते ब्रह्मणः पुत्रा वीर्यवन्तो महर्षयः ॥
data.md: (It has been already said that) Marichi, Angiras, Atari, Pulastya, Pulaha and Kratu, these powerful Rishis were six mind-born sons of Brahma.

data.v: त्रयस्त्वङ्गिरसः पुत्रा लोके सर्वत्र विश्रुताः । बृहस्पतिरुतथ्यश्च संवर्तश्च धृतव्रताः ॥
data.md: It is well-known in the world that the sons of Angiras were three, namely Brihaspati, Utathya and Samvarta, all of great asceticism.

data.v: अत्रेस्तु बहवः पुत्राः श्रूयन्ते मनुजाधिप । सर्वे वेदविदः सिद्धाः शान्तात्मानो महर्षयः ॥
data.md: O king, it is said that the sons of Atri were countless, they were all great Rishis and they were all learned in the Vedas, they were crowned with ascetic successes and their souls were in perfect peace.

data.v: राक्षसास्तु पुलस्त्यस्य वानराः किंनरास्तथा । पुलहस्य मृगाः सिंहा व्याघ्राः किंपुरुषास्तथा ॥
data.md: O best of kings, the offspring of greatly wise Pulastya were the Rakshas, Monkeys, Kinnaras and Yakshas.

data.v: क्रतोः क्रतुसमाः पुत्राः पतंगसहचारिणः । विश्रुतास्त्रिषु लोकेषु सत्यव्रतपरायणाः ॥
data.md: The sons of Kratu (Valakhilyas), who were as sacred as sacrifice, were the companions of Surya. They were known to the three worlds and they were all devoted to truth and vows,

data.v: दक्षस्त्वजायताङ्गुष्ठाद्दक्षिणाद्भगवानृषिः । ब्रह्मणः पृथिवीपाल पुत्रः पुत्रवतां वरः ॥
data.md: O protector of the world, the illustrious Rishi Daksha, having his soul in complete peace and possessing great asceticism, sprang from the right thumb of Brahma.

data.v: वामादजायताङ्गुष्ठाद्भार्या तस्य महात्मनः । तस्यां पञ्चाशतं कन्याः स एवाजनयन्मुनिः ॥
data.md: The wife of the illustrious Daksha sprang from the left toe of Brahma. He then begot fifty daughters on her.

data.v: ताः सर्वास्त्वनवद्याङ्ग्यः कन्याः कमललोचनाः । पुत्रिकाः स्थापयामास नष्टपुत्रः प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: They were all lotus-eyed and of faultless features and limbs. As he (Daksha) had no sons of his own, he made these daughters his Putrikas.

data.v: ददौ स दश धर्माय सप्तविंशतिमिन्दवे । दिव्येन विधिना राजन्कश्यपाय त्रयोदश ॥
data.md: He (Daksha) bestowed in due form, ten of his daughters on Dharma twenty-seven on Chandra and thirteen on Kashyapa.

data.v: नामतो धर्मपत्न्यस्ताः कीर्त्यमाना निबोध मे । कीर्तिर्लक्ष्मीर्धृतिर्मेधा पुष्टिः श्रद्धा क्रिया तथा ॥
data.md: Hear, O king, the names of the wives of Dharma as I mention them. (They were) Kirti, Lakshmi, Dhriti, Medha, Pushti, Shraddha, Kriya.

data.v: बुद्धिर्लज्जा मतिश्चैव पत्न्यो धर्मस्य ता दश । द्वाराण्येतानि धर्मस्य विहितानि स्वयंभुवा ॥
data.md: Buddhi, Lajja and Mati. These were the ten wives of Dharma, as appointed by the selfcreated (Brahma).

data.v: सप्तविंशति सोमस्य पत्न्यो लोके परिश्रुताः । कालस्य नयने युक्ताः सोमपत्न्यः शुभव्रताः । सर्वा नक्षत्रयोगिन्यो लोकयात्राविधौ स्थिताः ॥
data.md: It is known throughout the world that the wives of Chandra were twenty-seven. They were all of rigid and holy vows, they were employed to indicate time.

data.v: पितामहो मुनिर्देवस्तस्य पुत्रः प्रजापतिः । तस्याष्टौ वसवः पुत्रास्तेषां वक्ष्यामि विस्तरम् ॥
data.md: The sons of Prajapati were eight and they were called the Vasus. I shall name them in detail. (They were) Dhara, Dhruva, Soma, Aha, Anila, Anala,

data.v: धरो ध्रुवश्च सोमश्च अहश्चैवानिलोऽनलः । प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च वसवोऽष्टाविति स्मृताः ॥
धूम्रायाश्च धरः पुत्रो ब्रह्मविद्यो ध्रुवस्तथा । चन्द्रमास्तु मनस्विन्याः श्वसायाः श्वसनस्तथा ॥
रतायाश्चाप्यहः पुत्रः शाण्डिल्याश्च हुताशनः । प्रत्यूषश्च प्रभासश्च प्रभातायाः सुतौ स्मृतौ ॥
data.md: Pratyusha and Prabhasa were the sons of Prabhata. Dhara had two sons, namely, Dravina and Hutahavyavaha. was

data.v: धरस्य पुत्रो द्रविणो हुतहव्यवहस्तथा । ध्रुवस्य पुत्रो भगवान्कालो लोकप्रकालनः ॥
सोमस्य तु सुतो वर्चा वर्चस्वी येन जायते । मनोहरायाः शिशिरः प्राणोऽथ रमणस्तथा ॥
अह्नः सुतः स्मृतो ज्योतिः श्रमः शान्तस्तथा मुनिः । अग्नेः पुत्रः कुमारस्तु श्रीमाञ्शरवणालयः ॥
तस्य शाखो विशाखश्च नैगमेशश्च पृष्ठजः । कृत्तिकाभ्युपपत्तेश्च कार्त्तिकेय इति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Agni's son was the handsome Kumara who was born in the forest and as he was reared up by Kirtika and others, he was called Kartikeya. After him were (born his three brothers, namely) Shakha, Vishakha and Naigameya, Anila's wife was Shiva and her sons were Manojava.

data.v: अनिलस्य शिवा भार्या तस्याः पुत्रः पुरोजवः । अविज्ञातगतिश्चैव द्वौ पुत्रावनिलस्य तु ॥
प्रत्यूषस्य विदुः पुत्रमृषिं नाम्नाथ देवलम् । द्वौ पुत्रौ देवलस्यापि क्षमावन्तौ मनीषिणौ ॥
बृहस्पतेस्तु भगिनी वरस्त्री ब्रह्मचारिणी । योगसिद्धा जगत्सर्वमसक्तं विचरत्युत । प्रभासस्य तु भार्या सा वसूनामष्टमस्य ह ॥
data.md: And an austere ascetic, roamed over the world, having no attraction for the world, She (the sister of Brihaspati) became the wife of the ! eighth Vasu, Prabhasa.

data.v: विश्वकर्मा महाभागो जज्ञे शिल्पप्रजापतिः । कर्ता शिल्पसहस्राणां त्रिदशानां च वर्धकिः ॥
data.md: She gave birth to the illustrious Vishvakarma, the founder of all arts, the creator of thousand arts, the artist of the celestials, the maker of all kinds of ornaments, the best of all artists and the maker of the celestials cars of the gods.

data.v: भूषणानां च सर्वेषां कर्ता शिल्पवतां वरः । यो दिव्यानि विमानानि देवतानां चकार ह ॥
data.md: She gave birth to the illustrious Vishvakarma, the founder of all arts, the creator of thousand arts, the artist of the celestials, the maker of all kinds of ornaments, the best of all artists and the maker of the celestials cars of the gods.

data.v: मनुष्याश्चोपजीवन्ति यस्य शिल्पं महात्मनः । पूजयन्ति च यं नित्यं विश्वकर्माणमव्ययम् ॥
data.md: Mankind was enabled to live in consequence of the arts of this illustrious man and for this reason he was worshipped by all men. This Vishvakarma is everlasting and immutable,

data.v: स्तनं तु दक्षिणं भित्त्वा ब्रह्मणो नरविग्रहः । निःसृतो भगवान्धर्मः सर्वलोकसुखावहः ॥
data.md: The illustrious Dharma, the dispenser of all happiness, came out of the right breast of Brahma, assuming the form of a man.

data.v: त्रयस्तस्य वराः पुत्राः सर्वभूतमनोहराः । शमः कामश्च हर्षश्च तेजसा लोकधारिणः ॥
data.md: He (Dharma) had three excellent sons, charming to all creatures. (They were) Shama, Kama and Harsha, who supported the worlds by their energy.

data.v: कामस्य तु रतिर्भार्या शमस्य प्राप्तिरङ्गना । नन्दी तु भार्या हर्षस्य यत्र लोकाः प्रतिष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: The wife of Kama was Rati, that of Shama was Prapti and that of Harsha was Nanda; upon these the worlds were made to depend.

data.v: मरीचेः कश्यपः पुत्रः कश्यपस्य सुरासुराः । जज्ञिरे नृपशार्दूल लोकानां प्रभवस्तु सः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa was the son of Marichi and Kashyapa's offspring were the Suras (celestial) and Asuras. O best of kings, therefore, he is the progenitor of all the worlds.

data.v: त्वाष्ट्री तु सवितुर्भार्या वडवारूपधारिणी । असूयत महाभागा सान्तरिक्षेऽश्विनावुभौ ॥
data.md: Tvashtri, who had the form of a mare, became the wife of Savita. She gave birth in the sky to a twin Ashvinis.

data.v: द्वादशैवादितेः पुत्राः शक्रमुख्या नराधिप । तेषामवरजो विष्णुर्यत्र लोकाः प्रतिष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: O king, the sons of Aditi were twelve with Indra at their head. The youngest of them was Vishnu, upon whom the worlds depend.

data.v: त्रयस्त्रिंशत इत्येते देवास्तेषामहं तव । अन्वयं संप्रवक्ष्यामि पक्षैश्च कुलतो गणान् ॥
data.md: These were the thirty-three celestials. I shall now mention to you their progeny according their Pakshas, Kulas and Ganas.

data.v: रुद्राणामपरः पक्षः साध्यानां मरुतां तथा । वसूनां भार्गवं विद्याद्विश्वेदेवांस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: The Rudras, the Sadhyas, the Marutas, the Vasus, the Bhargavas and the Visvedevas were each a Paksha.

data.v: वैनतेयस्तु गरुडो बलवानरुणस्तथा । बृहस्पतिश्च भगवानादित्येष्वेव गण्यते ॥
data.md: Vinata's son, Garuda and the Aruna also and illustrious Brihaspati were counted amongst the Adityas.

data.v: अश्विभ्यां गुह्यकान्विद्धि सर्वौषध्यस्तथा पशून् । एष देवगणो राजन्कीर्तितस्तेऽनुपूर्वशः । यं कीर्तयित्वा मनुजः सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The Ashvinis, all annual plants and all beasts were counted among the Guhyakas. O king, these are the Ganas of the celestials, narrated to you.

data.v: ब्रह्मणो हृदयं भित्त्वा निःसृतो भगवान्भृगुः । भृगोः पुत्रः कविर्विद्वाञ्शुक्रः कविसुतो ग्रहः ॥
त्रैलोक्यप्राणयात्रार्थे वर्षावर्षे भयाभये । स्वयंभुवा नियुक्तः सन्भुवनं परिधावति ॥
योगाचार्यो महाबुद्धिर्दैत्यानामभवद्गुरुः । सुराणां चापि मेधावी ब्रह्मचारी यतव्रतः ॥
तस्मिन्नियुक्ते विभुना योगक्षेमाय भार्गवे । अन्यमुत्पादयामास पुत्रं भृगुरनिन्दितम् ॥
data.md: Thus appointed by Brahma to look after the welfare (of Daityas), Bhrigu's son (Shukra) begot another son.

data.v: च्यवनं दीप्ततपसं धर्मात्मानं मनीषिणम् । यः स रोषाच्च्युतो गर्भान्मातुर्मोक्षाय भारत ॥
data.md: Named Chyavana, who was greatly famous, very virtuous minded and as effulgent as the sun. O descendant of the Bharata race, he came out of his mother's womb in anger and thus released his mother.

data.v: आरुषी तु मनोः कन्या तस्य पत्नी मनीषिणः । और्वस्तस्यां समभवदूरुं भित्त्वा महायशाः । महातपा महातेजा बाल एव गुणैर्युतः ॥
data.md: Arushi, the daughter of Manu, became the wife of the wise Chyavana and the greatly illustrious Aurva was born in her, ripping open her thighs.

data.v: ऋचीकस्तस्य पुत्रस्तु जमदग्निस्ततोऽभवत् । जमदग्नेस्तु चत्वार आसन्पुत्रा महात्मनः ॥
रामस्तेषां जघन्योऽभूदजघन्यैर्गुणैर्युतः । सर्वशस्त्रास्त्रकुशलः क्षत्रियान्तकरो वशी ॥
और्वस्यासीत्पुत्रशतं जमदग्निपुरोगमम् । तेषां पुत्रसहस्राणि बभूवुर्भृगुविस्तरः ॥
द्वौ पुत्रौ ब्रह्मणस्त्वन्यौ ययोस्तिष्ठति लक्षणम् । लोके धाता विधाता च यौ स्थितौ मनुना सह ॥
data.md: These hundred sons begot offspring by thousands and filled the whole world. Brahma had two other sons, who had victory as their signification.

data.v: तयोरेव स्वसा देवी लक्ष्मीः पद्मगृहा शुभा । तस्यास्तु मानसाः पुत्रास्तुरगा व्योमचारिणः ॥
वरुणस्य भार्या ज्येष्ठा तु शुक्राद्देवी व्यजायत । तस्याः पुत्रं बलं विद्धि सुरां च सुरनन्दिनीम् ॥
प्रजानामन्नकामानामन्योन्यपरिभक्षणात् । अधर्मस्तत्र संजातः सर्वभूतविनाशनः ॥
data.md: She gave birth to a son, called Bala and a daughter, named Sura, who gives joy to the celestials. And all destroying Adharma was born (of her), when creatures began to devour one another. Niriti was his wife, from whom were born the Rakshasas, called Nairitas.

data.v: तस्यापि निरृतिर्भार्या नैरृता येन राक्षसाः । घोरास्तस्यास्त्रयः पुत्राः पापकर्मरताः सदा । भयो महाभयश्चैव मृत्युर्भूतान्तकस्तथा ॥
data.md: She had also three other fearful and cruel sons, always engaged in sinful deeds. (They were) Bhaya, Mahabhaya and Mrityu, the destroyer of every created thing.

data.v: काकीं श्येनीं च भासीं च धृतराष्ट्रीं तथा शुकीम् । ताम्रा तु सुषुवे देवी पञ्चैता लोकविश्रुताः ॥
उलूकान्सुषुवे काकी श्येनी श्येनान्व्यजायत । भासी भासानजनयद्गृध्रांश्चैव जनाधिप ॥

data.v: तृतीयस्तु महाराज महाबाहुर्महासुरः । निषादाधिपतिर्जज्ञे भुवि भीमपराक्रमः ॥
data.md: The third was a great Asura, endued with great prowess and power of deception, (Magical powers) and he became the greatly powerful king of the Nishadas.

data.v: तेषामन्यतमो यस्तु चतुर्थः परिकीर्तितः । श्रेणिमानिति विख्यातः क्षितौ राजर्षिसत्तमः ॥
data.md: The fourth of the brothers became the best of royal sages, Shrenimana.

data.v: पञ्चमस्तु बभूवैषां प्रवरो यो महासुरः । महौजा इति विख्यातो बभूवेह परंतपः ॥
data.md: That great Asura, the fifth (brother) became king Mahauja, the oppressor of his foes on earth.

data.v: षष्ठस्तु मतिमान्यो वै तेषामासीन्महासुरः । अभीरुरिति विख्यातः क्षितौ राजर्षिसत्तमः ॥
data.md: That greatly intelligent and powerful Asura who was the sixth (brother) became the vest of royal sages Abhiru on earth.

data.md: The seventh of the brothers) became king Samudrasena, famous all over the earth from its centre to the sea and he was learned in the Shastras.

data.md: O king, the eighth of the Kaleyas, who was known as Brihata became a virtuous king, ever engaged in doing good to all creatures,

data.md: O king, many heroic monarchs, were born on earth form the race of Asuras, called Krodhavasha, of whom I have already spoken to you.

data.v: नन्दिकः कर्णवेष्टश्च सिद्धार्थः कीटकस्तथा । सुवीरश्च सुबाहुश्च महावीरोऽथ बाह्लिकः ॥

आषाढो वायुवेगश्च भूरितेजास्तथैव च । एकलव्यः सुमित्रश्च वाटधानोऽथ गोमुखः ॥

data.md: These greatly fortunate, powerful and illustrious and best of monarchs were all born on earth of the race of Asuras, called Krodhavasha.

data.v: यस्त्वासीद्देवको नाम देवराजसमद्युतिः । स गन्धर्वपतिर्मुख्यः क्षितौ जज्ञे नराधिपः ॥
data.md: The best of the kings of the Gandharvas was born on earth as Devaka who was as effulgent as Indra himself.

data.v: बृहस्पतेर्बृहत्कीर्तेर्देवर्षेर्विद्धि भारत । अंशाद्द्रोणं समुत्पन्नं भारद्वाजमयोनिजम् ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, Drona, the son of Bharadvaja, who was not born of any woman, sprang from the celestial Rishi Brihaspati.

data.v: धन्विनां नृपशार्दूल यः स सर्वास्त्रवित्तमः । बृहत्कीर्तिर्महातेजाः संजज्ञे मनुजेष्विह ॥
data.md: O best of kings, he was a hero of great achievements and the best of all those that were learned in the ways of using arms. He was most illustrious and most powerful.

data.v: धनुर्वेदे च वेदे च यं तं वेदविदो विदुः । वरिष्ठमिन्द्रकर्माणं द्रोणं स्वकुलवर्धनम् ॥
data.md: He was called learned, in the Vedas, as well as in the Science of arms by all men wellversed in the Vedas. He was a doer of wonderful deeds and a pride of his race.

data.v: महादेवान्तकाभ्यां च कामात्क्रोधाच्च भारत । एकत्वमुपपन्नानां जज्ञे शूरः परंतपः ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, O king, his son, the heroic, surpassingly energetic and lotus-eyed Ashvathama, the terror of all his foes and the great oppressor of all enemies, was born on earth from the united portions of Mahadeva, Yama, Kama and Krodha.

data.v: अश्वत्थामा महावीर्यः शत्रुपक्षक्षयंकरः । वीरः कमलपत्राक्षः क्षितावासीन्नराधिप ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, O king, his son, the heroic, surpassingly energetic and lotus-eyed Ashvathama, the terror of all his foes and the great oppressor of all enemies, was born on earth from the united portions of Mahadeva, Yama, Kama and Krodha.

data.v: जज्ञिरे वसवस्त्वष्टौ गङ्गायां शंतनोः सुताः । वसिष्ठस्य च शापेन नियोगाद्वासवस्य च ॥
data.md: Begot by her husband Shantanu, the eight Vasus were given birth to by Ganga, on account of the curse of Rishi Vasistha and also from the command of Indra.

data.v: तेषामवरजो भीष्मः कुरूणामभयंकरः । मतिमान्वेदविद्वाग्मी शत्रुपक्षक्षयंकरः ॥
data.md: The youngest of them was Bhishma, who was the dispeller of the fears of the Kurus, who was greatly intelligent, who was a great scholar in the Vedas and a best of speakers and the destroyer of the enemy's ranks.

data.v: जामदग्न्येन रामेण यः स सर्वविदां वरः । अयुध्यत महातेजा भार्गवेण महात्मना ॥
data.md: That best of men, being learned in the science of arms and endued with great energy, fought with the illustrious (Parshu) Rama, the son of Jamadagni.

data.v: यस्तु राजन्कृपो नाम ब्रह्मर्षिरभवत्क्षितौ । रुद्राणां तं गणाद्विद्धि संभूतमतिपौरुषम् ॥
data.md: O king, that Brahmana Rishi, who was known in the world as Kripa, was the embodiment of all manliness, was born of the Rudraganas.

data.v: शकुनिर्नाम यस्त्वासीद्राजा लोके महारथः । द्वापरं विद्धि तं राजन्संभूतमरिमर्दनम् ॥
data.md: O king, that king and great car-warrior, that chastiser of foes, who was known as Shakuni in the world, know him to be the Dvapara himself.

data.v: सात्यकिः सत्यसंधस्तु योऽसौ वृष्णिकुलोद्वहः । पक्षात्स जज्ञे मरुतां देवानामरिमर्दनः ॥
data.md: He who was known as Satyaki, the upholder of the pride of Vrishnis and the chastiser of foes, was born of the portion of celestial Marutas.

data.v: द्रुपदश्चापि राजर्षिस्तत एवाभवद्गणात् । मानुषे नृप लोकेऽस्मिन्सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः ॥
data.md: That royal sage, king Drupada, the best of all the wielder of arms, was also born the portions of the same celestials (Marutas).

data.v: ततश्च कृतवर्माणं विद्धि राजञ्जनाधिपम् । जातमप्रतिकर्माणं क्षत्रियर्षभसत्तमम् ॥
data.md: O king, know that Kritavarma that king of men, that man of matchless deeds, that best of best Kshatriyas,

data.v: मरुतां तु गणाद्विद्धि संजातमरिमर्दनम् । विराटं नाम राजर्षिं परराष्ट्रप्रतापनम् ॥
data.md: That chastiser of foes, was also born of the same celestials. The king Virata, the conqueror of other kingdoms, was also born of the same celestials.

data.v: अरिष्टायास्तु यः पुत्रो हंस इत्यभिविश्रुतः । स गन्धर्वपतिर्जज्ञे कुरुवंशविवर्धनः ॥
data.md: That son of Arishta, known as Hansa, the king of the Gandharvas, was born to increase the Kuru race.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्र इति ख्यातः कृष्णद्वैपायनादपि । दीर्घबाहुर्महातेजाः प्रज्ञाचक्षुर्नराधिपः । मातुर्दोषादृषेः कोपादन्ध एव व्यजायत ॥
data.md: He was known on earth as Dhritarashtra, the son of Krishna Dvaipayana; he had long arms, he was greatly powerful and he was a king with prophetic eyes.

data.v: अत्रेस्तु सुमहाभागं पुत्रं पुत्रवतां वरम् । विदुरं विद्धि लोकेऽस्मिञ्जातं बुद्धिमतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Know, that he who was known as Vidura, he wino was the best of all virtuous men, he who was the god of justice himself who was the excellent and greatly fortunate son of Atri (Surya). one

data.v: कलेरंशात्तु संजज्ञे भुवि दुर्योधनो नृपः । दुर्बुद्धिर्दुर्मतिश्चैव कुरूणामयशस्करः ॥
data.md: The evil and wicked-minded king Duryodhana, the destroyer of the fame of the Kuru dynasty, was born of the portion of the Kali.

data.v: जगतो यः स सर्वस्य विद्विष्टः कलिपूरुषः । यः सर्वां घातयामास पृथिवीं पुरुषाधमः । येन वैरं समुद्दीप्तं भूतान्तकरणं महत् ॥
data.md: O king, It was he who was the cause of the slaughter of all creatures and of the world, he ruined the earth.

data.v: पौलस्त्या भ्रातरः सर्वे जज्ञिरे मनुजेष्विह । शतं दुःशासनादीनां सर्वेषां क्रूरकर्मणाम् ॥
दुर्मुखो दुःसहश्चैव ये चान्ये नानुशब्दिताः । दुर्योधनसहायास्ते पौलस्त्या भरतर्षभ ॥
धर्मस्यांशं तु राजानं विद्धि राजन्युधिष्ठिरम् । भीमसेनं तु वातस्य देवराजस्य चार्जुनम् ॥
data.md: Know, O king, king Yudhishthira was a portion of Dharma; Bhima was that of Maruta; Arjuna was that of the king of the celestials (Indra).

data.v: अश्विनोस्तु तथैवांशौ रूपेणाप्रतिमौ भुवि । नकुलः सहदेवश्च सर्वलोकमनोहरौ ॥
data.md: The most handsome men amongst all men and the matchless beauties on earth, Nakula and Sahadeva were the portions of the Ashvinas.

data.v: यः सुवर्चा इति ख्यातः सोमपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । अभिमन्युर्बृहत्कीर्तिरर्जुनस्य सुतोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: He, who was known as Varcha the son of Soma, became Abhimanyu of wonderful deeds, the son of Arjuna.

data.v: अग्नेरंशं तु विद्धि त्वं धृष्टद्युम्नं महारथम् । शिखण्डिनमथो राजन्स्त्रीपुंसं विद्धि राक्षसम् ॥
द्रौपदेयाश्च ये पञ्च बभूवुर्भरतर्षभ । विश्वेदेवगणान्राजंस्तान्विद्धि भरतर्षभ ॥
आमुक्तकवचः कर्णो यस्तु जज्ञे महारथः । दिवाकरस्य तं विद्धि देवस्यांशमनुत्तमम् ॥
यस्तु नारायणो नाम देवदेवः सनातनः । तस्यांशो मानुषेष्वासीद्वासुदेवः प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Karna, the best of kings, expert in the use of all arms, the destroyer of his foes, became the friend and counsellor of Duryodhana, Know, O king, he was born of a portion of the sun. Of that god of gods, that everlasting Being, whose name is Narayana, the powerful Vasudeva (Krishna), was a portion in the world of men.

data.v: शेषस्यांशस्तु नागस्य बलदेवो महाबलः । सनत्कुमारं प्रद्युम्नं विद्धि राजन्महौजसम् ॥
data.md: Baladeva was a portion of the Naga, Shesha. O king, know that the greatly energetic Pradyumna was a portion of Sanatkumara. In this was many dwellers of heaven became great men on earth, In the race of Vasudeva, thus increasing its glory.

data.v: एवमन्ये मनुष्येन्द्र बहवोंऽशा दिवौकसाम् । जज्ञिरे वसुदेवस्य कुले कुलविवर्धनाः ॥
data.md: Baladeva was a portion of the Naga, Shesha. O king, know that the greatly energetic Pradyumna was a portion of Sanatkumara. In this was many dwellers of heaven became great men on earth, In the race of Vasudeva, thus increasing its glory.

data.v: गणस्त्वप्सरसां यो वै मया राजन्प्रकीर्तितः । तस्य भागः क्षितौ जज्ञे नियोगाद्वासवस्य च ॥
data.md: O king, the Apsaras, of whom I have already spoken, were also born on earth in portions as ordered by Indra.

data.v: तानि षोडश देवीनां सहस्राणि नराधिप । बभूवुर्मानुषे लोके नारायणपरिग्रहः ॥
data.md: O king, sixteen thousand portions of these celestial ladies, became in the world of men the wives of Vasudeva. A portion of Sree (Lakshmi), herself became incarnate on earth out of love (for Narayana).

data.v: श्रियस्तु भागः संजज्ञे रत्यर्थं पृथिवीतले । द्रुपदस्य कुले कन्या वेदिमध्यादनिन्दिता ॥
data.md: She was born in the race of Bhishmaka and that illustrious lady was named Rukmini. Draupadi was born from a portion of Sachi, (the wife of Indra) in the race of Drupada and from the altar of the sacrifice.

data.v: नातिह्रस्वा न महती नीलोत्पलसुगन्धिनी । पद्मायताक्षी सुश्रोणी असितायतमूर्धजा ॥
data.md: She was neither tall nor short, she had the fragrance of blue lotus. Her eyes were like the lotus leaves, her thighs were fair and round and her dense masses of hair were black and curly.

data.v: सर्वलक्षणसंपन्ना वैडूर्यमणिसंनिभा । पञ्चानां पुरुषेन्द्राणां चित्तप्रमथिनी रहः ॥
data.md: She was endued with all auspicious marks and her complexion was like the emerald. She was the charmer of the hearts of the five kings of men (the Pandavas).

data.v: सिद्धिर्धृतिश्च ये देव्यौ पञ्चानां मातरौ तु ते । कुन्ती माद्री च जज्ञाते मतिस्तु सुबलात्मजा ॥
data.md: The goddesses Siddhi and Dhriti became the mothers of the five (Pandavas). They were named Kunti and Madri. And the goddess, who was Mati, became the daughter of Subala (Gandhari, the wife of Dhritarashtra).

data.v: इति देवासुराणां ते गन्धर्वाप्सरसां तथा । अंशावतरणं राजन्राक्षसानां च कीर्तितम् ॥
ये पृथिव्यां समुद्भूता राजानो युद्धदुर्मदाः । महात्मानो यदूनां च ये जाता विपुले कुले ॥
धन्यं यशस्यं पुत्रीयमायुष्यं विजयावहम् । इदमंशावतरणं श्रोतव्यमनसूयता ॥
अंशावतरणं श्रुत्वा देवगन्धर्वरक्षसाम् । प्रभवाप्ययवित्प्राज्ञो न कृच्छ्रेष्ववसीदति ॥
data.md: Hearing the incarnations of the Devas, the Asuras and the Gandharvas, the learned person, thus knowing the mystery of creation, preservation and destruction, does not feel depressed, even in the greatest sorrow.

data.v: त्वत्तः श्रुतमिदं ब्रह्मन्देवदानवरक्षसाम् । अंशावतरणं सम्यग्गन्धर्वाप्सरसां तथा ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : O Brahmana, I have heard in detail the account of the births of the Devas, the Danavas, the Rakshasas, the Gandharvas and the Apsaras.

data.v: इमं तु भूय इच्छामि कुरूणां वंशमादितः । कथ्यमानं त्वया विप्र विप्रर्षिगणसंनिधौ ॥
data.md: Now I desire to hear the accounts of the births of the kings of the Kuru race from the beginning. Therefore, O Brahmana, narrate them before all these Brahmana Rishis.

data.v: पौरवाणां वंशकरो दुःषन्तो नाम वीर्यवान् । पृथिव्याश्चतुरन्ताया गोप्ता भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O best of the Bharata race, the founder of the Paurava dynasty was a greatly powerful king, named Dushyanta. He was the protector of the earth bounded by the four seas.

data.v: चतुर्भागं भुवः कृत्स्नं स भुङ्क्ते मनुजेश्वरः । समुद्रावरणांश्चापि देशान्स समितिंजयः ॥

data.v: तादृशं तपसा युक्तं प्रदीप्तमिव पावकम् । कथमस्मद्विधा बाला जितेन्द्रियमभिस्पृशेत् ॥
data.md: How can a woman (like my humble self) touch such a man who is full of ascetic virtues, who is as blazing as the blazing fire and who has completely controlled his passions.

data.v: हुताशनमुखं दीप्तं सूर्यचन्द्राक्षितारकम् । कालजिह्वं सुरश्रेष्ठ कथमस्मद्विधा स्पृशेत् ॥
data.md: His mouth is as blazing as the fire, the pupils of his eyes are like the sun and the moon and his tongue is like Yama himself. O best of the celestials, how can women like ourselves touch him?

data.v: यमश्च सोमश्च महर्षयश्च; साध्या विश्वे वालखिल्याश्च सर्वे । एतेऽपि यस्योद्विजन्ते प्रभावा;त्कस्मात्तस्मान्मादृशी नोद्विजेत ॥
data.md: Yama, Soma, great Rishis, the Sadhyas, the Vishvedevas, the Valakhilyas, all are alarmed at the thought of his prowess. Why should not a woman (like myself) be afraid of him?

data.v: त्वयैवमुक्ता च कथं समीप;मृषेर्न गच्छेयमहं सुरेन्द्र । रक्षां तु मे चिन्तय देवराज; यथा त्वदर्थं रक्षिताहं चरेयम् ॥
data.md: O king of the celestials, commanded by you somehow or other I must go to that Rishi. But, O king of the celestials, devise some means by which, under your protection, I can safely inove about him.

data.v: कामं तु मे मारुतस्तत्र वासः; प्रक्रीडिताया विवृणोतु देव । भवेच्च मे मन्मथस्तत्र कार्ये; सहायभूतस्तव देवप्रसादात् ॥
data.md: Ocelestial ! when I shall be near the Rishi, Maruta (wind) should be there and rob me of my cloth. Manmatha (the god of love) should at your command help me in my this work.

data.v: वनाच्च वायुः सुरभिः प्रवाये;त्तस्मिन्काले तमृषिं लोभयन्त्याः । तथेत्युक्त्वा विहिते चैव तस्मिं;स्ततो ययौ साश्रमं कौशिकस्य ॥
data.md: Let the wind carry sweet fragrance from the wood to tempt the Rishi. Having said this and having seen that all that she wanted had been duly provided, she went to the hermitage of the great Kaushika, (Vishvamitra).

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तया शक्रः संदिदेश सदागतिम् । प्रातिष्ठत तदा काले मेनका वायुना सह ॥
data.md: Kanva said: Having been thus addressed, Indra commanded the wind to be present with Menaka when she would be present before the Rishi.

data.v: अथापश्यद्वरारोहा तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषम् । विश्वामित्रं तपस्यन्तं मेनका भीरुराश्रमे ॥
data.md: The timid and the beautiful girl then entered the hermitage and saw Vishvamitra, who had destroyed all his sins by penances and who was still engaged in austere penances.

data.v: अभिवाद्य ततः सा तं प्राक्रीडदृषिसंनिधौ । अपोवाह च वासोऽस्या मारुतः शशिसंनिभम् ॥
data.md: Having saluted the Rishi, she then began to sport near him. At this very time Maruta robbed of her cloth, which was as white as the moon (light.)

data.v: सागच्छत्त्वरिता भूमिं वासस्तदभिलिङ्गती । उत्स्मयन्तीव सव्रीडं मारुतं वरवर्णिनी ॥
data.md: And that beautiful girl in great bashfulness began to run after the cloth to catch it and she appeared to express her great annoyance at the conduct of Maruta (wind).

data.v: गृद्धां वाससि संभ्रान्तां मेनकां मुनिसत्तमः । अनिर्देश्यवयोरूपामपश्यद्विवृतां तदा ॥
data.md: She did all this before that great Rishi Vishvamitra, as effulgent as the fire and he saw her in that state. He marked that she was of faultless features. In her nude state, the best of the Rishis saw that Menaka was exceedingly beautiful, with no marks of age on her person.

data.v: तस्या रूपगुणं दृष्ट्वा स तु विप्रर्षभस्तदा । चकार भावं संसर्गे तया कामवशं गतः ॥
data.md: Seeing her great beauty and accomplishments, that best of Rishis was filled with desire and wished for her company.

data.v: न्यमन्त्रयत चाप्येनां सा चाप्यैच्छदनिन्दिता । तौ तत्र सुचिरं कालं वने व्यहरतामुभौ । रममाणौ यथाकामं यथैकदिवसं तथा ॥
जनयामास स मुनिर्मेनकायां शकुन्तलाम् । प्रस्थे हिमवतो रम्ये मालिनीमभितो नदीम् ॥
जातमुत्सृज्य तं गर्भं मेनका मालिनीमनु । कृतकार्या ततस्तूर्णमगच्छच्छक्रसंसदम् ॥
तं वने विजने गर्भं सिंहव्याघ्रसमाकुले । दृष्ट्वा शयानं शकुनाः समन्तात्पर्यवारयन् ॥
नेमां हिंस्युर्वने बालां क्रव्यादा मांसगृद्धिनः । पर्यरक्षन्त तां तत्र शकुन्ता मेनकात्मजाम् ॥
उपस्प्रष्टुं गतश्चाहमपश्यं शयितामिमाम् । निर्जने विपिनेऽरण्ये शकुन्तैः परिवारिताम् । आनयित्वा ततश्चैनां दुहितृत्वे न्ययोजयम् ॥
data.md: The vultures protected the life of Menaka's child. I had gone there to perform my ablutions. I saw the child lying. In the deep solitude of the forest, surrounded by the vultures. Bringing her here, I have made her my daughter. According to the scriptures, the maker of the body, the protector of life and the giver of food, these three, are in their order considered to be fathers.

data.v: शरीरकृत्प्राणदाता यस्य चान्नानि भुञ्जते । क्रमेण ते त्रयोऽप्युक्ताः पितरो धर्मनिश्चये ॥
निर्जने च वने यस्माच्छकुन्तैः परिरक्षिता । शकुन्तलेति नामास्याः कृतं चापि ततो मया ॥
data.md: Because she was found in the solitude of the forest, protected by the Shakuntas (birds), she has been named Shakuntala (protected by birds.)

data.v: एवं दुहितरं विद्धि मम सौम्य शकुन्तलाम् । शकुन्तला च पितरं मन्यते मामनिन्दिता ॥
data.md: O Brahmana, know that it is thus that Shakuntala has become my daughter. And faultless Shakuntala also regards me as her father.

data.v: एतदाचष्ट पृष्टः सन्मम जन्म महर्षये । सुतां कण्वस्य मामेवं विद्धि त्वं मनुजाधिप ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: Thus the great Rishi (Kanva), when asked, told (the Brahmana) the account of my birth. O king of men, you must know that I have thus become the daughter of Kanva. Not knowing who is my real father, I regard Kanva as my father. Thus have I told you, O king, all that I heard about my birth.

data.v: कण्वं हि पितरं मन्ये पितरं स्वमजानती । इति ते कथितं राजन्यथावृत्तं श्रुतं मया ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: Thus the great Rishi (Kanva), when asked, told (the Brahmana) the account of my birth. O king of men, you must know that I have thus become the daughter of Kanva. Not knowing who is my real father, I regard Kanva as my father. Thus have I told you, O king, all that I heard about my birth.

data.v: सुव्यक्तं राजपुत्री त्वं यथा कल्याणि भाषसे । भार्या मे भव सुश्रोणि ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते ॥
data.md: Dushyanta said : O princess, O blessed lady, all that you have said is well-spoken. O beautiful lady, be my wife. Tell me what I shall do (for you).

data.v: सुवर्णमाला वासांसि कुण्डले परिहाटके । नानापत्तनजे शुभ्रे मणिरत्ने च शोभने ॥
data.md: I shall present you, this very day, gold and golden-garlands, robes, ear-rings, white and beautiful pearls and gems, golden coins and finest carpets, coilected from various countries. Let the whole of my kingdom be yours. O beautiful lady, be my wife.

data.v: आहरामि तवाद्याहं निष्कादीन्यजिनानि च । सर्वं राज्यं तवाद्यास्तु भार्या मे भव शोभने ॥
data.md: I shall present you, this very day, gold and golden-garlands, robes, ear-rings, white and beautiful pearls and gems, golden coins and finest carpets, coilected from various countries. Let the whole of my kingdom be yours. O beautiful lady, be my wife.

data.v: गान्धर्वेण च मां भीरु विवाहेनैहि सुन्दरि । विवाहानां हि रम्भोरु गान्धर्वः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते ॥
data.md: O handsome lady, O timid maiden, O beauty of tapering thighs, marry me according to the Gandharva form, for the form of marriage is said to be the best.

data.v: फलाहारो गतो राजन्पिता मे इत आश्रमात् । तं मुहूर्तं प्रतीक्षस्व स मां तुभ्यं प्रदास्यति ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: O king, my father has gone from the hermitage to collect fruits. Kindly wait for a moment. He will bestow me upon you.

data.v: इच्छामि त्वां वरारोहे भजमानामनिन्दिते । त्वदर्थं मां स्थितं विद्धि त्वद्गतं हि मनो मम ॥
data.md: Dushyanta said : O beautiful lady, O faultless beauty, I desire that you yourself should accept me. Know that I exist for you. Know also, my heart is completely in you.

data.v: आत्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव गतिरात्मैव चात्मनः । आत्मनैवात्मनो दानं कर्तुमर्हसि धर्मतः ॥
data.md: One is certainly one's own friend; one can certainly depend upon one's own self. Therefore, according to the ordinance, you yourself should bestow your own self on others.

data.v: अष्टावेव समासेन विवाहा धर्मतः स्मृताः । ब्राह्मो दैवस्तथैवार्षः प्राजापत्यस्तथासुरः ॥
data.md: According to the ordinance, there are eight kinds of marriages, namely, Brahma, Daiva, Arsha, Prajapatya, Asura. Gandharva, Rakshasas and Paishacha. The son of the selfcreated (Brahma), Manu, has spoken which of these forms (of marriages) is appropriate to each of the four castes.

data.v: गान्धर्वो राक्षसश्चैव पैशाचश्चाष्टमः स्मृतः । तेषां धर्मान्यथापूर्वं मनुः स्वायंभुवोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: According to the ordinance, there are eight kinds of marriages, namely, Brahma, Daiva, Arsha, Prajapatya, Asura. Gandharva, Rakshasas and Paishacha. The son of the selfcreated (Brahma), Manu, has spoken which of these forms (of marriages) is appropriate to each of the four castes.

data.v: प्रशस्तांश्चतुरः पूर्वान्ब्राह्मणस्योपधारय । षडानुपूर्व्या क्षत्रस्य विद्धि धर्म्याननिन्दिते ॥
data.md: O faultless beauty, know that the first four forms are appropriate to the Brahmanas and the first six for Kshatriyas.

data.v: राज्ञां तु राक्षसोऽप्युक्तो विट्शूद्रेष्वासुरः स्मृतः । पञ्चानां तु त्रयो धर्म्या द्वावधर्म्यौ स्मृताविह ॥
data.md: To the kings, even the Rakshasas form is permissible. The Asura form is permissible to the Vaishyas and Shudras. Of the first five (forms), three are proper and two improper.

data.v: पैशाचश्चासुरश्चैव न कर्तव्यौ कथंचन । अनेन विधिना कार्यो धर्मस्यैषा गतिः स्मृता ॥
data.md: The Paishacha and Asura forms should never be adopted (by any man). These are the ordinances of the scriptures and man should act according to them.

data.v: गान्धर्वराक्षसौ क्षत्रे धर्म्यौ तौ मा विशङ्किथाः । पृथग्वा यदि वा मिश्रौ कर्तव्यौ नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: The Gandharva and the Rakshasas forms are proper to the Kshatriyas, therefore, you need no entertain the least fear. There is not the least doubt that either according to one single form or according to the mixed form of these two, marriage is proper to us, (and we may be married).

data.v: सा त्वं मम सकामस्य सकामा वरवर्णिनि । गान्धर्वेण विवाहेन भार्या भवितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O beautiful lady, I am full of desire, so are you. You should, therefore, become my wife according to the Gandharva form.

data.v: यदि धर्मपथस्त्वेष यदि चात्मा प्रभुर्मम । प्रदाने पौरवश्रेष्ठ शृणु मे समयं प्रभो ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: ( best of the Puru race, if this are the dictates of the scriptures and if I am really my own disposer, know then my terms.

data.v: सत्यं मे प्रतिजानीहि यत्त्वां वक्ष्याम्यहं रहः । मम जायेत यः पुत्रः स भवेत्त्वदनन्तरम् ॥
data.md: Promise to give me what I ask, in this lonely place, alone, between ourselves. The son that will be here after born of me, will become the hire-apparent (to your throne). O Dushyanta, I tell you the truth. If this be the case, we may be united.

data.v: युवराजो महाराज सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीहि मे । यद्येतदेवं दुःषन्त अस्तु मे संगमस्त्वया ॥
data.md: Promise to give me what I ask, in this lonely place, alone, between ourselves. The son that will be here after born of me, will become the hire-apparent (to your throne). O Dushyanta, I tell you the truth. If this be the case, we may be united.

data.v: एवमस्त्विति तां राजा प्रत्युवाचाविचारयन् । अपि च त्वां नयिष्यामि नगरं स्वं शुचिस्मिते । यथा त्वमर्हा सुश्रोणि सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: The king, without taking time to consider the demand, told her at once, “O beauty of sweet smiles, let it be so. I shall even take you to my capital.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा स राजर्षिस्तामनिन्दितगामिनीम् । जग्राह विधिवत्पाणावुवास च तया सह ॥
विश्वास्य चैनां स प्रायादब्रवीच्च पुनः पुनः । प्रेषयिष्ये तवार्थाय वाहिनीं चतुरङ्गिणीम् । तया त्वामानयिष्यामि निवासं स्वं शुचिस्मिते ॥
data.md: O handsome maiden, I tell you the truth. You deserve all this. I promise to do what you ask. So saying, the royal sage, (Dushyanta) married the beautiful Shakuntala of graceful walking, according to the due rites; and she accepted him as her husband. He returned to his capital after assuring her of his promise. He repeatedly told her, “I shall send for you my troops of the four sorts. O beauty of sweet smiles, it is thus (with all honour). I shall take you to my capital."

data.v: इति तस्याः प्रतिश्रुत्य स नृपो जनमेजय । मनसा चिन्तयन्प्रायात्काश्यपं प्रति पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O Janamejaya, having thus promised to her, the king went away. The king, as he went (towards his capital), began to think of Kanva. (He thought), “What would the illustrious ascetic do when he would hear all. Thus thinking on his way, he entered his capital.

data.v: भगवांस्तपसा युक्तः श्रुत्वा किं नु करिष्यति । एवं संचिन्तयन्नेव प्रविवेश स्वकं पुरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O Janamejaya, having thus promised to her, the king went away. The king, as he went (towards his capital), began to think of Kanva. (He thought), “What would the illustrious ascetic do when he would hear all. Thus thinking on his way, he entered his capital.

data.v: मुहूर्तयाते तस्मिंस्तु कण्वोऽप्याश्रममागमत् । शकुन्तला च पितरं ह्रिया नोपजगाम तम् ॥
data.md: The moment the king had gone away, Kanva came to the hermitage. But Shakuntala did not go out to receive her father for shame.

data.v: विज्ञायाथ च तां कण्वो दिव्यज्ञानो महातपाः । उवाच भगवान्प्रीतः पश्यन्दिव्येन चक्षुषा ॥
data.md: The great ascetic Kanva, possessed of spiritual knowledge (sight), knew all. Having thus seen everything with his spiritual sight, the illustrious man was pleased and saidत्वयाद्य भद्रे रहसि मामनादृत्य यः कृतः।

data.v: त्वयाद्य राजान्वयया मामनादृत्य यत्कृतः । पुंसा सह समायोगो न स धर्मोपघातकः ॥
data.md: “O amiable child, the act that you have committed today in secret without having waited (to receive my permission), has not been destructive of your virtue.

data.v: क्षत्रियस्य हि गान्धर्वो विवाहः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते । सकामायाः सकामेन निर्मन्त्रो रहसि स्मृतः ॥
data.md: The marriage according to the Gandharva form, without Mantras and between a willing woman and a willing man, is said to be the best to a Kshatriya.

data.v: धर्मात्मा च महात्मा च दुःषन्तः पुरुषोत्तमः । अभ्यगच्छः पतिं यं त्वं भजमानं शकुन्तले ॥
data.md: The best of men Dushyanta, is virtuousminded and high-souled. O Shakuntala, you have accepted (this Dushyanta) for your husband. The son, whom you will give birth to, will be mighty and illustrious in this world. He will extend his sway over the whole of this earth bounded by the sea.

data.v: महात्मा जनिता लोके पुत्रस्तव महाबलः । य इमां सागरापाङ्गां कृत्स्नां भोक्ष्यति मेदिनीम् ॥
data.md: The best of men Dushyanta, is virtuousminded and high-souled. O Shakuntala, you have accepted (this Dushyanta) for your husband. The son, whom you will give birth to, will be mighty and illustrious in this world. He will extend his sway over the whole of this earth bounded by the sea.

data.v: परं चाभिप्रयातस्य चक्रं तस्य महात्मनः । भविष्यत्यप्रतिहतं सततं चक्रवर्तिनः ॥
data.md: When that illustrious king of kings (your son) will march out against his foes, his army will be irresistible to all opposition.

data.v: ततः प्रक्षाल्य पादौ सा विश्रान्तं मुनिमब्रवीत् । विनिधाय ततो भारं संनिधाय फलानि च ॥
data.md: Shakuntala, then came to her fatigued father and washed his feet. She took down the heavy load that was on his shoulder and placed the fruits in proper order. Then she said-

data.v: मया पतिर्वृतो योऽसौ दुःषन्तः पुरुषोत्तमः । तस्मै ससचिवाय त्वं प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: (O father), you should give your grace to my husband, king Dushyanta, the best of men.

data.v: प्रसन्न एव तस्याहं त्वत्कृते वरवर्णिनि । गृहाण च वरं मत्तस्तत्कृते यदभीप्सितम् ॥
data.md: Kanva said: O beautiful child, I am prepared to bless him for your sake. But O blessed girl, receive from me the boon you desire to have.

data.v: ततो धर्मिष्ठतां वव्रे राज्याच्चास्खलनं तथा । शकुन्तला पौरवाणां दुःषन्तहितकाम्यया ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon, Shakuntala, moved with the desire to do good to Dushyanta, asked the boon that Paurava kings should be ever virtuous and never to be deprived of their thrones.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञाय तु दुःषन्ते प्रतियाते शकुन्तला । गर्भं सुषाव वामोरुः कुमारममितौजसम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When Dushyanta went away from the hermitage, making the (above) promises to Shakuntala, she gave birth to a boy of immeasurable energy. When the child grew only three years old, he became in splendour as blazing as the blazing fire. O Janamejaya, he was endued with great beauty, magnanimity and all accomplishments.

data.v: त्रिषु वर्षेषु पूर्णेषु दिप्तानलसमद्युतिम् । रूपौदार्यगुणोपेतं दौःषन्तिं जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When Dushyanta went away from the hermitage, making the (above) promises to Shakuntala, she gave birth to a boy of immeasurable energy. When the child grew only three years old, he became in splendour as blazing as the blazing fire. O Janamejaya, he was endued with great beauty, magnanimity and all accomplishments.

data.v: जातकर्मादिसंस्कारं कण्वः पुण्यकृतां वरः । तस्याथ कारयामास वर्धमानस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: The best of pious men, Kanvas, performed all the rites ordained by the scriptures on that intelligent boy who began to grow up day by day.

data.v: दन्तैः शुक्लैः शिखरिभिः सिंहसंहननो युवा । चक्राङ्कितकरः श्रीमान्महामूर्धा महाबलः । कुमारो देवगर्भाभः स तत्राशु व्यवर्धत ॥
data.md: The boy was gifted with sharp, strong and pearly teeth; he was strong enough to kill lions, he had all auspicious signs on his palms, he had a broad forehead, he was beautiful and strong.

data.v: षड्वर्ष एव बालः स कण्वाश्रमपदं प्रति । व्याघ्रान्सिंहान्वराहांश्च गजांश्च महिषांस्तथा ॥
data.md: Like a celestial child, he began daily to grow up. When he grew six years old, he was so strong that he seized and bound tigers, boars, buffaloes and elephants to the trees that stood near the hermitage.

data.v: बद्ध्वा वृक्षेषु बलवानाश्रमस्य समन्ततः । आरोहन्दमयंश्चैव क्रीडंश्च परिधावति ॥
ततोऽस्य नाम चक्रुस्ते कण्वाश्रमनिवासिनः । अस्त्वयं सर्वदमनः सर्वं हि दमयत्ययम् ॥
data.md: He rode on some of these wild beasts; he seized some of them and sometimes he pursued some of them in playful mood. The dwellers of the hermitage of Kanva, (finding all this), gave him a name. (They said,) “As he subjugated all beasts, let him be called Sarvadamana". Thus the prince came to be called Sarvadamana, endued as he was with great strength, energy and powers.

data.v: स सर्वदमनो नाम कुमारः समपद्यत । विक्रमेणौजसा चैव बलेन च समन्वितः ॥
data.md: He rode on some of these wild beasts; he seized some of them and sometimes he pursued some of them in playful mood. The dwellers of the hermitage of Kanva, (finding all this), gave him a name. (They said,) “As he subjugated all beasts, let him be called Sarvadamana". Thus the prince came to be called Sarvadamana, endued as he was with great strength, energy and powers.

data.v: तं कुमारमृषिर्दृष्ट्वा कर्म चास्यातिमानुषम् । समयो यौवराज्यायेत्यब्रवीच्च शकुन्तलाम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the extraordinary acts of the boy, the Rishi (Kanva) told Shakuntala that the time had come when he should be installed as the heir-apparent.

data.v: तस्य तद्बलमाज्ञाय कण्वः शिष्यानुवाच ह । शकुन्तलामिमां शीघ्रं सहपुत्रामितोऽऽश्रमात् । भर्त्रे प्रापयताद्यैव सर्वलक्षणपूजिताम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the great strength of the boy, Kanva spoke to his disciples thus, "Take Shakuntala with her son from the hermitage to the house of her husband, blessed with all auspicious signs."

data.v: नारीणां चिरवासो हि बान्धवेषु न रोचते । कीर्तिचारित्रधर्मघ्नस्तस्मान्नयत माचिरम् ॥
data.md: "It is not fit for women to live for ever in the house of their paternal or maternal relations. Such residence destroys their good name, good conduct and virtue. Therefore, take her to her husband's house without delay."

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु ते सर्वे प्रातिष्ठन्तामितौजसः । शकुन्तलां पुरस्कृत्य सपुत्रां गजसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: The greatly effulgent disciples (of Kanva), having promised to do it, started with Shakuntala and her son towards the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: गृहीत्वामरगर्भाभं पुत्रं कमललोचनम् । आजगाम ततः शुभ्रा दुःषन्तविदिताद्वनात् ॥
data.md: That beauty of fair eye-brows, taking her lotus-eyed son of celestial beauty with her, left the forest where she had first met Dushyanta.

data.v: अभिसृत्य च राजानं विदिता सा प्रवेशिता । सह तेनैव पुत्रेण तरुणादित्यवर्चसा ॥
data.md: Having sent words, she entered the royal court with her son, as effulgent as the morning sun. And she was then introduced to him.

data.v: पूजयित्वा यथान्यायमब्रवीत्तं शकुन्तला । अयं पुत्रस्त्वया राजन्यौवराज्येऽभिषिच्यताम् ॥
त्वया ह्ययं सुतो राजन्मय्युत्पन्नः सुरोपमः । यथासमयमेतस्मिन्वर्तस्व पुरुषोत्तम ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said : O King, this is your son. Let him be installed as your heir-apparent. O King, this god-like boy was begotten by you on me. O best of men, fulfil now the promise you made of me.

data.v: यथा समागमे पूर्वं कृतः स समयस्त्वया । तं स्मरस्व महाभाग कण्वाश्रमपदं प्रति ॥
data.md: O illustrious man, call to your mind the agreement you made with me on the occasion of our marriage at the hermitage of Kanva.

data.v: सोऽथ श्रुत्वैव तद्वाक्यं तस्या राजा स्मरन्नपि । अब्रवीन्न स्मरामीति कस्य त्वं दुष्टतापसि ॥
data.md: Having heard her words, the King remembered everything, but he said, “I remember nothing. O wicked ascetic woman, to whom do you belong?"

data.v: धर्मकामार्थसंबन्धं न स्मरामि त्वया सह । गच्छ वा तिष्ठ वा कामं यद्वापीच्छसि तत्कुरु ॥
data.md: "I do not remember to have any connection with you with regard to (either) Dharma, Artha and Kama. Go or stay or do whatever you please."

data.v: सैवमुक्ता वरारोहा व्रीडितेव मनस्विनी । विसंज्ञेव च दुःखेन तस्थौ स्थाणुरिवाचला ॥
data.md: Thus being addressed, the beautiful ascetic lady was filled with shame. She lost her consciousness from grief and she stood like a wooden post.

data.v: संरम्भामर्षताम्राक्षी स्फुरमाणोष्ठसंपुटा । कटाक्षैर्निर्दहन्तीव तिर्यग्राजानमैक्षत ॥
data.md: Soon became her eyes red like copper; her lips began to quiver; she cast upon the king her (angry) glances which seemed to burn him.

data.v: आकारं गूहमाना च मन्युनाभिसमीरिता । तपसा संभृतं तेजो धारयामास वै तदा ॥
data.md: Her rising anger and blazing fire of her asceticism she kept down with a great effort.

data.v: सा मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा दुःखामर्षसमन्विता । भर्तारमभिसंप्रेक्ष्य क्रुद्धा वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Collecting her thought in a moment, she thus addressed her husband looking straight at him in grief and in anger. “O great king, knowing everything, how can you, like a mean and inferior man, say that you know nothing'?

data.v: जानन्नपि महाराज कस्मादेवं प्रभाषसे । न जानामीति निःसङ्गं यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा ॥
data.md: Collecting her thought in a moment, she thus addressed her husband looking straight at him in grief and in anger. “O great king, knowing everything, how can you, like a mean and inferior man, say that you know nothing'?

data.v: अत्र ते हृदयं वेद सत्यस्यैवानृतस्य च । कल्याण बत साक्षी त्वं मात्मानमवमन्यथाः ॥
data.md: Your heart is the witness to the truth or to the falsehood of my words. Therefore, speak the truth and do not degrade yourself.

data.v: योऽन्यथा सन्तमात्मानमन्यथा प्रतिपद्यते । किं तेन न कृतं पापं चोरेणात्मापहारिणा ॥
data.md: He, who has one thing in his mind, but represents another thing to others, is a thief and a robber of his own self. What sin is he not capable of committing?

data.v: एकोऽहमस्मीति च मन्यसे त्वं; न हृच्छयं वेत्सि मुनिं पुराणम् । यो वेदिता कर्मणः पापकस्य; तस्यान्तिके त्वं वृजिनं करोषि ॥
data.md: You think that you alone know what you did. But do you not know that the great Omniscient One dwells in your heart. He knows all your sins and you sin in his presence.

data.v: मन्यते पापकं कृत्वा न कश्चिद्वेत्ति मामिति । विदन्ति चैनं देवाश्च स्वश्चैवान्तरपूरुषः ॥
data.md: Man, when sinning, thinks that no one sees him. But he is seen by the celestials and by the Deity who dwells in every heart.

data.v: आदित्यचन्द्रावनिलानलौ च; द्यौर्भूमिरापो हृदयं यमश्च । अहश्च रात्रिश्च उभे च संध्ये; धर्मश्च जानाति नरस्य वृत्तम् ॥
data.md: The sun, the moon, the air, the fire, the earth, the sky, the water, the heart, Yama, the day, the night, the twilight and Dharma see every act of man.

data.v: यमो वैवस्वतस्तस्य निर्यातयति दुष्कृतम् । हृदि स्थितः कर्मसाक्षी क्षेत्रज्ञो यस्य तुष्यति ॥
data.md: Yama, the son of Vivasvata, takes no account of the sins of that man with whom the Deity, the witness of all acts, remains pleased.

data.v: न तु तुष्यति यस्यैष पुरुषस्य दुरात्मनः । तं यमः पापकर्माणं निर्यातयति दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: But that sinner, with whom the great Deity is not pleased, is punished by Yama for his wicked deeds.

data.v: अवमन्यात्मनात्मानमन्यथा प्रतिपद्यते । देवा न तस्य श्रेयांसो यस्यात्मापि न कारणम् ॥
data.md: He, who has one thing in his mind, but represents another thing to others, is a thief and a robber of his own self. What sin is he not capable of committing?

data.v: स्वयं प्राप्तेति मामेवं मावमंस्थाः पतिव्रताम् । अर्घ्यार्हां नार्चयसि मां स्वयं भार्यामुपस्थिताम् ॥
data.md: He, who falsely represents his self and thus degrades himself, is never blessed by the celestials. Even his own soul does not bless him. I have come of my own accord, but I am a devoted wife to my husband. Do not disrespect me. I am your wife and deserve to be treated respectfully.

data.v: किमर्थं मां प्राकृतवदुपप्रेक्षसि संसदि । न खल्वहमिदं शून्ये रौमि किं न शृणोषि मे ॥
data.md: Why do you treat me before all these men like an ordinary woman? I am certainly not crying in the wilderness. Do you not hear me?

data.v: यदि मे याचमानाया वचनं न करिष्यसि । दुःषन्त शतधा मूर्धा ततस्तेऽद्य फलिष्यति ॥
data.md: O Dushyanta, If you refuse what I ask you to do, your head will to day be divided into a thousand pieces.

data.v: भार्यां पतिः संप्रविश्य स यस्माज्जायते पुनः । जायाया इति जायात्वं पुराणाः कवयो विदुः ॥
data.md: The learned men of old say that the husband himself, entering into the womb of his wife, comes out as the son. Therefore, the wife is called Jaya.

data.v: यदागमवतः पुंसस्तदपत्यं प्रजायते । तत्तारयति संतत्या पूर्वप्रेतान्पितामहान् ॥
data.md: The son, that is born to a wise man, rescues the spirits of his deceased ancestors.

data.v: पुन्नाम्नो नरकाद्यस्मात्पितरं त्रायते सुतः । तस्मात्पुत्र इति प्रोक्तः स्वयमेव स्वयम्भुवा ॥
data.md: Because the son rescues his ancestors from the hell, called Put, therefore he has been called by the self-created (Brahma) himself as Putra.

data.v: सा भार्या या गृहे दक्षा सा भार्या या प्रजावती । सा भार्या या पतिप्राणा सा भार्या या पतिव्रता ॥
data.md: She is a true wife who is a good housewife; she is a true wife whose heart is devoted to her husband; she is a true wife who is faithful to her husband,

data.v: अर्धं भार्या मनुष्यस्य भार्या श्रेष्ठतमः सखा । भार्या मूलं त्रिवर्गस्य भार्या मित्रं मरिष्यतः ॥
data.md: A man's half is his wife, the wife is her husband's best of friends; the wife is the source of Dharma, Artha and Kama; the wife is the source of salvation.

data.v: भार्यावन्तः क्रियावन्तः सभार्या गृहमेधिनः । भार्यावन्तः प्रमोदन्ते भार्यावन्तः श्रियान्विताः ॥
data.md: Those that have wives can perform religious acts; those that have wives lead domestic lives. Those that have wives can be happy and those that have wives can achieve good fortune.

data.v: सखायः प्रविविक्तेषु भवन्त्येताः प्रियंवदाः । पितरो धर्मकार्येषु भवन्त्यार्तस्य मातरः ॥
data.md: The sweet-speeched wives their husband's friends on the occasion of joy; they are as fathers on occasions of religious acts; they are as mothers in the hours of illness and are woe.

data.v: कान्तारेष्वपि विश्रामो नरस्याध्वनिकस्य वै । यः सदारः स विश्वास्यस्तस्माद्दाराः परा गतिः ॥
data.md: Even in the deep forest, the wife is the refreshment and solace to her roaming husband. He who has a wife, is trusted by all. The wife, therefore, is man's great means of salvation.

data.v: संसरन्तमपि प्रेतं विषमेष्वेकपातिनम् । भार्यैवान्वेति भर्तारं सततं या पतिव्रता ॥
data.md: When the husband goes to the land of Yama, leaving this world, it is the devoted wife only that accompanies him there.

data.v: प्रथमं संस्थिता भार्या पतिं प्रेत्य प्रतीक्षते । पूर्वं मृतं च भर्तारं पश्चात्साध्व्यनुगच्छति ॥
data.md: The wife, gone before (dying before her husband), waits for the spirit of her husband and if the husband goes before, the chaste wife soon follows him.

data.v: एतस्मात्कारणाद्राजन्पाणिग्रहणमिष्यते । यदाप्नोति पतिर्भार्यामिह लोके परत्र च ॥
data.md: O king, for all these reasons, marriage exists (in this world). The husband enjoys the company of his wife, both here in this world and hereafter.

data.v: आत्मात्मनैव जनितः पुत्र इत्युच्यते बुधैः । तस्माद्भार्यां नरः पश्येन्मातृवत्पुत्रमातरम् ॥
data.md: The learned men have said that a man himself is born as his son; therefore, a man whose wife has given birth to a son, should look upon her as his mother.

data.v: भार्यायां जनितं पुत्रमादर्शे स्वमिवाननम् । ह्लादते जनिता प्रेष्क्य स्वर्गं प्राप्येव पुण्यकृत् ॥
data.md: Looking at the face of the son, begotten on his wife, a man sees his own face as he does in a mirror; and feels himself as happy as a virtuous man attaining to heaven.

data.v: दह्यमाना मनोदुःखैर्व्याधिभिश्चातुरा नराः । ह्लादन्ते स्वेषु दारेषु घर्मार्ताः सलिलेष्विव ॥
data.md: Men, burnt out by mental grief or afflicted by disease, feel as much relieved in the company of their wives as a perspiring man does in a cool bath.

data.v: सुसंरब्धोऽपि रामाणां न ब्रूयादप्रियं बुधः । रतिं प्रीतिं च धर्मं च तास्वायत्तमवेक्ष्य च ॥
data.md: No man, even in anger, should even do any thing that is disagreeable to his wife; for happiness, joy, virtue and everything depend on the wife.

data.v: आत्मनो जन्मनः क्षेत्रं पुण्यं रामाः सनातनम् । ऋषीणामपि का शक्तिः स्रष्टुं रामामृते प्रजाः ॥
data.md: Wife is the sacred soil in which the husband is born again. Even Rishis cannot create men without women.

data.v: परिपत्य यदा सूनुर्धरणीरेणुगुण्ठितः । पितुराश्लिष्यतेऽङ्गानि किमिवास्त्यधिकं ततः ॥
data.md: What is a greater happiness to a father than what the father feels when his son, running to him, clasps him with his (tiny little) arms, though his body is full of dust and dirt?

data.v: स त्वं स्वयमनुप्राप्तं साभिलाषमिमं सुतम् । प्रेक्षमाणं च काक्षेण किमर्थमवमन्यसे ॥
data.md: Why are you treating with indifference this your son who has himself come to you and who is wistfully casting his glances towards you? Even ants support their off-spring and do not destroy their eggs. Why then should you not, being learned in the rules of piety, support your own child?

data.v: अण्डानि बिभ्रति स्वानि न भिन्दन्ति पिपीलिकाः । न भरेथाः कथं नु त्वं धर्मज्ञः सन्स्वमात्मजम् ॥
data.md: Why are you treating with indifference this your son who has himself come to you and who is wistfully casting his glances towards you? Even ants support their off-spring and do not destroy their eggs. Why then should you not, being learned in the rules of piety, support your own child?

data.v: न वाससां न रामाणां नापां स्पर्शस्तथा सुखः । शिशोरालिङ्ग्यमानस्य स्पर्शः सूनोर्यथा सुखः ॥
data.md: The touch of the sandal-paste, that of women and water, is not so pleasing as that of one's own infant son, locked in his embrace.

data.v: ब्राह्मणो द्विपदां श्रेष्ठो गौर्वरिष्ठा चतुष्पदाम् । गुरुर्गरीयसां श्रेष्ठः पुत्रः स्पर्शवतां वरः ॥
data.md: As the Brahmana is the best among bipeds (men), as cow is the best among quadrupeds, as preceptor is the best among all superiors, so is the son among all objects pleasing to the touch.

data.v: स्पृशतु त्वां समाश्लिष्य पुत्रोऽयं प्रियदर्शनः । पुत्रस्पर्शात्सुखतरः स्पर्शो लोके न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Let this handsome son touch you in your embrace. There is nothing in the world more pleasing to the touch than that of a son.

data.v: त्रिषु वर्षेषु पूर्णेषु प्रजाताहमरिंदम । इमं कुमारं राजेन्द्र तव शोकप्रणाशनम् ॥
data.md: O chastiser of foes, O great king, I gave birth to this boy, the dispeller of your grief, after the completion of three years. O descendant of the Puru race, when I was in the lying-in room, the following words were uttered in the sky, He shall perform one hundred horse-sacrifices.

data.v: आहर्ता वाजिमेधस्य शतसंख्यस्य पौरव । इति वागन्तरिक्षे मां सूतकेऽभ्यवदत्पुरा ॥
data.md: O chastiser of foes, O great king, I gave birth to this boy, the dispeller of your grief, after the completion of three years. O descendant of the Puru race, when I was in the lying-in room, the following words were uttered in the sky, He shall perform one hundred horse-sacrifices.

data.v: ननु नामाङ्कमारोप्य स्नेहाद्ग्रामान्तरं गताः । मूर्ध्नि पुत्रानुपाघ्राय प्रतिनन्दन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.md: Men, going to places remote from their homes, take up other men's sons on their laps and smelling their heads, feel great happiness.

data.v: वेदेष्वपि वदन्तीमं मन्त्रवादं द्विजातयः । जातकर्मणि पुत्राणां तवापि विदितं तथा ॥
data.md: You know that the Brahmanas utter the following Vedic Mantras at the birthday, ceremony of the child.

data.v: अङ्गादङ्गात्संभवसि हृदयादभिजायसे । आत्मा वै पुत्रनामासि स जीव शरदः शतम् ॥
data.md: “You are born of my body; you have sprung from my heart. You are myself in the form of my son. Live for one hundred years."

data.v: पोषो हि त्वदधीनो मे संतानमपि चाक्षयम् । तस्मात्त्वं जीव मे वत्स सुसुखी शरदां शतम् ॥
data.md: "My life depends on you. The continuation of my race also depends on you. Therefore, live in happiness for one hundred years."

data.v: त्वदङ्गेभ्यः प्रसूतोऽयं पुरुषात्पुरुषोऽपरः । सरसीवामलेऽऽत्मानं द्वितीयं पश्य मे सुतम् ॥
data.md: He (this boy) has sprung from your body, he is a second being begotten from you. Behold your own self in your own son, as you see your image in the clear waters of the lake.

data.v: यथा ह्याहवनीयोऽग्निर्गार्हपत्यात्प्रणीयते । तथा त्वत्तः प्रसूतोऽयं त्वमेकः सन्द्विधा कृतः ॥
data.md: As the sacrificial fire is kindled from the domestic fire, so has this one (your son), sprung from you. Though you are one, you have divided yourself in two. O king, in your hunting expedition, I was approached by you when I was a virgin in my father's hermitage.

data.v: मृगापकृष्टेन हि ते मृगयां परिधावता । अहमासादिता राजन्कुमारी पितुराश्रमे ॥
data.md: As the sacrificial fire is kindled from the domestic fire, so has this one (your son), sprung from you. Though you are one, you have divided yourself in two. O king, in your hunting expedition, I was approached by you when I was a virgin in my father's hermitage.

data.v: उर्वशी पूर्वचित्तिश्च सहजन्या च मेनका । विश्वाची च घृताची च षडेवाप्सरसां वराः ॥
data.md: Urvashi, Purvachitti, Sahajanya, Menaka, Vishvachi and Ghritachi, these are the six foremost Apsaras.

data.v: तासां मां मेनका नाम ब्रह्मयोनिर्वराप्सराः । दिवः संप्राप्य जगतीं विश्वामित्रादजीजनत् ॥
data.md: Amongst them again, Menaka, born of a Brahmana, is the first. Descending from heaven on earth, she gave me birth from her association with Vishvamitra.

data.v: सा मां हिमवतः पृष्ठे सुषुवे मेनकाप्सराः । अवकीर्य च मां याता परात्मजमिवासती ॥
data.md: The Apsara Menaka gave me birth in a valley of the Himalayas. Devoid of affections, she went away, leaving me there, as if I was a child of some others.

data.v: किं नु कर्माशुभं पूर्वं कृतवत्यस्मि जन्मनि । यदहं बान्धवैस्त्यक्ता बाल्ये संप्रति च त्वया ॥
data.md: What great sin did I commit of old in some other life that I was cast away by my parents in my infancy and now I am cast away by you?

data.v: कामं त्वया परित्यक्ता गमिष्याम्यहमाश्रमम् । इमं तु बालं संत्यक्तुं नार्हस्यात्मजमात्मना ॥
data.md: Cast off from you, I am ready to go back to the hermitage. But you should not cast off this child who is your own son.

data.v: न पुत्रमभिजानामि त्वयि जातं शकुन्तले । असत्यवचना नार्यः कस्ते श्रद्धास्यते वचः ॥
data.md: Dushyanta said : O Shakuntala, I do not know that I begot this child on you. Women generally speak falsehood. Who will believe your words? Your mother is lewd Menaka, destitute of affection; she cast off you in the valley of the Himalayas as one casts off the flowers after offering them to the gods.

data.v: मेनका निरनुक्रोशा बन्धकी जननी तव । यया हिमवतः पृष्ठे निर्माल्येव प्रवेरिता ॥
data.md: Dushyanta said : O Shakuntala, I do not know that I begot this child on you. Women generally speak falsehood. Who will believe your words? Your mother is lewd Menaka, destitute of affection; she cast off you in the valley of the Himalayas as one casts off the flowers after offering them to the gods.

data.v: स चापि निरनुक्रोशः क्षत्रयोनिः पिता तव । विश्वामित्रो ब्राह्मणत्वे लुब्धः कामपरायणः ॥
data.md: Your father also is lustful Vishvamitra of the Kshatriya race, destitute of all affection, the ! man who was tempted to become a Brahmana.

data.v: मेनकाप्सरसां श्रेष्ठा महर्षीणां च ते पिता । तयोरपत्यं कस्मात्त्वं पुंश्चलीवाभिधास्यसि ॥
data.md: But (if you say), Menaka is the foremost of Apsaras and Vishvamitra is the foremost of Rishis, why then do you, being their daughter, speak like a lewd woman?

data.v: अश्रद्धेयमिदं वाक्यं कथयन्ती न लज्जसे । विशेषतो मत्सकाशे दुष्टतापसि गम्यताम् ॥
data.md: Your these words deserve no credence. Are you not ashamed to utter them, specially before me? Go away, O wicked ascetic woman.

data.v: क्व महर्षिः सदैवोग्रः साप्सरा क्व च मेनका । क्व च त्वमेवं कृपणा तापसीवेषधारिणी ॥
data.md: Where is now that best of great Rishis (Vishvamitra) and that best of Apsaras Menaka? And where are you, (though) in the humble garb of ascetics.

data.v: अतिकायश्च पुत्रस्ते बालोऽपि बलवानयम् । कथमल्पेन कालेन शालस्कन्ध इवोद्गतः ॥
data.md: Your this son is very big and appears to be very strong. How has he, within so short time, grown up like a Sala sprout?

data.v: सुनिकृष्टा च योनिस्ते पुंश्चली प्रतिभासि मे । यदृच्छया कामरागाज्जाता मेनकया ह्यसि ॥
data.md: You are born very low, you speak also like a lewd woman. You were lustfully conceived by Menaka.

data.v: सर्वमेतत्परोक्षं मे यत्त्वं वदसि तापसि । नाहं त्वामभिजानामि यथेष्टं गम्यतां त्वया ॥
data.md: O ascetic woman, all that you say is quite unknown to me. I do not know you. Go away wherever you please.

data.v: राजन्सर्षपमात्राणि परच्छिद्राणि पश्यसि । आत्मनो बिल्वमात्राणि पश्यन्नपि न पश्यसि ॥
data.md: Shakuntala said: O king, you (can) see the faults of others, though they may be as small as the mustard seed. But you can not see your own faults, though they are as big as the Bilva fruit.

data.v: मेनका त्रिदशेष्वेव त्रिदशाश्चानु मेनकाम् । ममैवोद्रिच्यते जन्म दुःषन्त तव जन्मतः ॥
data.md: Menaka is a celestial, (nay) Menaka is considered to be the best of celestial. O Dushyanta, my birth is noble than your own.

data.v: क्षितावटसि राजंस्त्वमन्तरिक्षे चराम्यहम् । आवयोरन्तरं पश्य मेरुसर्षपयोरिव ॥
data.md: O great king, you walk on earth, but I roam in the sky. Know that the difference between you and me is like that of a mustard seed and the Meru (mountain).

data.v: महेन्द्रस्य कुबेरस्य यमस्य वरुणस्य च । भवनान्यनुसंयामि प्रभावं पश्य मे नृप ॥
data.md: O king, behold, I can go to the abodes of Indra, Kubera, Yama and Varuna.

data.v: सत्यश्चापि प्रवादोऽयं यं प्रवक्ष्यामि तेऽनघ । निदर्शनार्थं न द्वेषात्तच्छ्रुत्वा क्षन्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O sinless man, there is a proverb which I am going to mention to you; (but I am not doing it) from any evil motive, but only as an example. Therefore, kindly pardon me for referring to it.

data.v: विरूपो यावदादर्शे नात्मनः पश्यते मुखम् । मन्यते तावदात्मानमन्येभ्यो रूपवत्तरम् ॥
data.md: The ugly man, until he sees his face in a mirror, considers himself more handsome than others.

data.v: यदा तु मुखमादर्शे विकृतं सोऽभिवीक्षते । तदेतरं विजानाति आत्मानं नेतरं जनम् ॥
data.md: But when he sees his own face in the mirror, it is then that he perceives the difference between himself and others.

data.v: अतीव रूपसंपन्नो न किंचिदवमन्यते । अतीव जल्पन्दुर्वाचो भवतीह विहेठकः ॥
data.md: He, who is really very handsome, never taunts others. He, who too much vilifies others, is only considered to be a reviler.

data.v: मूर्खो हि जल्पतां पुंसां श्रुत्वा वाचः शुभाशुभाः । अशुभं वाक्यमादत्ते पुरीषमिव सूकरः ॥
data.md: As the swine seeks for the dirt and filth even when it is in a flower-garden, so does a wicked man chose only evil out of the evil and the good that others speak.

data.v: प्राज्ञस्तु जल्पतां पुंसां श्रुत्वा वाचः शुभाशुभाः । गुणवद्वाक्यमादत्ते हंसः क्षीरमिवाम्भसः ॥
data.md: But as the geese always extract milk, though inixed with water, so does a wise man accept only what is good from the speech that is intermixed with both good and evil.

data.v: अन्यान्परिवदन्साधुर्यथा हि परितप्यते । तथा परिवदन्नन्यांस्तुष्टो भवति दुर्जनः ॥
data.md: Honest men always feel pain to speak ill of others, but wicked men always derive pleasure in doing it.

data.v: अभिवाद्य यथा वृद्धान्सन्तो गच्छन्ति निर्वृतिम् । एवं सज्जनमाक्रुश्य मूर्खो भवति निर्वृतः ॥
data.md: Honest men always feel pleasure in showing respect towards the old (good men), but the fools always feel pleasure in abusing them. Honest men are happy in not seeking others' fault, but the fools are happy in doing it. The wicked always speak ill of honest men, but honest men never injure the wicked, even if injured by them.

data.v: सुखं जीवन्त्यदोषज्ञा मूर्खा दोषानुदर्शिनः । यत्र वाच्याः परैः सन्तः परानाहुस्तथाविधान् ॥
data.md: Honest men always feel pleasure in showing respect towards the old (good men), but the fools always feel pleasure in abusing them. Honest men are happy in not seeking others' fault, but the fools are happy in doing it. The wicked always speak ill of honest men, but honest men never injure the wicked, even if injured by them.

data.v: अतो हास्यतरं लोके किंचिदन्यन्न विद्यते । यत्र दुर्जन इत्याह दुर्जनः सज्जनं स्वयम् ॥
data.md: What could be more ridiculous in the world than this, that those that are wicked should represent really honest men as wicked.

data.v: सत्यधर्मच्युतात्पुंसः क्रुद्धादाशीविषादिव । अनास्तिकोऽप्युद्विजते जनः किं पुनरास्तिकः ॥
data.md: Even atheists are afraid of those who have fallen from truth and virtue, as all men are afraid of the snakes of virulent poison. (When such is the case with an atheist), what shall I speak of me who is atheist?

data.v: स्वयमुत्पाद्य वै पुत्रं सदृशं योऽवमन्यते । तस्य देवाः श्रियं घ्नन्ति न च लोकानुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: The man, who having begotten a son who is his own image, does not look after him, never gains the higher worlds. The celestial destroy his good fortune an wealth.

data.v: कुलवंशप्रतिष्ठां हि पितरः पुत्रमब्रुवन् । उत्तमं सर्वधर्माणां तस्मात्पुत्रं न संत्यजेत् ॥
