data.md: The Pitris (ancestors) have said that the son continues the race and supports the relations; therefore, to give birth to a son is the best of all pious acts. Therefore, your this son should not be abandoned.

data.v: स्वपत्नीप्रभवान्पञ्च लब्धान्क्रीतान्विवर्धितान् । कृतानन्यासु चोत्पन्नान्पुत्रान्वै मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Manu has said that there are five kinds of sons, namely those begotten by one on his wife, those obtained from others, those purchased for a price, those reared out of affection and those begotten on other women.

data.v: धर्मकीर्त्यावहा नॄणां मनसः प्रीतिवर्धनाः । त्रायन्ते नरकाज्जाताः पुत्रा धर्मप्लवाः पितॄन् ॥
data.md: Sons support the religion and achievements of men; they increase their happiness; they rescue the dead ancestor from hell.

data.v: स त्वं नृपतिशार्दूल न पुत्रं त्यक्तुमर्हसि । आत्मानं सत्यधर्मौ च पालयानो महीपते । नरेन्द्रसिंह कपटं न वोढुं त्वमिहार्हसि ॥
data.md: Therefore, O best of kings, it is not proper for you to abandon your son. O king of the earth, cherish your own self, truth and virtue, more more (by cherishing your this son). () best of the kings, it is not proper for you to play hypocrite's in this matter.

data.v: वरं कूपशताद्वापी वरं वापीशतात्क्रतुः । वरं क्रतुशतात्पुत्रः सत्यं पुत्रशताद्वरम् ॥
data.md: The dedication of a tank is meritorious than that of one hundred wells. A sacrifice is meritorious than the dedication of a tank. But (to beget a son) is inore meritorious than the celebration of sacrifices. Truth (however) is more meritorious than the birth of one hundred sons.

data.v: अश्वमेधसहस्रं च सत्यं च तुलया धृतम् । अश्वमेधसहस्राद्धि सत्यमेव विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: If one thousand horse-sacrifices and truth were weighed, truth would be found heavier than one thousand horse-sacrifices.

data.v: सर्ववेदाधिगमनं सर्वतीर्थावगाहनम् । सत्यं च वदतो राजन्समं वा स्यान्न वा समम् ॥
data.md: O king, I tell you, truth is equal to the study of the entire Vedas and ablutions in all the sacred pilgrimages.

data.v: नास्ति सत्यात्परो धर्मो न सत्याद्विद्यते परम् । न हि तीव्रतरं किंचिदनृतादिह विद्यते ॥
data.md: There is no virtue equal to truth, there is nothing (in this world) superior to truth. And there is nothing (again) more sinful than falsehood.

data.v: राजन्सत्यं परं ब्रह्म सत्यं च समयः परः । मा त्याक्षीः समयं राजन्सत्यं संगतमस्तु ते ॥
data.md: O king, truth is the great Brahma, truth is the great vow; therefore, O king, do not violate your pledge. Let truth and yourself be ever united.

data.v: अनृते चेत्प्रसङ्गस्ते श्रद्दधासि न चेत्स्वयम् । आत्मनो हन्त गच्छामि त्वादृशे नास्ति संगतम् ॥
data.md: If, however, you are united with falsehood, li you do not place any credence on my word, I shall go away from this place of my own accord. Your companionship should not be sought after.

data.v: ऋतेऽपि त्वयि दुःषन्त शैलराजावतंसकाम् । चतुरन्तामिमामुर्वीं पुत्रो मे पालयिष्यति ॥
data.md: But, ( Dushyanta, (know this for a certainty), that when you are dead, my this son shall rule the whole earth, surrounded by the four seas and adorned by the king of mountains.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं प्रातिष्ठत शकुन्तला । अथान्तरिक्षे दुःषन्तं वागुवाचाशरीरिणी । ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्यैर्मन्त्रिभिश्चावृतं तदा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having said all this to the king, Shakuntala turned her back. Thereupon a voice from the sky, coming from one who had no visible shape, addressed Dushyanta who was sitting, surrounded by his ministers, priests and Ritvikas.

data.v: भस्त्रा माता पितुः पुत्रो येन जातः स एव सः । भरस्व पुत्रं दुःषन्त मावमंस्थाः शकुन्तलाम् ॥
data.md: (It said), “O Dushyanta, the mother is but a sheath of flesh (within which the son dwells). The son, sprung from the father, is the father himself. Therefore, cherish your son and do not insult Shakuntala. O best of men, the son begotten by one's own self, rescues him from the abode of Yama. You are the father of this son. Shakuntala has spoken the truth. The husband divides his body in two parts and is born in the womb of his wife as the son.

data.v: रेतोधाः पुत्र उन्नयति नरदेव यमक्षयात् । त्वं चास्य धाता गर्भस्य सत्यमाह शकुन्तला ॥
data.md: (It said), “O Dushyanta, the mother is but a sheath of flesh (within which the son dwells). The son, sprung from the father, is the father himself. Therefore, cherish your son and do not insult Shakuntala. O best of men, the son begotten by one's own self, rescues him from the abode of Yama. You are the father of this son. Shakuntala has spoken the truth. The husband divides his body in two parts and is born in the womb of his wife as the son.

data.v: जाया जनयते पुत्रमात्मनोऽङ्गं द्विधा कृतम् । तस्माद्भरस्व दुःषन्त पुत्रं शाकुन्तलं नृप ॥
अभूतिरेषा कस्त्यज्याज्जीवञ्जीवन्तमात्मजम् । शाकुन्तलं महात्मानं दौःषन्तिं भर पौरव ॥
भर्तव्योऽयं त्वया यस्मादस्माकं वचनादपि । तस्माद्भवत्वयं नाम्ना भरतो नाम ते सुतः ॥
data.md: Therefore, O descendant of the Puru race, cherish your this high-souled son, born of Shakuntala. As you will cherish this child at our word, therefore, your this son will be known by the name of Bharata.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा पौरवो राजा व्याहृतं वै दिवौकसाम् । पुरोहितममात्यांश्च संप्रहृष्टोऽब्रवीदिदम् ॥
data.md: Having heard these words of the dwellers of heaven, the king of the Puru race was much pleased and addressing his priests and ministers, he said : “Hear all of you the words of the messenger of heaven."

data.v: शृण्वन्त्वेतद्भवन्तोऽस्य देवदूतस्य भाषितम् । अहमप्येवमेवैनं जानामि स्वयमात्मजम् ॥
यद्यहं वचनादेव गृह्णीयामिममात्मजम् । भवेद्धि शङ्का लोकस्य नैवं शुद्धो भवेदयम् ॥
data.md: "I myself know that this boy is my son. If I had accepted him as my son at Shakuntala's words, my people would have been suspicious and my son also would not have been considered to be pure (of pure birth).”

data.v: तं विशोध्य तदा राजा देवदूतेन भारत । हृष्टः प्रमुदितश्चापि प्रतिजग्राह तं सुतम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O descendant of the Virata race, the king was exceedingly pleased, because the purity of the birth of his son was established by the messenger of heaven.

data.v: मूर्ध्नि चैनमुपाघ्राय सस्नेहं परिषस्वजे । सभाज्यमानो विप्रैश्च स्तूयमानश्च बन्दिभिः । स मुदं परमां लेभे पुत्रसंस्पर्शजां नृपः ॥
data.md: He smelt his son's head; he embraced him with affection. The Brahmanas uttered blessings on him and the bards began to applaud him. The king then enjoyed the great pleasure that one feels at the touch of one's own son.

data.v: तां चैव भार्यां धर्मज्ञः पूजयामास धर्मतः । अब्रवीच्चैव तां राजा सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वचः ॥
data.md: Dushyanta also received his wife (Shakuntala) with all honour and affection. Affectionately pacifying her, he spoke to her thus,

data.v: कृतो लोकपरोक्षोऽयं संबन्धो वै त्वया सह । तस्मादेतन्मया देवि त्वच्छुद्ध्यर्थं विचारितम् ॥
data.md: “O lady, my union with you took place in private. None knew of it and therefore, it is natural that people should have thought that our union was only out of lust and that we were not husband and wife. This son, installed as my heir-apparent, would have been considered as a man of impure birth. Therefore, I was thinking how best to establish your purity.

data.v: मन्यते चैव लोकस्ते स्त्रीभावान्मयि संगतम् । पुत्रश्चायं वृतो राज्ये मया तस्माद्विचारितम् ॥
data.md: “O lady, my union with you took place in private. None knew of it and therefore, it is natural that people should have thought that our union was only out of lust and that we were not husband and wife. This son, installed as my heir-apparent, would have been considered as a man of impure birth. Therefore, I was thinking how best to establish your purity.

data.v: यच्च कोपितयात्यर्थं त्वयोक्तोऽस्म्यप्रियं प्रिये । प्रणयिन्या विशालाक्षि तत्क्षान्तं ते मया शुभे ॥
data.md: "O dearest, O lady of beautiful eyes, I have forgiven you for all the hard words you have uttered in anger. You are my darling.”

data.v: तामेवमुक्त्वा राजर्षिर्दुःषन्तो महिषीं प्रियाम् । वासोभिरन्नपानैश्च पूजयामास भारत ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, having spoken thus to his dear queen (Shakuntala), the royal sage Dushyanta, received her with the presents of perfume, food and drink.

data.v: दुःषन्तश्च ततो राजा पुत्रं शाकुन्तलं तदा । भरतं नामतः कृत्वा यौवराज्येऽभ्यषेचयत् ॥
data.md: The king Dushyanta, thereupon, installed the son of Shakuntala as his heir-apparent bestowing upon him the name of Bharata.

data.v: तस्य तत्प्रथितं चक्रं प्रावर्तत महात्मनः । भास्वरं दिव्यमजितं लोकसंनादनं महत् ॥
data.md: From that day the invincible car of Bharata, like the car of the celestials, with its famous and bright wheels, traversed the whole earth, filling it with its rattle.

data.v: स विजित्य महीपालांश्चकार वशवर्तिनः । चचार च सतां धर्मं प्राप चानुत्तमं यशः ॥
data.md: The son of Dushyanta (Bharata) brought under his sway all the kings of the world. He ruled his subjects virtuously and gained great fame.

data.v: स राजा चक्रवर्त्यासीत्सार्वभौमः प्रतापवान् । ईजे च बहुभिर्यज्ञैर्यथा शक्रो मरुत्पतिः ॥
data.md: That king (Bharata) was known by the name of Chakravarti and Sarvabhauma. He performed many sacrifices like Indra, the lord of the Marutas.

data.v: याजयामास तं कण्वो दक्षवद्भूरिदक्षिणम् । श्रीमान्गोविततं नाम वाजिमेधमवाप सः । यस्मिन्सहस्रं पद्मानां कण्वाय भरतो ददौ ॥
data.md: Kanva was the chief priest in those sacrifices and great offerings were made to the Brahmanas. The fortunate king performed both the cow and the horse-sacrifices. Bharata gave one thousand gold coins to Kanva as his sacrificial fee.

data.v: भरताद्भारती कीर्तिर्येनेदं भारतं कुलम् । अपरे ये च पूर्वे च भारता इति विश्रुताः ॥
data.md: From this Bharata has followed this, "achievement of Bharata," from him has sprung this great race (of Bharata.) All kings that were born after him are called after his name.

data.v: भरतस्यान्ववाये हि देवकल्पा महौजसः । बभूवुर्ब्रह्मकल्पाश्च बहवो राजसत्तमाः ॥
data.md: And in this Bharata race were many godlike and greatly powerful best of monarchs. They were like Brahma himself. Their names are countless. O descendant of the Bharata race, I shall name only the chief ones, who were all blessed with great fortune and devoted to truth and honesty. They were all like the celestial.

data.v: येषामपरिमेयानि नामधेयानि सर्वशः । तेषां तु ते यथामुख्यं कीर्तयिष्यामि भारत । महाभागान्देवकल्पान्सत्यार्जवपरायणान् ॥
data.md: And in this Bharata race were many godlike and greatly powerful best of monarchs. They were like Brahma himself. Their names are countless. O descendant of the Bharata race, I shall name only the chief ones, who were all blessed with great fortune and devoted to truth and honesty. They were all like the celestial.

data.v: प्रजापतेस्तु दक्षस्य मनोर्वैवस्वतस्य च । भरतस्य कुरोः पूरोरजमीढस्य चान्वये ॥
यादवानामिमं वंशं पौरवाणां च सर्वशः । तथैव भारतानां च पुण्यं स्वस्त्ययनं महत् । धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं कीर्तयिष्यामि तेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O sinless one, Prajapati Daksha, Vaivasvata Manu, Manu, Bharata, Kuru, Puru, Ajamidha, Yadava and all the other kings of the Bharata race, O sinless king, I shall now recite the holy, illustrious and long lifebestowing histories of these great men. They were as effulgent as the sun and the great Rishis.

data.v: तेजोभिरुदिताः सर्वे महर्षिसमतेजसः । दश प्रचेतसः पुत्राः सन्तः पूर्वजनाः स्मृताः । मेघजेनाग्निना ये ते पूर्वं दग्धा महौजसः ॥
data.md: Pracheta had ten sons, who were all devoted to asceticism and they all possessed every virtue. They burnt with the fire of their mouth many medicinal plants.

data.v: तेभ्यः प्राचेतसो जज्ञे दक्षो दक्षादिमाः प्रजाः । संभूताः पुरुषव्याघ्र स हि लोकपितामहः ॥
data.md: O lion among the men, from them was born Prachetas Daksha and from Daksha sprang all creatures. Therefore, he was called the Grandsire.

data.v: वीरिण्या सह संगम्य दक्षः प्राचेतसो मुनिः । आत्मतुल्यानजनयत्सहस्रं संशितव्रतान् ॥
data.md: The Rishi Daksha, born of Prachetas, begot one thousand sons, uniting with Virini; they were all of rigid vows like himself.

data.v: सहस्रसंख्यान्समितान्सुतान्दक्षस्य नारदः । मोक्षमध्यापयामास सांख्यज्ञानमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Narada taught these one thousand sons of Daksha the excellent knowledge of Sankhya, the means of salvation.

data.v: ततः पञ्चाशतं कन्याः पुत्रिका अभिसंदधे । प्रजापतिः प्रजा दक्षः सिसृक्षुर्जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Janamejaya, the lord of creation Prajapati Daksha, from the desire of creating more creatures, begot fifty daughters. He made them all his Putrikas.

data.v: ददौ स दश धर्माय कश्यपाय त्रयोदश । कालस्य नयने युक्ताः सप्तविंशतिमिन्दवे ॥
data.md: He bestowed ten of his daughters on Daksha, thirteen on Kashyapa and twentyseven on Chandra who were all engaged in indicating time.

data.v: त्रयोदशानां पत्नीनां या तु दाक्षायणी वरा । मारीचः कश्यपस्तस्यामादित्यान्समजीजनत् । इन्द्रादीन्वीर्यसंपन्नान्विवस्वन्तमथापि च ॥
data.md: Kashyapa, the son of Marichi, begot on his wife, the daughter of Daksha, who was the eldest among his thirteen wives, Aditya, the greatly effulgent celestials, Indra, being at their head and Vaivasvata also, Vaivasvata's son was born Yama, the great lord.

data.v: विवस्वतः सुतो जज्ञे यमो वैवस्वतः प्रभुः । मार्तण्डश्च यमस्यापि पुत्रो राजन्नजायत ॥
मार्तण्डस्य मनुर्धीमानजायत सुतः प्रभुः । मनोर्वंशो मानवानां ततोऽयं प्रथितोऽभवत् । ब्रह्मक्षत्रादयस्तस्मान्मनोर्जातास्तु मानवाः ॥
data.md: Manu was greatly wise and virtuous; he became the progenitor of a race. The offspring of Manu were called Manavas, (human beings.)

data.v: तत्राभवत्तदा राजन्ब्रह्म क्षत्रेण संगतम् । ब्राह्मणा मानवास्तेषां साङ्गं वेदमदीधरन् ॥
वेनं धृष्णुं नरिष्यन्तं नाभागेक्ष्वाकुमेव च । करूषमथ शर्यातिं तथैवात्राष्टमीमिलाम् ॥
पृषध्रनवमानाहुः क्षत्रधर्मपरायणान् । नाभागारिष्टदशमान्मनोः पुत्रान्महाबलान् ॥
पञ्चाशतं मनोः पुत्रास्तथैवान्येऽभवन्क्षितौ । अन्योन्यभेदात्ते सर्वे विनेशुरिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard, they all perished quarrelling with one another. The learned Pururava was born of Ila.

data.v: पुरूरवास्ततो विद्वानिलायां समपद्यत । सा वै तस्याभवन्माता पिता चेति हि नः श्रुतम् ॥
त्रयोदश समुद्रस्य द्वीपानश्नन्पुरूरवाः । अमानुषैर्वृतः सत्त्वैर्मानुषः सन्महायशाः ॥
विप्रैः स विग्रहं चक्रे वीर्योन्मत्तः पुरूरवाः । जहार च स विप्राणां रत्नान्युत्क्रोशतामपि ॥
data.md: Though he was a human being, yet he remained always surrounded by superhuman companions. Pururava, intoxicated with the pride of power which he possessed, quarrelled with the Brahmanas, caring little for their anger. He robbed them of their wealth.

data.v: सनत्कुमारस्तं राजन्ब्रह्मलोकादुपेत्य ह । अनुदर्शयां ततश्चक्रे प्रत्यगृह्णान्न चाप्यसौ ॥
data.md: Seeing this, Sanatkumar came from the region of Brahma and gave him good counsel, which he did not accept. Thereupon, the wrath of the great Rishis was excited and the king, who was intoxicated with the pride of power and who lost his reason, was immediately killed by their curse.

data.v: ततो महर्षिभिः क्रुद्धैः शप्तः सद्यो व्यनश्यत । लोभान्वितो मदबलान्नष्टसंज्ञो नराधिपः ॥
स हि गन्धर्वलोकस्थ उर्वश्या सहितो विराट् । आनिनाय क्रियार्थेऽग्नीन्यथावद्विहितांस्त्रिधा ॥
षट्पुत्रा जज्ञिरेऽथैलादायुर्धीमानमावसुः । दृढायुश्च वनायुश्च श्रुतायुश्चोर्वशीसुताः ॥
नहुषं वृद्धशर्माणं रजिं रम्भमनेनसम् । स्वर्भानवीसुतानेतानायोः पुत्रान्प्रचक्षते ॥
आयुषो नहुषः पुत्रो धीमान्सत्यपराक्रमः । राज्यं शशास सुमहद्धर्मेण पृथिवीपतिः ॥
पितॄन्देवानृषीन्विप्रान्गन्धर्वोरगराक्षसान् । नहुषः पालयामास ब्रह्मक्षत्रमथो विशः ॥
data.md: O king, He ruled his kingdom with great virtue. King Nahusha equally supported the Pitris, the Devas, the Rishis, the Gandharvas, the Nagas, the Rakshasas, the Brahmanas, the Kshatriyas and the Vaishyas. He suppressed all the robbers with a mighty hand; he made Rishis to pay tribute to himself.

data.v: स हत्वा दस्युसंघातानृषीन्करमदापयत् । पशुवच्चैव तान्पृष्ठे वाहयामास वीर्यवान् ॥
कारयामास चेन्द्रत्वमभिभूय दिवौकसः । तेजसा तपसा चैव विक्रमेणौजसा तथा ॥
यतिं ययातिं संयातिमायातिं पाञ्चमुद्धवम् । नहुषो जनयामास षट्पुत्रान्प्रियवाससि ॥
ययातिर्नाहुषः सम्राडासीत्सत्यपराक्रमः । स पालयामास महीमीजे च विविधैः सवैः ॥
अतिशक्त्या पितॄनर्चन्देवांश्च प्रयतः सदा । अन्वगृह्णात्प्रजाः सर्वा ययातिरपराजितः ॥
तस्य पुत्रा महेष्वासाः सर्वैः समुदिता गुणैः । देवयान्यां महाराज शर्मिष्ठायां च जज्ञिरे ॥
data.md: O great king, a dispute, thereupon, arose between Devayani and Sharmishtha.

data.v: देवयान्यामजायेतां यदुस्तुर्वसुरेव च । द्रुह्युश्चानुश्च पूरुश्च शर्मिष्ठायां प्रजज्ञिरे ॥
स शाश्वतीः समा राजन्प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् । जरामार्छन्महाघोरां नाहुषो रूपनाशिनीम् ॥
data.md: O king, after ruling his subjects with virtue for a long time. The son of Nahusha (Yayati) was attacked by the terrible old age which destroyed his personal beauty.

data.v: जराभिभूतः पुत्रान्स राजा वचनमब्रवीत् । यदुं पूरुं तुर्वसुं च द्रुह्युं चानुं च भारत ॥
data.md: Having been thus attacked by old age, the king thus addressed his sons, namely Yadu, Puru, Turvasu, Druhyu and Anu.

data.v: यौवनेन चरन्कामान्युवा युवतिभिः सह । विहर्तुमहमिच्छामि साह्यं कुरुत पुत्रकाः ॥
data.md: “O Dear sons, I wish to be young and desire to pass my time with young women. Help me in this."

data.v: तं पुत्रो देवयानेयः पूर्वजो यदुरब्रवीत् । किं कार्यं भवतः कार्यमस्माभिर्यौवनेन च ॥
data.md: His eldest son, born of Devayani said, “Why do you require? Do you want to have our youth?"

data.v: ययातिरब्रवीत्तं वै जरा मे प्रतिगृह्यताम् । यौवनेन त्वदीयेन चरेयं विषयानहम् ॥
data.md: Yayati replied, “Accept my old age.” I would then enjoy myself with your youth.

data.v: यजतो दीर्घसत्रैर्मे शापाच्चोशनसो मुनेः । कामार्थः परिहीणो मे तप्येऽहं तेन पुत्रकाः ॥
data.md: During a long sacrifice, I was cursed by the Rishi Ushanas and therefore, thus have I lost all my powers of enjoying sensual pleasures. O sons, I shall enjoy myself with your youth.

data.v: मामकेन शरीरेण राज्यमेकः प्रशास्तु वः । अहं तन्वाभिनवया युवा कामानवाप्नुयाम् ॥
data.md: (Therefore), take any of you my decrepitude and rule the kingdom with my body. I would then enjoy myself with a renovated youthful body.

data.v: न ते तस्य प्रत्यगृह्णन्यदुप्रभृतयो जराम् । तमब्रवीत्ततः पूरुः कनीयान्सत्यविक्रमः ॥
data.md: Yadu and other sons did not agree to take upon them his old age. Thereupon, his youngest son, the virtuous and powerful Puru said-"O king, enjoy again with a renovated body and returned youth. I shall take upon me your old age and I shall rule the kingdom at your command."

data.v: राजंश्चराभिनवया तन्वा यौवनगोचरः । अहं जरां समास्थाय राज्ये स्थास्यामि तेऽऽज्ञया ॥
data.md: Yadu and other sons did not agree to take upon them his old age. Thereupon, his youngest son, the virtuous and powerful Puru said-"O king, enjoy again with a renovated body and returned youth. I shall take upon me your old age and I shall rule the kingdom at your command."

data.v: एवमुक्तः स राजर्षिस्तपोवीर्यसमाश्रयात् । संचारयामास जरां तदा पुत्रे महात्मनि ॥
data.md: Thus being addressed, the royal sage (Yayati) transferred his old age on his highsouled son (Puru) with his power of asceticism.

data.v: पौरवेणाथ वयसा राजा यौवनमास्थितः । यायातेनापि वयसा राज्यं पूरुरकारयत् ॥
data.md: The king again became a young man with the youth of Puru; and Puru with the old age of his father upon him ruled the kingdom.

data.v: ततो वर्षसहस्रान्ते ययातिरपराजितः । अतृप्त एव कामानां पूरुं पुत्रमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Though his desires were not satiated, he gave back his youth to his son Puru and

data.v: त्वया दायादवानस्मि त्वं मे वंशकरः सुतः । पौरवो वंश इति ते ख्यातिं लोके गमिष्यति ॥
data.md: "From you my race would continue. You are my true son and heir. My race will be known in the world after your name."

data.v: ततः स नृपशार्दूलः पूरुं राज्येऽभिषिच्य च । कालेन महता पश्चात्कालधर्ममुपेयिवान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : That best of kings, (Yayati), having installed Puru on the throne went to the mount Bhrigu to become a great ascetic. After many years he succumbed to the inevitable influence of Time. Observing the vow of fasting, he ascended heaven with his wives.

data.v: ययातिः पूर्वकोऽस्माकं दशमो यः प्रजापतेः । कथं स शुक्रतनयां लेभे परमदुर्लभाम् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : How did our ancestor (Yayati) who was the tenth from Prajapati, obtain the unobtainable daughter of Shukra? O great ascetic, I desire to hear this in detail. Tell me also separately the account of those kings who were the founders of dynasties.

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं विस्तरेण द्विजोत्तम । आनुपूर्व्या च मे शंस पूरोर्वंशकरान्पृथक् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said : How did our ancestor (Yayati) who was the tenth from Prajapati, obtain the unobtainable daughter of Shukra? O great ascetic, I desire to hear this in detail. Tell me also separately the account of those kings who were the founders of dynasties.

data.v: ययातिरासीद्राजर्षिर्देवराजसमद्युतिः । तं शुक्रवृषपर्वाणौ वव्राते वै यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O Janamejaya, the king Yayati was as effulgent as Indra himself. I shall tell you in reply to your question how Shukra and Vrishaparva bestowed (on the king) their daughters in due rites and I shall specially narrate how the union of the Nahusha, took place with Devayani.

data.v: तत्तेऽहं संप्रवक्ष्यामि पृच्छतो जनमेजय । देवयान्याश्च संयोगं ययातेर्नाहुषस्य च ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O Janamejaya, the king Yayati was as effulgent as Indra himself. I shall tell you in reply to your question how Shukra and Vrishaparva bestowed (on the king) their daughters in due rites and I shall specially narrate how the union of the Nahusha, took place with Devayani.

data.v: सुराणामसुराणां च समजायत वै मिथः । ऐश्वर्यं प्रति संघर्षस्त्रैलोक्ये सचराचरे ॥
data.md: In the days of yore, great battles were often faught between the Devas and the Asuras for the sovereignty over the three worlds.

data.v: जिगीषया ततो देवा वव्रिरेऽऽङ्गिरसं मुनिम् । पौरोहित्येन याज्यार्थे काव्यं तूशनसं परे । ब्राह्मणौ तावुभौ नित्यमन्योन्यस्पर्धिनौ भृशम् ॥
data.md: From the desire of securing victory, the celestials appointed the Rishi who was the son of Angirasa (Brihaspati) as their priest to conduct their sacrifices; and their opponents appointed Ushanas (Shukra) as their priest for the same purpose. There was much boastful rivalry between these two Brahmanas. All those Danavas that were killed in battle by the Devas were revived by that sage (Shukra) with the power of his knowledge; and they, thus being made alive, fought again with the celestial.

data.v: तत्र देवा निजघ्नुर्यान्दानवान्युधि संगतान् । तान्पुनर्जीवयामास काव्यो विद्याबलाश्रयात् । ततस्ते पुनरुत्थाय योधयां चक्रिरे सुरान् ॥
data.md: From the desire of securing victory, the celestials appointed the Rishi who was the son of Angirasa (Brihaspati) as their priest to conduct their sacrifices; and their opponents appointed Ushanas (Shukra) as their priest for the same purpose. There was much boastful rivalry between these two Brahmanas. All those Danavas that were killed in battle by the Devas were revived by that sage (Shukra) with the power of his knowledge; and they, thus being made alive, fought again with the celestial.

data.v: असुरास्तु निजघ्नुर्यान्सुरान्समरमूर्धनि । न तान्संजीवयामास बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः ॥
data.md: The Asuras also killed many Devas, but the greatly learned Brihaspati could not revive them.

data.v: न हि वेद स तां विद्यां यां काव्यो वेद वीर्यवान् । संजीवनीं ततो देवा विषादमगमन्परम् ॥
data.md: He did not know the science of Sanjivini (giving life to the dead) which the greatly powerful Rishi (Shukra) knew very well. The celestial were, therefore, very sorry.

data.v: ते तु देवा भयोद्विग्नाः काव्यादुशनसस्तदा । ऊचुः कचमुपागम्य ज्येष्ठं पुत्रं बृहस्पतेः ॥
data.md: Thereupon, the celestials, in great anxiety and in fear of the learned Ushanas, went to Kacha, the eldest son of Brihaspati; and they spoke to him thus.

data.v: भजमानान्भजस्वास्मान्कुरु नः साह्यमुत्तमम् । यासौ विद्या निवसति ब्राह्मणेऽमिततेजसि । शुक्रे तामाहर क्षिप्रं भागभाङ्नो भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: "We ask for your protection, we worship you. Help us in a work which we consider as very important. The knowledge of that science which is known to that Brahmana of immeasurable prowess. Shukra, must be obtained by you as soon as possible. You will then be a sharer with us in all sacrificial offerings. You shall find that Brahmana (Shukra) in the court of (king) Vrishaparva.

data.v: वृषपर्वसमीपे स शक्यो द्रष्टुं त्वया द्विजः । रक्षते दानवांस्तत्र न स रक्षत्यदानवान् ॥
तमाराधयितुं शक्तो भवान्पूर्ववयाः कविम् । देवयानीं च दयितां सुतां तस्य महात्मनः ॥
त्वमाराधयितुं शक्तो नान्यः कश्चन विद्यते । शीलदाक्षिण्यमाधुर्यैराचारेण दमेन च । देवयान्यां हि तुष्टायां विद्यां तां प्राप्स्यसि ध्रुवम् ॥
data.md: "You are sure to obtain that knowledge (of Sanjivini from the Rishi) by gratifying Devayani with your conduct, liberality, sweetness and general behaviour.”

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा ततः प्रायाद्बृहस्पतिसुतः कचः । तदाभिपूजितो देवैः समीपं वृषपर्वणः ॥
data.md: Having been thus addressed and worshipped by the celestials, he said, “Be it so." He then went to the court of king Vrishaparva.

data.v: स गत्वा त्वरितो राजन्देवैः संप्रेषितः कचः । असुरेन्द्रपुरे शुक्रं दृष्ट्वा वाक्यमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: O king, having been thus sent by the celestials, Kacha soon came to the city of the king of the Asuras; and seeing Shukra there, he thus addressed him.

data.v: ऋषेरङ्गिरसः पौत्रं पुत्रं साक्षाद्बृहस्पतेः । नाम्ना कच इति ख्यातं शिष्यं गृह्णातु मां भवान् ॥
data.md: “Reverend Sir, accept me as your disciple. I am the grandson of Rishi Angirasa and the son of Brihaspati. I am known as Kacha by naine.

data.v: ब्रह्मचर्यं चरिष्यामि त्वय्यहं परमं गुरौ । अनुमन्यस्व मां ब्रह्मन्सहस्रं परिवत्सरान् ॥
data.md: Accepting you as my great preceptor, I shall practise Brahmacharya for one thousand years. Therefore, command me.

data.v: कच सुस्वागतं तेऽस्तु प्रतिगृह्णामि ते वचः । अर्चयिष्येऽहमर्च्यं त्वामर्चितोऽस्तु बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: Shukra said:: O Kacha, you are welcome, I accept your words. I shall treat you with regard, for by my doing it, Brihaspati will be regarded.

data.v: कचस्तु तं तथेत्युक्त्वा प्रतिजग्राह तद्व्रतम् । आदिष्टं कविपुत्रेण शुक्रेणोशनसा स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Commanded by the son of Kavi, Ushanas, also called Shukra, Kacha said, “Be it so." And he rook the vow he spoke of.

data.v: व्रतस्य व्रतकालं स यथोक्तं प्रत्यगृह्णत । आराधयन्नुपाध्यायं देवयानीं च भारत ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, (Kacha) took the vow he had spoken of at the proper time and began to worship his preceptor (Shukra) and Devayani. That youth (Kacha) daily gratified Devayani who was also in her youth with singing, dancing and playing on various kinds of instruinents.

data.v: नित्यमाराधयिष्यंस्तां युवा यौवनगोऽऽमुखे । गायन्नृत्यन्वादयंश्च देवयानीमतोषयत् ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, (Kacha) took the vow he had spoken of at the proper time and began to worship his preceptor (Shukra) and Devayani. That youth (Kacha) daily gratified Devayani who was also in her youth with singing, dancing and playing on various kinds of instruinents.

data.v: संशीलयन्देवयानीं कन्यां संप्राप्तयौवनाम् । पुष्पैः फलैः प्रेषणैश्च तोषयामास भारत ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, he gratified that maiden, Devayani, who was in her youth, with the presentations of flowers and fruits and serving her as an obedient servant.

data.v: देवयान्यपि तं विप्रं नियमव्रतचारिणम् । अनुगायमाना ललना रहः पर्यचरत्तदा ॥
data.md: And Devayani also, when they were alone, gratified that vow-observing youth (Kacha) with her songs and sweetness of manners.

data.v: पञ्च वर्षशतान्येवं कचस्य चरतो व्रतम् । तत्रातीयुरथो बुद्ध्वा दानवास्तं ततः कचम् ॥
data.md: When five hundreds years had thus passed away of his vow, the Danavas came to know his intention. One day the Danavas saw Kacha when he was tending (his preceptor's) kine. They then killed him out of the hatred they bore against Brihaspati and from the desire of saving the knowledge of Sanjivini.

data.v: गा रक्षन्तं वने दृष्ट्वा रहस्येकममर्षिताः । जघ्नुर्बृहस्पतेर्द्वेषाद्विद्यारक्षार्थमेव च । हत्वा शालावृकेभ्यश्च प्रायच्छंस्तिलशः कृतम् ॥
data.md: When five hundreds years had thus passed away of his vow, the Danavas came to know his intention. One day the Danavas saw Kacha when he was tending (his preceptor's) kine. They then killed him out of the hatred they bore against Brihaspati and from the desire of saving the knowledge of Sanjivini.

data.v: ततो गावो निवृत्तास्ता अगोपाः स्वं निवेशनम् । ता दृष्ट्वा रहिता गास्तु कचेनाभ्यागता वनात् । उवाच वचनं काले देवयान्यथ भारत ॥
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata race, when Devayani saw that the kine had returned

data.v: अहुतं चाग्निहोत्रं ते सूर्यश्चास्तं गतः प्रभो । अगोपाश्चागता गावः कचस्तात न दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Devayani said: O sire, the Agnihotra (evening fire) is kindled, the sun has also set. The kine have come back without their cowherd. But Kacha is not to be seen.

data.v: व्यक्तं हतो मृतो वापि कचस्तात भविष्यति । तं विना न च जीवेयं कचं सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: It is evident, Kacha is either dead or killed. I tell you truly, I shall not live without him.”

data.v: अयमेहीति शब्देन मृतं संजीवयाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Shukra said: I will revive him by saying, "Come here." Then with the help of the knowledge of Sanjivini, he summoned Kacha (to come to him.)

data.v: ततः संजीवनीं विद्यां प्रयुज्य कचमाह्वयत् । आहूतः प्रादुरभवत्कचोऽरिष्टोऽथ विद्यया । हतोऽहमिति चाचख्यौ पृष्टो ब्राह्मणकन्यया ॥
स पुनर्देवयान्योक्तः पुष्पाहारो यदृच्छया । वनं ययौ ततो विप्रो ददृशुर्दानवाश्च तम् ॥
data.md: On another occasion, the Brahmana Kacha at the request of Devayani, went into the forest to collect flowers and when he was freely roaming there, he was again seen by the Danavas. They again killed him, (pounded him to powders) and mixed him with the waters of the ocean.

data.v: ततो द्वितीयं हत्वा तं दग्ध्वा कृत्वा च चूर्णशः । प्रायच्छन्ब्राह्मणायैव सुरायामसुरास्तदा ॥
data.md: They killed him for the third time. And having reduced him to ashes by burning, they mixed those ashes with the wine which they offered to the Brahmana (Shukra).

data.v: देवयान्यथ भूयोऽपि वाक्यं पितरमब्रवीत् । पुष्पाहारः प्रेषणकृत्कचस्तात न दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Devayani again spoke to her father thus, "O father, Kacha was sent to gather flowers, but he is not to be seen.

data.v: बृहस्पतेः सुतः पुत्रि कचः प्रेतगतिं गतः । विद्यया जीवितोऽप्येवं हन्यते करवाणि किम् ॥
मैवं शुचो मा रुद देवयानि; न त्वादृशी मर्त्यमनुप्रशोचेत् । सुराश्च विश्वे च जगच्च सर्व;मुपस्थितां वैकृतिमानमन्ति ॥
यस्याङ्गिरा वृद्धतमः पितामहो; बृहस्पतिश्चापि पिता तपोधनः । ऋषेः पुत्रं तमथो वापि पौत्रं; कथं न शोचेयमहं न रुद्याम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : Why should I not grieve and weep for Kacha, whose grandfather is old Angirasa himself and whose father is the great ascetic Brihaspati, who is the grandson of a Rishi and the son of a Rishi.

data.v: स ब्रह्मचारी च तपोधनश्च; सदोत्थितः कर्मसु चैव दक्षः । कचस्य मार्गं प्रतिपत्स्ये न भोक्ष्ये; प्रियो हि मे तात कचोऽभिरूपः ॥
data.md: He himself is a Brahmachari and an ascetic; he is always wakeful in every work. O father, I shall starve and follow the way on which Kacha has gone. The handsome Kacha is dear to me.

data.v: असंशयं मामसुरा द्विषन्ति; ये मे शिष्यं नागसं सूदयन्ति । अब्राह्मणं कर्तुमिच्छन्ति रौद्रा;स्ते मां यथा प्रस्तुतं दानवैर्हि । अप्यस्य पापस्य भवेदिहान्तः; कं ब्रह्महत्या न दहेदपीन्द्रम् ॥
data.md: These followers of Rudra (Asuras) want to make me a non-Brahmana by making me participate in their crimes of killing Brahmanas. The crime of killing a Brahmana even bums Indra. This crime has a terrible end."

data.v: संचोदितो देवयान्या महर्षिः पुनराह्वयत् । संरम्भेणैव काव्यो हि बृहस्पतिसुतं कचम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : The great Rishi (Shukra), the son of Kavi, being much afflicted by Devayani's words, cried in anger, "The Asuras certainly want to injure me, for they killed my disciple living with ime.

data.v: गुरोर्भीतो विद्यया चोपहूतः; शनैर्वाचं जठरे व्याजहार । तमब्रवीत्केन पथोपनीतो; ममोदरे तिष्ठसि ब्रूहि विप्र ॥
data.md: Having said this, he summoned Kacha, but being afraid of his preceptor's safety, he feebly replied from within the stomach of Shukra.

data.v: भवत्प्रसादान्न जहाति मां स्मृतिः; स्मरे च सर्वं यच्च यथा च वृत्तम् । न त्वेवं स्यात्तपसो व्ययो मे; ततः क्लेशं घोरमिमं सहामि ॥
data.md: Kacha said: By your grace my memory has not left me. I recollect every thing that had happened not been destroyed. Therefore, I am capable of bearing this insufferable pain.

data.v: असुरैः सुरायां भवतोऽस्मि दत्तो; हत्वा दग्ध्वा चूर्णयित्वा च काव्य । ब्राह्मीं मायामासुरी चैव माया; त्वयि स्थिते कथमेवातिवर्तेत् ॥
data.md: O son of Kavi, I was killed by the Asuras; my body was burnt and reduced to ashes and I was then given to you with your wine. O Brahman, when you are present, how is possible for the Asura Maya (the power of the Asuras) to overcome the Brahma Maya (the power of the Brahmanas)?

data.v: किं ते प्रियं करवाण्यद्य वत्से; वधेन मे जीवितं स्यात्कचस्य । नान्यत्र कुक्षेर्मम भेदनेन; दृश्येत्कचो मद्गतो देवयानि ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Devayani, what good can I do to you? Kacha's life can be revived only with my death. Kacha is within me. There is no other way of his coming out, except by ripping open my stomach.

data.v: द्वौ मां शोकावग्निकल्पौ दहेतां; कचस्य नाशस्तव चैवोपघातः । कचस्य नाशे मम नास्ति शर्म; तवोपघाते जीवितुं नास्मि शक्ता ॥
data.md: Devayani said : Both the shocks will burn me like fire. The death of Kacha and that of yours are both same to me. The death of Kacha will kill me. If you die, I shall not be able to bear life.

data.v: संसिद्धरूपोऽसि बृहस्पतेः सुत; यत्त्वां भक्तं भजते देवयानी । विद्यामिमां प्राप्नुहि जीवनीं त्वं; न चेदिन्द्रः कचरूपी त्वमद्य ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O son of Brihaspati, you are crowned with success, when Devayani adores you so much. If you are not Indra in the guise of Kacha, today, accept, I give you the science of reviving life.

data.v: न निवर्तेत्पुनर्जीवन्कश्चिदन्यो ममोदरात् । ब्राह्मणं वर्जयित्वैकं तस्माद्विद्यामवाप्नुहि ॥
data.md: come None can out alive from my stomach. A Brahmana, however, must not be killed. Therefore, accept the knowledge I teach you.

data.v: पुत्रो भूत्वा भावय भावितो मा;मस्माद्देहादुपनिष्क्रम्य तात । समीक्षेथा धर्मवतीमवेक्षां; गुरोः सकाशात्प्राप्य विद्यां सविद्यः ॥
data.md: Come to life again as my son. Possessed of the knowledge I teach you and being again revived by me, O child, take care that you act with gratitude when you come out of my stomach.

data.v: गुरोः सकाशात्समवाप्य विद्यां; भित्त्वा कुक्षिं निर्विचक्राम विप्रः । कचोऽभिरूपो दक्षिणं ब्राह्मणस्य; शुक्लात्यये पौर्णमास्यामिवेन्दुः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Receiving the knowledge (of reviving life) from his preceptor, the handsome Kacha ripped open the stomach (of Shukra) and came out like the moon on the evening of the full-moon night.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च तं पतितं ब्रह्मराशि;मुत्थापयामास मृतं कचोऽपि । विद्यां सिद्धां तामवाप्याभिवाद्य; ततः कचस्तं गुरुमित्युवाच ॥
data.md: Seeing the remains of his preceptor lying like a heap of ascetic virtues and learning, Kacha revived him with the knowledge he had received. He then spoke to the preceptor thus-

data.v: ऋतस्य दातारमनुत्तमस्य; निधिं निधीनां चतुरन्वयानाम् । ये नाद्रियन्ते गुरुमर्चनीयं; पापाँल्लोकांस्ते व्रजन्त्यप्रतिष्ठान् ॥
data.md: Those that, having acquired knowledge, injure their preceptor who is an object of adoration, who is the giver of knowledge and who is the most precious of all precious objects on earth, become hated on earth and finally go to the regions of the sinful.

data.v: सुरापानाद्वञ्चनां प्रापयित्वा; संज्ञानाशं चैव तथातिघोरम् । दृष्ट्वा कचं चापि तथाभिरूपं; पीतं तदा सुरया मोहितेन ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been deceived while under the influence of wine and remembering the terrible consequences of drink and the total loss of consciousness, the result of it and seeing before him the handsome Kacha whom he had drink with the wine while intoxicated, (the learned Shukra), with the wish of effecting a reform in the manner of the Brahmanas, rose from the ground in anger and spoke thus-

data.v: समन्युरुत्थाय महानुभाव;स्तदोशना विप्रहितं चिकीर्षुः । काव्यः स्वयं वाक्यमिदं जगाद; सुरापानं प्रति वै जातशङ्कः ॥
यो ब्राह्मणोऽद्य प्रभृतीह कश्चि;न्मोहात्सुरां पास्यति मन्दबुद्धिः । अपेतधर्मो ब्रह्महा चैव स स्या;दस्मिँल्लोके गर्हितः स्यात्परे च ॥
data.md: "That wretched Brahmana, who being unable to resist the temptation, will drink liquor from this day, shall be considered as to have committed the sin of slaying a Brahmana and he shall be hated both in this and in the other world."

data.v: मया चेमां विप्रधर्मोक्तिसीमां; मर्यादां वै स्थापितां सर्वलोके । सन्तो विप्राः शुश्रुवांसो गुरूणां; देवा लोकाश्चोपशृण्वन्तु सर्वे ॥
data.md: I set this limit to the conduct of the Brahmanas everywhere. Let this (my solemn words) be heard by the honest men, by the Brahmanas, by the celestials and by those who regard their superiors."

data.v: इतीदमुक्त्वा स महानुभाव;स्तपोनिधीनां निधिरप्रमेयः । तान्दानवान्दैवविमूढबुद्धी;निदं समाहूय वचोऽभ्युवाच ॥
data.md: Having said this, the illustrious Rishi, the ascetic of ascetics, summoned the Danavas who had been deprived of their good sense by Fate. He then told them.

data.v: आचक्षे वो दानवा बालिशाः स्थ; सिद्धः कचो वत्स्यति मत्सकाशे । संजीवनीं प्राप्य विद्यां महार्थां; तुल्यप्रभावो ब्रह्मणा ब्रह्मभूतः ॥
data.md: "O foolish Danavas, know that Kacha had obtained his wish. He will henceforth dwelt with me. Having obtained the knowledge of Sanjivini, that illustrious Brahmana has become as powerful as Brahma himself."

data.v: गुरोरुष्य सकाशे तु दश वर्षशतानि सः । अनुज्ञातः कचो गन्तुमियेष त्रिदशालयम् ॥
data.md: Kacha, after having lived with his preceptor for full one thousand years, prepared to go to the land of the celestials with the permission of his preceptor.

data.v: समावृत्तव्रतं तं तु विसृष्टं गुरुणा तदा । प्रस्थितं त्रिदशावासं देवयान्यब्रवीदिदम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When the period of his vow expired and when he was prepared to go to the land of the celestials, after having received the permission of his preceptor, Devayani addressed him thus-"O the grandson of Rishi Angirasa, you shine most brightly in conduct, in birth, in learning, in asceticism and in humility.

data.v: ऋषेरङ्गिरसः पौत्र वृत्तेनाभिजनेन च । भ्राजसे विद्यया चैव तपसा च दमेन च ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When the period of his vow expired and when he was prepared to go to the land of the celestials, after having received the permission of his preceptor, Devayani addressed him thus-"O the grandson of Rishi Angirasa, you shine most brightly in conduct, in birth, in learning, in asceticism and in humility.

data.v: ऋषिर्यथाङ्गिरा मान्यः पितुर्मम महायशाः । तथा मान्यश्च पूज्यश्च भूयो मम बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: As the Rishi Angirasa is honoured by me illustrious father, so is (your father) Brihaspati honoured and respected by me.

data.v: एवं ज्ञात्वा विजानीहि यद्ब्रवीमि तपोधन । व्रतस्थे नियमोपेते यथा वर्ताम्यहं त्वयि ॥
data.md: O great ascetic, knowing this, hear what I say. You are aware of my behaviour towards you during the period of your vow.

data.v: स समावृत्तविद्यो मां भक्तां भजितुमर्हसि । गृहाण पाणिं विधिवन्मम मन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् ॥
data.md: "Your vow is now over; you should now fix your affection on me who love you. Accept my hand with ordained rites and Mantras."

data.v: पूज्यो मान्यश्च भगवान्यथा तव पिता मम । तथा त्वमनवद्याङ्गि पूजनीयतरा मम ॥
data.md: Kacha said: You are an object of my respect and worship, as is your illustrious father. O lady of faultless features, you are an object of greater reverence to me (than your father).

data.v: आत्मप्राणैः प्रियतमा भार्गवस्य महात्मनः । त्वं भद्रे धर्मतः पूज्या गुरुपुत्री सदा मम ॥
data.md: You are dearer than life to the high-souled Bhargava. O amiable lady, you are ever worthy of my worship, as you are the daughter of my preceptor.

data.v: यथा मम गुरुर्नित्यं मान्यः शुक्रः पिता तव । देवयानि तथैव त्वं नैवं मां वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: As your father Shukra, my preceptor, is ever honoured by me, so are you. O Devayani, therefore, you should not speak to me thus.

data.v: गुरुपुत्रस्य पुत्रो वै न तु त्वमसि मे पितुः । तस्मान्मान्यश्च पूज्यश्च ममापि त्वं द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O best of the twice born, you are the son of my preceptor's son, you are not the son of my father. Therefore, you are an object of my respect and worship. O Kacha, when the Asuras killed you again and again, you should recollect today the love I showed towards you.

data.v: असुरैर्हन्यमाने च कच त्वयि पुनः पुनः । तदा प्रभृति या प्रीतिस्तां त्वमेव स्मरस्व मे ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O best of the twice born, you are the son of my preceptor's son, you are not the son of my father. Therefore, you are an object of my respect and worship. O Kacha, when the Asuras killed you again and again, you should recollect today the love I showed towards you.

data.v: सौहार्दे चानुरागे च वेत्थ मे भक्तिमुत्तमाम् । न मामर्हसि धर्मज्ञ त्यक्तुं भक्तामनागसम् ॥
data.md: O virtuous man, remembering my love and affection for you and also my devoted regard for you, you should not abandon me without any faults.

data.v: अनियोज्ये नियोगे मां नियुनक्षि शुभव्रते । प्रसीद सुभ्रु त्वं मह्यं गुरोर्गुरुतरी शुभे ॥
यत्रोषितं विशालाक्षि त्वया चन्द्रनिभानने । तत्राहमुषितो भद्रे कुक्षौ काव्यस्य भामिनि ॥
भगिनी धर्मतो मे त्वं मैवं वोचः शुभानने । सुखमस्म्युषितो भद्रे न मन्युर्विद्यते मम ॥
आपृच्छे त्वां गमिष्यामि शिवमाशंस मे पथि । अविरोधेन धर्मस्य स्मर्तव्योऽस्मि कथान्तरे । अप्रमत्तोत्थिता नित्यमाराधय गुरुं मम ॥
data.md: I ask your leave to go away. Bless me so that good may come to my journey. Remember me in your conversations as one who has not transgressed virtue. Serve my preceptor with readiness and singleness of heart.

data.v: यदि मां धर्मकामार्थे प्रत्याख्यास्यसि चोदितः । ततः कच न ते विद्या सिद्धिमेषा गमिष्यति ॥
data.md: Devayani said: If you refuse to make me your wife, solicited by me as I do, O Kacha, (indeed I say) your knowledge will bear no fruits.

data.v: गुरुपुत्रीति कृत्वाहं प्रत्याचक्षे न दोषतः । गुरुणा चाभ्यनुज्ञातः काममेवं शपस्व माम् ॥
data.md: Kacha said: I refused to comply with your request, because you are my preceptor's daughter. (I did not refuse you) for any fault of yours. my preceptor also had not issued any command regarding this matter. Curse me if it pleases you.

data.v: आर्षं धर्मं ब्रुवाणोऽहं देवयानि यथा त्वया । शप्तो नार्होऽस्मि शापस्य कामतोऽद्य न धर्मतः ॥
data.md: O Devayani, I have told you what should be the conduct of Rishis. I, therefore, do not deserve your curse. But notwithstanding all this you have cursed me out of desire and not from a sense of duty. Therefore, your desire shall not be fulfilled no Rishi's son will ever accept your hand.

data.v: तस्माद्भवत्या यः कामो न तथा स भविष्यति । ऋषिपुत्रो न ते कश्चिज्जातु पाणिं ग्रहीष्यति ॥
data.md: O Devayani, I have told you what should be the conduct of Rishis. I, therefore, do not deserve your curse. But notwithstanding all this you have cursed me out of desire and not from a sense of duty. Therefore, your desire shall not be fulfilled no Rishi's son will ever accept your hand.

data.v: फलिष्यति न ते विद्या यत्त्वं मामात्थ तत्तथा । अध्यापयिष्यामि तु यं तस्य विद्या फलिष्यति ॥
data.md: You have said that my knowledge would not bear fruits. Let it be so. But it shall bear fruits in him whom I shall teach it.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा द्विजश्रेष्ठो देवयानीं कचस्तदा । त्रिदशेशालयं शीघ्रं जगाम द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having said this to Devayani, that best of Brahmanas, that foremost of the twice-born, Kacha hurriedly went away to the land of the celestials.

data.v: तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य देवा इन्द्रपुरोगमाः । बृहस्पतिं सभाज्येदं कचमाहुर्मुदान्विताः ॥
data.md: Seeing him arrived, the celestials with Indra at their head looked with delight towards Brihaspati and spoke to him thus.

data.v: यत्त्वमस्मद्धितं कर्म चकर्थ परमाद्भुतम् । न ते यशः प्रणशिता भागभाङ्नो भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: The Devas said : You have performed an act of great good for us; your achievements are wonderful, your fame will never die, you will be the sharer with us in the sacrificial offerings.

data.v: कृतविद्ये कचे प्राप्ते हृष्टरूपा दिवौकसः । कचादधीत्य तां विद्यां कृतार्था भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: O best of the Bharata race, the dwellers of heaven were exceedingly glad to get back Kacha who had learnt the knowledge (of Sanjivini). The celestial then learnt the Sanjivini from Kacha and considered their object achieved.

data.v: सर्व एव समागम्य शतक्रतुमथाब्रुवन् । कालस्ते विक्रमस्याद्य जहि शत्रून्पुरंदर ॥
data.md: They all assembled together and thus spoke to Indra. “O Indra, the time has come to show your prowess. Kill your enemies."

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सहितैस्त्रिदशैर्मघवांस्तदा । तथेत्युक्त्वोपचक्राम सोऽपश्यत वने स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Having been thus addressed, Indra said “Be it so." He then, accompanied by the celestials set out. He saw many damsels in the forest.

data.v: क्रीडन्तीनां तु कन्यानां वने चैत्ररथोपमे । वायुभूतः स वस्त्राणि सर्वाण्येव व्यमिश्रयत् ॥
data.md: The maidens were sporting in a lake in the wood which was like that of Chitraratha. Changing himself into wind, he (Indra) mixed up their clothes.

data.v: ततो जलात्समुत्तीर्य कन्यास्ताः सहितास्तदा । वस्त्राणि जगृहुस्तानि यथासन्नान्यनेकशः ॥
data.md: The maidens, after rising from the water all together, put on the clothes which each got near her from the mixed up heap. The cloth of Devayani was thus taken up and worn by Sharmishtha, the daughter of king Vrishaparva, not knowing that it belonged to others.

data.v: तत्र वासो देवयान्याः शर्मिष्ठा जगृहे तदा । व्यतिमिश्रमजानन्ती दुहिता वृषपर्वणः ॥
data.md: The maidens, after rising from the water all together, put on the clothes which each got near her from the mixed up heap. The cloth of Devayani was thus taken up and worn by Sharmishtha, the daughter of king Vrishaparva, not knowing that it belonged to others.

data.v: ततस्तयोर्मिथस्तत्र विरोधः समजायत । देवयान्याश्च राजेन्द्र शर्मिष्ठायाश्च तत्कृते ॥
data.md: O great king, a dispute, thereupon, arose between Devayani and Sharmishtha.

data.v: कस्माद्गृह्णासि मे वस्त्रं शिष्या भूत्वा ममासुरि । समुदाचारहीनाया न ते श्रेयो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O daughter of the Asura, how do you dare take my cloth, being my pupil. Destitute of good conduct, nothing good can come to you.

data.v: आसीनं च शयानं च पिता ते पितरं मम । स्तौति वन्दति चाभीक्ष्णं नीचैः स्थित्वा विनीतवत् ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : Whether my father is sitting or lying your father, occupying a lower seat and casting his eyes downwards, adores him like a Vandi (a chanter of praises.)

data.v: याचतस्त्वं हि दुहिता स्तुवतः प्रतिगृह्णतः । सुताहं स्तूयमानस्य ददतोऽप्रतिगृह्णतः ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Devayani, you are not the daughter of a hired chanter of praises, nor that of one who asks for alms and receives them. You are the daughter of one who is adored by all and who adores none.

data.v: अनायुधा सायुधाया रिक्ता क्षुभ्यसि भिक्षुकि । लप्स्यसे प्रतियोद्धारं न हि त्वां गणयाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: You are the daughter of a man who begs and I am the daughter of one who bestows alms. your father chants praises of others and my father's praises are chanted. Your father lives on alms, my father bestows them. O beggar's girl, you are free to strike your breast, to use harsh words, to vow enmity to me and to give way to your wrath. O beggarly woman, you weep in vain. You cannot harm me, though I can harm you. You desire to quarrel with me, but I do not at all consider you as my equal.

data.v: समुच्छ्रयं देवयानीं गतां सक्तां च वाससि । शर्मिष्ठा प्राक्षिपत्कूपे ततः स्वपुरमाव्रजत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard this, Devayani became very angry and she began to tear her cloth. But Sharmishtha, throwing her into a well, went away to her home. The wicked Sharmishtha thought her to be dead and went home in a wrathful mood. When she went away, the son of Nahusha, Yayati came to that place; he was after deer.

data.v: हतेयमिति विज्ञाय शर्मिष्ठा पापनिश्चया । अनवेक्ष्य ययौ वेश्म क्रोधवेगपरायणा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard this, Devayani became very angry and she began to tear her cloth. But Sharmishtha, throwing her into a well, went away to her home. The wicked Sharmishtha thought her to be dead and went home in a wrathful mood. When she went away, the son of Nahusha, Yayati came to that place; he was after deer.

data.v: अथ तं देशमभ्यागाद्ययातिर्नहुषात्मजः । श्रान्तयुग्यः श्रान्तहयो मृगलिप्सुः पिपासितः ॥
data.md: The pair of horses in his car were fatigued and he himself was thirsty. That son of Nahusha (Yayati) saw a well in which there was no water.

data.v: स नाहुषः प्रेक्षमाण उदपानं गतोदकम् । ददर्श कन्यां तां तत्र दीप्तामग्निशिखामिव ॥
तामपृच्छत्स दृष्ट्वैव कन्याममरवर्णिनीम् । सान्त्वयित्वा नृपश्रेष्ठः साम्ना परमवल्गुना ॥
data.md: Thai best of kings, pacifying her with sweet words said, O fair lady, O lady with bright nails, as burnished copper and with earrings of celestial gems, who are you?

data.v: का त्वं ताम्रनखी श्यामा सुमृष्टमणिकुण्डला । दीर्घं ध्यायसि चात्यर्थं कस्माच्छ्वसिषि चातुरा ॥
कथं च पतितास्यस्मिन्कूपे वीरुत्तृणावृते । दुहिता चैव कस्य त्वं वद सर्वं सुमध्यमे ॥
data.md: Why are you in such anxiety? Why are you weeping in distress? How have you fallen into this well covered with long grass and creepers? O beauty of slender-waist, tell me truly, whose daughter are you?

data.v: योऽसौ देवैर्हतान्दैत्यानुत्थापयति विद्यया । तस्य शुक्रस्य कन्याहं स मां नूनं न बुध्यते ॥
data.md: Devayani said : I am the daughter of Shukra who revives the Asuras, killed by the celestial. He knows not what has befallen me.

data.v: एष मे दक्षिणो राजन्पाणिस्ताम्रनखाङ्गुलिः । समुद्धर गृहीत्वा मां कुलीनस्त्वं हि मे मतः ॥
data.md: O king, this is my right hand with nails as bright as the burnished copper. You are nobly born, I ask you, take my hand and raise me up. I know, you are very gentle, very powerful and greatly famous. You should raise me up from this well.

data.v: जानामि हि त्वां संशान्तं वीर्यवन्तं यशस्विनम् । तस्मान्मां पतितामस्मात्कूपादुद्धर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O king, this is my right hand with nails as bright as the burnished copper. You are nobly born, I ask you, take my hand and raise me up. I know, you are very gentle, very powerful and greatly famous. You should raise me up from this well.

data.v: तामथ ब्राह्मणीं स्त्रीं च विज्ञाय नहुषात्मजः । गृहीत्वा दक्षिणे पाणावुज्जहार ततोऽवटात् ॥
उद्धृत्य चैनां तरसा तस्मात्कूपान्नराधिपः । आमन्त्रयित्वा सुश्रोणीं ययातिः स्वपुरं ययौ ॥
त्वरितं घूर्णिके गच्छ सर्वमाचक्ष्व मे पितुः । नेदानीं हि प्रवक्ष्यामि नगरं वृषपर्वणः ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O Ghurnika, go speedily to my father and tell him as soon as possible all that had happened. I shall not enter the city of Vrishaparva.

data.v: सा तु वै त्वरितं गत्वा घूर्णिकासुरमन्दिरम् । दृष्ट्वा काव्यमुवाचेदं संभ्रमाविष्टचेतना ॥
आचक्षे ते महाप्राज्ञ देवयानी वने हता । शर्मिष्ठया महाभाग दुहित्रा वृषपर्वणः ॥
श्रुत्वा दुहितरं काव्यस्तत्र शर्मिष्ठया हताम् । त्वरया निर्ययौ दुःखान्मार्गमाणः सुतां वने ॥
दृष्ट्वा दुहितरं काव्यो देवयानीं ततो वने । बाहुभ्यां संपरिष्वज्य दुःखितो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
आत्मदोषैर्नियच्छन्ति सर्वे दुःखसुखे जनाः । मन्ये दुश्चरितं तेऽस्ति यस्येयं निष्कृतिः कृता ॥
निष्कृतिर्मेऽस्तु वा मास्तु शृणुष्वावहितो मम । शर्मिष्ठया यदुक्तास्मि दुहित्रा वृषपर्वणः । सत्यं किलैतत्सा प्राह दैत्यानामसि गायनः ॥
data.md: Devayani said: Be it punishment of my fault or not (O father), hear all that the daughter of Vrishaparva, Sharmishtha, had said to me. She has said, (I say) truly, that you are a Bandi (hired chanter) of the Asura king. Even thus did Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva, speak. These cruel and piercing words, with her eyes red (with anger). (She said), “You are the daughter of one who always chants the praise of others for hire and who always asks for charity.

data.v: एवं हि मे कथयति शर्मिष्ठा वार्षपर्वणी । वचनं तीक्ष्णपरुषं क्रोधरक्तेक्षणा भृशम् ॥
स्तुवतो दुहिता हि त्वं याचतः प्रतिगृह्णतः । सुताहं स्तूयमानस्य ददतोऽप्रतिगृह्णतः ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Devayani, you are not the daughter of a hired chanter of praises, nor that of one who asks for alms and receives them. You are the daughter of one who is adored by all and who adores none.

data.v: इति मामाह शर्मिष्ठा दुहिता वृषपर्वणः । क्रोधसंरक्तनयना दर्पपूर्णा पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: And who accepts alms, whereas I am the daughter of one who is the adored of all, who gives alms and never receives and gift from any body.” Thus again and again spoke to me Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva, full of pride, her eyes red in anger.

data.v: यद्यहं स्तुवतस्तात दुहिता प्रतिगृह्णतः । प्रसादयिष्ये शर्मिष्ठामित्युक्ता हि सखी मया ॥
data.md: O father, if I am really the daughter of a hired chanter of others' praises and of one who accepts alms, I must adore her in the hope of getting her favour. I have already told this to her.

data.v: स्तुवतो दुहिता न त्वं भद्रे न प्रतिगृह्णतः । अस्तोतुः स्तूयमानस्य दुहिता देवयान्यसि ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Devayani, you are not the daughter of a hired chanter of praises, nor that of one who asks for alms and receives them. You are the daughter of one who is adored by all and who adores none.

data.v: वृषपर्वैव तद्वेद शक्रो राजा च नाहुषः । अचिन्त्यं ब्रह्म निर्द्वन्द्वमैश्वरं हि बलं मम ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva and Indra and king Yayati, (all) know my strength to be inconceivable like Brahma and unapproachable God.

data.v: यः परेषां नरो नित्यमतिवादांस्तितिक्षति । देवयानि विजानीहि तेन सर्वमिदं जितम् ॥
data.md: O Devayani, know that he who subdues the rising anger by his feeling of non-anger, conquers everything on earth.

data.v: यः समुत्पतितं क्रोधं निगृह्णाति हयं यथा । स यन्तेत्युच्यते सद्भिर्न यो रश्मिषु लम्बते ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Devayani, know that the man who does not regard the evil words of others, conquers every thing. The wise men call him a true charioteer who holds tightly the reins of his horses. He is a true man who subdues his rising anger.

data.v: यः समुत्पतितं क्रोधमक्रोधेन निरस्यति । देवयानि विजानीहि तेन सर्वमिदं जितम् ॥
data.md: O Devayani, know that he who subdues the rising anger by his feeling of non-anger, conquers everything on earth.

data.v: यः समुत्पतितं क्रोधं क्षमयेह निरस्यति । यथोरगस्त्वचं जीर्णां स वै पुरुष उच्यते ॥
data.md: He who subdues his rising anger by forgiveness like the casting off the slough of a snake is called a true man.

data.v: यः संधारयते मन्युं योऽतिवादांस्तितिक्षति । यश्च तप्तो न तपति दृढं सोऽर्थस्य भाजनम् ॥
data.md: He who subdues his anger, he who does not regard the bad words of others, he who is not angry even when there is a cause, certainly acquires the four objects for which we live (namely Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha.)

data.v: यो यजेदपरिश्रान्तो मासि मासि शतं समाः । न क्रुध्येद्यश्च सर्वस्य तयोरक्रोधनोऽधिकः ॥
data.md: Between the two men, one performing sacrifices continually every month for one hundred years and one who does not feel any anger, the man who does not feel any anger is the greater man.

data.v: यत्कुमाराः कुमार्यश्च वैरं कुर्युरचेतसः । न तत्प्राज्ञोऽनुकुर्वीत विदुस्ते न बलाबलम् ॥
data.md: Boys and girls, who are incapable of distinguishing between right and wrong, quarrel among one another. The wise never imitate them.

data.v: वेदाहं तात बालापि धर्माणां यदिहान्तरम् । अक्रोधे चातिवादे च वेद चापि बलाबलम् ॥
data.md: the power Devayani said: O father, I know, though I am a girl, what are duties and virtues. I also know the difference between anger and forgiveness and of each.

data.v: शिष्यस्याशिष्यवृत्तेर्हि न क्षन्तव्यं बुभूषता । तस्मात्संकीर्णवृत्तेषु वासो मम न रोचते ॥
data.md: But when a pupil behaves disrespectfully towards his tutor, he should never be forgiven by the preceptor, if he wants to benefit him. Therefore, I do not desire to live in a country where the people are so bad.

data.v: पुमांसो ये हि निन्दन्ति वृत्तेनाभिजनेन च । न तेषु निवसेत्प्राज्ञः श्रेयोर्थी पापबुद्धिषु ॥
data.md: The wise man who desire the good of all, should not live among men who are sinfully inclined and she always speak ill of men of high birth and good behaviour.

data.v: ये त्वेनमभिजानन्ति वृत्तेनाभिजनेन च । तेषु साधुषु वस्तव्यं स वासः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते ॥
data.md: It is said to be the best place to live where high birth and good conduct are known and respected and where men know our birth and behaviour.

data.v: वाग्दुरुक्तं महाघोरं दुहितुर्वृषपर्वणः । न ह्यतो दुष्करतरं मन्ये लोकेष्वपि त्रिषु । यः सपत्नश्रियं दीप्तां हीनश्रीः पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: The cruel words of the daughter of Vrishaparva burn my heart, as men, desirous of kindling a fire, burn the dry woods.

data.v: ततः काव्यो भृगुश्रेष्ठः समन्युरुपगम्य ह । वृषपर्वाणमासीनमित्युवाचाविचारयन् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : The best of the Bhrigu race, the son of Kavi (Shukra) himself became angry. Coming to the place where Vrishaparva was seated he fearlessly addressed him thus-

data.v: नाधर्मश्चरितो राजन्सद्यः फलति गौरिव । पुत्रेषु वा नप्तृषु वा न चेदात्मनि पश्यति । फलत्येव ध्रुवं पापं गुरुभुक्तमिवोदरे ॥
data.md: Such fruits, are seen, either in one's ownself, or in one's son, or in one's grandson. Sin must bear fruits, like rich food they cannot be digested.

data.v: यदघातयथा विप्रं कचमाङ्गिरसं तदा । अपापशीलं धर्मज्ञं शुश्रूषुं मद्गृहे रतम् ॥
data.md: As you killed the grandson of Rishi Angirasa, the Brahmana Kacha, who was virtuous, learned in religious precepts and attentive to duties, when he lived with me.

data.v: वधादनर्हतस्तस्य वधाच्च दुहितुर्मम । वृषपर्वन्निबोधेदं त्यक्ष्यामि त्वां सबान्धवम् । स्थातुं त्वद्विषये राजन्न शक्ष्यामि त्वया सह ॥
data.md: As you have mal-treated my daughter who did not deserve it, O Vrishaparva, know, I shall leave you and all your race. O king, for this reason I can no longer stay with you.

data.v: अहो मामभिजानासि दैत्य मिथ्याप्रलापिनम् । यथेममात्मनो दोषं न नियच्छस्युपेक्षसे ॥
data.md: Do not think, O Danava, that I am raving or I am a liar. You think very little of your faults and do not try to correct them.

data.v: नाधर्मं न मृषावादं त्वयि जानामि भार्गव । त्वयि धर्मश्च सत्यं च तत्प्रसीदतु नो भवान् ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva said : O son of Bhrigu, never I attributed to you falsehood or impiety. Virtue and truth ever dwell in you. Be gracious to me. O son of Bhrigu, if you really leave me and go away (from this place), we shall have then to go into the deep bottom of the ocean. There is no other alternative for us.

data.v: यद्यस्मानपहाय त्वमितो गच्छसि भार्गव । समुद्रं संप्रवेक्ष्यामो नान्यदस्ति परायणम् ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva said : O son of Bhrigu, never I attributed to you falsehood or impiety. Virtue and truth ever dwell in you. Be gracious to me. O son of Bhrigu, if you really leave me and go away (from this place), we shall have then to go into the deep bottom of the ocean. There is no other alternative for us.

data.v: समुद्रं प्रविशध्वं वा दिशो वा द्रवतासुराः । दुहितुर्नाप्रियं सोढुं शक्तोऽहं दयिता हि मे ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O Asura, I care very little whether you go into the bottom of the sea, of fly away to all directions, I am incapable of bearing my daughter's grief.

data.v: प्रसाद्यतां देवयानी जीवितं ह्यत्र मे स्थितम् । योगक्षेमकरस्तेऽहमिन्द्रस्येव बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: My life depends on her. Seek, O Asuras, to please her. As Brihaspati always seeks the good of Indra, so I seek your good with my ascetic powers.

data.v: यत्किंचिदसुरेन्द्राणां विद्यते वसु भार्गव । भुवि हस्तिगवाश्वं वा तस्य त्वं मम चेश्वरः ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva said : O son of Bhrigu, you are the absolute master of everything that belongs to the Asura chief in this world these elephants, kine and horses, nay even myself.

data.v: यत्किंचिदस्ति द्रविणं दैत्येन्द्राणां महासुर । तस्येश्वरोऽस्मि यदि ते देवयानी प्रसाद्यताम् ॥
data.md: Shukra said: Ogreat Asura, if it is (really) true that I am the lord over all the wealth of the Asuras, then go and try to please Devayani.

data.v: यदि त्वमीश्वरस्तात राज्ञो वित्तस्य भार्गव । नाभिजानामि तत्तेऽहं राजा तु वदतु स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O son of Bhrigu, O father, if you are really the lord over the Asura king and all his wealth, then let the king come personally to me and speak it in my presence.

data.v: यं काममभिकामासि देवयानि शुचिस्मिते । तत्तेऽहं संप्रदास्यामि यदि चेदपि दुर्लभम् ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva said : O Devayani, O lady of sweet smiles, whatever you desire to possess, however difficult it may be to get, I am willing to give you.

data.v: दासीं कन्यासहस्रेण शर्मिष्ठामभिकामये । अनु मां तत्र गच्छेत्सा यत्र दास्यति मे पिता ॥
data.md: Devayani said : I desire to have Sharmishtha as my maidservant one thousand other damsels. She must also follow me to the house of him on whom my father will bestow me.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ हे संग्रहीत्रि शर्मिष्ठां शीघ्रमानय । यं च कामयते कामं देवयानी करोतु तम् ॥
data.md: Vrishaparva said : O nurse, go and bring quickly Sharmishtha here. Let her also act according to the desire of Devayani.

data.v: ततो धात्री तत्र गत्वा शर्मिष्ठां वाक्यमब्रवीत् । उत्तिष्ठ भद्रे शर्मिष्ठे ज्ञातीनां सुखमावह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : The nurse then went to Sharmishtha and told her, “O amiable Sharmishtha, rise and follow me.

data.v: त्यजति ब्राह्मणः शिष्यान्देवयान्या प्रचोदितः । सा यं कामयते कामं स कार्योऽद्य त्वयानघे ॥
data.md: Accomplish the good of your race. Urged by Devayani, the Brahmana (Shukra) is about to leave his disciples (the Asuras). O sinless lady, you must do as Devayani desires."

data.v: सा यं कामयते कामं करवाण्यहमद्य तम् । मा त्वेवापगमच्छुक्रो देवयानी च मत्कृते ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : I shall cheerfully do as Devayani desires. Both Shukra and Devayani, must not leave the Asuras through any fault of mine.

data.v: ततः कन्यासहस्रेण वृता शिबिकया तदा । पितुर्नियोगात्त्वरिता निश्चक्राम पुरोत्तमात् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been commanded by her father, Sharmishtha with one thousand maidens came out of her father's excellent palace.

data.v: अहं कन्यासहस्रेण दासी ते परिचारिका । अनु त्वां तत्र यास्यामि यत्र दास्यति ते पिता ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : I am your maid-servant, with my one thousand maids. I shall follow you where your father will bestow you.

data.v: स्तुवतो दुहिता तेऽहं बन्दिनः प्रतिगृह्णतः । स्तूयमानस्य दुहिता कथं दासी भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Devayani said: I am the daughter of one who is a hired chanter of praise, who asks for alms and accepts them, whereas you are the daughter of one who is adored. Why should you become my maid-servant?

data.v: येन केनचिदार्तानां ज्ञातीनां सुखमावहेत् । अतस्त्वामनुयास्यामि यत्र दास्यति ते पिता ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : One must try to do good to one's affected relatives. Therefore, I shall follow you where your father will bestow you.

data.v: प्रतिश्रुते दासभावे दुहित्रा वृषपर्वणः । देवयानी नृपश्रेष्ठ पितरं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O best of kings, when Sharmishtha thus promised to be the maid-servant of Devayani, she then thus spoke to her father.

data.v: प्रविशामि पुरं तात तुष्टास्मि द्विजसत्तम । अमोघं तव विज्ञानमस्ति विद्याबलं च ते ॥
data.md: Devayani said : () best of Brahmanas, O father, I am satisfied. I shall now enter the Asura capital. I know your science and power of knowledge is not futile.

data.v: एवमुक्तो दुहित्रा स द्विजश्रेष्ठो महायशाः । प्रविवेश पुरं हृष्टः पूजितः सर्वदानवैः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed by his daughter, that best of Brahmanas, that illustrious man entered the capital with all happiness, sand he was worshipped by all the Danavas.

data.v: अथ दीर्घस्य कालस्य देवयानी नृपोत्तम । वनं तदेव निर्याता क्रीडार्थं वरवर्णिनी ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O best of kings, after a long time the beautiful Devayani went to the same wood to sport.

data.v: तेन दासीसहस्रेण सार्धं शर्मिष्ठया तदा । तमेव देशं संप्राप्ता यथाकामं चचार सा । ताभिः सखीभिः सहिता सर्वाभिर्मुदिता भृशम् ॥
data.md: She reached the spot with Sharmishtha and her one thousand maids. She wandered about at pleasure. She felt herself very happy, being waited upon by these companions. They all sported there, they drank the honey of the flowers. They ate various fruits, (they threw away many) after biting. The king (Yayati), the son of Nahusha, in the course of his wanderings for hunting again came there, tired and thirsty. He saw Devayani and Sharmishtha and all those maidens.

data.v: क्रीडन्त्योऽभिरताः सर्वाः पिबन्त्यो मधुमाधवीम् । खादन्त्यो विविधान्भक्ष्यान्विदशन्त्यः फलानि च ॥
पुनश्च नाहुषो राजा मृगलिप्सुर्यदृच्छया । तमेव देशं संप्राप्तो जलार्थी श्रमकर्शितः ॥
ददृशे देवयानीं च शर्मिष्ठां ताश्च योषितः । पिबन्तीर्ललमानाश्च दिव्याभरणभूषिताः ॥
उपविष्टां च ददृशे देवयानीं शुचिस्मिताम् । रूपेणाप्रतिमां तासां स्त्रीणां मध्ये वराङ्गनाम् । शर्मिष्ठया सेव्यमानां पादसंवाहनादिभिः ॥
data.md: She was matchless in beauty and the most handsome of all the damsels. She was waited upon by Sharmishtha who was gently pressing her feet.

data.v: द्वाभ्यां कन्यासहस्राभ्यां द्वे कन्ये परिवारिते । गोत्रे च नामनी चैव द्वयोः पृच्छामि वामहम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O amiable ladies, it seems that these one thousands maids wait on you two. I would ask you (to tell me) both your names and parentage.

data.v: आख्यास्याम्यहमादत्स्व वचनं मे नराधिप । शुक्रो नामासुरगुरुः सुतां जानीहि तस्य माम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O king, hear my words, Know that I am the daughter of Shukra, the preceptor of the Asuras.

data.v: इयं च मे सखी दासी यत्राहं तत्र गामिनी । दुहिता दानवेन्द्रस्य शर्मिष्ठा वृषपर्वणः ॥
data.md: This my companion is my maid, she will go wherever I shall go. She is Sharmishtha, the daughter of the Asura king, Vrishaparva.

data.v: कथं नु ते सखी दासी कन्येयं वरवर्णिनी । असुरेन्द्रसुता सुभ्रु परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: Yayati said : I am curious to know why this lady of fair eye-brows, this most beautiful damsel, this daughter of the Asura king, companion, is your maid-servant?

data.v: सर्व एव नरव्याघ्र विधानमनुवर्तते । विधानविहितं मत्वा मा विचित्राः कथाः कृथाः ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O best of kings, everything comes to pass according to Fate. Do not be astonished at this. V:10w it to be also the result of Fate.

data.v: राजवद्रूपवेषौ ते ब्राह्मीं वाचं बिभर्षि च । किंनामा त्वं कुतश्चासि कस्य पुत्रश्च शंस मे ॥
data.md: Your features and attire are both like a king. Your speech is also like the words of the Vedas. Tell me your name. Whence have you come? Whose son are you?

data.v: ब्रह्मचर्येण कृत्स्नो मे वेदः श्रुतिपथं गतः । राजाहं राजपुत्रश्च ययातिरिति विश्रुतः ॥
data.md: this your Yayati said : In my Brahmacharya, the whole of the Vedas entered my ears. I am a king and a son of a king; I am known as Yayati.

data.v: केनास्यर्थेन नृपते इमं देशमुपागतः । जिघृक्षुर्वारिजं किंचिदथ वा मृगलिप्सया ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O king, why have you come here? Is it to gather lotuses, or to angle, or to hunt.

data.v: मृगलिप्सुरहं भद्रे पानीयार्थमुपागतः । बहु चाप्यनुयुक्तोऽस्मि तन्मानुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O amiable lady, I was thirsty in the pursuit of deer. I have come here in search of water. I wait but your commands to leave this place.

data.v: द्वाभ्यां कन्यासहस्राभ्यां दास्या शर्मिष्ठया सह । त्वदधीनास्मि भद्रं ते सखा भर्ता च मे भव ॥
data.md: Devayani said: Prosperity to you? Be my friend and husband. I wait for your commands with my two thousand damsels and Sharmishtha, my maid-servant.

data.v: विद्ध्यौशनसि भद्रं ते न त्वामर्होऽस्मि भामिनि । अविवाह्या हि राजानो देवयानि पितुस्तव ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O beautiful lady, I do not deserve you. You are the daughter of Shukra, (therefore) you are far superior to me. O Devayani, your father cannot bestow you on even great king.

data.v: संसृष्टं ब्रह्मणा क्षत्रं क्षत्रं च ब्रह्मसंहितम् । ऋषिश्च ऋषिपुत्रश्च नाहुषाङ्ग वहस्व माम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : Brahmanas have already been mixed with Kshatriyas and Kshatriyas with Brahmanas. You are a son of a Rishi and a yourself a Rishi. Therefore, O son of Nahusha, marry me.

data.v: एकदेहोद्भवा वर्णाश्चत्वारोऽपि वराङ्गने । पृथग्धर्माः पृथक्शौचास्तेषां तु ब्राह्मणो वरः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O beautiful lady, the four orders have no doubt sprung from one body. But they have different duties and virtues, which are not the same (for every order.) The Brahmanas are superior to all.

data.v: पाणिधर्मो नाहुषायं न पुम्भिः सेवितः पुरा । तं मे त्वमग्रहीरग्रे वृणोमि त्वामहं ततः ॥
data.md: Devayani said : This hand of mine was never touched by any man except you. Therefore, I accept you as my husband.

data.v: कथं नु मे मनस्विन्याः पाणिमन्यः पुमान्स्पृशेत् । गृहीतमृषिपुत्रेण स्वयं वाप्यृषिणा त्वया ॥
data.md: How will any other man touch my hand of wise one which is touched by you who are a Rishi?

data.v: क्रुद्धादाशीविषात्सर्पाज्ज्वलनात्सर्वतोमुखात् । दुराधर्षतरो विप्रः पुरुषेण विजानता ॥
data.md: Yayati said : The wise men know that a Brahmana is to be avoided than an angry and virulently poisonous snake, or a blazing and flaming fire.

data.v: कथमाशीविषात्सर्पाज्ज्वलनात्सर्वतोमुखात् । दुराधर्षतरो विप्र इत्यात्थ पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O best of men, why do you say that a Brahmana is to be avoided like an angry and virulently poisonous snake, or a blazing and flaming fire?

data.v: एकमाशीविषो हन्ति शस्त्रेणैकश्च वध्यते । हन्ति विप्रः सराष्ट्राणि पुराण्यपि हि कोपितः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : The snake kills only one. The sharpest weapon kills but a single person. But the Brahmana, if angry, destroys many cities and kingdoms. Therefore, O beautiful lady, I think that Brahmanas should be avoided more than the two, (the snake and the fire) O amiable lady, I cannot marry you, unless your father bestows you on me.

data.v: दुराधर्षतरो विप्रस्तस्माद्भीरु मतो मम । अतोऽदत्तां च पित्रा त्वां भद्रे न विवहाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : The snake kills only one. The sharpest weapon kills but a single person. But the Brahmana, if angry, destroys many cities and kingdoms. Therefore, O beautiful lady, I think that Brahmanas should be avoided more than the two, (the snake and the fire) O amiable lady, I cannot marry you, unless your father bestows you on me.

data.v: दत्तां वहस्व पित्रा मां त्वं हि राजन्वृतो मया । अयाचतो भयं नास्ति दत्तां च प्रतिगृह्णतः ॥
data.md: Devayani said : You are chosen by me. O king it is then settled that you will accept me if my father bestows you on me. You need not fear in accept my humble self, if bestowed on you. You have not asked for me.

data.v: त्वरितं देवयान्याथ प्रेषितं पितुरात्मनः । श्रुत्वैव च स राजानं दर्शयामास भार्गवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Devayani quickly sent a maid-servant to her father. The maid told Shukra all that had happened.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव चागतं शुक्रं ययातिः पृथिवीपतिः । ववन्दे ब्राह्मणं काव्यं प्राञ्जलिः प्रणतः स्थितः ॥
data.md: Having heard this, the son of Bhrigu went to see the king. The king of the world Yayati, seeing that Shukra was coming, bowed to him. He worshipped and adored that Brahmana and stood before him with joined hands to receive his commands.

data.v: राजायं नाहुषस्तात दुर्गे मे पाणिमग्रहीत् । नमस्ते देहि मामस्मै नान्यं लोके पतिं वृणे ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O father, this is the son of Nahusha. He took hold of my hand when I was in difficulty (thrown into the well), Bestow me on him. I shall not marry any other man in the world.

data.v: वृतोऽनया पतिर्वीर सुतया त्वं ममेष्टया । गृहाणेमां मया दत्तां महिषीं नहुषात्मज ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O splendidly courageous king, you have been accepted by my dear daughter as her husband. I bestow her on you. Therefore, O son of Nahusha, accept her as your wife.

data.v: अधर्मो न स्पृशेदेवं महान्मामिह भार्गव । वर्णसंकरजो ब्रह्मन्निति त्वां प्रवृणोम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O Brahmana, I solicit the boon by which the sin of my begetting a mixed caste may not touch me.

data.v: अधर्मात्त्वां विमुञ्चामि वरयस्व यथेप्षितम् । अस्मिन्विवाहे मा ग्लासीरहं पापं नुदामि ते ॥
data.md: Shukra said: I shall absolve you from the sin (of begetting a mixed caste). Fear not to marry her. grant you absolution.

data.v: वहस्व भार्यां धर्मेण देवयानीं सुमध्यमाम् । अनया सह संप्रीतिमतुलां समवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Maintain virtuously your wife, Devayani of beautiful slender waist. Let great happiness be yours in her company.

data.v: इयं चापि कुमारी ते शर्मिष्ठा वार्षपर्वणी । संपूज्या सततं राजन्मा चैनां शयने ह्वयेः ॥
data.md: O king, this maiden, Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva, should always be respected by you. But you must no call her to your bed.

data.v: एवमुक्तो ययातिस्तु शुक्रं कृत्वा प्रदक्षिणम् । जगाम स्वपुरं हृष्टो अनुज्ञातो महात्मना ॥
data.md: Having received from Shukra a rich treasure in Devayani with Sharmishtha and two thousand maidens. That best of kings, being duly honoured by Shukra and the Asuras, returned to his capital, after receiving the commands of the illustrious of Bhrigu.

data.v: ययातिः स्वपुरं प्राप्य महेन्द्रपुरसंनिभम् । प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं तत्र देवयानीं न्यवेशयत् ॥
देवयान्याश्चानुमते तां सुतां वृषपर्वणः । अशोकवनिकाभ्याशे गृहं कृत्वा न्यवेशयत् ॥
वृतां दासीसहस्रेण शर्मिष्ठामासुरायणीम् । वासोभिरन्नपानैश्च संविभज्य सुसत्कृताम् ॥
देवयान्या तु सहितः स नृपो नहुषात्मजः । विजहार बहूनब्दान्देववन्मुदितो भृशम् ॥
data.md: The king, the son of Nahusha, happily passed many years in the company of Devayani.

data.v: ऋतुकाले तु संप्राप्ते देवयानी वराङ्गना । लेभे गर्भं प्रथमतः कुमारं च व्यजायत ॥
data.md: The beautiful lady, Devayani conceived when her season came. She gave birth to her eldest child which was a boy.

data.v: गते वर्षसहस्रे तु शर्मिष्ठा वार्षपर्वणी । ददर्श यौवनं प्राप्ता ऋतुं सा चान्वचिन्तयत् ॥
data.md: When one thousand years had passed away, Sharmishtha, the daughter of Vrishaparva, attained her puberty and her season came. She (therefore) began to ponder.

data.v: ऋतुकालश्च संप्राप्तो न च मेऽस्ति पतिर्वृतः । किं प्राप्तं किं नु कर्तव्यं किं वा कृत्वा कृतं भवेत् ॥
data.md: (She said to herself), "My season has come. But I have not yet chosen a husband. What would happen? What should I do? How am I to accomplish my wishes?

data.v: देवयानी प्रजातासौ वृथाहं प्राप्तयौवना । यथा तया वृतो भर्ता तथैवाहं वृणोमि तम् ॥
data.md: Devayani has given birth to a son. My youth is in vain. I shall choose him as my husband whom Devayani has chosen.

data.v: राज्ञा पुत्रफलं देयमिति मे निश्चिता मतिः । अपीदानीं स धर्मात्मा इयान्मे दर्शनं रहः ॥
data.md: The king should give me a son. This is a firm resolve. Will not that virtuous-minded king grant me a private interview?

data.v: अथ निष्क्रम्य राजासौ तस्मिन्काले यदृच्छया । अशोकवनिकाभ्याशे शर्मिष्ठां प्राप्य विष्ठितः ॥
data.md: (One day) the king listlessly came to the Ashoka grove and seeing Sharmishtha he stood before her.

data.v: तमेकं रहिते दृष्ट्वा शर्मिष्ठा चारुहासिनी । प्रत्युद्गम्याञ्जलिं कृत्वा राजानं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha, of sweet smiles, finding the king alone before her, thus addressed the king with joined hands.

data.v: सोमस्येन्द्रस्य विष्णोर्वा यमस्य वरुणस्य वा । तव वा नाहुष कुले कः स्त्रियं स्प्रष्टुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: O son of Nahusha, none can see the ladies that dwell in the inner-apartments of Soma, Indra, Vishnu, Yama, Varuna and your own. O king, you know that I am handsome and wellborn. O great king, I solicit you. My season has come. See that it goes not in vain.

data.v: रूपाभिजनशीलैर्हि त्वं राजन्वेत्थ मां सदा । सा त्वां याचे प्रसाद्याहमृतुं देहि नराधिप ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: O son of Nahusha, none can see the ladies that dwell in the inner-apartments of Soma, Indra, Vishnu, Yama, Varuna and your own. O king, you know that I am handsome and wellborn. O great king, I solicit you. My season has come. See that it goes not in vain.

data.v: वेद्मि त्वां शीलसंपन्नां दैत्यकन्यामनिन्दिताम् । रूपे च ते न पश्यामि सूच्यग्रमपि निन्दितम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : I know very well the great birth of yours, born as you are in the race of the Danavas. You are also exceedingly beautiful. I do not find the least defeat in your beauty.

data.v: अब्रवीदुशना काव्यो देवयानीं यदावहम् । नेयमाह्वयितव्या ते शयने वार्षपर्वणी ॥
data.md: Ushanas, the son of Kavi, however, commanded me when I was married to Devayani that Vrishaparva's daughter shall not be my bed.

data.v: न नर्मयुक्तं वचनं हिनस्ति; न स्त्रीषु राजन्न विवाहकाले । प्राणात्यये सर्वधनापहारे; पञ्चानृतान्याहुरपातकानि ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: It is not sinful to speak falsehood in the following five cases, namely in joke, in respect of women to be associated with, in marriage, in prospect of immediate death and at the time of the loss of one's whole fortune.

data.v: पृष्टं तु साक्ष्ये प्रवदन्तमन्यथा; वदन्ति मिथ्योपहितं नरेन्द्र । एकार्थतायां तु समाहितायां; मिथ्या वदन्तमनृतं हिनस्ति ॥
data.md: O king, it is not true that he is fallen who does not speak out the truth when asked (for there are occasions when to speak falsehood is an act of piety.) The falsehood is sinful when one (harmful) object is to be accomplished.

data.v: राजा प्रमाणं भूतानां स नश्येत मृषा वदन् । अर्थकृच्छ्रमपि प्राप्य न मिथ्या कर्तुमुत्सहे ॥
data.md: Yayati said : A king should be a model prince in the eyes of his people. That king who speaks falsehood is sure to meet with his destruction. I do not dare to speak a lie, though the greatest losses threaten me.

data.v: समावेतौ मतौ राजन्पतिः सख्याश्च यः पतिः । समं विवाहमित्याहुः सख्या मेऽसि पतिर्वृतः ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: O king, you have been chosen by my friends as her husband. One's friend's marriage is the same as one's own. You are, therefore, as much my husband (as Devayani's).

data.v: दातव्यं याचमानेभ्य इति मे व्रतमाहितम् । त्वं च याचसि मां कामं ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते ॥
data.md: Yayati said : It is one of my strict vows no doubt that I should grant what is asked of me. You ask me (to grant you a favour). Therefore, tell me what should I do?

data.v: अधर्मात्त्राहि मां राजन्धर्मं च प्रतिपादय । त्वत्तोऽपत्यवती लोके चरेयं धर्ममुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : O king, save me from sin. Protect my virtue. Becoming a mother by you, let me perform the greatest pious act in the world.

data.v: त्रय एवाधना राजन्भार्या दासस्तथा सुतः । यत्ते समधिगच्छन्ति यस्य ते तस्य तद्धनम् ॥
data.md: O king, it is ordained that three persons can never earn wealth for themselves. They are the wife, the slave and the son. That which they earn belong to him who owns them.

data.v: देवयान्या भुजिष्यास्मि वश्या च तव भार्गवी । सा चाहं च त्वया राजन्भरणीये भजस्व माम् ॥
data.md: O king, I am the slave of Devayani, the lady of the Bhrigu race. You are Devayani's master and lord. Therefore, you are my master and lord as well. I solicit you. Fulfill my wishes.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु राजा स तथ्यमित्येव जज्ञिवान् । पूजयामास शर्मिष्ठां धर्मं च प्रत्यपादयत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thus having been addressed by Sharmishtha, the king was persuaded to believe that what she said was true. He fulfilled Sharmishtha's wishes and thus protected her virtue.

data.v: समागम्य च शर्मिष्ठां यथाकाममवाप्य च । अन्योन्यमभिसंपूज्य जग्मतुस्तौ यथागतम् ॥
data.md: They passed some time together. They took affectionate farewell of each other and separated. Each went whence they came.

data.v: तस्मिन्समागमे सुभ्रूः शर्मिष्ठा चारुहासिनी । लेभे गर्भं प्रथमतस्तस्मान्नृपतिसत्तमात् ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha of sweet smiles and fair eyebrows conceived in consequence of that connection with that best of kings.

data.v: प्रजज्ञे च ततः काले राजन्राजीवलोचना । कुमारं देवगर्भाभं राजीवनिभलोचनम् ॥
data.md: O king, in due time the lotus-eyed lady (Sharmishtha) gave birth to a son, as effulgent as a celestial child and with eyes like lotus leaves.

data.v: श्रुत्वा कुमारं जातं तु देवयानी शुचिस्मिता । चिन्तयामास दुःखार्ता शर्मिष्ठां प्रति भारत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O descendant of the Bharata race, when Devayani heard of the birth of this boy, she ! became very sorry and Sharmishtha became an object of her sad reflections. Going to Sharmishtha, Devayani thus spoke to her.

data.v: अभिगम्य च शर्मिष्ठां देवयान्यब्रवीदिदम् । किमिदं वृजिनं सुभ्रु कृतं ते कामलुब्धया ॥
data.md: Devayani said: O girl of fair-eye-brows, what sin is this you have committed out of lust!

data.v: ऋषिरभ्यागतः कश्चिद्धर्मात्मा वेदपारगः । स मया वरदः कामं याचितो धर्मसंहितम् ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: A Rishi of virtuous mind, learned in the Vedas, came to me. He was capable of granting boons and he was solicited by me to grant my wishes based on virtue.

data.v: नाहमन्यायतः काममाचरामि शुचिस्मिते । तस्मादृषेर्ममापत्यमिति सत्यं ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: O lady of sweet smiles, I would never seek the fulfillment of my desires by sinful means. I tell you truly, this child was begotten by a Rishi.

data.v: शोभनं भीरु सत्यं चेदथ स ज्ञायते द्विजः । गोत्रनामाभिजनतो वेत्तुमिच्छामि तं द्विजम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said: O timid maiden, it is all right if that is the case. If you know the lineage, the name and the family of that Brahmana, tell me I wish to hear them. my
