data.v: ओजसा तेजसा चैव दीप्यमानं रविं यथा । तं दृष्ट्वा मम संप्रष्टुं शक्तिर्नासीच्छुचिस्मिते ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said : O lady of sweet smiles, that Rishi was as effulgent in asceticism and energy as the sun. Seeing him, I had no power of making these enquiries.

data.v: यद्येतदेवं शर्मिष्ठे न मन्युर्विद्यते मम । अपत्यं यदि ते लब्धं ज्येष्ठाच्छ्रेष्ठाच्च वै द्विजात् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O Sharmishtha, If this be true, if you have received this your son from such a great Brahmana, I have then no cause for anger.

data.v: अन्योन्यमेवमुक्त्वा च संप्रहस्य च ते मिथः । जगाम भार्गवी वेश्म तथ्यमित्येव जज्ञुषी ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: They talked and laughed with each other and then they separated, (Devayani) the daughter of the Bhrigu race going to her mansion and believing what Sharmishtha told her.

data.v: ययातिर्देवयान्यां तु पुत्रावजनयन्नृपः । यदुं च तुर्वसुं चैव शक्रविष्णू इवापरौ ॥
data.md: O king, Yayati begot on Devayani two more sons (namely) Yadu and Turvasu, who were like Indra and Vishnu.

data.v: तस्मादेव तु राजर्षेः शर्मिष्ठा वार्षपर्वणी । द्रुह्युं चानुं च पूरुं च त्रीन्कुमारानजीजनत् ॥
data.md: The daughter of Vrishaparva, Sharmishtha, by that royal sage gave birth to three sons in all, namely Druhyu, Anu and Puru.

data.v: ततः काले तु कस्मिंश्चिद्देवयानी शुचिस्मिता । ययातिसहिता राजन्निर्जगाम महावनम् ॥
data.md: O king, one day Devayani of sweet smiles went with Yayati into a solitary part of the royal park.

data.v: ददर्श च तदा तत्र कुमारान्देवरूपिणः । क्रीडमानान्सुविश्रब्धान्विस्मिता चेदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: There she saw three children of celestial beauty, playing with perfect ease. She was surprised and thus spoke to the king.

data.v: कस्यैते दारका राजन्देवपुत्रोपमाः शुभाः । वर्चसा रूपतश्चैव सदृशा मे मतास्तव ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O king, whose children are these, so handsome, so like the children of the celestial? They are exactly like you in splendour and beauty.

data.v: एवं पृष्ट्वा तु राजानं कुमारान्पर्यपृच्छत । किंनामधेयगोत्रो वः पुत्रका ब्राह्मणः पिता । विब्रूत मे यथातथ्यं श्रोतुमिच्छामि तं ह्यहम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : O children, what if your lineage! Who is your father? Answer me truly. I desire to know all.

data.v: तेऽदर्शयन्प्रदेशिन्या तमेव नृपसत्तमम् । शर्मिष्ठां मातरं चैव तस्याचख्युश्च दारकाः ॥
data.md: The children then pointed to the king with their fingers and said that Sharmishtha was their mother.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा सहितास्ते तु राजानमुपचक्रमुः । नाभ्यनन्दत तान्राजा देवयान्यास्तदान्तिके । रुदन्तस्तेऽथ शर्मिष्ठामभ्ययुर्बालकास्ततः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having said this, they came to the king to clasp his knees. But the king dared not caress them before Devayani.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तु तेषां बालानां प्रणयं पार्थिवं प्रति । बुद्ध्वा च तत्त्वतो देवी शर्मिष्ठामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Seeing the affection of the boys towards the king, (Devayani) understood all. All the addressed Sharmishtha thus :

data.v: मदधीना सती कस्मादकार्षीर्विप्रियं मम । तमेवासुरधर्मं त्वमास्थिता न बिभेषि किम् ॥
data.md: Devayani said : How have you dared to do me an injury, dependant as you are on me? Do you not fear to have recourse once more to your Asura conduct?

data.v: यदुक्तमृषिरित्येव तत्सत्यं चारुहासिनि । न्यायतो धर्मतश्चैव चरन्ती न बिभेमि ते ॥
data.md: Sharmishtha said: O lady of sweet smiles! all that I told you about the Rishi is quite true. My acts were according to the precepts of virtue and right.

data.v: यदा त्वया वृतो राजा वृत एव तदा मया । सखीभर्ता हि धर्मेण भर्ता भवति शोभने ॥
data.md: Therefore, I am not afraid of you. When you chose the king as your husband, I too did the same. O beautiful lady, a friend's husband is one's own husband according to the precept of religion. You are a daughter of a Brahmana and therefore you deserve my greatest worship and regard. Do you no know that this royal sage (Yayati) is the object of greater esteem to me?

data.v: पूज्यासि मम मान्या च ज्येष्ठा श्रेष्ठा च ब्राह्मणी । त्वत्तोऽपि मे पूज्यतमो राजर्षिः किं न वेत्थ तत् ॥
data.md: Therefore, I am not afraid of you. When you chose the king as your husband, I too did the same. O beautiful lady, a friend's husband is one's own husband according to the precept of religion. You are a daughter of a Brahmana and therefore you deserve my greatest worship and regard. Do you no know that this royal sage (Yayati) is the object of greater esteem to me?

data.v: श्रुत्वा तस्यास्ततो वाक्यं देवयान्यब्रवीदिदम् । राजन्नाद्येह वत्स्यामि विप्रियं मे कृतं त्वया ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard these words, Devayani said, "O king, you have wronged me, I will not live here any longer."

data.v: सहसोत्पतितां श्यामां दृष्ट्वा तां साश्रुलोचनाम् । त्वरितं सकाशं काव्यस्य प्रस्थितां व्यथितस्तदा ॥
data.md: Having said this, she with tearful eyes quickly rose to go away to her father. And the king was grieved to see her thus angry.

data.v: अनुवव्राज संभ्रान्तः पृष्ठतः सान्त्वयन्नृपः । न्यवर्तत न चैव स्म क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना ॥
data.md: He became very much alarmed; and he followed her, trying to appease her wrath. But she did not return. Her eyes were red in anger.

data.v: अविब्रुवन्ती किंचित्तु राजानं चारुलोचना । अचिरादिव संप्राप्ता काव्यस्योशनसोऽन्तिकम् ॥
data.md: She did not speak a word to the king, but she, with her eyes full of tears, soon reached her father, Ushanas, the son of Kavi.

data.v: सा तु दृष्ट्वैव पितरमभिवाद्याग्रतः स्थिता । अनन्तरं ययातिस्तु पूजयामास भार्गवम् ॥
data.md: Seeing her father, she made to him due salutation and stood before him. Yayati also came immediately after her and he saluted and worshipped the son of Bhrigu.

data.v: अधर्मेण जितो धर्मः प्रवृत्तमधरोत्तरम् । शर्मिष्ठयातिवृत्तास्मि दुहित्रा वृषपर्वणः ॥
data.md: Devayani said: O father, virtue has been defeated by vice. The low have risen and the high have fallen. I have been insulted by the daughter of Vrishaparva.

data.v: त्रयोऽस्यां जनिताः पुत्रा राज्ञानेन ययातिना । दुर्भगाया मम द्वौ तु पुत्रौ तात ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: Three sons have been begotten on her by this king Yayati. O father, unfortunate am I! I have got only two sons.

data.v: धर्मज्ञ इति विख्यात एष राजा भृगूद्वह । अतिक्रान्तश्च मर्यादां काव्यैतत्कथयामि ते ॥
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, this king is renowned for his knowledge in religion and virtue. But, O son of Kavi, I tell you, he has fallen from the path of virtue.

data.v: धर्मज्ञः सन्महाराज योऽधर्ममकृथाः प्रियम् । तस्माज्जरा त्वामचिराद्धर्षयिष्यति दुर्जया ॥
data.md: Shukra said: ( king, as you have made vice your favourite pursuit, though well-acquainted with the precepts of virtue, terrible decrepitude will overtake you.

data.v: ऋतुं वै याचमानाया भगवन्नान्यचेतसा । दुहितुर्दानवेन्द्रस्य धर्म्यमेतत्कृतं मया ॥
ऋतुं वै याचमानाया न ददाति पुमान्वृतः । भ्रूणहेत्युच्यते ब्रह्मन्स इह ब्रह्मवादिभिः ॥
अभिकामां स्त्रियं यस्तु गम्यां रहसि याचितः । नोपैति स च धर्मेषु भ्रूणहेत्युच्यते बुधैः ॥
इत्येतानि समीक्ष्याहं कारणानि भृगूद्वह । अधर्मभयसंविग्नः शर्मिष्ठामुपजग्मिवान् ॥
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, for these reason and being afraid of committing a sin, I went to Sharmishtha.

data.v: नन्वहं प्रत्यवेक्ष्यस्ते मदधीनोऽसि पार्थिव । मिथ्याचारस्य धर्मेषु चौर्यं भवति नाहुष ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O king, you are dependent on me. You should have waited to receive my command. O son of Nahusha, having acted falsely in the matter of your duty, you have committed the sin of theft.

data.v: क्रुद्धेनोशनसा शप्तो ययातिर्नाहुषस्तदा । पूर्वं वयः परित्यज्य जरां सद्योऽन्वपद्यत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said :; Thus being cursed by the angry Ushanas, Yayati, the son of Nahusha, was then deprived of his youth and terrible decrepitude soon overcame him.

data.v: अतृप्तो यौवनस्याहं देवयान्यां भृगूद्वह । प्रसादं कुरु मे ब्रह्मञ्जरेयं मा विशेत माम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O son of Bhrigu, I have not been as yet satiated with youth of Devayani. Therefore, O Brahmana, be graceful to Let not decrepitude overcome me. me.

data.v: नाहं मृषा ब्रवीम्येतज्जरां प्राप्तोऽसि भूमिप । जरां त्वेतां त्वमन्यस्मै संक्रामय यदीच्छसि ॥
data.md: Shukra said : I never speak an untruth, O king, (see), you have been immediately attacked by old age. But if you like, you can transfer this decrepitude to some other man.

data.v: राज्यभाक्स भवेद्ब्रह्मन्पुण्यभाक्कीर्तिभाक्तथा । यो मे दद्याद्वयः पुत्रस्तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O Brahmana, let this be ordered by you that, the son of mine who will accept my this old age will enjoy my kingdom and gain both virtue and fame.

data.v: संक्रामयिष्यसि जरां यथेष्टं नहुषात्मज । मामनुध्याय भावेन न च पापमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O son of Nahusha, remembering me you will be able to transfer your this decrepitude to whomever you like. Your that son who will give you his youth will become your successor on the throne. He will have long life, widespread fame and a large progeny.

data.v: वयो दास्यति ते पुत्रो यः स राजा भविष्यति । आयुष्मान्कीर्तिमांश्चैव बह्वपत्यस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: Shukra said: O son of Nahusha, remembering me you will be able to transfer your this decrepitude to whomever you like. Your that son who will give you his youth will become your successor on the throne. He will have long life, widespread fame and a large progeny.

data.v: जरां प्राप्य ययातिस्तु स्वपुरं प्राप्य चैव ह । पुत्रं ज्येष्ठं वरिष्ठं च यदुमित्यब्रवीद्वचः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus attacked by old age, Yayati returned to his capital. He summoned his eldest and accomplished son Yadu and thus spoke to him.

data.v: जरा वली च मां तात पलितानि च पर्यगुः । काव्यस्योशनसः शापान्न च तृप्तोऽस्मि यौवने ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O child; Old age, wrinkles and white hair have come over to me by the curse the son of Kavi who is called Ushanas. But I am not yet satiated with youth.

data.v: त्वं यदो प्रतिपद्यस्व पाप्मानं जरया सह । यौवनेन त्वदीयेन चरेयं विषयानहम् ॥
data.md: O Turvasu, take upon yourself my decrepitude and consequent weakness. I wish to enjoy the pleasures of life with your youth.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु पुनस्ते यौवनं त्वहम् । दत्त्वा स्वं प्रतिपत्स्यामि पाप्मानं जरया सह ॥
data.md: After the expiration of one thousand years, I shall return, to you, your youth and take back my decrepitude and its consequent weakness.

data.v: सितश्मश्रुशिरा दीनो जरया शिथिलीकृतः । वलीसंततगात्रश्च दुर्दर्शो दुर्बलः कृशः ॥
data.md: White hair, cheerlessness, relaxation of nerves, wrinkles, all the body, deformities, weakness, leanness, inability of work, these the consequences of decrepitude. Even friends and dependants forsake an old decrepit man.

data.v: अशक्तः कार्यकरणे परिभूतः स यौवनैः । सहोपजीविभिश्चैव तां जरां नाभिकामये ॥
data.md: White hair, cheerlessness, relaxation of nerves, wrinkles, all the body, deformities, weakness, leanness, inability of work, these the consequences of decrepitude. Even friends and dependants forsake an old decrepit man.

data.v: यत्त्वं मे हृदयाज्जातो वयः स्वं न प्रयच्छसि । तस्मादराज्यभाक्तात प्रजा ते वै भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O son, you have sprung from my heart, but you do not give me your youth. Therefore, your children will never be ruling kings.

data.v: तुर्वसो प्रतिपद्यस्व पाप्मानं जरया सह । यौवनेन चरेयं वै विषयांस्तव पुत्रक ॥
data.md: O Turvasu, take upon yourself my decrepitude and consequent weakness. I wish to enjoy the pleasures of life with your youth.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु पुनर्दास्यामि यौवनम् । स्वं चैव प्रतिपत्स्यामि पाप्मानं जरया सह ॥
data.md: After the expiration of one thousand years, I shall return, to you, your youth and take back my decrepitude and its consequent weakness.

data.v: न कामये जरां तात कामभोगप्रणाशिनीम् । बलरूपान्तकरणीं बुद्धिप्राणविनाशिनीम् ॥
data.md: Turvasu said : O father, I do not like old age. It destroys all pleasures and enjoyments, strength and beauty, the intellect and the memory, nay even life.

data.v: यत्त्वं मे हृदयाज्जातो वयः स्वं न प्रयच्छसि । तस्मात्प्रजा समुच्छेदं तुर्वसो तव यास्यति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : You are born from my heart, but you do not give me your youth. Therefore, O Turvasu, your line will be extinct.

data.v: संकीर्णाचारधर्मेषु प्रतिलोमचरेषु च । पिशिताशिषु चान्त्येषु मूढ राजा भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: You shall be the foolish king of those whose practise and precepts will be impure, whose women of superior birth will give birth to children by men of inferior birth, who will live on meat, who will be mean, who will not hesitate to appropriate the wives of their superiors, who will be like birds and beasts in their practise and who will be sinful and Mlecchas.

data.v: गुरुदारप्रसक्तेषु तिर्यग्योनिगतेषु च । पशुधर्मिषु पापेषु म्लेच्छेषु प्रभविष्यसि ॥
data.md: You shall be the foolish king of those whose practise and precepts will be impure, whose women of superior birth will give birth to children by men of inferior birth, who will live on meat, who will be mean, who will not hesitate to appropriate the wives of their superiors, who will be like birds and beasts in their practise and who will be sinful and Mlecchas.

data.v: एवं स तुर्वसुं शप्त्वा ययातिः सुतमात्मनः । शर्मिष्ठायाः सुतं द्रुह्युमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Having thus cursed his son Turvasu, Yayati spoke to Sharmishtha's son Druhyu thus:

data.v: द्रुह्यो त्वं प्रतिपद्यस्व वर्णरूपविनाशिनीम् । जरां वर्षसहस्रं मे यौवनं स्वं ददस्व च ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O Druhyu, take upon yourself for one thousand years my decrepitude, destructive of beauty and complexion. Give me your youth.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु प्रतिदास्यामि यौवनम् । स्वं चादास्यामि भूयोऽहं पाप्मानं जरया सह ॥
data.md: After the expiration of one thousand years, I shall return to you your youth and take back my own decrepitude.

data.v: न गजं न रथं नाश्वं जीर्णो भुङ्क्ते न च स्त्रियम् । वाग्भङ्गश्चास्य भवति तज्जरां नाभिकामये ॥
data.md: Druhyu said: O king, one, if he is decrepit, cannot enjoy elephants, cars, horses or women. His voice also becomes indistinct. Therefore, I do no desire (to take upon myself) your old age.

data.v: यत्त्वं मे हृदयाज्जातो वयः स्वं न प्रयच्छसि । तस्माद्द्रुह्यो प्रियः कामो न ते संपत्स्यते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O son, you are sprung from my heart, but you refuse to give me your youth. Therefore, your cherished wishes will never be fulfilled.

data.v: उडुपप्लवसंतारो यत्र नित्यं भविष्यति । अराजा भोजशब्दं त्वं तत्रावाप्स्यसि सान्वयः ॥
data.md: You shall be a king only in name. You shall rule over a region where there will be no roads, no passages for horses, cars, elephants, asses, goats, bullocks, palanquins and other good vehicles, where the only means of locomotion will be rafts and floats. In such a place you will live with all your friends.

data.v: अनो त्वं प्रतिपद्यस्व पाप्मानं जरया सह । एकं वर्षसहस्रं तु चरेयं यौवनेन ते ॥
data.md: Yayati said: O Anu, take my decrepitude and its consequent weakness. I shall enjoy the pleasures of life for one thousand years with your youth.

data.v: जीर्णः शिशुवदादत्तेऽकालेऽन्नमशुचिर्यथा । न जुहोति च कालेऽग्निं तां जरां नाभिकामये ॥
data.md: Anu said: Those that are decrepit eat like children and they are always impure. They cannot pour libations on sacrificial fire at the proper time. Therefore, I do not like to take upon myself your old age.

data.v: यत्त्वं मे हृदयाज्जातो वयः स्वं न प्रयच्छसि । जरादोषस्त्वयोक्तोऽयं तस्मात्त्वं प्रतिपत्स्यसे ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O son, you are sprung from my heart, but you refuse to give me your youth. Therefore, your cherished wishes will never be fulfilled.

data.v: प्रजाश्च यौवनप्राप्ता विनशिष्यन्त्यनो तव । अग्निप्रस्कन्दनपरस्त्वं चाप्येवं भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O son, you have sprung from my heart, but you do not give me your youth. As you find so many faults with decrepitude, decrepitude will overcome you. Your sons will die as soon as they will attain to their youth. You shall not be able to perform any sacrifice before fire.

data.v: पूरो त्वं मे प्रियः पुत्रस्त्वं वरीयान्भविष्यसि । जरा वली च मे तात पलितानि च पर्यगुः । काव्यस्योशनसः शापान्न च तृप्तोऽस्मि यौवने ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O child; Old age, wrinkles and white hair have come over to me by the curse the son of Kavi who is called Ushanas. But I am not yet satiated with youth.

data.v: पूरो त्वं प्रतिपद्यस्व पाप्मानं जरया सह । कंचित्कालं चरेयं वै विषयान्वयसा तव ॥
data.md: O Turvasu, take upon yourself my decrepitude and consequent weakness. I wish to enjoy the pleasures of life with your youth.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु प्रतिदास्यामि यौवनम् । स्वं चैव प्रतिपत्स्यामि पाप्मानं जरया सह ॥
data.md: After the expiration of one thousand years, I shall return, to you, your youth and take back my decrepitude and its consequent weakness.

data.v: एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच पूरुः पितरमञ्जसा । यथात्थ मां महाराज तत्करिष्यामि ते वचः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed the king, Puru replied to him with all humility. (He said:) “O great king, I shall do as you command me to do.

data.v: प्रतिपत्स्यामि ते राजन्पाप्मानं जरया सह । गृहाण यौवनं मत्तश्चर कामान्यथेप्सितान् ॥
data.md: O king, I shall take upon myself your old age and its consequent weakness. Take my youth and enjoy as you like the pleasures of life.

data.v: जरयाहं प्रतिच्छन्नो वयोरूपधरस्तव । यौवनं भवते दत्त्वा चरिष्यामि यथात्थ माम् ॥
data.md: "Attacked by your old age, deprived of youth and beauty, I shall at your command live and give you my youth.”

data.v: पूरो प्रीतोऽस्मि ते वत्स प्रीतश्चेदं ददामि ते । सर्वकामसमृद्धा ते प्रजा राज्ये भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O Puru, my child, I am much pleased with you. I grant you the following boon with great pleasure. "The people of your kingdom will have all their desires fulfilled."

data.v: पौरवेणाथ वयसा ययातिर्नहुषात्मजः । प्रीतियुक्तो नृपश्रेष्ठश्चचार विषयान्प्रियान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having thus received the youth of Puru, Yayati the son of Nahusha, that best of kings, was exceedingly delighted. He again indulged in the pleasures of life.

data.v: यथाकामं यथोत्साहं यथाकालं यथासुखम् । धर्माविरुद्धान्राजेन्द्रो यथार्हति स एव हि ॥
data.md: He enjoyed himself to the full extent of his desires and to the full limit of his powers, as much as he desired and as the seasons called forth. But, O king, he did nothing against the precepts of religion.

data.v: देवानतर्पयद्यज्ञैः श्राद्धैस्तद्वत्पितॄनपि । दीनाननुग्रहैरिष्टैः कामैश्च द्विजसत्तमान् ॥
data.md: He pleased the celestials, by performing sacrifices, the Pitris by Shraddhas, the poor by charities and the good Brahmana by fulfilling their desires.

data.v: अतिथीनन्नपानैश्च विशश्च परिपालनैः । आनृशंस्येन शूद्रांश्च दस्यून्संनिग्रहेण च ॥
data.md: The guests by food and drink, the Vaishyas by protection, the Shudras by kindness and the robbers by proper punishments, Yayati pleased all classes of his subjects by ruling over them virtuously like Indra.

data.v: धर्मेण च प्रजाः सर्वा यथावदनुरञ्जयन् । ययातिः पालयामास साक्षादिन्द्र इवापरः ॥
data.md: The guests by food and drink, the Vaishyas by protection, the Shudras by kindness and the robbers by proper punishments, Yayati pleased all classes of his subjects by ruling over them virtuously like Indra.

data.v: स राजा सिंहविक्रान्तो युवा विषयगोचरः । अविरोधेन धर्मस्य चचार सुखमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That king was as powerful as the lion. He was young and enjoyed all the pleasures of life. He enjoyed unlimited happiness without violating the precepts of religion.

data.v: स संप्राप्य शुभान्कामांस्तृप्तः खिन्नश्च पार्थिवः । कालं वर्षसहस्रान्तं सस्मार मनुजाधिपः ॥
परिसंख्याय कालज्ञः कलाः काष्ठाश्च वीर्यवान् । पूर्णं मत्वा ततः कालं पूरुं पुत्रमुवाच ह ॥
यथाकामं यथोत्साहं यथाकालमरिंदम । सेविता विषयाः पुत्र यौवनेन मया तव ॥
data.md: O son, O chastiser of foes, I have enjoyed with your youth to the full extent of my desires and to the full limit of my powers and all according to their seasons.

data.v: पूरो प्रीतोऽस्मि भद्रं ते गृहाणेदं स्वयौवनम् । राज्यं चैव गृहाणेदं त्वं हि मे प्रियकृत्सुतः ॥
data.md: O Puru, I am exceedingly pleased with you. Take (back) your own youth. Prosperity be to you. Receive my kingdom. You are my son who has done my favourite work.

data.v: प्रतिपेदे जरां राजा ययातिर्नाहुषस्तदा । यौवनं प्रतिपेदे च पूरुः स्वं पुनरात्मनः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Yayati, the son of Nahusha, then received back his own old age and his son Puru also received back his youth.

data.v: अभिषेक्तुकामं नृपतिं पूरुं पुत्रं कनीयसम् । ब्राह्मणप्रमुखा वर्णा इदं वचनमब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Yayati became desirous of installing his youngest son Puru on the throne. But the four orders of his subject with Brahmanas at their

data.v: कथं शुक्रस्य नप्तारं देवयान्याः सुतं प्रभो । ज्येष्ठं यदुमतिक्रम्य राज्यं पूरोः प्रदास्यसि ॥
data.md: “O lord, how can you install Puru on the throne, passing over your eldest son Yadu, born of Devayani and grandson of Shukra?

data.v: यदुर्ज्येष्ठस्तव सुतो जातस्तमनु तुर्वसुः । शर्मिष्ठायाः सुतो द्रुह्युस्ततोऽनुः पूरुरेव च ॥
data.md: Yadu is your eldest son, after him was Turvasu. Then Sharmishtha's son Druhyu, Anu and last Puru.

data.v: कथं ज्येष्ठानतिक्रम्य कनीयान्राज्यमर्हति । एतत्संबोधयामस्त्वां धर्मं त्वमनुपालय ॥
data.md: How it would be proper to pass over all the elders and install 1 the youngest? We represent this to you, act according to the precepts of religion.

data.v: ब्राह्मणप्रमुखा वर्णाः सर्वे शृण्वन्तु मे वचः । ज्येष्ठं प्रति यथा राज्यं न देयं मे कथंचन ॥
data.md: Yayati said : Hear all of you of the four orders of the caste with the Brahmanas at their head, why my kingdom should not be given to my eldest son.

data.v: मम ज्येष्ठेन यदुना नियोगो नानुपालितः । प्रतिकूलः पितुर्यश्च न स पुत्रः सतां मतः ॥
data.md: My commands were disobeyed by my eldest son. The opinion of the wise men is that the son disobeys his father is no son at all.

data.v: मातापित्रोर्वचनकृद्धितः पथ्यश्च यः सुतः । स पुत्रः पुत्रवद्यश्च वर्तते पितृमातृषु ॥
data.md: The son who obeys the commands of his father and mother, who is humble and a wellwisher of his parents and who loves them, is the best of sons.

data.v: यदुनाहमवज्ञातस्तथा तुर्वसुनापि च । द्रुह्युना चानुना चैव मय्यवज्ञा कृता भृशम् ॥
data.md: I have been slighted by Yadu and Turvasu; much have I been slighted by Druhyu and Anu.

data.v: पूरुणा मे कृतं वाक्यं मानितश्च विशेषतः । कनीयान्मम दायादो जरा येन धृता मम । मम कामः स च कृतः पूरुणा पुत्ररूपिणा ॥
data.md: Only Puru obeyed my commands and much have I been honoured and respected by him. He accepted my old age and therefore, though he is the youngest, yet he should be made king.

data.v: शुक्रेण च वरो दत्तः काव्येनोशनसा स्वयम् । पुत्रो यस्त्वानुवर्तेत स राजा पृथिवीपतिः । भवतोऽनुनयाम्येवं पूरू राज्येऽभिषिच्यताम् ॥
data.md: Puru is a great friend of mine and he did what was agreeable to me. And the son of Kavi, Ushanas, Shukra himself, granted me this boon. The son who would obey me would become the king and the lord of the earth. Therefore, I entreat you, let Puru be installed on the throne.

data.v: यः पुत्रो गुणसंपन्नो मातापित्रोर्हितः सदा । सर्वमर्हति कल्याणं कनीयानपि स प्रभो ॥
data.md: The people said : O king, it is true that, the son who is accomplished and who seeks the good of his parents, deserves all prosperity, though he is the youngest.

data.v: अर्हः पूरुरिदं राज्यं यः सुतः प्रियकृत्तव । वरदानेन शुक्रस्य न शक्यं वक्तुमुत्तरम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, Puru, who has done good to you, deserve, to have the kingdom. As Shukra has granted this boon, we have no power to say anything.

data.v: पौरजानपदैस्तुष्टैरित्युक्तो नाहुषस्तदा । अभ्यषिञ्चत्ततः पूरुं राज्ये स्वे सुतमात्मजम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Having been thus addressed the contented people the son of Nahusha (Yayati) installed his son Puru on the throne.

data.v: दत्त्वा च पूरवे राज्यं वनवासाय दीक्षितः । पुरात्स निर्ययौ राजा ब्राह्मणैस्तापसैः सह ॥
data.md: Bestowing the kingdom on Puru he resolved to live in the forest and he left his capital with Brahmanas and ascetics.

data.v: यदोस्तु यादवा जातास्तुर्वसोर्यवनाः सुताः । द्रुह्योरपि सुता भोजा अनोस्तु म्लेच्छजातयः ॥
data.md: The son of Yadu are known as the Yadavas, those of Turvasu as the Yavanas, those of Druhyu as the Bhojas and those of Anu as the Mlecchas,

data.v: पूरोस्तु पौरवो वंशो यत्र जातोऽसि पार्थिव । इदं वर्षसहस्राय राज्यं कारयितुं वशी ॥
data.md: Those of Puru as the Pauravas, in which dynasty, O king, you are born to rule the country for one thousand years.

data.v: एवं स नाहुषो राजा ययातिः पुत्रमीप्सितम् । राज्येऽभिषिच्य मुदितो वानप्रस्थोऽभवन्मुनिः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having thus installed his dear son Puru on the throne, the son of Nahusha king Yayati, became very happy and accepted the Vanaprastha mode of life.

data.v: उषित्वा च वने वासं ब्राह्मणैः सह संश्रितः । फलमूलाशनो दान्तो यथा स्वर्गमितो गतः ॥
data.md: He lived in the forest with the Brahmanas, becoming self-controlled and living on fruits and roots. Thus patiently bearing privations of all sorts, he at last ascended to heaven.

data.v: स गतः सुरवासं तं निवसन्मुदितः सुखम् । कालस्य नातिमहतः पुनः शक्रेण पातितः ॥
data.md: Having thus ascended heaven, the king lived there in bliss. But some time after, he was hurled down (from heaven) by Indra. I have heard that having thus fallen from heaven, he stayed in the sky and did not fall on the earth.

data.v: निपतन्प्रच्युतः स्वर्गादप्राप्तो मेदिनीतलम् । स्थित आसीदन्तरिक्षे स तदेति श्रुतं मया ॥
data.md: Having thus ascended heaven, the king lived there in bliss. But some time after, he was hurled down (from heaven) by Indra. I have heard that having thus fallen from heaven, he stayed in the sky and did not fall on the earth.

data.v: तत एव पुनश्चापि गतः स्वर्गमिति श्रुतिः । राज्ञा वसुमता सार्धमष्टकेन च वीर्यवान् । प्रतर्दनेन शिबिना समेत्य किल संसदि ॥
data.md: I have heard that some tiine after, he again ascended heaven in company with greatly powerful Vasumana, Ashtaka, Pratardana and Shibi.

data.v: कर्मणा केन स दिवं पुनः प्राप्तो महीपतिः । सर्वमेतदशेषेण श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः । कथ्यमानं त्वया विप्र विप्रर्षिगणसंनिधौ ॥
देवराजसमो ह्यासीद्ययातिः पृथिवीपतिः । वर्धनः कुरुवंशस्य विभावसुसमद्युतिः ॥
तस्य विस्तीर्णयशसः सत्यकीर्तेर्महात्मनः । चरितं श्रोतुमिच्छामि दिवि चेह च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: O Brahmana, let this be narrated by you before all these Brahmana Rishis. The lord of the earth Yayati was like the king of the celestials (Indra). He was the progenitor of the exhaustive Kuru race; he was as effulgent as the sun. He was illustrious, world-wide famous and a man of wonderful achievements. I desire to hear in full the story of his life both here in this world and in heaven.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि ययातेरुत्तरां कथाम् । दिवि चेह च पुण्यार्थां सर्वपापप्रणाशिनीम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said: I shall narrate to you the excellent history of Yayati's exploits both here on earth and in heaven. The story is sacred and it destroys all the sins of those that hear it.

data.v: ययातिर्नाहुषो राजा पूरुं पुत्रं कनीयसम् । राज्येऽभिषिच्य मुदितः प्रवव्राज वनं तदा ॥
data.md: The son of Nahusha, king Yayati, having installed his youngest son Puru on the throne, went to the forest to lead the life of a recluse. He passed over the claims of his other sons with Yadu at their head and he lived in the forest on fruits and roots.

data.v: अन्तेषु स विनिक्षिप्य पुत्रान्यदुपुरोगमान् । फलमूलाशनो राजा वने संन्यवसच्चिरम् ॥
data.md: The son of Nahusha, king Yayati, having installed his youngest son Puru on the throne, went to the forest to lead the life of a recluse. He passed over the claims of his other sons with Yadu at their head and he lived in the forest on fruits and roots.

data.v: संशितात्मा जितक्रोधस्तर्पयन्पितृदेवताः । अग्नींश्च विधिवज्जुह्वन्वानप्रस्थविधानतः ॥
data.md: He brought his mind and his passions under complete control. He pleased the Pitris and celestial by performing sacrifices. He poured libations according to the prescribed rites of men leading the Vanaprastha.

data.v: अतिथीन्पूजयामास वन्येन हविषा विभुः । शिलोञ्छवृत्तिमास्थाय शेषान्नकृतभोजनः ॥
data.md: The illustrious king entertained the guests and strangers with fruits of the forest and ghee. He supported himself by eating only the scattered corn seeds.

data.v: पूर्णं वर्षसहस्रं स एवंवृत्तिरभून्नृपः । अब्भक्षः शरदस्त्रिंशदासीन्नियतवाङ्मनाः ॥
ततश्च वायुभक्षोऽभूत्संवत्सरमतन्द्रितः । पञ्चाग्निमध्ये च तपस्तेपे संवत्सरं नृपः ॥
एकपादस्थितश्चासीत्षण्मासाननिलाशनः । पुण्यकीर्तिस्ततः स्वर्गं जगामावृत्य रोदसी ॥
स्वर्गतः स तु राजेन्द्रो निवसन्देवसद्मनि । पूजितस्त्रिदशैः साध्यैर्मरुद्भिर्वसुभिस्तथा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When that great king was living in heaven, he was adored by the celestials, the Sadhyas, the Marutas and the Vasus.

data.v: देवलोकाद्ब्रह्मलोकं संचरन्पुण्यकृद्वशी । अवसत्पृथिवीपालो दीर्घकालमिति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: That doer of pious acts (Yayati) often went from the region of the celestials to the region of Brahma. It is heard that he lived in heaven for a long time.

data.v: स कदाचिन्नृपश्रेष्ठो ययातिः शक्रमागमत् । कथान्ते तत्र शक्रेण पृष्टः स पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: One day the best of kings, Yayati, went to Indra and in the course of conversation the lord of earth was asked by Indra.

data.v: यदा स पूरुस्तव रूपेण राज;ञ्जरां गृहीत्वा प्रचचार भूमौ । तदा राज्यं संप्रदायैव तस्मै; त्वया किमुक्तः कथयेह सत्यम् ॥
data.md: Indra said: O king, what did you say when Puru took your old age on earth and when you gave him his kingdom?

data.v: गङ्गायमुनयोर्मध्ये कृत्स्नोऽयं विषयस्तव । मध्ये पृथिव्यास्त्वं राजा भ्रातरोऽन्त्याधिपास्तव ॥
data.md: Yayati said : I told him the whole country between the rivers Ganges and the Yamuna which is in fact the central region of the earth, is yours. Your brothers will have the outlying regions.

data.v: अक्रोधनः क्रोधनेभ्यो विशिष्ट;स्तथा तितिक्षुरतितिक्षोर्विशिष्टः । अमानुषेभ्यो मानुषाश्च प्रधाना; विद्वांस्तथैवाविदुषः प्रधानः ॥
data.md: I told him, the men having no anger are superior to men with anger; men having forgiveness are superior to men having no forgiveness. Man is superior to animals and the learned to the ignorant.

data.v: आक्रुश्यमानो नाक्रोशेन्मन्युरेव तितिक्षतः । आक्रोष्टारं निर्दहति सुकृतं चास्य विन्दति ॥
data.md: If wronged, you should not wrong in return. One's anger, if not subdued, burns one's own self. If subdued, it procures the virtues of the doers of good acts.

data.v: नारुंतुदः स्यान्न नृशंसवादी; न हीनतः परमभ्याददीत । ययास्य वाचा पर उद्विजेत; न तां वदेद्रुशतीं पापलोक्याम् ॥
data.md: You should never give pain to others by cruel words. Never defeat your enemies by despicable means. Never utter such sinful and burning words as may give pain to others.

data.v: अरुंतुदं पुरुषं रूक्षवाचं; वाक्कण्टकैर्वितुदन्तं मनुष्यान् । विद्यादलक्ष्मीकतमं जनानां; मुखे निबद्धां निरृतिं वहन्तम् ॥
data.md: He who pricks another by the thorns of cruel words holds in his mouth a persecuting Rakshasa. Lakshmi (prosperity) leaves the man who casts his eyes on even such a man.

data.v: सद्भिः पुरस्तादभिपूजितः स्या;त्सद्भिस्तथा पृष्ठतो रक्षितः स्यात् । सदासतामतिवादांस्तितिक्षे;त्सतां वृत्तं चाददीतार्यवृत्तः ॥
data.md: You should always keep the virtuous man before you as your model. You should always compare your acts with those of the virtuous. You should always disregard the cruel words of the wicked.

data.v: वाक्सायका वदनान्निष्पतन्ति; यैराहतः शोचति रात्र्यहानि । परस्य वा मर्मसु ये पतन्ति; तान्पण्डितो नावसृजेत्परेषु ॥
data.md: He who keeps the arrows of cruel words in his lips weeps day and night. The cruel words strike at the inmost part of the body. The wise men never fling such arrows (of cruel words) at others.

data.v: न हीदृशं संवननं त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते । यथा मैत्री च भूतेषु दानं च मधुरा च वाक् ॥
data.md: There is nothing in the three worlds with which you can worship the deities as kindness, friendship, charity and sweet words.

data.v: तस्मात्सान्त्वं सदा वाच्यं न वाच्यं परुषं क्वचित् । पूज्यान्संपूजयेद्दद्यान्न च याचेत्कदाचन ॥
data.md: Therefore, you should always utter sweet words that give pleasure and not pain. You should always give and never beg. You should show respects to those that deserve your respect.

data.v: सर्वाणि कर्माणि समाप्य राज;न्गृहान्परित्यज्य वनं गतोऽसि । तत्त्वां पृच्छामि नहुषस्य पुत्र; केनासि तुल्यस्तपसा ययाते ॥
data.md: Indra said: O king, O son of Nahusha, O Yayati, after accomplishing all your duties, you went to the forest, leaving your home. I ask you, tell me like whom you are in ascetic merits.

data.v: नाहं देवमनुष्येषु न गन्धर्वमहर्षिषु । आत्मनस्तपसा तुल्यं कंचित्पश्यामि वासव ॥
data.md: Yayati said: O Vasava (Indra), I do not find among men, the celestials, the Gandharvas and great Rishis, any one equal to me in ascetic merits.

data.v: यदावमंस्थाः सदृशः श्रेयसश्च; पापीयसश्चाविदितप्रभावः । तस्माल्लोका अन्तवन्तस्तवेमे; क्षीणे पुण्ये पतितास्यद्य राजन् ॥
data.md: Indra said: O king, as you disregard those that are your superiors, those that are your equals and those that are your inferiors, your virtues, therefore, suffer a diminution and thus you must fall from heaven.

data.v: सुरर्षिगन्धर्वनरावमाना;त्क्षयं गता मे यदि शक्र लोकाः । इच्छेयं वै सुरलोकाद्विहीनः; सतां मध्ये पतितुं देवराज ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O king of the celestials, if my virtues have really been diminished (by my pride), let me fall at least among men who are virtuous and honest.

data.v: सतां सकाशे पतितासि राजं;श्च्युतः प्रतिष्ठां यत्र लब्धासि भूयः । एवं विदित्वा तु पुनर्ययाते; न तेऽवमान्याः सदृशः श्रेयसश्च ॥
data.md: Indra said: O king, you shall fall among those that are virtuous and honest. You shall also gain great renown. O Yayati, after your this experience, never again disregard any one, your superiors, your equals or even your inferiors.

data.v: ततः प्रहायामरराजजुष्टा;न्पुण्याँल्लोकान्पतमानं ययातिम् । संप्रेक्ष्य राजर्षिवरोऽष्टकस्त;मुवाच सद्धर्मविधानगोप्ता ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon Yayati fell from the region of the holy. And he was seen when thus falling by that royal sage, Ashtaka, the protector of religion. Seeing him he asked.

data.v: कस्त्वं युवा वासवतुल्यरूपः; स्वतेजसा दीप्यमानो यथाग्निः । पतस्युदीर्णाम्बुधरान्धकारा;त्खात्खेचराणां प्रवरो यथार्कः ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: Who are you, young as you are, as handsome as Indra, as prominent by your own splendour as that of fire? Who are you falling like the foremost ranger of the sky, the sun, driving away the dark masses of clouds?

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च त्वां सूर्यपथात्पतन्तं; वैश्वानरार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम् । किं नु स्विदेतत्पततीति सर्वे; वितर्कयन्तः परिमोहिताः स्मः ॥
data.md: Seeing you fall from the region of the sun, as effulgent as the fire or the sun, all men are asking themselves, "What is this that falls?" They are deprived of their consciousness.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च त्वां विष्ठितं देवमार्गे; शक्रार्कविष्णुप्रतिमप्रभावम् । अभ्युद्गतास्त्वां वयमद्य सर्वे; तत्त्वं पाते तव जिज्ञासमानाः ॥
data.md: Seeing you in the path of the celestials, as effulgent as Surya, Indra or Vishnu, we have all come to you to ascertain the truth.

data.v: न चापि त्वां धृष्णुमः प्रष्टुमग्रे; न च त्वमस्मान्पृच्छसि ये वयं स्मः । तत्त्वां पृच्छामः स्पृहणीयरूपं; कस्य त्वं वा किंनिमित्तं त्वमागाः ॥
data.md: O enviably handsome one, we would not have been guilty of incivility by first asking you who you are, if you would have asked us first who we are. We ask you, (tell us) who you are and why you come here?

data.v: भयं तु ते व्येतु विषादमोहौ; त्यजाशु देवेन्द्रसमानरूप । त्वां वर्तमानं हि सतां सकाशे; नालं प्रसोढुं बलहापि शक्रः ॥
data.md: O Indra-like great one, let your fears be dispelled, let your woes and afflictions cease. । You are now in the presence of the virtuous and the wise. Even Indra, the slayer of Bala, cannot do you any harm.

data.v: सन्तः प्रतिष्ठा हि सुखच्युतानां; सतां सदैवामरराजकल्प । ते संगताः स्थावरजङ्गमेशाः; प्रतिष्ठितस्त्वं सदृशेषु सत्सु ॥
data.md: O Indra-like great one, the honest and the virtuous are the support of their brethren. Here are assembled the protectors of the movable and the immovables of the world, the honest and the virtuous. You are now with such ones.

data.v: प्रभुरग्निः प्रतपने भूमिरावपने प्रभुः । प्रभुः सूर्यः प्रकाशित्वे सतां चाभ्यागतः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: As Agni is the lord that gives heat, as earth is the lord that holds the seed (and produces corn), as sun is the lord that dispels darkness, so is a guest the lord of the honest and the virtuous.

data.v: अहं ययातिर्नहुषस्य पुत्रः; पूरोः पिता सर्वभूतावमानात् । प्रभ्रंशितः सुरसिद्धर्षिलोका;त्परिच्युतः प्रपताम्यल्पपुण्यः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : I am Yayati, the son of Nahusha and the father of Puru. I am falling down from the region of the celestials, the Siddhas and the Rishis, for the diminution of my virtues. (I am falling), because I disregarded every creature on earth.

data.v: अहं हि पूर्वो वयसा भवद्भ्य;स्तेनाभिवादं भवतां न प्रयुञ्जे । यो विद्यया तपसा जन्मना वा; वृद्धः स पूज्यो भवति द्विजानाम् ॥
data.md: As I am older than in age, I did not salute you first. He who is older in age or superior in learning or asceticism is revered by Brahmanas.

data.v: अवादीश्चेद्वयसा यः स वृद्ध; इति राजन्नाभ्यवदः कथंचित् । यो वै विद्वान्वयसा सन्स्म वृद्धः; स एव पूज्यो भवति द्विजानाम् ॥
data.md: As I am older than in age, I did not salute you first. He who is older in age or superior in learning or asceticism is revered by Brahmanas.

data.v: प्रतिकूलं कर्मणां पापमाहु;स्तद्वर्ततेऽप्रवणे पापलोक्यम् । सन्तोऽसतां नानुवर्तन्ति चैत;द्यथा आत्मैषामनुकूलवादी ॥
data.md: Yayati said : It is said that sin destroys the merit of all virtuous acts. Vanity contains the element of that which leads to hell. The virtuous never follow the path of the sinful.

data.v: अभूद्धनं मे विपुलं महद्वै; विचेष्टमानो नाधिगन्ता तदस्मि । एवं प्रधार्यात्महिते निविष्टो; यो वर्तते स विजानाति जीवन् ॥
data.md: They act in a way as to increase their virtue. I myself had great religious merits, but all is now gone. I shall never be able to regain them with my best efforts. He, who will take lesson from my this fate, will be wise and virtueus.

data.v: नानाभावा बहवो जीवलोके; दैवाधीना नष्टचेष्टाधिकाराः । तत्तत्प्राप्य न विहन्येत धीरो; दिष्टं बलीय इति मत्वात्मबुद्ध्या ॥
data.md: No one should be proud of his great wealth; no one should feel exalted, because he has studied the entire Vedas. Men are of different dispositions in the world, but Destiny is supreme. Power and exertion are both futile and useless. Knowing Destiny to be supreme (over all), the wise should neither feel pride nor grief.

data.v: सुखं हि जन्तुर्यदि वापि दुःखं; दैवाधीनं विन्दति नात्मशक्त्या । तस्माद्दिष्टं बलवन्मन्यमानो; न संज्वरेन्नापि हृष्येत्कदाचित् ॥
data.md: Remembering that Destiny is supreme (over all), creatures should know that happiness and misery depend on Destiny and not on their own exertion and power.

data.v: दुःखे न तप्येन्न सुखेन हृष्ये;त्समेन वर्तेत सदैव धीरः । दिष्टं बलीय इति मन्यमानो; न संज्वरेन्नापि हृष्येत्कदाचित् ॥
data.md: The wise should always live contented, without grieving for misery or exalting for happiness. When Destiny is supreme, both grief and exaltation are useless.

data.v: भये न मुह्याम्यष्टकाहं कदाचि;त्संतापो मे मानसो नास्ति कश्चित् । धाता यथा मां विदधाति लोके; ध्रुवं तथाहं भवितेति मत्वा ॥
data.md: O Ashtaka, I never feel terrified with fear, nor do I ever feel grief, for I know that I shall be on earth exactly what the great Ordainer has made me.

data.v: संस्वेदजा अण्डजा उद्भिदाश्च; सरीसृपाः कृमयोऽथाप्सु मत्स्याः । तथाश्मानस्तृणकाष्ठं च सर्वं; दिष्टक्षये स्वां प्रकृतिं भजन्ते ॥
data.md: The Insects, the worms, all the oviparous creatures, vegetables, crawling animals, vermins, fishes, stones, wood, in fact all created things, are united with the Prakriti when they are freed from their acts.

data.v: अनित्यतां सुखदुःखस्य बुद्ध्वा; कस्मात्संतापमष्टकाहं भजेयम् । किं कुर्यां वै किं च कृत्वा न तप्ये; तस्मात्संतापं वर्जयाम्यप्रमत्तः ॥
data.md: Happiness and misery are transitory, O Ashtaka, knowing this, why should I grieve? We never know how we are to act to avoid misery. Therefore, grief must be cast off.

data.v: ये ये लोकाः पार्थिवेन्द्र प्रधाना;स्त्वया भुक्ता यं च कालं यथा च । तन्मे राजन्ब्रूहि सर्वं यथाव;त्क्षेत्रज्ञवद्भाषसे त्वं हि धर्मान् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king of the world, tell me in detail the account of all those regions which you have visited and in which you passed your time in bliss. (Tell me also) the period for which you thus lived.

data.v: राजाहमासमिह सार्वभौम;स्ततो लोकान्महतो अजयं वै । तत्रावसं वर्षसहस्रमात्रं; ततो लोकं परमस्म्यभ्युपेतः ॥
data.md: Yayati said: I was a great king on earth, ruling over the whole world as my kingdom. I acquired many high regions by my religious merits. I lived full one thousand years on earth and then I ascended to a very high region.

data.v: ततः पुरीं पुरुहूतस्य रम्यां; सहस्रद्वारां शतयोजनायताम् । अध्यावसं वर्षसहस्रमात्रं; ततो लोकं परमस्म्यभ्युपेतः ॥
data.md: It is the abode of Indra. It is very beautiful; it has one thousand gates and it extends one hundred Yojanas all around. Here lived I for another one thousand years. And then I ascended to a higher region.

data.v: ततो दिव्यमजरं प्राप्य लोकं; प्रजापतेर्लोकपतेर्दुरापम् । तत्रावसं वर्षसहस्रमात्रं; ततो लोकं परमस्म्यभ्युपेतः ॥
data.md: This is the region of supreme beatitude, the abode of the Prajapati, the lord of the earth, a region very difficult to attain. Here lived I for another on thousand years. And I then ascended to a higher region.

data.v: देवस्य देवस्य निवेशने च; विजित्य लोकानवसं यथेष्टम् । संपूज्यमानस्त्रिदशैः समस्तै;स्तुल्यप्रभावद्युतिरीश्वराणाम् ॥
data.md: It is the abode of the god of gods, (Vishnu), where I lived for many years in supreme bliss. I have lived in various regions and I was adored by the celestials and I possessed splendour and prowess like the celestial.

data.v: तथावसं नन्दने कामरूपी; संवत्सराणामयुतं शतानाम् । सहाप्सरोभिर्विहरन्पुण्यगन्धा;न्पश्यन्नगान्पुष्पितांश्चारुरूपान् ॥
data.md: I was capable of assuming any form at will; I sported for many millions of years with the Apsaras in the gardens of Nandana, under innumerable beautiful trees clad in flowery garb and spreading delicious perfume.

data.v: तत्रस्थं मां देवसुखेषु सक्तं; कालेऽतीते महति ततोऽतिमात्रम् । दूतो देवानामब्रवीदुग्ररूपो; ध्वंसेत्युच्चैस्त्रिः प्लुतेन स्वरेण ॥
data.md: I lived there in celestial happiness for many years, when a celestial messenger of grim visage thrice shouted to me in a loud and deep voice, “Ruined, Ruined, Ruined."

data.v: एतावन्मे विदितं राजसिंह; ततो भ्रष्टोऽहं नन्दनात्क्षीणपुण्यः । वाचोऽश्रौषं चान्तरिक्षे सुराणा;मनुक्रोशाच्छोचतां मानवेन्द्र ॥
data.md: O best of kings, this much I remember that I fell from Nandana and all my religious merits were gone. O king of men, I heard the voices of the celestials in the sky exclaiming in grief.

data.v: अहो कष्टं क्षीणपुण्यो ययातिः; पतत्यसौ पुण्यकृत्पुण्यकीर्तिः । तानब्रुवं पतमानस्ततोऽहं; सतां मध्ये निपतेयं कथं नु ॥
data.md: "What misfortune! The virtuous and meritorious Yayati is falling! His all religious merits are destroyed!” And when I was falling, I asked them, “Where are those wise ones amongst whom am I to fall?"

data.v: तैराख्याता भवतां यज्ञभूमिः; समीक्ष्य चैनां त्वरितमुपागतोऽस्मि । हविर्गन्धं देशिकं यज्ञभूमे;र्धूमापाङ्गं प्रतिगृह्य प्रतीतः ॥
data.md: They pointed out to me this sacred sacrificial region belonging to you. I am hastily coming to this your sacrificial ground, seeing the curls of smoke that rise from the sacrificial fire and blacken the sky. I smelt the perfume of the sacrificial ghee.

data.v: यदावसो नन्दने कामरूपी; संवत्सराणामयुतं शतानाम् । किं कारणं कार्तयुगप्रधान; हित्वा तत्त्वं वसुधामन्वपद्यः ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O foremost man of the Krita Yuga, you having been able to assume any form at will, passed millions of years in the garden of Nandana. For what reason have you been compelled to leave that happy region and come here today?

data.v: ज्ञातिः सुहृत्स्वजनो यो यथेह; क्षीणे वित्ते त्यज्यते मानवैर्हि । तथा तत्र क्षीणपुण्यं मनुष्यं; त्यजन्ति सद्यः सेश्वरा देवसंघाः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : As relatives and kinsmen forsake in this world a man who has lost his wealth, so in the other world Indra and the celestials forsake one who loses his righteousness.

data.v: कथं तस्मिन्क्षीणपुण्या भवन्ति; संमुह्यते मेऽत्र मनोऽतिमात्रम् । किंविशिष्टाः कस्य धामोपयान्ति; तद्वै ब्रूहि क्षेत्रवित्त्वं मतो मे ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, I am very curious to learn how men can lose their righteousness in the other world. Tell me also what regions are attained by what means. I know you are acquainted with all the doings and the sayings.

data.v: इमं भौमं नरकं ते पतन्ति; लालप्यमाना नरदेव सर्वे । ते कङ्कगोमायुबलाशनार्थं; क्षीणा विवृद्धिं बहुधा व्रजन्ति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O God-like man, they that speak of their own merits are doomed to the painful hell called Bhauma, (earth). Though really lean, they appear to grow (fat on earth) to become the food for vultures, dogs and jackals.

data.v: तस्मादेतद्वर्जनीयं नरेण; दुष्टं लोके गर्हणीयं च कर्म । आख्यातं ते पार्थिव सर्वमेत;द्भूयश्चेदानीं वद किं ते वदामि ॥
data.md: Therefore, O king, this censurable and wicked vice should be cast off in this world. O king, I have now told you all. Tell me what more I shall speak.

data.v: यदा तु तान्वितुदन्ते वयांसि; तथा गृध्राः शितिकण्ठाः पतंगाः । कथं भवन्ति कथमाभवन्ति; न भौममन्यं नरकं शृणोमि ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: When life is destroyed by age, vultures, Shitikantha, insects and worms eat up the human body, where does man then live? How does he come to life again? I have never heard of any hell called Bhauma.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं देहात्कर्मणो जृम्भमाणा;द्व्यक्तं पृथिव्यामनुसंचरन्ति । इमं भौमं नरकं ते पतन्ति; नावेक्षन्ते वर्षपूगाननेकान् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : When the body is destroyed (by death), man, according to the effects of his acts, is born again in the womb of his mother. He stays there in an indistinct form and he then gradually assumes distinct and visible form. He then reappears and walks on the earth. Thus he falls into the hell Bhauma (earth) and does not see the end of his existence.

data.v: षष्टिं सहस्राणि पतन्ति व्योम्नि; तथा अशीतिं परिवत्सराणि । तान्वै तुदन्ति प्रपततः प्रपातं; भीमा भौमा राक्षसास्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राः ॥
data.md: Some thus falling live for sixty thousand years in the firmament; some again for eighty thousand years. They then fall (on this earth) and they are attacked by fearful Bhauma Rakshasas of sharp teeth.

data.v: यदेनसस्ते पततस्तुदन्ति; भीमा भौमा राक्षसास्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्राः । कथं भवन्ति कथमाभवन्ति; कथंभूता गर्भभूता भवन्ति ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said : Why are men, when thus falling from heaven, attacked by these fearful and sharpteethed Rakshasas? Why are they not annihilated? How do they again enter the womb?

data.v: अस्रं रेतः पुष्पफलानुपृक्त;मन्वेति तद्वै पुरुषेण सृष्टम् । स वै तस्या रज आपद्यते वै; स गर्भभूतः समुपैति तत्र ॥
data.md: Yayati said : All beings, thus fallen from heaven, become subtle substance, living in water. This water subsequently becomes the semen from which life is created. It then enters the womb of a woman in her season and develops into the embryo. It then becomes visible life like the fruit from the flower. Entering into trees, plants, vegetables, water, air, earth and space, the watery seed of life becomes quadrupeds of bipeds. This is the case with all creatures.

data.v: वनस्पतींश्चौषधीश्चाविशन्ति; अपो वायुं पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षम् । चतुष्पदं द्विपदं चापि सर्व;मेवंभूता गर्भभूता भवन्ति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : All beings, thus fallen from heaven, become subtle substance, living in water. This water subsequently becomes the semen from which life is created. It then enters the womb of a woman in her season and develops into the embryo. It then becomes visible life like the fruit from the flower. Entering into trees, plants, vegetables, water, air, earth and space, the watery seed of life becomes quadrupeds of bipeds. This is the case with all creatures.

data.v: अन्यद्वपुर्विदधातीह गर्भ; उताहोस्वित्स्वेन कामेन याति । आपद्यमानो नरयोनिमेता;माचक्ष्व मे संशयात्प्रब्रवीमि ॥
शरीरदेहादिसमुच्छ्रयं च; चक्षुःश्रोत्रे लभते केन संज्ञाम् । एतत्तत्त्वं सर्वमाचक्ष्व पृष्टः; क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तात मन्याम सर्वे ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: Does a being who has got a human form enter the womb in its own shape or in some other? How does it acquire its distinct and visible shape, its eyes, ears and consciousness? Tell me all this, I ask you, because I have my doubts.

data.v: वायुः समुत्कर्षति गर्भयोनि;मृतौ रेतः पुष्परसानुपृक्तम् । स तत्र तन्मात्रकृताधिकारः; क्रमेण संवर्धयतीह गर्भम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said: The being that remains in a subtle form in the seed, when dropped into the womb, is attracted by atmospheric force for purposes of rebirth, according to the merits of one's acts.

data.v: स जायमानो विगृहीतगात्रः; षड्ज्ञाननिष्ठायतनो मनुष्यः । स श्रोत्राभ्यां वेदयतीह शब्दं; सर्वं रूपं पश्यति चक्षुषा च ॥
data.md: He then develops in course of time into the embryo. He is then furnished with the visible organisation. Coming out of the womb in course of time, he becomes conscious of his existence. He then becomes sensible of sound by his ears, of colour and form by his eyes, of scent by his nose, of taste by his tongue, of touch by his whole body and of ideas by his mind. O Ashtaka, it is thus that the gross and visible body develops from the subtle essence.

data.v: घ्राणेन गन्धं जिह्वयाथो रसं च; त्वचा स्पर्शं मनसा वेद भावम् । इत्यष्टकेहोपचितिं च विद्धि; महात्मनः प्राणभृतः शरीरे ॥
data.md: He then develops in course of time into the embryo. He is then furnished with the visible organisation. Coming out of the womb in course of time, he becomes conscious of his existence. He then becomes sensible of sound by his ears, of colour and form by his eyes, of scent by his nose, of taste by his tongue, of touch by his whole body and of ideas by his mind. O Ashtaka, it is thus that the gross and visible body develops from the subtle essence.

data.v: यः संस्थितः पुरुषो दह्यते वा; निखन्यते वापि निघृष्यते वा । अभावभूतः स विनाशमेत्य; केनात्मानं चेतयते पुरस्तात् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: The body is burnt, buried of otherwise destroyed after death. Reduced to nothing on one's death, by what principle is one again revived.

data.v: हित्वा सोऽसून्सुप्तवन्निष्टनित्वा; पुरोधाय सुकृतं दुष्कृतं च । अन्यां योनिं पवनाग्रानुसारी; हित्वा देहं भजते राजसिंह ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O lion of kings, the man who dies, assumes a subtle form, but he retains the consciousness of all his acts as if in a dream. He then assumes some other form with a quicker speed than that of air.

data.v: पुण्यां योनिं पुण्यकृतो व्रजन्ति; पापां योनिं पापकृतो व्रजन्ति । कीटाः पतंगाश्च भवन्ति पापा; न मे विवक्षास्ति महानुभाव ॥
data.md: The virtuous attain to a superior and the vicious to an inferior form of existence. The vicious becomes worms and insects. O illustrious one, I have nothing more to say. I have told you, how beings are born by the development of their embryonic formas quadrupeds, bipeds and six-footed creatures. What more will you ask me?

data.v: चतुष्पदा द्विपदाः षट्पदाश्च; तथाभूता गर्भभूता भवन्ति । आख्यातमेतन्निखिलेन सर्वं; भूयस्तु किं पृच्छसि राजसिंह ॥
data.md: The virtuous attain to a superior and the vicious to an inferior form of existence. The vicious becomes worms and insects. O illustrious one, I have nothing more to say. I have told you, how beings are born by the development of their embryonic formas quadrupeds, bipeds and six-footed creatures. What more will you ask me?

data.v: किं स्वित्कृत्वा लभते तात लोका;न्मर्त्यः श्रेष्ठांस्तपसा विद्यया वा । तन्मे पृष्टः शंस सर्वं यथाव;च्छुभाँल्लोकान्येन गच्छेत्क्रमेण ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O sire, how does a man attain to those higher regions whence there is no return to earthly life again? Is it by asceticism or knowledge? How does a man attain to the region of the highest bliss? As I ask you, tell me all.

data.v: तपश्च दानं च शमो दमश्च; ह्रीरार्जवं सर्वभूतानुकम्पा । नश्यन्ति मानेन तमोऽभिभूताः; पुंसः सदैवेति वदन्ति सन्तः ॥
data.md: Yayati said ; The wise say that there are seven gates through which admission might be gained to heaven. These are asceticism, gift, tranquility of mind, self-command, modesty, simplicity and kindness. A person loses all this in consequence of vanity.

data.v: अधीयानः पण्डितं मन्यमानो; यो विद्यया हन्ति यशः परेषाम् । तस्यान्तवन्तश्च भवन्ति लोका; न चास्य तद्ब्रह्म फलं ददाति ॥
data.md: The man who, having acquired knowledge, regards himself as learned and destroys, the reputation of others by his learning, never goes to the region of the highest bliss. It does not also give him the power of attaining to Brahma.

data.v: चत्वारि कर्माण्यभयंकराणि; भयं प्रयच्छन्त्ययथाकृतानि । मानाग्निहोत्रमुत मानमौनं; मानेनाधीतमुत मानयज्ञः ॥
data.md: Study, taciturnity, worship before fire and sacrifices, these are the four means through which fear is removed. But when these four are mixed with vanity, they cause fear instead of removing it.

data.v: न मान्यमानो मुदमाददीत; न संतापं प्राप्नुयाच्चावमानात् । सन्तः सतः पूजयन्तीह लोके; नासाधवः साधुबुद्धिं लभन्ते ॥
data.md: The wise should never feel pride in receiving honours, nor should they be sorry if insulted. For it is the wise alone that honour the wise; the wicked and vicious can never act like the virtuous. I have given so much, I have performed so many sacrifices, I have studied so much, I have observed so many vows, such vanity and pride are the roots of all fear. Therefore, it must be abandoned by all means.

data.v: इति दद्यादिति यजेदित्यधीयीत मे व्रतम् । इत्यस्मिन्नभयान्याहुस्तानि वर्ज्यानि नित्यशः ॥
येनाश्रयं वेदयन्ते पुराणं; मनीषिणो मानसमानभक्तम् । तन्निःश्रेयस्तैजसं रूपमेत्य; परां शान्तिं प्राप्नुयुः प्रेत्य चेह ॥
data.md: Those learned men who accept as their only support the unchangeable and inconceivable Brahma, Brahma that showers blessings on persons virtuous as you are, enjoy perfect peace here in this world and hereafter in heaven.

data.v: चरन्गृहस्थः कथमेति देवा;न्कथं भिक्षुः कथमाचार्यकर्मा । वानप्रस्थः सत्पथे संनिविष्टो; बहून्यस्मिन्संप्रति वेदयन्ति ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: Those that are learned in the Vedas differ in opinions as regards the respective methods which should be practised by the Grihastas, Brahmacharis, Bhikshus and Vanaprasthas, so that they may acquire religious merits.

data.v: आहूताध्यायी गुरुकर्मस्वचोद्यः; पूर्वोत्थायी चरमं चोपशायी । मृदुर्दान्तो धृतिमानप्रमत्तः; स्वाध्यायशीलः सिध्यति ब्रह्मचारी ॥
data.md: Yayati said: A Brahmachari must do the following. When he will live in the house of his preceptor, he must receive lessons only when his preceptor will call him to do it. He must serve his preceptor without waiting for his command. He must rise before his preceptor from his bed and go to bed after him. He must be humble, self-controlled, patient, vigilant and devoted to study.

data.v: धर्मागतं प्राप्य धनं यजेत; दद्यात्सदैवातिथीन्भोजयेच्च । अनाददानश्च परैरदत्तं; सैषा गृहस्थोपनिषत्पुराणी ॥
data.md: It is said in the oldest Upanishad that he must perform sacrifices after acquiring wealth by honest means. He should spend it in charity; he should be hospitable to all that would come to his house; he should never use anything without giving a portion to others.

data.v: स्ववीर्यजीवी वृजिनान्निवृत्तो; दाता परेभ्यो न परोपतापी । तादृङ्मुनिः सिद्धिमुपैति मुख्यां; वसन्नरण्ये नियताहारचेष्टः ॥
data.md: A Muni (Brahmachari) should live in the forest, depending on his own vigour and without searching for food. He should abstain from all vicious acts; he should give away in charity; he should never inflict pain upon any creatures. It is then only that he can gain success.

data.v: अशिल्पजीवी नगृहश्च नित्यं; जितेन्द्रियः सर्वतो विप्रमुक्तः । अनोकसारी लघुरल्पचार;श्चरन्देशानेकचरः स भिक्षुः ॥
data.md: He is a true Bhikshu, who does not support himself by any manual labour, who possesses many accomplishments, who has his passions under complete control, who is thoroughly unconnected with all worldly concerns, who does not sleep under the shelter of a householder's roof, who is without wife and who travels over many countries, going some distance every day.

data.v: रात्र्या यया चाभिजिताश्च लोका; भवन्ति कामा विजिताः सुखाश्च । तामेव रात्रिं प्रयतेत विद्वा;नरण्यसंस्थो भवितुं यतात्मा ॥
data.md: A learned should adopt the Vanaprastha mode of life, after the performance of the necessary rites. He should adopt it when he has been able to control his thirst for enjoyments and desire of acquiring wealth. When a man dies in the forest, leading the Vanaprastha mode of life, he mixes his ancestors and grand-children, numbering ten generations including himself, with the divine man essence.

data.v: दशैव पूर्वान्दश चापरांस्तु; ज्ञातीन्सहात्मानमथैकविंशम् । अरण्यवासी सुकृते दधाति; विमुच्यारण्ये स्वशरीरधातून् ॥
data.md: A learned should adopt the Vanaprastha mode of life, after the performance of the necessary rites. He should adopt it when he has been able to control his thirst for enjoyments and desire of acquiring wealth. When a man dies in the forest, leading the Vanaprastha mode of life, he mixes his ancestors and grand-children, numbering ten generations including himself, with the divine man essence.

data.v: कति स्विदेव मुनयो मौनानि कति चाप्युत । भवन्तीति तदाचक्ष्व श्रोतुमिच्छामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said : How many kinds of Munis are there and how many kinds of Munis (observers of vows)? We desire to hear all this.

data.v: अरण्ये वसतो यस्य ग्रामो भवति पृष्ठतः । ग्रामे वा वसतोऽरण्यं स मुनिः स्याज्जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Yayati said: O king, he is a true Muni, who possesses all things pertaining to a village though living in the forest and also possesses all things pertaining to the forest though living in a village.

data.v: कथं स्विद्वसतोऽरण्ये ग्रामो भवति पृष्ठतः । ग्रामे वा वसतोऽरण्यं कथं भवति पृष्ठतः ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said : How is it possible to possess all things pertaining to a village when living in the forest and all things pertaining to a forest when living in a village?

data.v: न ग्राम्यमुपयुञ्जीत य आरण्यो मुनिर्भवेत् । तथास्य वसतोऽरण्ये ग्रामो भवति पृष्ठतः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : A Muni lives in the forest after withdrawing himself from all worldly objects. But though he never seeks to possess things pertaining to a village, he may yet get them by his ascetic powers.

data.v: अनग्निरनिकेतश्च अगोत्रचरणो मुनिः । कौपीनाच्छादनं यावत्तावदिच्छेच्च चीवरम् ॥
यावत्प्राणाभिसंधानं तावदिच्छेच्च भोजनम् । तथास्य वसतो ग्रामेऽरण्यं भवति पृष्ठतः ॥
यस्तु कामान्परित्यज्य त्यक्तकर्मा जितेन्द्रियः । आतिष्ठेत मुनिर्मौनं स लोके सिद्धिमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: A true Muni, withdrawn from all earthly objects, might live in a village, leading the life of a hermit. Chad in Kaupina (scantiest of robes,) he considers himself attired in the richest robe. He is content with food just sufficient to support life. He who abandons all desires, who has all his passions under complete control and who has given up all actions, is the man who attains success.

data.v: धौतदन्तं कृत्तनखं सदा स्नातमलंकृतम् । असितं सितकर्मस्थं कस्तं नार्चितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Why should you not revere the man who lives on pure food, who refrains from injuring others, whose heart is ever holy, who is effulgent in his ascetic merits, who is free from the leaden weight of desire and who abstains from injury even when it is sanctioned by the scriptures?

data.v: तपसा कर्शितः क्षामः क्षीणमांसास्थिशोणितः । यदा भवति निर्द्वन्द्वो मुनिर्मौनं समास्थितः । अथ लोकमिमं जित्वा लोकं विजयते परम् ॥
data.md: The Muni who sits in Yoga mediation and who becomes indifferent to happiness and misery, honour and insult, conquers this world and conquering it, he conquers the highest world.

data.v: आस्येन तु यदाहारं गोवन्मृगयते मुनिः । अथास्य लोकः पूर्वो यः सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: The Muni who eats like the kine and other animals, without providing for it beforehand and without any relish, becomes identified with the whole universe.

data.v: कतरस्त्वेतयोः पूर्वं देवानामेति सात्म्यताम् । उभयोर्धावतो राजन्सूर्याचन्द्रमसोरिव ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, who does amongst the two, namely the ascetic and the man of knowledge, first attain to the communion with Brahma, although both exerting like the sun and the moon!

data.v: अनिकेतो गृहस्थेषु कामवृत्तेषु संयतः । ग्राम एव वसन्भिक्षुस्तयोः पूर्वतरं गतः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : He who is a man of knowledge and who is self controlled, though living among the householders with various sorts of desires, attains to salvation first.

data.v: अप्राप्य दीर्घमायुस्तु यः प्राप्तो विकृतिं चरेत् । तप्येत यदि तत्कृत्वा चरेत्सोऽन्यत्ततस्तपः ॥
data.md: Those that devote themselves to Yoga meditation take time to acquire that knowledge, for by practice alone they divest themselves from the idea of duality.

data.v: यद्वै नृशंसं तदपथ्यमाहु;र्यः सेवते धर्ममनर्थबुद्धिः । अस्वोऽप्यनीशश्च तथैव राजं;स्तदार्जवं स समाधिस्तदार्यम् ॥
data.md: Then again, if a man devoted to Yoga do not find sufficient time to attain to success in one's one life, he is benefited in his next life by the progress already made. But the man of knowledge ever sees the indestructible Unity, therefore he, though emerged in worldly enjoyments, is never affected in the heart.

data.v: केनासि दूतः प्रहितोऽद्य राज;न्युवा स्रग्वी दर्शनीयः सुवर्चाः । कुत आगतः कतरस्यां दिशि त्व;मुताहोस्वित्पार्थिवं स्थानमस्ति ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, you are young, you are handsome, you are decorated with celestial garlands, your splendour is great. From what place have you come and where do you go? Whose messenger are you? Are you going to earth?

data.v: इमं भौमं नरकं क्षीणपुण्यः; प्रवेष्टुमुर्वीं गगनाद्विप्रकीर्णः । उक्त्वाहं वः प्रपतिष्याम्यनन्तरं; त्वरन्ति मां ब्राह्मणा लोकपालाः ॥
data.md: Yayati said : As I have lost my religious virtues, I am falling into the Bhauma,(earth) hell. I shall go there after finishing my talk with you. The Lokapalas are commanding me even now to hasten thither.

data.v: सतां सकाशे तु वृतः प्रपात;स्ते संगता गुणवन्तश्च सर्वे । शक्राच्च लब्धो हि वरो मयैष; पतिष्यता भूमितले नरेन्द्र ॥
data.md: O king, I have obtained the following boon from Indra. Though I shall fall on earth, yet I shall fall among wise and virtuous men.

data.v: पृच्छामि त्वां मा प्रपत प्रपातं; यदि लोकाः पार्थिव सन्ति मेऽत्र । यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिताः; क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तस्य धर्मस्य मन्ये ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said : O king, I believe, you know every thing. I ask you, is there any region for myself either in heaven or in the firmament? If there be any, you shall not fall.

data.v: यावत्पृथिव्यां विहितं गवाश्वं; सहारण्यैः पशुभिः पर्वतैश्च । तावल्लोका दिवि ते संस्थिता वै; तथा विजानीहि नरेन्द्रसिंह ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O best of kings, there are many regions for you to enjoy in heaven, as many as the kine and horses of earth, as the animals in the wilderness and the hills.

data.v: तांस्ते ददामि मा प्रपत प्रपातं; ये मे लोका दिवि राजेन्द्र सन्ति । यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिता;स्तानाक्रम क्षिप्रममित्रसाह ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, I give to you all those regions in heaven or in the firmament that are for me to enjoy. Therefore, though falling, you must not fall. Take them soon, wherever they may be, in heaven or in the firmament. Let your sorrow cease.

data.v: नास्मद्विधोऽब्राह्मणो ब्रह्मविच्च; प्रतिग्रहे वर्तते राजमुख्य । यथा प्रदेयं सततं द्विजेभ्य;स्तथाददं पूर्वमहं नरेन्द्र ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O best of kings, a Brahma-knowing Brahmana alone can accept gifts and not men like ourselves. O king, I myself have given away (many gifts) to Brahmanas, as I should do.

data.v: नाब्राह्मणः कृपणो जातु जीवे;द्या चापि स्याद्ब्राह्मणी वीरपत्नी । सोऽहं यदैवाकृतपूर्वं चरेयं; विवित्समानः किमु तत्र साधु ॥
data.md: Let no man, who is not a Brahmana and no woman who is the wife of a hero, earn infamy by accepting gifts. I have always desired to perform virtuous acts on earth. What I have never done before, how shall I do it now and accept a gift?

data.v: पृच्छामि त्वां स्पृहणीयरूप; प्रतर्दनोऽहं यदि मे सन्ति लोकाः । यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिताः; क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तस्य धर्मस्य मन्ये ॥
data.md: Pratardana said : O handsome one, I am Pratardana by name. I ask you, is there any region for me in heaven or in the firmament to enjoy as fruits of my virtues? You know everything.

data.v: सन्ति लोका बहवस्ते नरेन्द्र; अप्येकैकः सप्त सप्ताप्यहानि । मधुच्युतो घृतपृक्ता विशोका;स्ते नान्तवन्तः प्रतिपालयन्ति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O king, innumerable regions, as effulgent as the solar disc and full of great felicity, await you. If you live only for seven days in each, they will never be exhausted.

data.v: तांस्ते ददामि मा प्रपत प्रपातं; ये मे लोकास्तव ते वै भवन्तु । यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिता;स्तानाक्रम क्षिप्रमपेतमोहः ॥
data.md: Pratardana said : I give to you all of them. Therefore, though falling, you must not fall. Let all the regions for me to enjoy be yours, whether they may be in heaven or in the firmament. Take them soon and let your sorrow cease.

data.v: न तुल्यतेजाः सुकृतं कामयेत; योगक्षेमं पार्थिव पार्थिवः सन् । दैवादेशादापदं प्राप्य विद्वां;श्चरेन्नृशंसं न हि जातु राजा ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O king, no king of equal energy should ever desire to accept in gift the religious merits of another king acquired by Yoga. No king, if wise, should act in a censurable way, though afflicted with calamity.

data.v: धर्म्यं मार्गं चेतयानो यशस्यं; कुर्यान्नृपो धर्ममवेक्षमाणः । न मद्विधो धर्मबुद्धिः प्रजान;न्कुर्यादेवं कृपणं मां यथात्थ ॥
data.md: A king should keep his eyes fixed on virtue and walk in the path of piety and thus increase his fame. A virtuous man like me, who know what are his duties, should not act so meanly as you ask me to do.

data.v: कुर्यामपूर्वं न कृतं यदन्यै;र्विवित्समानः किमु तत्र साधु । ब्रुवाणमेवं नृपतिं ययातिं; नृपोत्तमो वसुमनाब्रवीत्तम् ॥
data.md: When others, desirous of acquiring religious merit, do not accept gifts, how can I do it what they do not? When the best of kings, Yayati, said this, he was thus addressed by Vasuman.

data.v: पृच्छामि त्वां वसुमना रौशदश्वि;र्यद्यस्ति लोको दिवि मह्यं नरेन्द्र । यद्यन्तरिक्षे प्रथितो महात्म;न्क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तस्य धर्मस्य मन्ये ॥
data.md: Vasuman said: I am Vasuman, the son of Ushadashva. I ask you, O king, is there any region for me to enjoy either in heaven or in the firmament, as fruits of my virtuous acts? O high-souled one, you know all holy regions.

data.v: यदन्तरिक्षं पृथिवी दिशश्च; यत्तेजसा तपते भानुमांश्च । लोकास्तावन्तो दिवि संस्थिता वै; ते नान्तवन्तः प्रतिपालयन्ति ॥
data.md: Yayati said : The extensive regions, as extensive as those in the firmament, on earth and ten points of heaven that are illuminated by the sun, are all waiting for you.

data.v: तांस्ते ददामि पत मा प्रपातं; ये मे लोकास्तव ते वै भवन्तु । क्रीणीष्वैनांस्तृणकेनापि राज;न्प्रतिग्रहस्ते यदि सम्यक्प्रदुष्टः ॥
data.md: Vasuman said : I give them all to you. Let those regions that are mine be all yours. O king, if it is improper for you to accept them in gift, then pur hase them with a straw.

data.v: न मिथ्याहं विक्रयं वै स्मरामि; वृथा गृहीतं शिशुकाच्छङ्कमानः । कुर्यां न चैवाकृतपूर्वमन्यै;र्विवित्समानः किमु तत्र साधु ॥
data.md: Yayati said : I do not remember to have ever bought or sold any thing in an unfair way. This has also never been done by other kings. How shall I do it then?

data.v: तांस्त्वं लोकान्प्रतिपद्यस्व राज;न्मया दत्तान्यदि नेष्टः क्रयस्ते । अहं न तान्वै प्रतिगन्ता नरेन्द्र; सर्वे लोकास्तव ते वै भवन्तु ॥
data.md: Vasuman said: O king, if to purchase them be considered by you improper, take them from me as gifts. I for myself speak, that I shall never go to those regions that are for me. Let thein, therefore, be yours.

data.v: पृच्छामि त्वां शिबिरौशीनरोऽहं; ममापि लोका यदि सन्तीह तात । यद्यन्तरिक्षे यदि वा दिवि श्रिताः; क्षेत्रज्ञं त्वां तस्य धर्मस्य मन्ये ॥
data.md: Sibi said : I am Sibi, the son of Ushinara. I ask you, O king, O sire, is there any region in heaven or in the firmament for me to enjoy? You know every region that one may enjoy as the fruit of his religious merit.

data.v: न त्वं वाचा हृदयेनापि विद्व;न्परीप्समानान्नावमंस्था नरेन्द्र । तेनानन्ता दिवि लोकाः श्रितास्ते; विद्युद्रूपाः स्वनवन्तो महान्तः ॥
data.md: Yayati said: You have never disregarded either in mind or by speech the honest and the virtuous men that ever applied to you. There are infinite worlds for you to enjoy in heaven, all blazing like lightning.

data.v: तांस्त्वं लोकान्प्रतिपद्यस्व राज;न्मया दत्तान्यदि नेष्टः क्रयस्ते । न चाहं तान्प्रतिपत्स्येह दत्त्वा; यत्र गत्वा त्वमुपास्से ह लोकान् ॥
data.md: Sibi said : If you consider their purchase as improper, I give them to you as gifts. O king, take them all. I shall never go to the region where the wise never feel the least grief.

data.v: यथा त्वमिन्द्रप्रतिमप्रभाव;स्ते चाप्यनन्ता नरदेव लोकाः । तथाद्य लोके न रमेऽन्यदत्ते; तस्माच्छिबे नाभिनन्दामि दायम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said : O Sibi, you have indeed obtained for yourself infinite worlds, possessed as you are of the prowess of Indra. But I do not wish to enjoy regions given to me by others. Therefore, I cannot accept your gifts.

data.v: न चेदेकैकशो राजँल्लोकान्नः प्रतिनन्दसि । सर्वे प्रदाय भवते गन्तारो नरकं वयम् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, each of us has expressed our desire to give you the regions that each of us has acquired by his religious merits. You refuse to accept them. We leave them for you and we shall now descend into the earth-hell.

data.v: यदर्हाय ददध्वं तत्सन्तः सत्यानृशंस्यतः । अहं तु नाभिधृष्णोमि यत्कृतं न मया पुरा ॥
data.md: Yayati said : You are all truth-loving and wise. Give me that which I desire to have. I shall not be able to do what I have not done before.

data.v: कस्यैते प्रतिदृश्यन्ते रथाः पञ्च हिरण्मयाः । उच्चैः सन्तः प्रकाशन्ते ज्वलन्तोऽग्निशिखा इव ॥
data.md: Yayati said : These fine golden cars, as blazing as fire and displaying great glory, will carry you to regions of bliss.

data.v: युष्मानेते हि वक्ष्यन्ति रथाः पञ्च हिरण्मयाः । उच्चैः सन्तः प्रकाशन्ते ज्वलन्तोऽग्निशिखा इव ॥
data.md: Yayati said : These fine golden cars, as blazing as fire and displaying great glory, will carry you to regions of bliss.

data.v: आतिष्ठस्व रथं राजन्विक्रमस्व विहायसा । वयमप्यनुयास्यामो यदा कालो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: O king, get on these cars and go to heaven. We shall also follow you in time.

data.v: सर्वैरिदानीं गन्तव्यं सहस्वर्गजितो वयम् । एष नो विरजाः पन्था दृश्यते देवसद्मनः ॥
data.md: Yayati said: We can now all go together. All of us have conquered heaven . Behold, the glorious path to heaven becomes visible.

data.v: तेऽधिरुह्य रथान्सर्वे प्रयाता नृपसत्तमाः । आक्रमन्तो दिवं भाभिर्धर्मेणावृत्य रोदसी ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Illuminating the whole firmament by the glory of their virtues, those excellent kings got on those cars and set out in order to get admittance into heaven.

data.v: अहं मन्ये पूर्वमेकोऽस्मि गन्ता; सखा चेन्द्रः सर्वथा मे महात्मा । कस्मादेवं शिबिरौशीनरोऽय;मेकोऽत्यगात्सर्ववेगेन वाहान् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said: I always thought that Indra was my special friend and that I shall, of all others, first obtain admittance into heaven. But how is it that Sibi, the son of Ushinara, has already left us behind?

data.v: अददाद्देवयानाय यावद्वित्तमविन्दत । उशीनरस्य पुत्रोऽयं तस्माच्छ्रेष्ठो हि नः शिबिः ॥
दानं तपः सत्यमथापि धर्मो; ह्रीः श्रीः क्षमा सौम्य तथा तितिक्षा । राजन्नेतान्यप्रतिमस्य राज्ञः; शिबेः स्थितान्यनृशंसस्य बुद्ध्या । एवंवृत्तो ह्रीनिषेधश्च यस्मा;त्तस्माच्छिबिरत्यगाद्वै रथेन ॥
अथाष्टकः पुनरेवान्वपृच्छ;न्मातामहं कौतुकादिन्द्रकल्पम् । पृच्छामि त्वां नृपते ब्रूहि सत्यं; कुतश्च कस्यासि सुतश्च कस्य । कृतं त्वया यद्धि न तस्य कर्ता; लोके त्वदन्यः क्षत्रियो ब्राह्मणो वा ॥
ययातिरस्मि नहुषस्य पुत्रः; पूरोः पिता सार्वभौमस्त्विहासम् । गुह्यमर्थं मामकेभ्यो ब्रवीमि; मातामहोऽहं भवतां प्रकाशः ॥
सर्वामिमां पृथिवीं निर्जिगाय; प्रस्थे बद्ध्वा ह्यददं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः । मेध्यानश्वानेकशफान्सुरूपां;स्तदा देवाः पुण्यभाजो भवन्ति ॥
अदामहं पृथिवीं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः; पूर्णामिमामखिलां वाहनस्य । गोभिः सुवर्णेन धनैश्च मुख्यै;स्तत्रासन्गाः शतमर्बुदानि ॥
सत्येन मे द्यौश्च वसुंधरा च; तथैवाग्निर्ज्वलते मानुषेषु । न मे वृथा व्याहृतमेव वाक्यं; सत्यं हि सन्तः प्रतिपूजयन्ति । सर्वे च देवा मुनयश्च लोकाः; सत्येन पूज्या इति मे मनोगतम् ॥
यो नः स्वर्गजितः सर्वान्यथावृत्तं निवेदयेत् । अनसूयुर्द्विजाग्रेभ्यः स लभेन्नः सलोकताम् ॥
एवं राजा स महात्मा ह्यतीव; स्वैर्दौहित्रैस्तारितोऽमित्रसाहः । त्यक्त्वा महीं परमोदारकर्मा; स्वर्गं गतः कर्मभिर्व्याप्य पृथ्वीम् ॥
भगवञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि पूरोर्वंशकरान्नृपान् । यद्वीर्या यादृशाश्चैव यावन्तो यत्पराक्रमाः ॥
न ह्यस्मिञ्शीलहीनो वा निर्वीर्यो वा नराधिपः । प्रजाविरहितो वापि भूतपूर्वः कदाचन ॥
तेषां प्रथितवृत्तानां राज्ञां विज्ञानशालिनाम् । चरितं श्रोतुमिच्छामि विस्तरेण तपोधन ॥
हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि । पूरोर्वंशधरान्वीराञ्शक्रप्रतिमतेजसः ॥
प्रवीरेश्वररौद्राश्वास्त्रयः पुत्रा महारथाः । पूरोः पौष्ट्यामजायन्त प्रवीरस्तत्र वंशकृत् ॥
मनस्युरभवत्तस्माच्छूरः श्येनीसुतः प्रभुः । पृथिव्याश्चतुरन्ताया गोप्ता राजीवलोचनः ॥
सुभ्रूः संहननो वाग्मी सौवीरीतनयास्त्रयः । मनस्योरभवन्पुत्राः शूराः सर्वे महारथाः ॥
रौद्राश्वस्य महेष्वासा दशाप्सरसि सूनवः । यज्वानो जज्ञिरे शूराः प्रजावन्तो बहुश्रुताः । सर्वे सर्वास्त्रविद्वांसः सर्वे धर्मपरायणाः ॥
ऋचेपुरथ कक्षेपुः कृकणेपुश्च वीर्यवान् । स्थण्डिलेपुर्वनेपुश्च स्थलेपुश्च महारथः ॥
तेजेपुर्बलवान्धीमान्सत्येपुश्चेन्द्रविक्रमः । धर्मेपुः संनतेपुश्च दशमो देवविक्रमः । अनाधृष्टिसुतास्तात राजसूयाश्वमेधिनः ॥
मतिनारस्ततो राजा विद्वांश्चर्चेपुतोऽभवत् । मतिनारसुता राजंश्चत्वारोऽमितविक्रमाः । तंसुर्महानतिरथो द्रुह्युश्चाप्रतिमद्युतिः ॥
तेषां तंसुर्महावीर्यः पौरवं वंशमुद्वहन् । आजहार यशो दीप्तं जिगाय च वसुंधराम् ॥
इलिनं तु सुतं तंसुर्जनयामास वीर्यवान् । सोऽपि कृत्स्नामिमां भूमिं विजिग्ये जयतां वरः ॥
रथंतर्यां सुतान्पञ्च पञ्चभूतोपमांस्ततः । इलिनो जनयामास दुःषन्तप्रभृतीन्नृप ॥
दुःषन्तं शूरभीमौ च प्रपूर्वं वसुमेव च । तेषां ज्येष्ठोऽभवद्राजा दुःषन्तो जनमेजय ॥
दुःषन्ताद्भरतो जज्ञे विद्वाञ्शाकुन्तलो नृपः । तस्माद्भरतवंशस्य विप्रतस्थे महद्यशः ॥
भरतस्तिसृषु स्त्रीषु नव पुत्रानजीजनत् । नाभ्यनन्दन्त तान्राजा नानुरूपा ममेत्युत ॥
ततो महद्भिः क्रतुभिरीजानो भरतस्तदा । लेभे पुत्रं भरद्वाजाद्भुमन्युं नाम भारत ॥
ततः पुत्रिणमात्मानं ज्ञात्वा पौरवनन्दनः । भुमन्युं भरतश्रेष्ठ यौवराज्येऽभ्यषेचयत् ॥
ततस्तस्य महीन्द्रस्य वितथः पुत्रकोऽभवत् । ततः स वितथो नाम भुमन्योरभवत्सुतः ॥
सुहोत्रश्च सुहोता च सुहविः सुयजुस्तथा । पुष्करिण्यामृचीकस्य भुमन्योरभवन्सुताः ॥
तेषां ज्येष्ठः सुहोत्रस्तु राज्यमाप महीक्षिताम् । राजसूयाश्वमेधाद्यैः सोऽयजद्बहुभिः सवैः ॥
सुहोत्रः पृथिवीं सर्वां बुभुजे सागराम्बराम् । पूर्णां हस्तिगवाश्वस्य बहुरत्नसमाकुलाम् ॥
ममज्जेव मही तस्य भूरिभारावपीडिता । हस्त्यश्वरथसंपूर्णा मनुष्यकलिला भृशम् ॥
सुहोत्रे राजनि तदा धर्मतः शासति प्रजाः । चैत्ययूपाङ्किता चासीद्भूमिः शतसहस्रशः । प्रवृद्धजनसस्या च सहदेवा व्यरोचत ॥
ऐक्ष्वाकी जनयामास सुहोत्रात्पृथिवीपतेः । अजमीढं सुमीढं च पुरुमीढं च भारत ॥
अजमीढो वरस्तेषां तस्मिन्वंशः प्रतिष्ठितः । षट्पुत्रान्सोऽप्यजनयत्तिसृषु स्त्रीषु भारत ॥
ऋक्षं धूमिन्यथो नीली दुःषन्तपरमेष्ठिनौ । केशिन्यजनयज्जह्नुमुभौ च जनरूपिणौ ॥
तथेमे सर्वपाञ्चाला दुःषन्तपरमेष्ठिनोः । अन्वयाः कुशिका राजञ्जह्नोरमिततेजसः ॥
जनरूपिणयोर्ज्येष्ठमृक्षमाहुर्जनाधिपम् । ऋक्षात्संवरणो जज्ञे राजन्वंशकरस्तव ॥
आर्क्षे संवरणे राजन्प्रशासति वसुंधराम् । संक्षयः सुमहानासीत्प्रजानामिति शुश्रुमः ॥
व्यशीर्यत ततो राष्ट्रं क्षयैर्नानाविधैस्तथा । क्षुन्मृत्युभ्यामनावृष्ट्या व्याधिभिश्च समाहतम् । अभ्यघ्नन्भारतांश्चैव सपत्नानां बलानि च ॥
चालयन्वसुधां चैव बलेन चतुरङ्गिणा । अभ्ययात्तं च पाञ्चाल्यो विजित्य तरसा महीम् । अक्षौहिणीभिर्दशभिः स एनं समरेऽजयत् ॥
ततः सदारः सामात्यः सपुत्रः ससुहृज्जनः । राजा संवरणस्तस्मात्पलायत महाभयात् ॥
सिन्धोर्नदस्य महतो निकुञ्जे न्यवसत्तदा । नदीविषयपर्यन्ते पर्वतस्य समीपतः । तत्रावसन्बहून्कालान्भारता दुर्गमाश्रिताः ॥
तेषां निवसतां तत्र सहस्रं परिवत्सरान् । अथाभ्यगच्छद्भरतान्वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः ॥
तमागतं प्रयत्नेन प्रत्युद्गम्याभिवाद्य च । अर्घ्यमभ्याहरंस्तस्मै ते सर्वे भारतास्तदा । निवेद्य सर्वमृषये सत्कारेण सुवर्चसे ॥
तं समामष्टमीमुष्टं राजा वव्रे स्वयं तदा । पुरोहितो भवान्नोऽस्तु राज्याय प्रयतामहे । ओमित्येवं वसिष्ठोऽपि भारतान्प्रत्यपद्यत ॥
अथाभ्यषिञ्चत्साम्राज्ये सर्वक्षत्रस्य पौरवम् । विषाणभूतं सर्वस्यां पृथिव्यामिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
भरताध्युषितं पूर्वं सोऽध्यतिष्ठत्पुरोत्तमम् । पुनर्बलिभृतश्चैव चक्रे सर्वमहीक्षितः ॥
ततः स पृथिवीं प्राप्य पुनरीजे महाबलः । आजमीढो महायज्ञैर्बहुभिर्भूरिदक्षिणैः ॥
ततः संवरणात्सौरी सुषुवे तपती कुरुम् । राजत्वे तं प्रजाः सर्वा धर्मज्ञ इति वव्रिरे ॥
तस्य नाम्नाभिविख्यातं पृथिव्यां कुरुजाङ्गलम् । कुरुक्षेत्रं स तपसा पुण्यं चक्रे महातपाः ॥

दक्षस्यादितिः । अदितेर्विवस्वान् । विवस्वतो मनुः । मनोरिला । इलायाः पुरूरवाः । पुरूरवस आयुः । आयुषो नहुषः । नहुषस्य ययातिः ॥

यदुं च तुर्वसुं चैव देवयानी व्यजायत । द्रुह्युं चानुं च पूरुं च शर्मिष्ठा वार्षपर्वणी ॥
